This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2150mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 19 hours on 2G networks. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 1 micro SIM card and 1 nano SIM card.
Competition:
Alcatel X1 faces competition from Nokia Lumia 730 Dual SIM. Nokia Lumia 730 Dual SIM has smaller screen and poor camera than Alcatel X1.

Overview: Another release by the company is the Asus Zenfone 5.

Vivo's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed Vivo Y73 2021 might actually be one of the cheapest devices of all time. This device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone will also pack in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a huge 4000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone will be powered by the MediaTek Helio G95 SoC.
Design and Display: The Vivo Y73 2021 will reportedly boast a 6.44 inch AMOLEDdisplay with a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixelsand a high pixel density of 409ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive Waterdrop notch design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 and a screen to body ratio of 90.6% for enhanced viewing experience.
Cameras: The Vivo Y73 2021 is expected to house a triple rear camera with a powerful 64MP primary sensor, an 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device will feature a powerful 16MP selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features likeArtificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Time Lapse, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Vivo Y73 2021 will be baked with the MediaTek Helio G95 chipset coupled with a Mali-G76 MC4GPU. The device will come assembled with 8GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 128 GB, which can be expanded upto 1TB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 4000mAh Li-ion battery with flash charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Vivo Y73 2021 will run Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features likedual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n, GPS, Radio ,and Bluetooth 5.0. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm headphone jack ,and an on-screen fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Realme X2 comes with a large battery capacity that will deliver long power backup for the users. In terms of camera, it can be a perfect choice for the users. Under the hood, the hardware also renders smooth and lag-free performance with the strong processor. Above all, lies the trendy look that is worth the flaunt.
Display and Battery: Realme X2 flaunts an amazing curved glass display that offers an edge-to-edge view. It stands 6.4-inch screen that has a resolution of 1,080 x 2,340 pixels. It carries an aspect ratio of 19.5:9. The Super AMOLED display is enhanced with the 403 PPI pixel density, which is excellent to provide a sharp and immersive view.
Configuration and Connectivity: At its core, Realme X2 equips with a 2.2GHz dual-core processor along with a 1.8GHz hexa-core unit. The combination is seated on the Qualcomm Snapdragon 730G. A 6GB RAM ensures smooth gaming and multitasking of the device. There is an Adreno 618 GPU, which is great to offer graphics.
Storage and Camera: For storage, there is 128GB internal memory. It also has up to 256GB external memory with the help of a microSD card.

Overview: The device has a 13MP rear camera which is capable for recording 1080p videos with a flash. And on the front lies the 5MP camera. The phone has 32GB internal storage with expandable storage option up to 128GB via an expandable MicroSD card. There is another variant Asus Zenfone 2 Laser 3GB/32GB with 32GB internal storage but has 3GB of RAM.

The Zenfone 2 Laser ZE601KL is a Dual SIM device which supports 4G. The phone is powered by a 3000mAh battery & runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop with Asus’s ZenUI running on top. The smartphone is available in three colors viz. Gold, Red, Silver.

Symbian might be on its way out after years of domination - but Nokia even as they are making the big switch over to Windows Phone, is dependent on this old platform for a decent chunk of its sales. That brings us to the Nokia E6 which debuted back in 2011 as a successor to the hugely popular E72 and is still on sale. The E6 had huge shoes to fill and it managed to do it thanks to the enhanced features that it boasted of. The E6 was the first Nokia phone to sport VGA screen resolution and the first E Series candybar phone to sport both - a touchscreen and a full fledged QWERTY keypad. Thanks to the smaller screen size and the high resolution, it boasted of a higher pixel per inch density than that of the iPhone 4 and the retina display. In its current avatar, the E6 gets Symbian Belle which by far is the best Symbian version of all times - although some might disagree!

The XPERIA SP is a pretty interesting mid-range phone. Its got a good 1.7 GHz dual-core Snapdragon S4 Pro chip, 1GB RAM and the Adreno 320 GPU  thereby ensuring that it is ready for heavy lifting. The internal 8GB memory leaves a reasonable 5.8GB free for the user, other than the microSD slot for storing media of course. The 4.6-inch 720p HD display is complemented with an transparent edge below it. When viewing photos, this edge emits colours that are in tune with the image on the screen; somewhat similar to the Ambilight technology Philips used in TVs. The 8MP camera at the back records 1080p Full HD videos at a smooth 30 fps. The 2370 mAh battery claims to deliver decent battery life given the power-hungry internals. Lastly, the phone is built quite well; holding it gives you that awesome feeling of solidity, which unfortunately, is not common these days.

Poco has now officially launched the Poco F1 Armoured Edition which turns out to be a budget smartphone that tries to deliver the absolute bang for the buck. The specifications make it quite clear that Poco has made a great attempt to deliver way more for the price. The Poco F1 Armoured Edition has a large 4000mAh battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chipset. The device also scores well in the display and cameras department.
Design and Display: The Poco F1 Armoured Edition features a 6.18 inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 2246 pixels and a pixel density of 403ppi. The display has a notch with less bezels and an aspect ratio of 18.7:9.The device comes with added Corning Gorilla Glass protection.
Cameras: The Poco F1 Armoured Edition houses a dual camera system consisting of a 12MP primary sensor, and a 5MP sensor with LED flash. For selfies, the device comes with a 20MP camera sensor on the front. Features like Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Electronic Image Stabilization (EIS), Exmor-RS CMOS Sensor, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets are some of the many other that the camera supports.
Battery and Performance: The Poco F1 Armoured Edition is embedded with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chip and a Adreno 630 GPU. The RAM and internal storage of the device stand at 8GB and 256GB respectively. The device also supports memory cards up to 256GB. Battery life with this device is not going to be an issue with the large 4000mAh Li-Polymer battery that it comes with.
Software and Connectivity: Poco F1 Armoured Edition runs MIUI on the top of Android 8.1 out of the box. The smartphone has a variety of connectivity options like dual SIM 4G(Nano + Nano(Hybrid)), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n, GPS, Radio and Bluetooth 5.0. Coming to ports selection, the device has a USB Type-C port , a 3.5mm headphone jack, and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor placed on the side of the device.

Overview: Poco has now officially launched the Poco F1 256GB which turns out to be a budget smartphone that tries to deliver the absolute bang for the buck. The specifications make it quite clear that Coolpad has made a great attemp to deliver way more for the price. The Poco F1 256GB has a large 4000mAh battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chipset. The device also scores well in the display and cameras department.
Design and Display: The Poco F1 256GB features a 6.18 inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 2246 pixels and a pixel density of 403ppi. The display has a notch with less bezels and an aspect ratio of 18.7:9.The device comes with added Corning Gorilla Glass and water resistance as well.
Cameras: The Poco F1 256GB has a dual camera system consisting of a 12MP primary sensor, and a 2MP sensor with LED flash. For selfies, the device comes with a 20MP camera sensor on the front. Features like Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Electronic Image Stabilization (EIS), Exmor-RS CMOS Sensor, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets are some of the many other that the camera supports.
Battery and Performance: The Poco F1 256GB is embedded with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chip and a Adreno 630 GPU. The RAM and internal storage of the device stand at 8GB and 256GB respectively. The device also supports memory cards up to 256GB. Battery life with this device is not going to be an issue with the large 4000mAh Li-Polymer battery that it comes with.
Software and Connectivity: Poco F1 256GB runs with MIUI on the top of Android 8.1 out of the box. The smartphone has a variety of connectivity options like dual SIM 4G(Nano + Nano(Hybrid)), Wi-Fi 802.11,a/ac/b/g/n, GPS, Radio and Bluetooth 5.0. Coming to ports selection, the device has a USB Type-C port , a 3.5mm headphone jack, and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor placed on the side of the device.

Overview: OPPO's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM might actually be one of the cheapest 5G devices of all time. This 5G device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone will also pack in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a beautiful AMOLED display, a huge 5000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone will be powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 700 MT6833 Octa core SoC.
Design and Display: The OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM will reportedly boast a 6.52 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a high pixel density of 269ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive Waterdrop notch design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 and a screen to body ratio of 88.7% for enhanced viewing experience. The display will arrive with a refresh rate of 60Hz.
Cameras: The OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM is expected to house a triple rear camera with a 13MP wide-angle primary sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device will feature a 8MP wide-angle selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features likeAF Phase Detection, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Time Lapse, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM will be baked with the MediaTek Dimensity 700 MT6833 Octa core chipset coupled with an Mali-G57 MC2GPU. The device will come assembled with 8GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 128 GB, which can be expanded upto a whopping 1TB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 5000mAh Li-ion battery .
Software and Connectivity: OPPO A53s 5G 8GB RAM will run ColorOS UI on top of Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features like 5G, dual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.0. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm headphone jack ,and a side-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Ahead of IPL 2017, Vivo introduced the limited edition of the V5 Plus. The biggest attraction, it comes with a humongous 20MP camera up front alongside an 8MP secondary camera for capturing selfies. Below that, 1920 x 1080 pixels stretched across a 5.5-inch display result in 401 PPI pixel density. The display further comes protected with Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection with 2.5D curved glass on top.

The HTC Desire X is a lower mid-range handset by the Taiwanese phone maker. It's got a 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel Super LCD display, a dual-core 1GHz processor and 768MB of RAM. There's 4GB of internal memory, assumingly around half of which should be available to the user. There's a microSD card slot to expand further. The Desire X is a 3G-enabled handset with speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps. It also has Bluetooth 4.0 support as well. The 5 megapixel autofocus sensor at the back can shoot videos in a non-HD 480p resolution (a.k.a DVD resolution, presumably due to the low-end Adreno 203 graphics chip. It runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean with HTC's Sense UI 4. Powering this device is a 1650 mAh Lithium ion battery. The Desire X has now been discontinued, and replaced with the Desire X Dual SIM, which is essentially the same handset but with two SIM card slots.

Samsung Grand series have been highly successful since its launch a couple of years back. With the Galaxy Grand Max it aims to cash in on the already popular Grand series and bring a different phone to the masses. The phone is available in two colours: Grey & White.
The features of the Samsung Galaxy Grand Max are as follows
5.25 Inch display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels
1.2 GHz Snapdragon 410 Processor with 1.5GB of RAM
16GB Internal storage for apps and user data
MicroSD card supports cards upto 64GB
13 Megapixel Autofocus camera with LED Flash
5 Megapixel front facing wide angle camera
Samsung TouchWiz UI on top of Android 4.4 Kitkat
2500mAh Battery
Dual SIM
Alternatives
HTC Desire 816G
Micromax Canvas 4 Plus
Micromax Canvas Nitro

Intro:: Le 2 Pro 64GB launched in April, 2016. This device has an maximum internal memory of 64GB. The primary camera of the phone is 21MP. It is built with CDLA (Continual Digital Lossless Audio) technology due to which users will get loss-less experience of finest quality audio.
Display and Design:: The dimension of this device is 151.1x74.2x7.5 mm and the weight is 153gm. The maximum resolution is 1080x1920 pixels over LED screen size of 5.5 inches. This device is available for many variant colors including Rose Gold, Gold, and Silver, Gray.
Hardware & Features:: The Le 2 Pro 64GB has a chipset of MediaTek MT6797T Helio X25 and a processor of Deca-core (2x2.5GHz Cortex-A72, 4x2GHz Cortex-A53, 4x1.4GHz Cortex-A53). The inbuilt OS of the device is Android 6.0 version (Marshmallow).
Camera & Storage:: The Le 2 Pro 64GB has a primary camera of 21MP and the secondary camera of 8MP available with a LED flash light. The internal storage is 64GB with no extra slot of external memory card. The users can watch Full HD 1080p video in fine quality.
Battery & Connectivity:: The Le 2 Pro 64GB has a non-removable battery of 3000mAh which provides a great amount of battery backup and stand by features and it also supports fast charging. The device has both 4G and 3G features and Wi-Fi functionalities.
Competition: This mobile can be considered as an affordable product in this category of mobile phones. Samsung Galaxy A8 has some equivalent specifications when compared to Le 2 Pro.
FAQs: 1. Will this phone support Reliance Jio network?
Ans: Yes, the Le 2 Pro from LeEco does support VoLTE allowing you to use Jio voice calling without the need of using Jio 4G Voice app.
2. What type of charging connector do I need?
Ans: This phone comes with the latest USB Type-C port for charging and data syncing.
3. What is the internal storage size available to install apps?
Ans: Out of the 64GB onboard storage, around 52GB is available to the user to install apps and store other data.
4. Is this a good phone for gaming?
Ans: Yes, Le 2 Pro sports good hardware and should run most games without any issues.
5. Will this phone get future software updates of Android?
Ans: LeEco like Xiaomi has never focused on providing Android updates but rather focus on their own eUI to improve performance and feature additions.
6. Does the phone support 4K video recording?
Ans: Yes, the Le 2 Pro has a 21MP rear camera that can shoot videos up to 4K resolution.
7. Does it support USB OTG?
Ans: Yes, apart from the internal storage, this phone also support USB OTG wherein you can transfer and browse the content of your pen drive or a HDD on your phone.
8. Is the battery removable?
Ans: Having a metal unibody construction, the Le 2 Pro's battery is not user removable.

Overview: Xolo X900 is a stylish smartphone running on Android Ice Cream Sandwich by Lava Mobiles. Intel partnered with Lava Mobiles to make an entry in the smartphone market after being rejected by the giants like Samsung, HTC, LG and others. X900 has a 1.6 GHz Intel Atom processor and 1 GB RAM allowing fast web browsing, responsive apps and better multi-tasking. The processor comes with Hyper-Threading technology ensuring the applications get loaded in minimum time. The phone also contains a 400 MHz Graphics Engine providing rich 3D gaming experience with super-responsive graphics. The display on the device is a 4 inch TFT LCD Capacitive touchscreen and screen resolution of 1024 x 600 pixels giving full HD video output.

The phone features an 8 MP camera with burst mode, allowing the users to take up to 10 pictures in less than a second. However, the image quality is not as good as what we would expect with an 8 MP camera. The camera unit has been clubbed with an application allowing filters like Sepia, Black and White, Negative and more. The back camera allows you to capture 1080 p HD videos and the 1.3 MP front camera is capable of recording 720 p videos. One major problem the users might face is the lack of compatibility of the applications present in the play store. Most of the applications are made compatible with ARM chipset and not the Intel chipset.

The Nokia 701 was released in October 2011. The phone has a 3.5 inch Gorilla glass touch screen with ClearBlack technology. It has 512MB RAM, and an 8GB internal memory which is expandable upto 64GB through a provided microSD slot.

It is equipped with an 8MP full focus camera with 3x digital zoom and dual LED flash, and a secondary VGA camera and video recording. It also has a music player with MP3 support and surround sound, and a stereo FM radio with RDS. It also has support for A-GPS, Bluetooth and USB 2.0.

After the Wildfire S, HTC has another Android phone that is priced for the ones with a short budget. The Explorer has a compact size that is convenient as compared to the huge brick-sized phones available nowadays. It runs the same HTC's Sense UI like past Wildfire models atop Android 2.3 Gingerbread. The 3.2" HVGA (320 x 480 pixel) screen is the same as the Wildfire S, but the camera is downgraded from 5 MP auto-focus sensor to a 3MP fixed focus one. The Snapdragon processor on the HTC Explorer is clocked at 600 MHz with 512MB RAM. Internal memory, like its cousin models, is barely sufficient for installing just a few modern day apps. There's a microSD card slot to cater to your media files. The Explorer is also known as the Pico.

Gionee Elife E5 is a launched by Chinese manufacturer Gionee, which is gaining popularity for its high quality phones at affordable prices. This smartphone supports single SIM. The screen size is 4.8 Inch HD Super AMOLED Display with 1280 x 720 pixels resolution. The phone is available in three colors viz. Yellow, Graphite Black and White. The processor used is 1.5GHz quad-core, MediaTek MT6589T chipset with 1GB of RAM memory. The smartphone has an internal storage of 16GB and cannot be expanded further, as theres no microSD card slot. The phone runs on Android OS v4.2 (Jelly Bean). About camera, the rear camera sports 8MP with flashlight, Face Detection, Geo-Tagging, Touch Focus. Also the front facing camera has 5MP clarity and can be used for video calling and taking selfies. Videos can be recorded in 1080p HD quality. Sensors used on the Elife E5 are Magnetometer, Proximity sensor, Accelerometer sensor and Ambient light sensor. The smartphone supports 2G and 3G network as well. Other typical features include WiFi, GPS, Bluetooth and FM radio as well. A Lithium-Ion 2000 mAh Battery is used that is expected to give a reasonable up-time.

With a good design and an amazing camera, the Honor Play is a competitive entry in the Indian smartphone market. With the tagline of ‘Crazy fast, crazy smart’, this is a phone that delivers on all fronts. Here is what you sign up for when you decide to buy the phone:
The design is a thin metallic unibody with a tall display, which is a 6.3-inch full-HD+ IPS LCD panel with a resolution of 1080×2340 pixels and a 19.5:9 aspect ratio.
Like all leading phones today, Honor Play has a dual 16MP and 2MP camera at the rear with assisted dual LED flash. A16MP camera sits at the front.
The phone comes packed with Huawei’s flagship HiSilicon Kirin 970 chipset and a GPU Turbo option technology that delivers amazing performance.
The call quality is improved by a new antenna design. Along with this, the phone has a huge 3750 mAh battery and comes with Huawei’s fast charger to make sure your phone never runs out of juice.
The phone sports Android Oreo 8.1 with a custom skin from Huawei on top of it, known as the EMUI 8.2. Functions such as the one-hand mode, navigation gesture, and themes catalog are included.

Pros: Large screen size with a notch and thin bezels.
Smart AI camera with Creative features.
Cons: A tendency to mildly heat up with extended use.
The camera struggles in low light.

Overview: Xperia T3 is Sonys newest phablet in the market and based on the name it sounds like the successor to the Xperia T2 (but it isnt). Sony has adopted the OmniBalance design philosophy for most of its devices and the Xperia T3 is no exception. The phablets have recently shown a lot of promise in the developing markets and Sony is aiming to capitalize on the situation. Sony took the formula applied to the Xperia T2 and after a bit of changes, enter the Xperia T3.

The Xperia T3 has a lot of similarities when compared to the Xperia T2. The same 1.4 GHz Cortex A7 Quad Core processors along with 1GB of RAM are in charge of the processing. The screen resolution remains the same (at 1280 x 720 pixels) along with the Triluminos display and the Mobile BRAVIA Engine 2. But the Xperia T3 is much smaller at 5.3 inches, thereby making the display sharper; and the dimensions much more handy. The device comes with the same 8GB of internal storage with MicroSD slot for expansion. The camera has been reduced to 8 megapixel sensor as compared to the 13 megapixel on the Xperia T2 with no changes to the front facing camera.

The Xperia T3 comes with Android Kitkat (4.4.2) out of the box with Sony's Customizations. Sony claims it to be the slimmest 5.3 device, packing in a huge screen and components in a slim unibody construction. The battery at 2500 mAh seems like a bit of a compromise to reduce the thickness of the device, but we're guessing should be OK considering the mid-range specs of the device.
FAQs:
1. Does it support OTG?
Ans: No, it doesn’t support OTG.

2. Does the phone have a Hybrid SIM slot?
Ans: No, it has a dedicated slot for MicroSD card up to 32GB.

3. Is the battery removable? 
Ans: No, the Sony Xperia T3 comes with a 2500mAh non-removable battery.

4. Does it work with Reliance Jio Network? 
Ans: No, it doesn’t works with Reliance Jio Network.

5. What is the thickness of this phone?
Ans: Sony Xperia T3 is very slim device with only 5.3mm thickness and has a unibody construction.

6. What type or charging connector do I need? 
Ans: It sports a micro-USB charging connector.

7. What’s the Android update track record of this phone? 
Ans: It was launched with Android 4.4 Kitkat with Sony’s customization on top and received the Android 5.1.1 Lollipop update.

Overview: The HTC Desire X is a lower mid-range handset by the Taiwanese phone maker. It's got a 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel Super LCD display, a dual-core 1GHz processor and 768MB of RAM. There's 4GB of internal memory, assumingly around half of which should be available to the user. There's a microSD card slot to expand further. The Desire X is a 3G-enabled handset with speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps. It also has Bluetooth 4.0 support as well. The 5 megapixel autofocus sensor at the back can shoot videos in a non-HD 480p resolution (a.k.a DVD resolution, presumably due to the low-end Adreno 203 graphics chip. It runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean with HTC's Sense UI 4. Powering this device is a 1650 mAh Lithium ion battery. This is the Dual SIM version of the Desire X, which now has been discontinued. This version supports 3G network in one slot, and 2G in the other, pretty much like most dual SIM phones out there.

The younger sibling of the HTC One X, the One V is also armed with an Android 4.0 ICS operating system and the HTC Sense UI. It has a 3.7 inch display, with a curved chin design which has been an HTC trademark. The phone is built quite well thanks to its unibody construction with the use of aluminium and feels quite premium for a handset in its price-range. Also, it has 4GB internal memory (with a microSD slot for expansion) and 512MB RAM. It also has a 5MP camera with a quick one second camera start up, can also shoot HD videos, and rich sound quality thanks to Beats Audio. The HTC One V, also of the One series, is more conveniently priced than the HTC One X. In October 2012, HTC rolled out Android 4.1 (Jellybean) upgrade for the One V. The One V is replaced by the Desire X which brings in a dual-core processor, more RAM (768MB) and a removable battery.

The S850 is a smartphone from the Chinese manufacturer Lenovo. The phone is well designed and sleek, 8.2mm to be precise. The device has an all glass exterior and has multi colour options. It has a 5 inch IPS display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels and the pixel density is around 294 PPI. Though its not the best screen out there its still good enough for the price. The phone has a 1.3GHz Quad-core processor and has 1GB of RAM. The processor and RAM combo could have been better as Lenovo offers the same in a cheaper phone.

The S850 has 16GB of internal storage but this is non expandable due to the lack of a microSD card. Lenovo has offered better cameras on the device, The back has a 13 megapixel autofocus camera with flash capable of 1080p video recording. There is a 5 megapixel wide angle camera at the front which is fixed focus. The phone runs Android Kitkat (4.4.2) with some customizations from Lenovo. It is a dual SIM device and has a non removable 2000 mAh battery which might have been compromised to keep the device sleek.
Panasonic Eluga U2 is the companys mid-range offering. It has gotten most of its looks from its predecessors. It has good specifications and it closely competes with the likes of HTC Desire 510.
Lets have a look at its offerings:

It runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop out of the box and its the first Panasonic device to do so. It will also have the Panasonics Fit Home UI running on top of it, but since its Android, you can switch to another launcher of choice.
It is powered by a 64 bit Snapdragon 410 processor which offers fast performance. Coupled with 2GB RAM, one can expect a lag free experience out of this device.
It has a 13MP rear camera which would shoot sharp images and it also records 1080p videos. The front camera is a 5 megapixels which is good enough for selfies.

It has a 5 IPS OGS panel. What it means is that the display is very close to the protecting glass which gives more realistic feel. A pixel density of 294PPI makes it better for reading text on this phone.

Internal memory of 16GB is present on this device out of which 11GB is user available. You can attain more internal space by removing the bloatware or by making use of the expandable microSD card slot to upto 32GB.
The battery on the Eluga U2 is rated at 2500mAh which will be sufficient for one working day usage.
Alternatives:
HTC Desire 816G Dual Sim
Lenovo Vibe X2
Samsung Galaxy E5

Introduction:: The iberry Auxus 4X is the first unibody premium smartphone in India with a 4GB RAM. It was launched in August 2016. The phone also has a low temperature poly-silicon display with High Color Gamut which is a highlight of the device.
Display and Design:: iberry Auxus 4X has a 5.5 inches full HD LCD display and has a screen resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels. It offers 440PPI pixel density and is available in Black colour. It has a dimension of 148.4 x 74.2 x 7.3 and it weighs 143 grams. The phone has sides made of metal and has a stylish look with 178 degree viewing angle. The back panel of the phone is made of anti-scratch rugged rubber and front is protected with Dragontrail Glass Protector. The screen has a 95% high color gamut.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device has a 2GHz octa-core Helio P10 processor, 4GB RAM and Android 6 Marshmallow Operating System. Its ARM Mali-T860 MP2 GPU provides an excellent gaming experience. It has proximity sensor, accelerometer, and ambient light sensor. The phone comes with FM and a 3.5 mm audio jack.
Overview: The iberry Auxus 4X faces competition fromSamsung Galaxy J7 (2016),Lenovo Vibe P1 Turbo,Sony Xperia XA Dual, andOppo F1s as they are available in same price range and have somewhat similar features except the battery capacity which is higher in Lenovo Vibe P1 Turbo. Also, the iberry Auxus 4X comes in single color while other phones have at least 3 color variants.

XOLO Play is a lower mid-range Android handset with a focus on Gaming. It has a 4.7-inch 1280 x 720 pixel IPS panel and an NVIDIA Tegra 3 chipset. With four cores running at 1.5GHz, a GeForce ULP GPU and 1GB RAM, this phone sports the same power as popular products like the HTC One X or the first version of the Nexus 7. But for a phone on which you'd expect to load intensive 3D games, the internal memory is seemingly less at 4GB, out of which roughly close to half should be available to the user. Nonetheless, there's a microSD card slot that supports up to 32GB (but remember, not all games can be transferred to external memory). NVIDIA's 'Tegra Zone' showcases games that are optimised to work best with this chipset. The XOLO Play supports 3G speeds of 21Mbps and WiFi 802.11n.

Multimedia highlights of this phone include an 8 megapixel camera at the back, that does 1080p HD video recording (thanks to the Tegra 3 chip). There's also a 2MP camera up-front. Providing juice to all this hardware is a 2000mAh Lithium ion battery.

Samsung's upcoming mid-range smartphone Samsung Galaxy A23, from its A-series lineup, seems to be nearing its launch. The smartphone will pack in some pretty decent specs. Speaking of which, we will get to see a decent display, a huge 5100mAh battery, average cameras, and will be powered by the Samsung Exynos 7 Octa 7884 SoC.
Design and Display: The Samsung Galaxy A23 will reportedly feature a 6.5 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a pixel density of 270ppi. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive punch-hole design and an aspect ratio of 20:9.
Cameras: The Samsung Galaxy A23 is expected to house a quad rear camera with a 16MP wide-angle primary sensor, an 8MP wide-angle sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash. Coming to the front, the device will feature a 13MP selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features like Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Samsung Galaxy A23 will come baked with the Samsung Exynos 7 Octa 7884 chipset coupled with a Mali-G71 MP2GPU. The device will come with 4GB RAM and an internal storage capacity of 64GB, which can be expanded up to 512GB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 5100mAh Li-Polymer battery with fast charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Samsung Galaxy A23 will run Android 11 out of the box. Speaking of connectivity, the smartphone will support 5G, dual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.2. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a 3.5mm headphone jack, a USB Type-C port, and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Pros: USB type-C port and fingerprint sensor

Overview: HTC, has been doing decent in the mid-range category, it fills the space where an individual is looking for a mid range smartphone but also cares about the brand. HTC is said to have the maximum number of devices in the price range of 10,000 to 20,000, the HTC Desire 728 being on of them.
Display and Design: Display on the HTC Desire 728 is a 5.5 inch LCD Panel with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels (HD) giving it a pixel density of 267PPI. Unfortunately, this time we do not get Gorilla Glass protection over the display. The phone has a Plastic body construction but the build quality looks robust with solid colour options viz. White an Purple.
Hardware Specifications and Other Featur: Talking about the performance, the HTC Desire 728 runs on a MediaTek MT6753 Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and paired with it is 2GB of RAM which is bare minimum for a decent multitasking experience. In terms of software the phone runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box with HTC's Sense UI running on top of it. HTC Desire 728 also features HTC BoomSound with Dolby Audio for rich audio experience.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of the device sits a 13MP sensor that can record videos up to 1080p, whereas on the front you get a 5MP shooter for selfies and video calling. The rear camera also has an LED Flash for taking shots in the dark. And to store all your pictures and other data you get 16GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 2TB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: To power all this we have a 2800mAh battery that is non-removable which sounds decent enough to last through the day. The device supports Dual SIM GSM+GSM setup and takes Nano SIM only. The device also supports 4G connectivity.
Competition: In the similar price range there are other quite a few new entires that rock the latest chipset and are said to have a better camera with some other improvement features as well. The Moto G4 Plus being a decent performer with good camera, fingerprint sensor and also sports near stock Android experience. Latest entry to the list is Xiaomi Mi Max with a massive 6/44 inch display with top notch specs and performance.

Overview: HTC has had its Wildfire range in the budget segment and with the Desire C they have brought yet another compact Android device. HTC Desire C is one of the cheapest phones running Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich). The phone packs in Beats Audio, 3.5" LCD (HVGA 480x320) and the usual Sense UI layer over Android that HTC develops. Surprisingly the HTC Desire C runs a 600 Mhz single-core CPU and yet manages to run Android 4.0. Standard offerings like WiFi, Bluetooth, 3G and GPS are available on the Desire C along with 4GB of internal storage and 512MB RAM. With this offering HTC would compete with a range of Samsung and Motorola devices.

Samsung MPower TV is a CDMA handset which supports JAVA applications. One unique feature of this phone is Live TV. With the Live TV feature on the phone, you can watch TV anytime, anywhere on a 2.4 screen! It comes with a versatile multi-format audio and video player which is even capable of FM recording. Internal memory of 85 MB can be expanded up to 16 GB. The mobile can store 2000 contacts in phonebook memory and 1000 text messages at a time. The phone has a 1.3 Megapixels camera with Single Shot, Multi Shot, Mosaic Shot and Frame Shot mode. The connectivity options on the phone include 3G, Bluetooth, GPRS and microUSB v2.0.

It comes with Pre-installed Polaris browser and Samsung PC studio can be used for syncing files with your personal computer/laptop. It also has a mobile tracker that assists in tracking your phone in case it is lost. The phone is backed up by a 960 mAh battery giving talk time of up to 4.5 hours.

Released in August 2010, the 9300 Curve 3G is a mid range BlackBerry with support for 3G networks. The phone ran BlackBerry OS 5.0 at launch and is upgradeable to OS 6.0 as well. It gets a 320*240 pixel, 2,6 inch TFT display under which there is the touch sensitive optical track pad. The device boasts of 256 MB RAM and 256 MB ROM. Users can also expand the memory using microSD cards. At the rear of the device is an adequate 2 megapixel camera with the ability to record videos. The phone also supports A-GPS and supports BlackBerry Maps as well. Under the hood, it gets a Li-ion battery rated at 1150 mAH. Apart from Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and HSDPA, the handset also gets micro USB V2.0 support.
The Water 2 is a mid-range device from LYF. The brand much known for pioneering a series of phones with VoLTE support in India to compliment their Jio Network.
Here are the specifications of LYF Water 2:
The device has a good 5 inch HD (1280x720 pixels) resolution with a pixel density of 294PPI.
On the inside is the Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa Core chip clocked at 1.5GHz and has 2GB of RAM.
Behind sits a 13MP camera with an LED Flash and on the front is a 5MP shooter for those selfies.
The device supports Dual Normal SIMs of which one is 4G capable.
In terms of storage the device has 32GB internal storage that can be expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
The LYF Water 2 runs on Android Lollipop (5.1) out of the box.
The device has a 2400mAh removable battery life.

The Desire 516 is a budget friendly smartphone manufactured by Taiwanese smartphone maker, HTC. The Desire is priced in the same range as the highly successful Moto G and is a Dual SIM device. It sports a 5 inch display with qHD resolution (960x540 pixels), which is less than the Moto Gs 1280 x 720 pixel HD display. The Desire is powered by a 1.2 GHz Snapdragon 200 processor and has 1GB of RAM. The phone comes with 4GB internal storage and features a microSD card slot that supports cards of up to 32GB.

The smartphone runs Android 4.2 Jelly Bean, an outdated version of the OS with HTC BlinkFeed home screen. HTC Desire 516 sports a 5MP rear camera with fixed focus, capable of capturing 720p video, and a 2MP front-facing camera for selfies and video chat. It has a 1950mAh removable battery and it weighs 160gms which is a bit heavy for a phone of this size.

The XOLO Q1000S is the the flagship handset that goes toe-to-toe with Micromax's Canvas 4. Physically, the phone is slimmer by almost two millimeters by its competitor while it weighs exactly the same. Falling at the same price point, the Q1000S comes with the same 5-inch 1280 x 720 pixel IPS panel. Going into nitty-gritties though, it is revealed that the Canvas 4 is a quad-band phone, thus can work in most countries if not all. Whereas the Q1000S is a dual-band phone. Also, it is a single SIM handset while the Canvas 4 supports two SIMs. But the upper-hand for this handset is a faster 1.5GHz Quad-core chip from Mediatek. It has the same 1GB of RAM and 16GB of internal memory, along with a microSD card slot. This handset's 3G speeds can soar up to 42Mbps.

The 13 megapixel camera module boasts of a 'BSI 2' sensor that claims to capture better images in low light. It can shoot videos in full 1080p HD and has features like HDR and image stabilisation. It also has a 5 megapixel front-facing BSI sensor that will click self-portraits in a higher resolution than typical video-call cameras. The Q1000S runs Android 4.2 Jelly Bean and has a bigger 2500 mAh battery than the Canvas 4 (2000 mAh).

The Canvas 3D A115 is an uber entry-level smartphone that tries to ride on the 3D hype that you see around you. Its got a 5-inch, 800 x 480 pixel resolution display which is 3D enabled, thereby giving you the illusion of depth without the need to wear 3D glasses. It is powered by a dual-core Mediatek processor clocked at 1.2 GHz, 512MB RAM and 4GB of internal memory. There's a 5 megapixel camera at the back and a front-facing VGA camera. It supports two SIM cards and 3G internet too. The Canvas 3D A115 runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean. Micromax has a special app called '3D Space' that gives access to content such as videos, photos and games optimised for the three dimensions. You can also click 3D photos.

The iBall Andi 5.5 N2 Quadro is a mid-range phablet having a 5.5 inch 1280x720 pixel IPS HD display. It is powered by 1.2GHz Cortex A7 Quad-core processor allowing the user to multi task easily. It is providing 1GB RAM which is reasonable considering the price point. It provides 4GB of internal memory (Xolo Q2000 provides 8GB internal space) which can be expanded up to 32GB by microSD card. So of you are a heavy gamer or large size app user; it might be a problem.

With respect to camera, theres a 12MP rear facing camera with Autofocus and LED flash. Theres no clarity on whether HD video recording is supported or not, though typically phones with this particular chipset should be able to record at 720p HD resolution. Theres also a 2MP secondary camera for selfies and video chatting. It runs on Android Jelly Bean 4.2. It has a decent 2500mAh battery which should last for a day under average usage. Its a 3G enabled handset.

The HTC One E8 is the HTC One M8 on a budget, the toned down version if you may. It drops the premium metal body of the M8 and adopts bright colourful plastic casings. The specifications have more or less remained the same. The major change between the devices is that the E8 is a Dual SIM device and accepts Nano SIMs and both provide Quad-Band GSM connectivity. It is 3G CDMA/3G GSM + GSM so the first slot can be used for a CDMA connection as well. The One E8 has increased thickness but the plastic casing has reduced the weight of the device.

The One E8 is powered by a slightly faster Snapdragon 801 quad-core chipset, clocked at 2.5GHz (the M8 has a 2.3GHz one) and is supported by 2GB of RAM. Unlike the HTC One M8, theres only one storage capacity to choose from on the E8  16GB. The E8 also loses out on the Dual UltraPixel camera setup and the multi-tone flash that the M8 had. Instead the main camera is a 13 megapixel snapper with f2.2 aperture, while the front facing camera the same 5 megapixel sensor. Both cameras are equipped with a BSI (Backside Illumination) sensor. It helps taking better pictures in low-lighting conditions.

The E8 runs Sense UI 6.0 on top of Android Kitkat (4.4.2) which is Androids latest offering. HTC BoomSound is what theyve been calling the front firing stereo speaker pair, ensuring that loud and clear quality sound is delivered to the user. The Super LCD3 display offers Full HD resolution with 441PPI pixel density and is the same as the one on the big brother. The phone comes with a non-removable 2600mAh battery and comes with the the ultra power saving mode that should deliver long up-time even with little charge left in the battery.

Introduction:: Yureka S is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. Robust configuration, metallic and polycarbonate ergonomic design, Saturn rings, 3 element keys, OpenGL ES 3.0 for gaming, fast charging facility, very good cameras and Wolfson codec for superb sound through Yamaha amplifier are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Yureka S comes with 5.2 inch LCD touch screen AMOLED display, 1920 x 1080 pixels resolution, 423PPI pixel density and Corning Gorilla Glass 3 screen protector. It has a dimension of 154.8 x 78 x 8.5 mm and its weight is 172 grams. It is available in White, Dark Gray and Rose Gold colours.
Camera and Storage:

Yureka S is built with 13MP rear PureCel camera having 2.2F aperture, autofocus and LED flash and 5MP front camera. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p. Other camera features include zero shutter lag and HDR. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro SD card. Users can use approximately 10GB of storage.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 3000mAh non-removable Li-Po battery that provides talk time of nearly 9 hours and standby time of nearly 450 hours. Connectivity options include 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth. It has Hybrid Sim Tray (Micro SIM + Nano SIM)
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device is equipped with 1.7GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 processor, 3GB RAM, Adreno 405 graphics and Android 5.1 Lollipop operating system. Light sensor, proximity sensor, accelerometer, compass and gyroscope are in-built.

This dual SIM device is equipped with 1.7GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 processor, 3GB RAM, Adreno 405 graphics and Android 5.1 Lollipop operating system. Light sensor, proximity sensor, accelerometer, compass and gyroscope are in-built.
Competition:: Yureka S faces competition from Micromax Canvas 5 and Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus 3GB. Yureka S has a bigger screen, higher battery capacity and faster processor than Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus 3GB. Micromax Canvas 5 has lower battery capacity and faster processor than Yureka S.

Yureka S faces competition from Micromax Canvas 5 and Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus 3GB. Yureka S has a bigger screen, higher battery capacity and faster processor than Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus 3GB. Micromax Canvas 5 has lower battery capacity and faster processor than Yureka S.

Overview: Another leg in the One Series from HTC, the One S sports a 4.3" Gorilla Glass screen which is wrapped in a slim 7.8 mm metal unibody for durability. The One S is priced lower than the One X and fits in as a HTC Sensation replacement. One S is one of the thinnest (7.95mm) smartphones available in the market today. The One S is powered by a dual-core 1.5GHz process supported with 1GB RAM allowing your processes to run smoothly and avoid crashes while playing your favorite game! It also comes with Beats Audio for rich and authentic sound quality.

The 8 megapixel camera allows the consumer to capture every moment with crisp and accurate photos. The camera unit features options such as auto focus, smart LED flash, BSI sensor (for better low-light captures) and is also capable of 1080p HD video recording. The phone also has a VGA front camera for video-calling facility. The 1650 mAh battery that comes in the box is sufficient for normal usage but might die out by evening if lot of apps and background data is kept on. The phone comes with 16 GB internal memory and does not support micro SD card expansion.
The mid-range phone by Honor set to launch in March of 2019.
Design: The Body of the Honor phone is made completely of plastic. The notched display has a significant bezel. The phone is quite slippery.
Display: The phone has a 6.26 inch IPS LCD display with a screen resolution of 1080 x 2280 pixels. The aspect ratio is 19:9 with a pixel density of 432 PPI. The display is bezel-less and supports multi-touch. The screen to body ratio is 79.07%
Camera: The rear camera is 13 megapixels with an aperture of f/1.8 and a depth sensor of 2 megapixels.
The front camera is 8 megapixels and features single LED flash. Features like the ISO, white balance, shutter speed can be altered.
The device is powered by an Octa-core processor coupled with 4GB RAM with 64-bit architecture. The chipset is the Qualcomm Snapdragon 632.

The two variants available are 4GB of RAM with 32 GB of storage and 4GB of RAM with 64 GB of storage.  The 64GB internal memory can be expanded to up to 256 GB. The operating system is the Android 8.1 Oreo.
The graphical processor Mali-T830 MP2 GPU provides an excellent gaming experience.
Its battery power is 4000 mAh and is Li-Polymer.

Pros: The keyboard is classic BlackBerry and is excellent for typing
Cons: Camera is bad in low light conditions
Touchscreen is cramped which makes hitting a touch point challenging
Trackpad is not all that useful
No Google Play Services so plenty of Android apps do not function

Overview: Nokia PureView 808 promises to bring in innovation to the image capturing technology. Its USP is the super 41MP camera with a Carl Zeiss lens and PureView technology capable of shooting HD videos. It has a 4 inch AMOLED capacitive Gorilla glass touch screen, and a memory of 16GB expandable upto 48GB. It also has support for HDMI, DLNA and USB 2.0, and also NFC and WiFi. It is also equipped with a music player with Dolby Surround sound technology, and Stereo FM Radio, and promises a brilliant gaming experience as well. Nokia has also announced that they would bring the PureView camera technology to Windows phone devices.

Canvas Turbo Mini is one of the best smartphones launched by Micromax. It comes in a aluminium shell and thus looks premium. For the price, it offers a 4.7 inch IPS HD Display with a screen resolution of 1280x720 pixels, which boils down to a sharp pixel density of 312PPI. There is a 1.3GHz Quad-core MediaTek processor, paired with 1GB RAM. This chipset is powerful enough to provide a smooth multi-tasking experience. It has an inbuilt memory of 4GB which can be expanded upto 32GB.

For photography, there is a 8 Megapixel rear camera with flash. Also, there is a 5 Megapixel front facing secondary camera for selfies and video chat. The snapper can also record HD videos at 720p. It runs on Android 4.2 Jelly Bean. It supports 3G, WiFi and Bluetooth. It has a 1800mAh battery which as per company claims will give a talktime of 6.5 hours. Its close competitor is Moto G which also comes with a HD screen and Quad-core processor.

HTC has a bit of a rough ride, where some have blamed its poor marketing skills while the others have taken up the issue of poor pricing. Despite making real premium smartphones, the brand has lost out to the likes of Apple and Samsung who seem to always bring a better package than HTC. This has resulted in HTC launching tons and tons of devices in the hope that they stumble upon the winning formula.
Display & Design: The HTC Desire 630 is a mid range phone that HTC announced at MWC 2016, in order to make serious inroads in the budget segment. However, the phone had a delayed launch in India, which kind of killed the buzz.
Hardware and Features: HTC has gone with a 5 inch HD Super LCD panel on the Desire 630. This roughly equates to about 294PPI. Compare this to devices like Le 2 or even the Motorola Moto G4 Plus which bring a Full HD display in the same sort of price range, and you can see where HTC has cut the corners. Like most of the mid range phones especially in the Desire series, the 630 comes with a plastic body. There is no metal goodness going on here. The phone has an interesting painted home button in bright orange colour, which adds a bit of a personality to otherwise a bland candybar design. The phone has stereo speakers on the front, which is good to see.
Camera & Storage: Powering the HTC Desire 630 is a Snapdragon 400 chipset. There is 2GB of RAM on board. There is a serious lack of firepower there on the phone especially when you consider the likes of Zuk Z1 come which come with Snapdragon 801 in lesser. The good part about the phone is the BoomSound speakers on the front, which gives the device excellent media playback capability. There is no fingerprint scanner here either, though to their credit, HTC launched the phone with the latest Android 6.0 with Sense UI on top.
Battery and Connectivity: HTC Desire 630 comes with 13MP rear camera with f/2.4 aperture. The front facing camera is 5MP with an f/2.8 sensor. As expected, the rear camera is accompanied by a flash light for taking shots in night. There is 16GB internal storage that comes out of the box though it can be expanded by another 128GB thanks to the slot for MicroSD card that comes with the phone.
Competition: Battery is bit of mixed bag here. Although, you can be glad that the battery is removable and user replaceable, it packs only 2200 mAh, which you can be sure will not get you through a day with heavy usage. HTC has given a Dual SIM slot with the phone, both of which are capable of latching on to LTE connectivity. There is support for Bluetooth 4.1, WiFi as well as GPS. There is no NFC or USB Type C here.

Overview: After countless leaks and numerous rumour claims, Xiaomi finally unveiled the Mi 5c smartphone in China. What makes it special is the Company’s first in-house manufactured Surge S1 chipset which powers the phone. The Surge S1 is an octa-core chipset build with 28nm process and clocked at 2.2GHz. Earlier, it was claimed to be called Pinecone, but now it emerged as Surge.

The Xiaomi Mi 5c gets an all-metal unibody design and comes in three color options – Rose Gold, Gold, and Black. It sports a 5.15-inch Full HD display with a resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels and a 2.5D curved glass on the top. The device gets 3GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage. It sports a 12-megapixel rear camera with LED flash and an 8-megapixel front facing camera for capturing selfies.

The Xiaomi Mi 5c packs in a 2860mAh battery and runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow. However, Xiaomi has promised to provide Android Nougat update in March. The phone also houses a fingerprint print scanner integrated into the home button. It is a dual SIM phone and includes connectivity features such as 4G VoLTE, Wi-Fi 802.11 ac dual-band, Bluetooth 4.1, GPS, USB Type-C, a 3.5mm audio jack, and FM radio.

Looking at the details of the Surge S1 chipset, it looks like a mid-budget processor, more of in-line with Helio P20 and Snapdragon 625. The Company also shared the Geekbench 4.0 CPU multi-core benchmark and GFXBench benchmark scores boasting about the benchmark numbers. According to benchmark scores, the Surge S1 beats both Snapdragon 625 and Helio P20. But it would be little early to say whether this chipset is as good as Snapdragon 625 or not.

The XPERIA M2 looks like a successor to the XPERIA C mid-range Android smartphone. It's got a premium-ish build thanks to the glossy reflective back. The display is a smaller 4.8 inches with the same qHD (960 x 540 pixel) resolution, which is a little disappointing as 720p displays are becoming pretty common in mid-range phones nowadays.

The XPERIA M2 is powered by a Snapdragon 400 quad-core 1.2GHz chip (XPERIA C had a Mediatek one running at the same clock speed with same number of cores). Internal memory is doubled to 8GB, and it's a dual SIM phone. The phone is available in three colours like Purple, White & Black.

Realme's mid-ranger dubbed Realme 8 5G 64GB is actually one of the cheapest 5G devices of all time. This 5G device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone packs in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a beautiful AMOLED display, a huge 5000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone is powered by the MediaTek Dimensity 700 MT6833 Octa core SoC.
Design and Display: The Realme 8 5G 64GB flaunts a 6.5 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixelsand a high pixel density of 405ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display sports an immersive Punch-hole display design ,a screen to body ratio of 90.5% and an aspect ratio of 20:9 for enhanced viewing experience. The display arrives with a refresh rate of 90Hz.
Cameras: The Realme 8 5G 64GB houses a triple rear camera with a powerful 48MP wide-angle primary sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device feature a powerful 16MP wide-angle selfie shooter. The camera arrives with features likeAF Phase Detection, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Electronic Image Stabilization (EIS), Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, ISOCELL Plus, Time Lapse, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Realme 8 5G 64GB is baked with the MediaTek Dimensity 700 MT6833 Octa core chipset coupled with an Mali-G57 MC2GPU. The device comes assembled with 4GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 64 GB, which can be expanded upto a whopping 1TB. Fuelling the device is a huge 5000mAh Li-ion battery with quick charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Realme 8 5G 64GB runs Realme UI on top of Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone supports features like 5G, dual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n/n, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.1. Furthermore, the smartphone packs in a USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm headphone jack, and a side-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Samsung Galaxy A30s 128GB is a mid-range smartphone by Samsung, which brings some amazing features. It has ample battery capacity with fast charging support so the users can charge the device on-the-go. Apart from that, it has an excellent display quality, massive internal storage, amazing camera set up and many more reasons to choose this as your next smartphone.
Display and Camera: Samsung Galaxy A30s 128GB flaunts a 6.4-inch Super AMOLED display. The screen bears a resolution of 720 x 1560 pixels along with a pixel density of 268PPI. The smartphone features an admirable display design but it lacks screen protection, which is disappointing.
Configuration and Battery: Samsung Galaxy A30s 128GB is seated on a Samsung Exynos 7 Octa 7904 chipset. It is powered by a dual-core 1.8GHz Cortex A73 and a hexa-core 1.6GHz Cortex A53 processor. To handle the graphics of the device, it is coupled with a Mali-G71 MP2 GPU. There is a 4GB RAM to keep the games and apps running smoothly.
Storage and Connectivity: To store the files and data of the users, the smartphone has an internal memory capacity of 128GB that can be expanded up to 512GB with the expense of a microSD card.

Overview: Xiaomi's Redmi 2 and the Redmi 2 Plus has been a huge hit in the Indian market and one of the major reason it being this hit is Xiaomi's pricing strategy. The features and specs then offered with the two phones were an absolute value for money for the price it was offered at. Following the similar trend, Xiaomi this year is back with the two devices Xiaomi Redmi 3s and the Xiaomi Redmi 3s Plus. Again these phones offer great value for money and have a price difference of Rs. 2000, however the extra amount is totally worth it as the expensive Redmi 3s Plus features a fingerprint scanner and an extra GB of RAM.
Display and Design: Even the display size of the device is rarely found these days at 5 inch, it is great for one hand usage. The resolution of the display is 1280x720 pixels (HD) which gives it a pixel density of 294PPI which does sound sharp enough and on the display we do not get any sort of protection. The phone looks good and well build to not make any creaking sound and has a similar design to the Xiaomi Redmi Note 3.
Hardware and Features: Inside Xiaomi Redmi 3s Plus runs on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 Octa Core chipset that is clocked at 1.4Ghz and paired along is 3GB of RAM. The device should perform well, thanks to the decent processor and ample 2GB of RAM for an decent multitasking experience. The phone also features an IR blaster which acts as a remote to most of the home appliances and a fingerprint scanner on the rear of the device which is fast and quite accurate while unlocking the device.
Camera and Battery: The Redmi 3s Plus has got a 13MP sensor on the rear that is capable of recording Full HD (1080p) videos whereas on the front lies a 5MP shooter. The rear sensor also features Phase Detection Autofocus (PDAF) and there is also an LED Flash to help take pictures in light conditions. The battery of the device is yet another excellent feature to have but the charging time is quite more despite being said to have fast charging. Thanks to the massive 4100mah battery unit sealed inside the device, the Redmi 3s Plus delivers impressive battery backup.
Connectivity and Storage: Xiaomi Redmi 3s Plus is a 4G LTE enabled device and also supports VoLTE. Even though it is a Dual SIM device only the first SIM supports VoLTE and the second slot is Hybrid, meaning it will either accept the second SIM or you can use the slot expand storage on the phone to up to 128GB via a MicroSD card.

Overview: The Indian manufacturer Lava has this time come up with a device at a very interesting price point. The Lava Iris X10 is priced around Rs. 11,000 but unfortunately does not offer specs that are expected at the price point.
The device comes with a 5 inch HD display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels (HD) making it a total of 294PPI which is decent but not the sharpest at the price point.
Lava claims it has superb contrast & true blacks ensuring great viewing experience. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass.

Talking about performance, the Iris X10 sports a MediaTek MT6735 Quad Core processor clocked at 1.3GHz and has 3GB of RAM. The processor looks mediocre but the 3GB of RAM should ensure smoother multitasking.
On the back is the 13MP camera sensor with Dual LED flash & f2.0 aperture for good low light shots. And on the front is the 84 Degree Wide Angle selfie camera which is a 5MP shooter.
The phone is powered by a 2900mAh battery which sounds good & the phone does have a power saver mode for those few extra hours you might need to pull.
Iris X10 is a Dual SIM 4G enabled device.
The phone comes with 16GB internal storage & is expandable up to 32GB via a MicroSD card, also it supports USB OTG.
It runs on Android Lollipop 5.1 & as mentioned by Lava should be receiving the Marshmallow update soon. The phone does have some extra features like Smart Gestures & Air Shuffle for certain tasks.
The Lava Iris X10 is available in two colors viz. Black & White.

The Sony XPERIA L is a mid-range handset from the Japanese phone maker. It has a comfortably-sized 4.3-inch "scratch-resistant" display bearing an 854 x 480 pixel resolution. There's a dual-core 1GHz Krait-based Snapdragon processor inside with a reasonable 1GB of RAM. Out of the 8GB internal memory, 5.8GB is allocated to the user, other than the microSD card slot. It can pull 3G internet at speeds of 21 Mbps, and has Bluetooth 4.0 and NFC support as well. An 8 megapixel camera at the back has features like HDR, image stabilisation, sweep panaroma etc. It also shoots 720p HD videos too. It runs the fairly recent Android 4.1 Jelly Bean. The XPERIA L is powered by a 1750 mAh battery. There's an LED light strip at the bottom of the phone that glows when a notification comes in.

Karbonn is the first Indian company to launch a phone running on the latest Android version KitKat. Moreover Titanium Hexa is the second phone to run on a hexa-core chip (six independent cores), first one being Samsung Galaxy Note Neo. Although it is a budget phablet, it sports notch features to survive in the cut throat competition.

It has a 5.5 inch Full HD (1080p) screen with a pixel density of 400PPI. The hexacore MediaTek processor clocks in at 1.5GHz and is coupled with 2GB of RAM. This hardware is powerful enough to ensure smooth multitasking. It has a 13 megapixel rear camera with flash which can record Full HD videos as well. There's a 5 megapixel secondary camera for selfie lovers. It is a Dual-SIM phone with 3G connectivity. This phablet is powered by a 2050mAh battery (The Samsung Galaxy Grand 2 has a 2600mAh battery).
Faster internet connectivity with eight 4G LTE network bands
Similar 5.1 inch Super AMOLED Full HD display as found on Galaxy S5
Pixel rich display with 431.9 PPI
Powered by a Quad-Core 2.5 GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 801 and 2GB RAM
16GB Internal Storage (10GB approx. user available), expandable upto 128GB via a microSD card
16 megapixel autofocus camera (LED flash) that does HDR for videos as well
4K Video shooting (2160p) along with full HD recording
2.1 megapixel front facing camera
TouchWiz UI on top of Android 4.4 KitKat
Fingerprint scanner on the home button and a heart rate sensor below the 16 MP rear camera
Ultra power saving mode that lets the phone run for upto 24 hours on just 10 percent charge
IP67 certification which makes it dust and water-resistant
It supports microUSB input (v3.0) and MHL
Single Micro SIM support, removable 2800mAh battery
4 Color options -- Black and Gold
Alternatives
Apple iPhone 5S 16GB
HTC One M8 32GB
Sony Xperia Z3 Compact

The upcoming mobile brand  Xolo has recently launched Q900, which falls in its Q series of smartphones priced within an affordable range. This is a successor to Q800. The phone comes with a 4.7-inch TFT 1280 x 720 pixel HD display (compared to 960 x 540 pixels of Q800) having a pixel density of 312 PPI (which is good for a phone of this price range). It runs on Android 4.2 Jelly Bean and has a 1.2 GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6589 processor with PowerVR SGX544 GPU and 1GB of RAM (the processor and RAM have been unchanged). Besides, there is a 4GB of internal storage (of which approximately 2 GB would be available to the user), and can be expanded by up to 32GB using a microSD card. The phone comes with an 8-megapixel rear camera with LED flash and BSI sensor and is capable of recording videos at 1080p, and has a 2-megapixel front camera with support for video calling. There has been a significant improvement in the camera as compared to its predecessor, which lacked HD recording and BSI sensor for low light photography. Also Face-detection and Panorama have been added along with Geo-tagging.

It has sensors like Proximity sensor, Accelerometer and Ambient light sensor. It also comes with a Quick Access Toolbar to launch and access favourite apps in a flash. Other features include support for dual-SIM, 3G (up to 42.2 MBPS), but only one SIM supports 3G, Bluetooth (v4.0), Wi-Fi and GPS, and a 1800mAh battery with up to 10 hours of talk time (Battery has been degraded as compared to 2100mAh of Q800).

The Chinese smartphone maker recently entered the Indian smartphone race with its flagship E Series. Now it has launched M and P series to penetrate deeper into the market. The Gionee M2 sports a 5-inch TFT capacitive display with a resolution of 854x480 pixels, resulting in a pixel density of 196PPI (which is below average considering 326PPI of Moto G). The phones main highlight is its massive 4,200mAh battery which promises the highest talk time in the market (Lenovo P780 and Canvas Power A96 come with similar-sized batteries). The phone comes with an OTG cable which can be used to charge other mobile phones. The Dual-SIM phone is powered by a Quad-core 1.3GHz Cortex A7 chip and 1GB RAM. The hardware is decent enough and should provide a smooth user experience.

Although this device is not a camera oriented device like other Gionee phones, it boasts of an 8-megapixel rear camera for capturing photos and HD videos at a resolution of 720p. It also has a 2-megapixel secondary camera at the front. The company claims that the phone has a standby time of 555 hours. Apart from this, the smartphone also supports 3G connectivity, WiFi and Bluetooth.

Introduction:: Panasonic Eluga Mark 2 is a dual SIM device that was launched in November 2016. IR blaster, metallic and designed body, fast charging facility, and fingerprint scanner at the back side are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Panasonic Eluga Mark 2 comes with 5.5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive IPS display, 2.5D curved Asahi Dragontrail glass screen protector, and 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 267PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 151 x 76 x 7.7 mm. It is available in Gold colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6753 processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System, and 3GB RAM. Light sensor, proximity sensor, accelerometer and compass are available.
Camera and Storage:

Panasonic Eluga Mark 2 is loaded with 13MP rear camera having 4128 x 3096 Pixels image resolution and 5MP front camera having wide angle selfie mode. Other camera features include manual focus, HDR, scene mode, night scene mode, face beautify. It comes with LED flash and autofocus. It has an internal storage of 32GB that can be expanded up to 128GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a 3000mAh Li-Po battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 1 micro SIM and 1 nano SIM cards.
Competition:

Panasonic Eluga Mark 2 faces competition from Coolpad Note 5 and Lenovo K5 Note. Coolpad Note 5 has a slower processor, higher battery capacity, better front camera and more RAM than Panasonic Eluga Mark 2. Lenovo K5 Note has faster processor, better front camera, more RAM and higher battery capacity than Panasonic Eluga Mark 2.

Overview: The Samsung Galaxy Mega 5.8 is the smaller of the two Mega series of handsets launched by Samsung (the other being Mega 6.3). As the name suggests, this phone has a 5.8-inch display bearing a qHD resolution (960 x 540 pixels). This drives the pixel down to a little less than 200 PPI, which isn't as pixel dense as its competitors. Nonetheless, if big screen is what you like, then you get that aplenty with the Mega series. It runs on an unspecified 1.4 GHz dual-core processor, coupled with the same 1.5GB of RAM and 8GB of internal storage as its elder brother. No worries though, the chipset seems to be capable enough of handling 1080p HD video recording via the 8 megapixel sensor at the back. The front sensor is also the same as the Mega 6.3 at 1.9MP. The Mega 5.8 has a relatively smaller 2600 mAh battery, but that's exactly the same as the Galaxy S4. And if the S4 can drive a Full HD display and top-of-the-line chipset specs with that much power, the Mega 5.8 should not let you down in terms of battery life.

The Xperia U comes as a part of the new Sony smartphone series. It comes with a 1GHz Dual Core processor and Android Gingerbread operating system (upgradable to Android 4.0 ICS in Q2 of 2012). It has 8GB internal memory, inclusive of 4GB user accessible memory and 512MB RAM.

The Xperia U has a 3.5 inch screen high resolution Reality display with Mobile Bravia Engine. Also, it has a rear 5MP auto focus camera with 16x digital zoom and a front facing VGA camera, enabled with HD video recording. It has USB 2.0 and DLNA support with WiFi functionality. It also has a music player and Stereo FM radio.

Panasonic, the Japanese electronic giant has been in the smartphone industry in India for quite a while now. The brand has majorly focused on budget smartphones & to offer good value for money. The Eluga Turbo looks like another decent attempt from the brand to penetrate in the market. The brand competes with other brands in the budget like  Micromax, Xiaomi, LeEco & so on.

Pros: Massive internal memory with dedicated SDcard slot
Cons: Display resolution could have been better
Lacks dual camera compared to competitors

Overview: The Chinese smartphone maker Phicomm is yet to make a mark in the market but has definitely got some good line of products. The Phicomm Passion 660 is yet another effort from the brand.

One of the early Android successes for HTC, the Desire was launched in early 2010. The Desire sports a 1GHz processor along with a good 5 megapixel camera. The Sense UI layer by HTC makes optimal use of the 3.7-inch full touch screen. Also known as HTC Bravo or HTC Desire A8181.

HTC is gearing up to give tough competition to the Nokia Lumia 920 & 820 with its Windows Phone 8 offerings. The 8X is one of the first Windows Phone 8 devices to arrive. While simply designed, 8Xs slim, sleek and squared corners draw the users attention to the 4.3 inches 720p HD display screen with Gorilla Glass 2 for protection. The S LCD2 Capacitive touch screen gives a resolution of 720*1280 pixels. Powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon chipset, it has a dual-core processor of 1.5GHz and runs on Microsoft Windows Phone 8 OS. 8X enhances connectivity options with features like 2G/3G, dual-band Wi-Fi, Bluetooth v2.1 and internal GPS antenna with GLONASS. 8X has an internal storage of 16GB. Sporting an 8 megapixel camera, it has Auto focus, LED Flash and BSI sensor. It thus entails an image quality of 3264*2448 pixels. It also has a secondary front-facing camera (2.1 MP). 8Xs other specifications include sensors like proximity, accelerometer, digital compass, standard Li-ion battery of 1800 mAh, Live Tiles that helps the user arrange start screen with latest updates and in-built Beats Audio for distinguished sound quality. HTC Windows Phone 8X will be available in four colours - California Blue, Graphite Black, Flame Red and Limelight Yellow.

Xolo launched itself in India in early 2012 and has been doing good business in the market since then. The Xolo 8X 1000 was launched one month after the Xolo 6X 1000 and has almost similar specs. The 8X 1000 has more storage but a slightly smaller battery than the 6X 1000. The key features of this device are 
Has a 5 inch IPS display with the resolution of 1280x720 pixels with decent 293 PPI pixel density
Dual SIM phone
It runs on a 1.4GHz Octa Core processor and is packed with 2GB of RAM
Comes with 16GB of internal storage which is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 8MP which records video at 1080p
2MP front facing camera
Powered by a 1920 mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Micromax Canvas Nitro
Asus Zenfone 5

The A series from Lenovo are entry level handsets that are aimed towards first time smartphone buyers. The A850 is one of the better offerings in the series. The device has a 5.5 inch IPS display with a resolution of 960 x 540 pixels (qHD) and the pixel density is around 200 PPI. The screen resolution is low for a display of this size and it might appear pixelated on closer inspection. The phone has a 1.3GHz Quad-Core processor with 1GB of RAM. This combination is used in a lot of phones and is known to provide a decent smartphone experience.

The A850 has 4GB of internal memory and has a microSD card slot which accepts cards upto 32GB. The phone has a 5 megapixel autofocus camera, paired with a flash. There is a front camera present but sadly it has a VGA (640 x 480pixels) resolution. The device runs on Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean and there is no official word from Lenovo for future updates. It is a Dual SIM device and has a 2250 mAh battery. The phone weighs 184g which is heavier than other similarly sized phones. If you arent looking for a big screen phone, the Asus ZenFone 5 is a better phone for the price.

The Xolo Q1000 is a sub-Rs. 15k Android smartphone bearing a 5-inch 1280 x 720 pixel IPS panel, a 1.2GHz quad-core Mediatek MTK 6589 chipset coupled with 1GB of RAM. Internal storage is slightly less at just 4GB, though you can store more media with the use of a microSD card. This phone supports blazing 3G speeds of up to 42.2 Mbps, and has WiFi 802.11n and Bluetooth 4.0 support too. There is an 8 megapixel autofocus camera at the back with an LED flash, and a 1.2MP front-facing snapper. The rear camera can shoot Full HD 1080p videos. There's a 2100 mAh lithium-ion battery powering the unit. Lastly, one of the much-ignored feature is available on the Q1000  FM Radio. This is a dual-SIM handset.

Lava is one of the top 5 Indian smartphone manufacturer that competes with other global brands like Micromax, Xiaomi & LeEco. The company also owns Xolo which has been recently doing well in the market with their budget oriented devices that offers good value for money.
Design and Display: On the front we have a 5 inch HD (1280x720 pixels) display giving the display a pixel density of 294PPI which does sound sharp enough. For protecting the display we do have Asahi Dragontail Glass. In terms of design, the phone looks well built has Glass on the front and back of the device which somewhat resembles the iPhone 4 design.
Hardware and Features: You get a MediaTek MT6735 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and is available in 2GB and 3GB RAM options which should be great for average usage with basic apps and should provide a great multitasking experience. On the software front, Lava Pixel V2 2GB variant comes with Android 5.1 Lollipop whereas the 3GB variant packs the latest Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with Lava's Star OS running on top of it.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of Lava Pixel V2 lies a 13MP camera that can record videos up to 1080p whereas on the front sits a 8MP shooter for those selfie moments. The rear camera also gets a Dual LED Flash for taking videos and pictures in dark plus you also get an LED Flash on the front which is a huge bonus for all selfie lovers. To store all those selfies and other data there is 16GB of onboard storage with expandability option up to 32GB more via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: Powering the device is a 2500mAh non removable battery that should easily last you through the day. On the connectivity front, Lava Pixel V2 supports Dual Micro SIMs and also supports 4G LTE networks with VoLTE in India.

Overview: Blackberrys latest social networking phone, the Blackberry Curve 9320 is a sleek-looking stylish device with widest range of features. It comes in a bar shape and possesses an easy-to-use QWERTY keypad. Its display screen above the keypad is a 2.44-inch TFT LCD with a QVGA screen resolution of 240 x 320 pixels. Released in May 2012, this handset runs on the Blackberry 7.1 OS. It is backed with a 512MB RAM which can also be expanded up to 32GB using Micro SD cards. The Curve 9320 is capable of connecting via GPRS, EDGE and 3G technologies. Additionally, the phones Wi-Fi capable and allows connecting to internet when located in a wireless network. The micro USB port comes handy in transferring files through Bluetooth. Curve 9320 comes loaded with a 3.2 megapixel rear-facing camera which is backed up by an LED flash for clicking pictures in the dark. The phone is also capable of video recording, possesses a 4x digital zoom and has features like geo-tagging. The phone runs on a 1450 mAh Li-Ion battery which promises the user up to 7 hours of talk time and up to 432 hours in stand-by mode. Its other key highlights include GPS support, music player, BBM key, voice memo, document viewer, organizer, predictive text input, optical trackpad and LED indicator. Curve 9320 is only available in black colour.
5 Inch display with low resolution (540x960)
1.2 GHz Snapdragon 200 processor with 1GB RAM
Low 4GB internal memory
MicroSD card slot with 32GB support
5 Megapixel camera with LED flash capable of 720p video (No 1080p)
2 Megapixel front facing camera
Removable 1950mAh battery
Dual SIM, Dual Stand-by
Android 4.2.2 JellyBean (outdated OS)
Sense UI 5.1
Alternatives
Moto G 2nd Gen
Asus ZenFone 5
Micromax Canvas Nitro

The spinoff brand from Lava, Xolo has come up with Xolo Q600S which comes with a 4.5 inch display at a resolution of 960x540 giving it a pixel density of 245PPI which is below average compared to the Xiaomi Redmi 2 Prime or the Yu Yuphoria in the same price range.
