The phone runs on a Broadcom BCM23550 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.2GHz and comes with a 1GB RAM. We recommend to get a device with 2GB of RAM  to have a smooth multitasking experience.

On the back lies a 5MP camera sensor which can record videos up to 720p & on the front is just a VGA camera. It ia a Dual SIM smartphone with  normal SIM slots that are 3G enabled and lacks 4G support. The Xolo Q600s comes with just 4GB internal storage with expandable option up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
The phone is powered by a 2000mAh removable  Li-ion battery and runs Android 4.4 KitKat out of the box in the era of Marshmallow devices. Xolo Q600S is available in White color only.
Alternatives: For more options check out the best phones under 10,000

Overview: 4.5 Inch display with a resolution of 960x540 pixels (qHD), average pixel density of 245PPI
1.2GHz Quad Core Processor with 1GB of RAM
4GB of Internal Memory with 1.82GB available to the user
MicroSD card slot, expandable upto 32GB
5 Megapixel autofocus camera with LED flash and VGA front facing camera
Android 4.1 Jelly Bean (Outdated OS)
Pre installed apps like Hike and Kingston Office
Dual SIM (GSM+CDMA)
Removable 1500mAh battery
Alternatives
Nokia Lumia 630 Dual
ASUS ZenFone 5
Karbonn Titanium S9 Lite

Samsung's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed Samsung Galaxy M32 might actually be one of the cheapest 5G devices of all time. This 5G device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone will also pack in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a beautiful AMOLED display, a huge 6000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone will be powered by the MediaTek Helio G80 SoC.
Design and Display: The Samsung Galaxy M32 will reportedly boast a 6.4 inch Super AMOLEDdisplay with a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixelsand a high pixel density of 411ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive notch design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 for enhanced viewing experience. The device will come with Corning Gorilla Glass v5 protection.
Cameras: The Samsung Galaxy M32 is expected to house a quad rear camera with a powerful 64MP primary sensor, an 8MP wide-angle sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device will feature a powerful 20MP selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features likeAuto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Samsung Galaxy M32 will be baked with the MediaTek Helio G80 chipset coupled with an Mali-G52 MC2GPU. The device will come assembled with 4GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 64 GB, which can be expanded upto a whopping 1TB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 6000mAh Li-ion battery with fast charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Samsung Galaxy M32 will run Samsung One UI on top of Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features like 5G, dual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n/n 5GHz, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.0. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm headphone jack ,and a side-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: The Xperia ZL (also known as Xperia C6503 / C6502 / C6506) is yet another super Android device from Sony. Similar to the Xperia Z in specs, the ZL features a 1080p resolution on a 5-inch full touch-screen, a 13MP camera, Android Jelly Bean running on a 1.5GHz Qualcomm Quad-core processor with 2GB of RAM. Sony has a Bravia 2 engine running on the screen that improves the brightness and contrast on the 443 ppi display on the Xperia ZL. Just like the Xpeira Z, the ZL would compete with the HTC Butterfly on the specs front and expectedly also the Samsung Galaxy SIV.

The Xperia Z and ZL while being similar on the specs side, sport a different form factor. The ZL is a much more compact design when it comes to dimensions, but ends up being thicker than the Z and weighs a bit more at 151 grams. The Z on the other hand is much slimmer and features a IP57 certification that makes it a rugged device with dust and water protection. The front camera on the ZL is 2MP and is uncannily placed on the lower right side on the front of the device. The internal storage on the device is a standard 16GB with a Micro SD expansion option.

The LG Optimus G Pro E988 is a premium phablet from the 'other' Korean smartphone maker. Much like the Samsung Galaxy Note II, the G Pro has a 5.5-inch display, but with a better 1920 x 1080 pixel resolution. It may not have a built-in Stylus like the Note, but the G Pro's display is the high-sensitivity variety, allowing input even when you're wearing gloves. It is powered by a 1.7GHz quad-core Snapdragon 600 chipset, 2GB of RAM and has 16GB of internal storage (along with a microSD card slot too). It runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean, which as of today is a little outdated. In terms of connectivity, you've got WiFi's latest 802.11ac standard onboard, along with 4G LTE support too. 3G speeds are not too shabby as well, with the highest possible support of 42Mbps.

There's a 13 megapixel camera at the back with a myriad of features like image stabilization, Panorama, HDR (High Dynamic Range), Face detection etc. It does HDR video as well in 1080p Full HD. The 2.1 megapixel front-facing camera can shoot high-definition video too. All these powerful-sounding components are provided power by a big 3140 mAh battery, which should result in acceptable up-times.

Sony Xperia E4g Dual is a Mid-Range smartphone with average specifications. It is the successor to Xperia E3, which was also an entry level smartphone from Sony. With moderate specs this device competes with Moto E (2nd Gen), which supersedes this phone in almost every aspect except camera.

Smartphones from Indian brands are generally said to have mediocre camera sensors, but this Xolo phone flaunts an Exmor R sensor which is used in Sony devices. The 8 Megapixel sensor at the back can even record Full HD videos at 1080p. The secondary 2 Megapixel camera can be used for video calling and self-photography. The smartphone features a 5 inch HD Scratch-Resistant Display with a screen resolution of 1280x720, translating into a pixel density of 294PPI  which means that the screen can deliver a sharp and crisp output. Under the hood theres a 1.3GHz Quad-core MediaTek processor with 1GB RAM. The chipset should be powerful enough to provide a lag-free multi-tasking experience. The internal 8GB memory can be expanded upto 32GB by using a microSD card.

It is Dual-SIM phone with 3G connectivity and has other basic connectivity options like Bluetooth, Wifi and GPS. The phone packs Android v4.2 Jelly Bean but is upgradable to v4.4 Kitkat. The beast is powered by a 2250mAh battery which should be sufficient to juice this device for a day. This phone is a good alternative for people wanting a Moto G but arent satisfied with its camera.

The Microsoft Lumia 648 is a reasonably priced 4G enabled smartphone. A lot of companies are getting phones that have 4G ability at low cost. The Xiaomi Redmi Note 4G and Lenovo A6000 are such examples. The key specifications of this device are 
Has a 4.5 inch display with the resolution of 854 x 400 pixels which takes to 218 PPI
Packed with 1GB of RAM and runs on 1.2GHz, Quad Core processor
Comes with 8B of internal storage which is expandable up to 128GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 5MP but no camera in the front
Powered by a 1830 mAh battery which is non-removable
Alternatives
Asus Zenfone 5
Xiaomi Redmi Note 4G

The single SIM version of the Galaxy Grand Duos, the Galaxy Grand is similar to the former in all other specifications. Touted as an affordable large screened handset, the device boasts of a 5 inch display with a resolution of 480*800 pixels. This endows the Grand with a PPI density of 187. Tipping the scales at 162 gms, the Grand isnt even close to being lightweight. Under the hood is a dual core Qualcomm Snapdragon SoC which houses the 1.2 Ghz processor. Internal memory is a decent sounding 8GB which can be expanded further using micro SD cards. The camera is an 8 megapixel autofocus unit that can also capture videos in full HD. There is a 2 megapixel front camera as well for video calling and Skype. A 1200 mAh battery powers this handset which currently runs Android 4.1.2 (Jelly Bean). Connectivity options on the Galaxy Grand I9080 are comprehensive with support for BlueTooth 4.0, WiFi, GPS, HSDPA and FM Radio.

The device has a 13MP rear camera which is capable for recording 1080p videos with a flash. And on the front lies the 5MP camera. The phone has 32GB internal storage with expandable storage option up to 128GB via an expandable MicroSD card. There is another variant Asus Zenfone 2 Laser 2GB/16GB with 16GB internal storage but has 2GB of RAM.

The Zenfone 2 Laser ZE601KL is a Dual SIM device which supports 4G. The phone is powered by a 3000mAh battery & runs on Android 5.0 Lollipop with Asus’s ZenUI running on top. The smartphone is available in three colors viz. Gold, Red, Silver.

Xiaomi recently expanded its budget lineup of Redmi smartphones with Xiaomi Redmi 4X. It flaunts a unibody metal design with a rear-mounted fingerprint scanner. The phone measures 139.24 mm in height, 69.96 mm in width and 8.65 mm in thickness, and weighs 150 g.

India as a market has been very receptive towards devices that serve the purpose, both of a smartphone and a tablet. Therefore, it should come as no surprise that most manufacturers today include a phablet in their catalogue. When it comes to iBall, a smartphone manufacturer from India, the Cobalt 6 sits in there as their offering for the users who are interested in phablet devices.
Display & Design: The Cobalt 6 comes with a 6 inch Full HD display, which gives the phone a pixel density of 367 PPI, which should make for a nice reading as well as multimedia consumption experience. The design of the phone is largely plastic, though you do have a soft touch feel on the back. Other than that, the design is rather uninspiring and you have the candybar form factor on the iBall Cobalt 6. The chassis on the phone sees the overall thickness to be around 8.9mm.
Hardware and Features: Powering the Cobalt 6 is an Octa-core 1.7GHz chipset with A7 cores. There is 2GB of RAM, which should deliver you enough power and memory to be able to do most of the everyday tasks without much hiccup. One positive thing for the phone is that it comes with read and write support for 15 regional languages in India. On the software side of the story, you get slightly dated Android 4.4 Kitkat.
Camera & Storage: The rear camera on the Cobalt 6 is a 16MP sensor with BSI sensor and a Dual LED flash on the back. This LED flash can not just help you out when taking shots in dim light, but also can double up as a torch using any supported torch application. The front facing camera is an 8MP sensor with Auto Focus, that should suffice for your needs for clicking selfies and video calling.
Battery and Connectivity: iBall Cobalt 6 ships with 3000mAh battery out of the box. While, this may not be enough for the phone to be counted among the big battery phones, this should get you through a day on light usage. However, anything beyond that and you can expect the phone to look for its charger before it is time to go to bed. There is no LTE here, though you do have 3G support on both the SIM cards that the phone can use. The SIM slots here utilise Full sized SIM cards instead of micro or nano SIM. There is WiFi connectivity alongside Bluetooth here. There is also USB OTG support.
Competition: In the Rs 8,000 range, the phones that really could give the iBall Cobalt 6 run for its money are the Coolpad Note 3 and the Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus. If you can raise your budget a little, which we would recommend you to, devices like the Redmi Note 3 and the LeEco Le 1s would be excellent choices.

Introduction:: Zopo Hero 1 is a dual SIM device that was launched in February 2016. Sleek, elegant and symmetrical built, nano injection moulding and spray coating technology for back panel, shiny silver double track for the middle frame, face Beautify 4.0 are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Zopo Hero 1 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 293PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 146.10 x 70.60 x 8.65 mm and its weight is 136 grams. It is available in Black and White colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz Quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, Mali-T720 MP1 graphics, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System, and 2GB RAM. It has accelerometer, gravity sensor, Hall Effect sensor, geo-magnetic sensor and light sensor. Calculator, calendar, notes, reminders, to-do list, world clock, organizer, Google Apps are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Zopo Hero 1 is loaded with 13.2MP rear camera having 1/3.06 inch sensor size and 5P lens and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include LED flash It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2500mAh Li-ion battery, expert power management IC and super power saving chip. It provides talk time of up to 18 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards.
Competition:

Zopo Hero 1 faces competition from Lava Iris X5 4G and Meizu M3 Note. Lava Mobiles Iris X5 4G has a better front camera but lesser expandable storage than Zopo Hero 1. Meizu M3 Note has bigger screen, higher battery capacity and higher pixel density than Zopo Hero 1.

Overview: The Micromax Canvas Turbo is the first handset the Indian phone maker has launched after signing up with Hollywood superstar Hugh Jackman as Micromax's brand ambassador. The first and foremost difference between the Turbo and the Canvas 4 is the display resolution  while both have the same 5-inch size, the Canvas Turbo has a higher 1920 x 1080 pixel resolution. It has also received a speed bump with a faster 1.5GHz quad-core Mediatek chip with double the RAM (now 2GB). It has the same 16GB internal memory out of which about 10GB is available to the user. But surprisingly, there isnt a microSD card slot to expand it further.

The camera department is mostly untouched  the same 13 megapixel rear-facing and 5 megapixel front-facing sensors are put on the Turbo. Theres the same 2000 mAh battery as well; which can be a concern considering the higher density display and the faster internals. It runs Android 4.2.1 Jelly Bean with Micromaxs features like Blow-to-unlock and others weve seen in handsets like the Canvas 4.

Japanese smartphone manufacturer Panasonic extended its budget smartphone lineup with the launch of Eluga I9. It will compete against budget smartphones like the Xiaomi Redmi 5A. Lets see what this device has to offer.
FAQs: 1. Will this phone work with Reliance Jio network?
Ans: Yes, the Eluga I9 supports VoLTE which lets you use Reliance Jio.
2. How is the camera for selfies?
Ans:There is a 5MP front camera with LED flash for better quality selfie images.
3. Is the battery removable?
Ans: Yes, the user can remove the device battery.
4. Will it support my existing nano sim card?
Ans: This device offers two sim slots with one slot for micro sim card & the other for nano sim card.

Overview: Out of the numerous devices from Poco series, the recently launched Poco F1 128GB is one of the very few to support . That makes it one of the cheapest devices despite the fact that it still seems overpriced when comparing the remaining specs to devices such as the Note 9 Pro or the Pro Max. The Poco F1 128GB has a large 4000mAh battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chipset. The device also scores in the display and cameras department.
Design and Display: The Poco F1 128GB features a 6.18 inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 2246 pixels and a high pixel density of 403ppi. The display sports the Notch design with an aspect ratio of 18.7:9 for enhanced viewing experience. The device comes with added Corning Gorilla Glass protection and water resistance .
Cameras: The Poco F1 128GB houses a dual camera system consisting of a 12MP primary sensor, and a 5MP depth sensorwith LED flash support onboard. On the front, the device features a 20MP selfie shooter. The smartphone arrives with features like Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Electronic Image Stabilization (EIS), Exmor-RS CMOS Sensor, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Poco F1 128GB is baked with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 845 chip and a Adreno 630 GPU. The RAM and internal storage of the device stands at 6GB and 128GB respectively. The device supports memory cards up to 256GB. Battery life with this device is not an issue with the large 4000mAh Li-Polymer battery with fast charging support onboard .
Software and Connectivity: Poco F1 128GB runs MIUI on the top of Android 8.1 out of the box. The smartphone arrives with a variety of connectivity options like dual SIM 4G(Nano + Nano(Hybrid)), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n, GPS, Radio and Bluetooth 5.0. The device ships with an USB Type-C port , a 3.5mm headphone jack and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Karbonn Mobiles  along with Micromax has been of late doing pretty well in the extremely competitive mid-range high end phones. Thats right. We are talking about phones with large displays and fast processors which usually cost a bomb but are offered at mid-range price levels. The Karbonn Smart A111 is one such handset and features a 5-inch Capacitive Touchscreen with a resolution of 480*800 pixels. This dual SIM handset boasts of a 1.2 Ghz Scorpion Dual Core processor under the hood and is supported with 512 MB of RAM. The device runs Android v4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) and packs in 4 GB of ROM and an expandable storage capacity of 32 GB thanks to a microSD card slot.

The imaging bit is handled by a 5 MP Primary Camera which can also capture videos in HD. There is a secondary video calling camera as well. Connectivity wise, almost everything has been covered  including WiFi, 3G, micro USB, FM Radio and GPS. The device also supports FM Radio. Powering the handset is a 2150 mAh battery that should be good enough to keep you powered for an entire day of moderate usage.
Panasonic has launched its latest 4G VoLTE smartphone – Panasonic P88. It came as just another addition to P-series smartphones after the company launched the Panasonic P71 earlier.

A Dual SIM phone from the Indian manufacturer Xolo Mobile. Like most phones in this price range the Q800 also has a 4.5 inch screen with qHD display. The device is powered by a 1.2 GHz Quad-Core MediaTek processor based on the A7 architecture. 4GB of Internal storage is now standard in most devices finds its way in this device as well and storage is expandable via a MicroSD card slot upto 32GB.

The device runs on Android 4.1.2 (Jelly Bean) with power from the 2100mAh battery. The battery sounds like it it could hold up to a decent uptime. The phone is loaded with sensors, like a magnetometer and gyroscope.

Micromax Informatics Limited is one of the leading consumer electronics company in India and claims to be the 10th largest mobile phone player in the world. The Fire 2 is a dual-SIM phone which runs on Android 4.4. The phone has a 4.5 inches screen and comes with 1GB RAM. It runs on a 1.3GHz Quad Core processor. Theres 4GB of internal storage that is packed with the phone can be expandable upto 32GB via microSD cards. It is also 3G enabled. The rear camera is of 5MP whereas the front one is a VGA. The phone has a 1900mAh Lithium-ion battery. On paper, the phone is very similar to its preceded  Micromax Canvas Fire. One looking to buy this phone can also have a look at the Asus Zenfone 5.

Targeted at the ultra-low end segment of the market, the Samsung Guru E1205 is an inexpensive device that is designed to be a reliable barebones communication device. The phone features a 1.5 inch, 128*128 pixel, 65k TFT display. As expected from a phone of its class, this one does not feature a camera. A unique feature on this device is its Anti Dust Keypad that wont let dust settle inside the phone  extending its life. The E1205 supports MP3 ringtones and even gets an FM Radio that you can use after plugging in your headset. Another utilitarian feature on the handset is the torch light that you can use in emergencies. For the price it commands, it would be criminal of the buyer to expect this one to feature anything revolutionary.

Panasonic has added yet another model to its P series. The P31 is essentially an entry-level quad-core smartphone. It sports a 5-inch screen with 854 X 480 pixels, that results in a low pixel density of 196PPI. The screen will lack crispness and sharpness, other phones in this price range offer a HD screen. The phone is powered by a 1.3GHz quad-core processor, coupled with 1GB of RAM. It is a Dual-SIM phone but supports only Micro-SIM cards. The phone has a 8 megapixel rear camera which supports Full HD video recording and also there is a secondary camera for video calling.

With Panasonic P31, the company has introduced "Play Life" user interface. The smartphone understands gestures (hand movements) with its "Gesture Play" feature, it lets the user multi-task while playing videos with the "Pop-i Player". The "Music café" feature lets the user organise music. Its competitors are Moto G and Xolo Q1000 which offer similar hardware specifications but with a better screen.

Along with the launch of the much awaited Redmi 5, Xiaomi has also launched Redmi 5 Plus. The Redmi 5 Plus is the elder sibling of Redmi 5 with some key differences. Let’s take a look at the device overview:
FAQs: 1. Will this phone work with Reliance Jio network?
Ans: Yes, Reliance Jio is compatible with this phone due to VoLTE connectivity.
2. Will this support my existing Nano SIM card?
Ans: Yes, Nano SIM card is compatible with this device
3.What comes in the box?
Ans: Along with the device, Xiaomi has included charger, a separate cable & a user manual inside the box.
4. Does it support OTG?
Ans: Yes, USB OTG cable support allows you to connect the phone to other devices.

Overview: The Yoyo is a mid range handset by the Chinese smartphone maker OPPO. The phone has a 4.7 inch IPS display with a resolution of 960x540 pixels(qHD), the pixel density is around 234 PPI which is not that bad either. The device has a 1.3GHz quad-core processor along with 1GB of RAM. In terms of storage the phone has 4GB of internal memory which is expandable via a MicroSD card slot on the phone to 32GB. The Yoyo has a 5 megapixel primary camera and a 2 megapixel front facing camera.

The phone runs on Android 4.2 Jelly Bean with Oppos Color OS overlay on top of it. The software is seriously outdated and we wish it came with better software. The phone comes with a lot of features that Oppo has installed like the HotKnot where you can transfer photos, songs or file just by touching the touchscreens together. Gesture search is also loaded and it helps in launching apps by assigning a gesture to it. The phone has a removable 1900mAh battery and comes with in-ear headphones. Oppo also gives an 8GB card free in the box. For the price its offered wed recommend the new MotoG as an alternate.
Chinese tech company Lenovo launched the K6 Power in December 2016. Let’s take a look at the device’s overview below:
Display and Design:: Beginning with the display, the Lenovo K6 Power features a 5-inch LCD screen. The display resolution measures 1980 x 1020 pixels which roughly translates the pixel density  to 441 PPI. It features a metal unibody that feels sturdy and premium in hands. There is a fingerprint sensor on the back of the device and a 3.5mm headphone jack for connecting any audio accessories. The phone comes in three colors: Dark Grey, Silver, and Gold.
Camera:: In camera department, the Lenovo K6 Power comes with a  13MP rear camera with PDAF & LED flash. PDAF helps you click good pictures in low light. On the front, Lenovo has added an 8MP sensor for clicking selfies. The rear camera is capable of recording full HD videos (1080p).
Performance,Storage & OS:: The Lenovo K6 Power runs on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 processor clocked at 1.4GHz. It packs 3GB RAM and Adreno 505 graphics processor onboard. The hardware is enough to run normal to moderate tasks without a dip in performance. The device offers 32GB inbuilt storage & microSD card slot which is expandable up to 128GB. The K6 Power runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow OS out of the box.
Battery & Connectivity:: The Lenovo K6 Power packs a large 4000 mAh non-removable battery which is enough to last for a day without charging. It is a dual SIM smartphone that accepts nano SIM cards. On the connectivity front the phone offers support for 4G, 3G, 2G networks, along with WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE.

Overview: Samsungs Star series used to be a rage back in 2009-10. Although their popularity has decreased over the years thanks to the advent of low cost Android smartphones, Samsung continues to sell some of those devices in India. And why not? They make for some great feature phones. The Duos S5222 as you might have guessed by now happens to be a dual SIM device. This one features a 3-inch capacitive 320*240 pixel TFT display. The phone runs Samsungs proprietary TouchWiz OS that might be a bit sluggish at times  but is quite user friendly. The phone tips the scales at just over 95 grams making it quite pocketable. It has 20 MB of internal memory which can be expanded further using micro SD cards. The Duos S5222 does not support 3G  but has access to high speed Internet using Wi-Fi. There is a 3.15 megapixel camera at the rear which can also record videos in QCIF resolution at 15 fps. The Li-ion 1000 Mah battery is sufficient for a days worth of usage and more if you happen to be a casual user. The talktime offered by this phone is 14 hours and 20 minutes.

The Curve 8520 has for long been the cheapest and the best selling Blackberry around. With the popularity of BBM a lot of youngsters are keen on buying a cheap Blackberry device and the plastic body Curve fills that gap. On the features side the Curve 8520 isn't the best smartphone around, but if one is looking for a low cost Blackberry, this is the one to begin with.

Karbonn is making an attempt to sell phones by marketing them in the name of Rajnikants film: Kochadaiiyaan  The Legend. The Dual-SIM phone runs on a 1GHz processor and is supported by a 1GB of RAM (these specifications are good considering the price). The phone has two cameras; 5 megapixel rear camera with flash and a front facing VGA camera for video calling. The phone has a microSD memory card slot, WiFi and Bluetooth. The only thing this smartphone misses out on is 3G connectivity. It has a 1450mAh battery which should last for a day under normal usage.
5 inch IPS display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels, 294 PPI pixel density
1.3GHz Quad Core Processor with 1GB of RAM
8GB of Internal Storage, 1GB for system Apps
MicroSD card slot, expandable up to 32GB
13 Megapixel Autofocus camera(Sony Sensor) with LED Flash capable of 1080p Full HD Video recording,
Front facing 5 megapixel fixed focus camera for selfies and video calling
Android 4.4 Kitkat
Dual SIM (GSM+GSM)
2000mAh Removable battery
Alternatives
Micromax Canvas Elanza 2
Micromax Canvas 2 Colours
ASUS ZenFone 5

Panasonic has offered the Eluga I2 in three versions, each with a different RAM configuration. You can choose if you want the Eluga I2 with 1GB, 2GB or 3GB RAM. Of course, the pricing differs accordingly as well. Panasonic surely realises that the amount of RAM on a mobile phone plays an important role in decision making for consumers.

The Eluga I2 2GB RAM comes with a good 5” full touchscreen that has 720p HD resolution and Panasonic’s Oncell technology. The Phone supports 4G connectivity and Dual SIM operations, thus giving you best possible network operations. All Eluga I2 mobiles have a good 8MP camera that can record full HD videos and a 5MP front camera. With a 1GHz Quad-core processor, running the Android Lollipop on this device is easy. The battery is rated at 2000mAh, you can look at Gionee M2 if you are looking at better battery at this price range.

Vivo Y11 is a budget Android smartphone that is powered by a 1.3 GHz Mediatek Quad-Core processor and has 512 MB of RAM. It has an internal storage of 4 GB that can be extended up to 32GB using a microSD card.
Lava Iris X8 is yet another budget Android smartphone. It is an upgrade to Lavas Iris X5. It looks strikingly similar to the iPhone 4. For the price it has decent amount of specifications.

In order to cater to its selfie-loving gen-X audience, Asus launched the ZenFone Live. As the name suggests, the main attraction of the device is what the company calls as  the “world’s first live streaming beautification technology.”

Sony Xperia Neo L is a smart phone that oozes elegance with its 4 inches TFT display. Stylish and sleek, the LED backlit capacitive touch screen gives a resolution of 480 by 854 pixels and has a Timescape UI. Neo L is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon chipset and has a 1GHz processor that gives short response time. This phone runs on Android OS v4.0 (Ice-cream Sandwich). Its connectivity options are enhanced by features like 2G/3G networks, Wi-Fi and DLNA, Bluetooth v2.1 with A2DP and EDR and GPS-support. Neo L has an internal storage of 1GB out of which 300MB is user available. But this can be expanded to 32GB using Micro SD cards.

Xperia Neo L offers a 5MP camera with features like auto focus, LED flash, video recording of 720p, geo-tagging etc. This gives an image resolution of 2592 by 1944 pixels. It also has a front VGA camera for video calls. The other notable features of this phone include Track ID music recognition, xLoud technology for crisp and loud music, predictive text input, document viewer and voice memo. Neo L has a standard Li-ion battery that sustains 7 hours 9 min of talk-time and runs up to 410 hours in stand-by mode (for 3G). It is available in Black and White colours.
The Xperia E3 is the mid ranger for Sony for the year 2014. The device was launched alongside the Xperia Z3 and the Xperia Z3 Compact.

The phone is a successor to the Xperia E1 and the design is still somewhat the same. The phone has a bigger 4.5 inch screen and a slightly higher resolution of 854 x 480 pixels. The pixel density is around 218PPI which is lower than the model it replaced. It has a 1.2 GHz Quad-Core Snapdragon 400 processor along with 1GB of RAM. The processing power and RAM is expected in a phone at this price. The phone as a upgraded 5 megapixel camera with flash and is finally capable of recording 1080p. It has 4GB of internal memory and a MicroSD card slot to extend the storage by an additional 32GB.

The Xperia E3 runs on Android 4.4 Kitkat with Sonys customizations on top of it. The E3 sports stereo speakers on the front which should enhance the audio experience. The phone now has a non removable battery rated at 2330mAh. The battery capacity is good and Sony claims that the phone will last for more than a day. The E3 is a single SIM model and there is a dual SIM variant called the Sony Xperia E3 Dual. The Micromax Canvas Nitro is a competitor for this smartphone at the given price range along with the Asus ZenFone 5 and the Moto G Gen 2.

Out of the numerous devices from Redmi series, the recently launched Redmi Note 7S 64GB is one of the very few to support . That makes it one of the cheapest devices despite the fact that it still seems overpriced when comparing the remaining specs to devices such as the Note 9 Pro or the Pro Max. The Redmi Note 7S 64GB has a large 4000mAh battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 MSM8956 chipset. The device also scores in the display and cameras department.
Design and Display: The Redmi Note 7S 64GB features a 6.3 inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1080 x 2340 pixels and a high pixel density of 409ppi. The display sports a Waterdrop notch design with an aspect ratio of 19.5:9 for enhanced viewing experience. The device comes with added Corning Gorilla Glass v5 protection.
Cameras: The Redmi Note 7S 64GB ships with a dual camera system consisting of a 48MP primary sensor, and a 5MP depth sensor with LED flash . On the front, the device features a 13MP selfie shooter. The smartphone arrives with features like AF Phase Detection, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Electronic Image Stabilization (EIS), Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, ISOCELL Plus, Touch to focus, White balance presets .
Battery and Performance: The Redmi Note 7S 64GB is embedded with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 MSM8956 chip and a Adreno 512 GPU. The RAM and internal storage of the device stands at 4GB and 64GB respectively. The device supports memory cards up to 256GB. Battery life with this device is not an issue with the large 4000mAh Li-Polymer battery with fast charging support onboard .
Software and Connectivity: Redmi Note 7S 64GB runs MIUI on the top of Android 9 out of the box. The smartphone arrives with a variety of connectivity options like dual SIM 4G(Nano + Nano(Hybrid)), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n/n 5GHz, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.0. The device will ship with an USB Type-C port , a 3.5mm headphone jack and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Micromax has been a key player in the Indian market for a while now. But with the entry of big international players in India like Motorola and Xiaomi, Micromax had to rethink their strategy to entice customers. Hence, they are offering high-end specs for a lower price. This is what the Canvas Nitro A311 has to offer 
The phone has a 5 inch IPS display. The display has the resolution of 1280x720 pixels which takes the pixel density to a decent 293 PPI.
It runs on a 1.7GHz Octa Core processor and is packed with 2GB of RAM.
The rear camera has a 13 Megapixel sensor and it also has a front facing 5 Megapixel camera.
The phone runs on Android 4.4. KitKat and offers a near to stock Android experience. Micromax has added features like Smart Alerts and Apps Permissions to the phone.
Out of the 16GB internal storage, only 5.68 is available for use. Saying that, the memory can be expanded up to 32GB by using a microSD slot.
The phone is powered by a 2500mAh Lithium-Ion battery which is removable and has two SIM slots.
The phone is available in Black & White colour.
Alternatives
Yu Yureka

Nokia Asha 300 features a much more matured design when compared with the Asha 200, the S40 powered phone features a GHz processor, 5MP camera, 3G and USB on-the-go support. The Asha 300 also manages to pack in Angry Birds. The 2.4" touch screen is accompanied by a large number pad.

The Micromax Canvas Doodle A111 is an upper entry-level handset that comes bundled with a stylus. Mind you, it looks a lot like 3rd party styluses available for iPads and not like the 'S-Pen' stylus that comes with the Samsung Galaxy Note II. There doesn't seem to be a dedicated slot to place it inside the phone, nor does the tip seem as thin and pointy as the S-Pen. Micromax advertises the preloaded Evernote Skitch app which lets you draw using the bundled stylus. Again, remember that this app is freely available on typical Android phones too.

The display is generously large at 5.3-inches, bearing a relatively low 854 x 480 pixel resolution. The Canvas Doodle A111 is powered by a quad-core Snapdragon 1.2 GHz chip and 512MB of RAM. There's 4GB of flash storage, and a microSD card slot for expansion. A highlight of the phone would be the 8 megapixel camera at the back with dual-LED flash and a 2MP camera up front. The phone is powered by a 2100 mAh battery, which should serve fairly considering the medium-grade specs.
Introduction:

The Oppo Find 7 is also available in another variant called the Find 7a, which sports higher specs. It is lighter in weight and it’s capacitive screen supports for Gloved and Wet touch as well. It has great cameras with exclusive features, direct connectivity to other devices, USB OTG support. Oppo Find 7a is a single SIM device that was announced on 19 march and was released in April 2014.
Design and Display:

Oppo Find 7a comes with 5.5 inches IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen (16M colors), Corning Gorilla Glass 3 screen protector supports for gloved and wet touch input, 1920 x 720 pixels screen resolution and having 403 PPI pixels density and 71.85% screen-to-body ratio. It has a dimension of 152.60 x 75.00 x 9.20 mm and its weight is 170g. It is available in Astro Black and White colors.
Hardware and Features:

Oppo Find 7a has loaded with 2.3 GHz Quad-core Krait 400 Qualcomm MSM8974AB Snapdragon 801 processor. It is operated through Android v4.3 (Jelly Bean) operating system, Adreno 330 graphics, and 2GB RAM.
Camera and Storage:

Oppo Find 7a is loaded with 13MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Camera features include Geo-tagging, HDR, Panorama, Face detection, touch focus, autofocus and dual-LED Flash. Users can record HD video at 2160 @30fps, 1080 @60fps, 720 @120fps. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 256GB by using a microSD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

Oppo Find 7a is equipped with a removable 2800 mAh Li-Po battery that provides a talk time of 18 hours 11 minutes on 3G, web browsing of 7 hours 9 minutes and video playback of 9 hours 19 minutes. It takes in 1 Micro SIM GSM card that supports 3G, 4G/LTE.
Competition:
Oppo Find 7a faces competition from Oppo Find 7, Oneplus One, LG G3 and Samsung Galaxy Note 4 as they offer more specs than Oppo Find 7a at the same price.

Samsungs Galaxy Ace Duos is what the Korean company brought out by giving the Ace series a touch of Dual-Sim. It has a 3.5 inches TFT Capacitive Touch Screen which gives a resolution of 320 x 480 pixels. Ace Duos comes with an internal 3 GB Memory which is expandable upto 32 GB using Micro SD cards. This phone is powered by a 832 MHz processor, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth v3.0, 3G, Stereo FM radio with RDS and sensors for accelerometer, proximity and compass. Ace Duos runs on Android OS 2.3 Gingerbread. Android loads its customized Android UI, TouchWiz on the Ace Duos thus comforting long time Samsung users. Galaxy Ace has a 5MP Camera with features like auto-focus, geo-tagging and picture quality of 2592x1944 pixels. It provides a video resolution of 30 fps. Powered by a standard Li-ion battery of 1300mAh, it supports for 7 hours in talk-time mode and 420 hours in stand-by mode. Currently available in black and white colours, the Ace Duos would attract users looking for quality Dual SIM options in India.

Karbonn S1+ is a Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM) Android (v4.3 Jelly Bean) smartphone. The smartphone has a 4-inches 800x480 pixels display with a pixel density of 207PPI, which is acceptable for a phone of this price range. There is a 1.2 GHz Quad-core processor paired with 1GB RAM. The 4GB onboard storage can be used for apps and can be expanded upto 32GB by using a microSD card.

Karbonn S1 Plus flaunts a 5 megapixel snapper with flash at the back. Also there is a VGA (0.3MP) front facing camera for video chat. Along with 3G connectivity, basic connectivity options like Bluetooth, WiFi, FM Radio and GPS etc are also available. The 1500mAh battery sounds a little less considering that quad-core chip in this phone.

LG's answer to the new crop of super Android phones from the likes of HTC and Samsung, the Optimus 4X HD draws inspiration from its predecessor, the Optimus 2X and boasts of some very potent specifications. Starting off with the huge 4.7 inch 720*1280 pixel IPS display with Gorilla Glass coating, the phone also gets the all powerful Nvidia Tegra 3 chipset which houses a quad core Cortex A9 CPU running at 1.5 GHz. It runs Android 4.0 and will be pretty soon updated to version 4.1 Jelly Bean. The onboard 16 GB of memory can be further expanded. There is an 8 megapixel camera at the rear which also doubles up as your full HD, 30 fps capable camcorder. For those of you addicted to video calls, there is a 1.3 megapixel front camera as well. Powering all this hardware is a 2150 MAH battery that offers up to 11 hours of talk time.

Nokia launched the X2 as a successor the Nokia X, which has met with a tepid response. Compared to the X, a lot has been changed in this phone, both in software and hardware. The screen size which is bumped up to 4.3 inches now. The resolution is the same  800x480 pixels but the processor is now a Qualcomm Snapdragon 200 chipset with a 1.2GHz dual-core Cortex-A7 CPU and 1GB of RAM. Also, a Home button has been added next to the Back button. 4GB of internal storage can be expanded upto 32GB by a microSD card. The battery is 1800mAh and claims to give around 4 hours of internet browsing on cellular data, which doesnt sound mighty.

At 150 grams, the phone is heavier than the Nokia X which only weighed 129 grams. The phone comes with a 5MP camera which has both autofocus and flash. It also has a front facing camera for video calling. Nokia has tweaked their Nokia X Software Platform that features Fastlane  a feature that allows you to switch between your favourite apps, has gotten better. It also has HERE maps, MixRadio and gives you 1 month free worldwide Skype calls. Keeping up with Nokias fixation for colours, the phone will be available in glossy green, orange black, yellow and white variants.

The Win Q900s is Xolo's first Windows Phone 8.1 and is most probably the lightest Windows Phone in the market weighing a measly 100 grams. This phone joins other recently launched budget Windows Phone like the Canvas Win W092 and Canvas Win W121. It features a 4.7-inch HD (1280 x 720 pixels) IPS display with One Glass Solution (OGS) and DragonTrail Glass. The phone is powered by a 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 200 alongside 1GB of RAM and Adreno 302 GPU.

The Xolo Win Q900s sports an 8-megapixel rear camera with PureCel sensor and LED flash, while it also houses a 2-megapixel front-facing camera.The PureCel sensor supposedly enhances image and video quality in both high and low-light conditions which should translate to crisp images. The smartphone includes 8GB of inbuilt storage which is further expandable up to 32GB via microSD card. The Win Q900s packs an 1800mAh battery which is rated to deliver up to 14 hours of talktime and up to 246 hours of standby time on 3G network. The smartphone comes with GPRS/ EDGE, 3G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS and Micro-USB connectivity options. The smartphone is currently available in Black colour only.

The Xolo Q1000 Opus is a smartphone which is a scaled down version of the Xolo Q1000. The phone has a 5 inch IPS display with a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels, scaled down from the 720p display on the Q1000. The pixel density is 196 PPI, Xolo shouldve improved the screen resolution to give a good experience . The device runs on a 1.2GHz Quad core processor with 1GB of RAM.

It has a 5 megapixel autofocus camera on the back with a BSI sensor, this helps to click better images in low lighting. The camera is capable of shooting 720p video but there are cheaper phones like the Spice Dream Uno that does Full HD.The front has a VGA camera for selfies and video calling. The phone has 4GB of internal memory and a MicroSD card slot that accepts cards upto 32GB. The phone was launched with Android 4.2 JellyBean and will be updated to Android 4.4 Kitkat. It has a removable 2000mAh battery and offers dual SIM support.

The Zenfone Series by Asus saw rapid expansion with a launch of a lot of devices at the Asus Zen Festival. The Zenfone 2 Laser was launched alongside the Zenfone 2 Deluxe and the Zenfone Selfie. Just by looking at the name it is pretty evident that the phone is based on the highly popular Zenfone 2.

Xolo has added a new member to its Q series of smartphones. The budget Q700s Android smartphone features a 4.5-inch IPS display with a 480x854 (FWVGA) pixel resolution, which provides decent viewing experience (considering the price range). A quad-core MediaTek MT6582M processor powers the device, clocked at 1.3GHz with 1GB of RAM (this hardware is great for a phone of this price segment).

The smartphone features an 8-megapixel autofocus rear camera with LED flash and BSI sensor (Back Side Illumination, or BSI helps in capturing better quality images in dark), while there is a 0.3 megapixel front-facing camera for video calling. The special feature of this phone is that it can capture Full HD videos at 1080p. The Xolo Q700S handset comes with a 4GB in-built storage and can be expanded up to 32GB via a microSD card. The Dual-SIM phone supports 3G speeds of up to 21Mbps, with Wi-Fi , Bluetooth and GPS. It is powered by an 1800mAh battery, and is available in two colour variants  Silver and Gold.
5 inch display with the resolution of 854x480 pixels
Below average 195 PPI pixel density
Dual SIM phone
Runs on a 1.3Ghz, Quad Core processor and comes with 1GB RAM
Comes with 8GB of internal storage which is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 5MP does video recording at 720p
2MP camera in the front
Powered by a 2000mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Asus Zenfone 5
Micromax Canvas 2 Colours

1.3GHz Dual core processor with 512MB RAM
4GB of Internal storage
5 megapixel autofocus camera with flash but only records VGA@30FPS
VGA front facing camera for the occasional selfie
Android 4.4 Kitkat
LG Knock Code-( Unlock the phone by tapping the display), Guest Mode
Dual SIM support
Removable 1700mAh battery
Alternatives
Asus Zenfone 4 (CG450)
Spice Dream Uno
Micromax Canvas A1
Asus ZenFone 5 (8GB)
Introduction:

The Lenovo A5000 was announced in February 2015, which was released in April 2015. Its 5.0-inch screen makes everything appear clearer and sharper. Its Quick charge feature will fully recharge the A5000 in just 3 hours. Its energy saving software is designed to prolong the battery even further. It is available in India for just 5,000/- Rs. Only.
Design and Display:

Lenovo A5000 sports a 5.0 inch IPS LCD Capacitive Multitouch Display with an HD resolution of 720*1280 pixels which result in a density of 294 pixels per inch. The A5000 sits comfortably in the palm of your hand with its ergonomic and rounded shape body. Also thanks to its splash-proof nano-coating which prevent its screen from rain or a spilled drink. It has a dimension of 140*71.4*9.98 mm with a weight of 160 g which result in 68.9% Screen to Body ratio. It is available in Black and White color only.
Hardware and Features:

At the heart of it, The Lenovo A5000 is powered by 1.3 GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6582 Cortex A7 processor coupled with 1 GB RAM helps to make multitasking faster and smoother. It is operated through Android v4.4.2 (KitKat) which upgradable further up to Android v5.0.2 (Lollipop) with Mali-400 MP2 GPU.
Camera and Storage:

The Lenovo A5000 has 8 MP, f/2.2 primary camera with LED Flash and autofocus. It is also armed with 2 MP front camera makes video chatting easy and fun. Other camera features include Geo-tagging, touch to focus, face detection, HDR and recording video @ 1080@30 fps. Its internal memory is 8 GB which is expandable up to 32 GB gives more space for your files, photos, music, and videos.
Battery and Connectivity:

The Lenovo A5000 is backed with a non-removable 4000 mAh Li-Po battery that delivers extra long life, which claims to offer standby time up to 768 hours (2G)/ 804 hours (3G) and talk time up to 35hours (2G)/ 17 hours (3G). It is a Dual SIM Smartphone (Mini and Regular) which both offers 2G/3G service. Other connectivity features include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, MicroUSB, etc.

Lenovo A706 features a 4.5 inch FWVGA IPS TFT display with a screen resolution of 480 x 854 pixels. It is powered with a 1.2GHz Quad-core Snapdragon chip, supported by 1GB RAM. The device runs on Android 4.1 Jelly Bean OS.
The dual SIM phone sports a 5MP autofocus rear camera which is equipped with LED flash. At the front is a VGA camera for making video calls, Skype, etc.

It has an internal storage of 4GB and has a microSD card slot which support memory cards of storage upto 32GB. On the Connectivity front the Lenovo A706 smartphone includes 3G, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, microUSB connectivity and GPS (with A-GPS) helps in location tracking and navigation. The phone is energised by a 2000mAh Li-Po battery providing up to 230 hours of standby time and 16 hours talk time. An additional feature in this phone is the Dolby Digital Plus which should serve an enjoyable audio experience from headphones or through speakers.

If you thought the Lenovo P770 had a big battery, they've just taken it up a notch with the P780. A better model than the P770 in many ways, the P780 has a bigger 5-inch display with a higher 1280 x 720 pixel and IPS technology. The chipset is also upgraded to a quad-core 1.2GHz by Mediatek  the same chip you'll find on popular phones like the Micromax Canvas 4. The P780 has the same 1GB of RAM and 4GB internal memory. But enough about all these specs  the star feature of this phone is its humongous battery. The P770 had a 3500 mAh capacity battery, and the P780 pushes it further to a whopping 4000 mAh. The manufacturer claims 43 hours of talktime on 2G, and 20 days of active standby. Plus, with USB-on-the-go support, you can also provide charge to other phones. Lastly, the camera on the P780 is also upped to an 8 megapixel sensor.

Karbonn A21 is a smartphone that is launched by Indian phone maker Karbonn. It has a 4.5 inch TFT capacitive touchscreen with 256K colors support. The smartphone supports 2G and 3G network wherein 3G data speeds can go as high as 7.2Mbps. The internal memory of the phone is 4GB and can be expanded up to 32GB using microSD memory cards. The primary camera sports 5MP clarity with autofocus and LED flash. The camera also has other features like Geo-tagging and face detection. The secondary camera comprises of a 1.3MP sensor that can be used for video calling etc. Karbonn A21 runs on Android OS, v4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) and is powered by a Dual-core 1.2 GHz processor and 512MB RAM. Sensors on the Karbonn A21 include the accelerometer and proximity sensors. Li-Ion 1800 mAh battery is used wherein the company claims that the battery life during standby mode is Up to 200 hrs and in talk time mode is Up to 200 hrs.

Chinese smartphone manufacturer, Huawei is one of the many companies to launch high spec phones at reasonable prices, in India. They recently launched two new phones  the Honor Holly and the Honor 6. The key features of this device are 
5 inch display with the resolution of 854x480 pixels
Below average 195 PPI pixel density
Dual SIM
Comes with 512 MB RAM and runs on a 1.3GHz, Dual Core processor
4GB of internal storage is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 5MP
VGA camera in the front
Powered by a 2100mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Lava Iris X5

Introduction:: Panasonic Eluga Tapp is a dual SIM device that was launched in October 2016. Finger print scanner, exceptional look and VoLTE support are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Panasonic Eluga Tapp comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive IPS display, multi touch facility, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 143 x 71 x 8.15 mm and its weight is 138 grams. It is available in Champagne Gold and Silver Gray colour. It has a body to screen ratio of 67.72%.
Hardware and Features:
This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz Quad-core processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System, and 2GB RAM. Accelerometer, ambient light sensor and proximity sensor are available.
Camera and Storage:

Panasonic Eluga Tapp is loaded with an 8MP rear camera having 3264 x 2448 Pixels image resolution and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include continuous shooting, geotagging, face detection, autofocus, touch to focus and LED flash. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2800mAh Li-ion battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Panasonic Eluga Tapp faces competition from Micromax Canvas 5 and Meizu M3S 3GB. Micromax Canvas 5 has a higher capacity battery, better rear camera than Panasonic Eluga Tapp. Meizu M3S 3GB has more RAM, higher capacity battery and higher rear camera than Panasonic Eluga Tapp.

Overview: The Indian smartphone manufacturer Intex this time has focused slightly on design and looks following the flagship trend from Apple and has launched the Aqua Trend in similar color variants. The phone comes in Black, Champagne, Grey and Silver colors.
Intex Aqua Trend has 5 inch display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels. Pixel density is 294PPI which is not bad considering the price and the screen size.
On the inside runs a MediaTek’s MT6735 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz. It comes with 2GB RAM and should provide good multitasking experience.

The rear sports a 13MP sensor with a Dual LED flash and the sensor can record videos up to 1080p. It can also record Slo-mo videos, also there are several modes and filters from the software end on the smartphone. There is a also a 5MP camera on the front for quick selfies.

In terms of power, Intex Aqua Trend is powered by a 3000mAh removable battery. The phone supports Dual Micro SIMs and both are 4G enabled. It comes with 16GB of internal storage and expandable up to 32GB via a MicroSD card. The phone runs on Android Lollipop (5.1) that is mostly Stock Android with Intex icon pack out of the box.
Alternatives: For more options check out the best phones under 10,000

Overview: Introduction:

Panasonic P55 Novo 3GB is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. It has a good camera with gradient capture feature, HD IPS capacitive display with multi touch support and support for 12 Indian languages are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

This dual SIM device comes with a 5.3 inch touchscreen display with 1280 x 720 pixels resolution and 277PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 147.9 x 73.8 x 8.15 mm and its weight is 156 grams. It is obtainable in 3 colours which are Midnight Blue, Golden and Smoke Gray.
Hardware and Features:

Panasonic P55 Novo 3GB comes with a 1.3GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6592M processor, 3GB RAM, Android 6.0 Marshmallow operating system and Mali-450 MP4 graphics. Some applications like Google Maps, Google Play Store, Gmail, latitude and navigation are in-built. Accelerometer, light sensor and proximity sensor are available. MP3 media player and MP4 video player and radio are available.
Camera and Storage:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 13MP rear and 5MP front camera with triple LED flash. Autofocus, digital zoom, HDR and scene mode features are available. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p. It comes with an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
It is equipped with a 2500mAh removable Li-ion battery. Connectivity options include 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth.
Competition:

Panasonic P55 Novo 3GB can face direct competition from Micromax Canvas 5, Xiaomi Redmi 3S Prime and Xolo Black 1X as these are available in same price range with few differences in features and specifications. Panasonic P55 Novo 3GB has a bigger screen than the other three. Battery capacity of Micromax Canvas 5 and Xiaomi Redmi 3S Prime is better than that of Panasonic P55 Novo 3GB.

Introduction:: Oppo Mirror 3 is a dual SIM device that was launched in February 2015. The phone has some rich and impressive features like 6 diverse beautify modes, blue light filter, Pure Image 2.0+ technology, rapid shooting mode and Smart Remote Technology 2.0+.
Display and Design:

This dual SIM device is equipped with 4.7 inch LCD IPS TFT touchscreen display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels and pixel density of 312.5PPI. It has a dimension of 137.6 x 68.8 x 8.95 mm and it weighs 126 grams. It has capacitive multi-touchscreen with Gorilla Glass 3 screen protector. The back side is built with an ergonomic arc to fit in your palm perfectly. It is available in 2 colours including Blue and White.
Hardware and Features:

Oppo Mirror 3 comes with a 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor, ColorOS based on Android 4.4 Operating System, 1GB RAM and Adreno 306 for graphics. Distance sensor, light sensor, g-sensor and e-compass are in-built. Touch-free screen lock, easy screenshots, different air gestures are available.
Camera and Storage:

Oppo Mirror 3 is loaded with 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera and Sony IMX179 sensor. Autofocus, LED flash, panorama, HDR features are available. Both cameras have an aperture of f/2.0. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 128GB by using a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2000mAh Li-ion battery that can be fully charged within 90 minutes by using 2A charger. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, OTG GPS and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Oppo Mirror 3 can face direct competition from Samsung Galaxy E5, Sony Xperia Z1 and Yu Yureka. Yet, Oppo has some innovative features and great camera quality that makes it stand apart.

Overview: The Sony XPERIA M is the Japanese company's attempt at attracting the hot sub-Rs. 15,000 segment, where a bulk of Indian and Chinese players are betting. It carries over the signature 'OmniBalance' design found on higher-end handsets like the XPERIA Z and even the mid-range XPERIA SP, and hopes that and the brand value will attract buyers more than the spec sheet. It's got a 4-inch display with an 854 x 480 pixel resolution, a dual-core 1GHz Snapdragon chip, 1GB of RAM and 4GB of internal storage. This is probably one of the cheapest phones to include NFC, that allows for easy connectivity to other NFC devices by simply bringing them close. There's an LED notification light placed below the display that notifies you of any new activity when the phone's in standby. The 5 megapixel camera can capture 720p HD videos and there's a front-facing VGA cam as well. Lastly, a 1750 mAh battery powers this phone, which should give a decent up-time, given the modest specifications and Sony's Stamina mode.

Seeing the rise in demand for budget smartphones, HTC has launched Desire 210 which will compete with budget mobile phones from the local brands like Karbonn and Micromax. Going by the specs, HTC Desire 210 features a 4-inch WVGA display with a screen resolution of 800x480 pixels, which bears a pixel density of 233PPI (which is decent enough for a phone of this price range). Samsung Galaxy S Duos 2 has the same screen. The Desire 210 has a 1GHz Dual core processor paired with 512MB RAM while Samsung Galaxy S Duos 2 has a 1.3GHz Dual-core processor coupled with 768MB RAM (there should not be much difference in the performance but the latter may deliver a little smoother experience). The smartphone has an internal memory of 4GB which can be expanded upto 32GB by using a microSD card.

For photography, there is a 5-megapixel camera without LED flash and theres a front-facing VGA (0.3MP) camera for selfies. When compared with S Duos 2, the latter has a 5-Megapixel camera with flash and can also record HD videos @720p. Desire 210 runs on a fairly old Android v4.2 Jelly Bean. The connectivity features are same as the one from the Samsungs stable, it has 3G connectivity, Bluetooth, Wifi and GPRS. On the battery font, it is powered by a 1300mAh battery which sounds inadequate to power the phone for long periods of time.

Intex recently ventured into the smartphone segment with a range of devices which are priced aggressively to beat the competition. Intex Aqua i6 is their ace Smartphone launched by the company back in November 2013.
Display and Design: The magnificently designed Smartphone comes with 5 inch capacitive display (480x854 pixels). The device feels supremely handy and is easy to carry in the pocket owing to its slim built at only 9.9 mm in the thickness department but weights hefty at 170g. The brilliant display supports 16M colors and the phone is offered in shades of black and white.
Hardware and Features: The device is equipped with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek processor and is initially installed with the operating system as Android 4.2. Proximity Sensor, Accelerometer and Ambient Light Sensor installed in the device distinguish it from the others in this league of devices.
Camera and Storage: The device allows easy capturing of the lifetime memories with superb clarity and excellent image resolution. It is adorned with 8MP rear camera that is enabled with LED flash and has got 2MP front camera for the selfie shooters. The Smartphone is mechanized with a 512MB RAM and an internal storage of 4GB which can be expanded to up to 32GB with the use of a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity: It comes with a non-removable Li-Po battery with the capacity as 1900mAh. The device supports dual SIM and has got a number of connectivity options which include Wi-Fi, USB, 3G, GPS and Bluetooth.
Competition: There are a number of phones that were available in the market with similar configuration such as Lava Iris 406Q and iBall Andi 5K Sparkle.

Overview: HTC Desire 601 Dual SIM is a recent launch from HTC brand replacing HTC Desire 600 dual SIM. Desire 601 is available in Black, Red and White colors. The smartphone supports 2G and 3G network. The smartphone offers a touch screen of 4.5 inches which is left untouched from its predecessor. A notable change comes with boosted 3G speeds of up to 21Mbps (the Desire 600 dual SIM supported up to 7.2Mbps). The phone runs on an yet unspecified version of Android (we hope its 4.2 or 4.3 at least), with a quad-core processor clocked at 1.2 GHz coupled with 1GB of RAM.

Desire 601 has got an internal memory of 4GB, which infact is half of what the Desire 600 Dual SIM shipped with. You can expand memory up to 64 GB using a microSD card. Like the Desire 700 that was also launched alongside this handset, the Desire 601 also has stereo speakers on the front-face with a built-in amplifier, that should result in loud, clear output. About the camera, unfortunately the camera has been degraded from 8MP to 5MP autofocus and LED flash as compared with to its predecessor. Additional camera details are 1/4'' sensor size, 1.4µm pixel size, geo-tagging, face and smile detection. The phone can simultaneously take HD images and videos can be recorded at 1080p@30fps.The smartphone also offers a secondary front-facing camera. The phone has a relatively capacious Li-Po 2100 mAh battery that should give satisfactory results.

Vivo Y22 runs on Funtouch OS that is based on Android 4.2. The 1.3 GHz quad-core Mediatek processor along with 1 GB RAM powers the device. It has a 4 GB of in-built storage that can be expanded up to 128 GB via a MicroSD card slot.

The Bolt 075 is a smartphone from Micromax that comes in a bold blue colour and has a matching flip cover in the box. The device has a 5.2 inch screen with a resolution of 800x480 pixels which takes the pixel density to a mediocre 166PPI. The 262K colors display is not the best screen out there. The phone is powered by a 1GHz dual core processor with 512MB of RAM. The processor and RAM combo isnt gonna offer blazing performance but can work for a light user.

The Micromax Bolt 075 has 4GB of internal storage out of which 2.8GB is available to the user. There is a MicroSD card slot which allows storage expansion up to 32GB. It has an 8 megapixel primary camera and a 0.3 megapixel front facing camera. The rear camera only does 480p video at 30FPS. The device runs on Android 4.0.3 which is seriously outdated. It is dual SIM device and has a 2200mAh removable battery. Android One phones like the Spice Dream Uno, Micromax Canvas A1 and the Karbonn Sparkle V have a much better processor and a 5 megapixel camera capable of 1080p video.

Introduction:: Gfive xHero 7 is a dual SIM device that was launched in March 2016. Slim design, lightweight body, decent configuration and HD display are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Gfive xHero 7 comes with 5 inch LCD TFT touch screen display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 141.5 x 70.1 x 7.9 mm and its weight is 138 grams. It is available in Black and White colours. It has a capacitive screen supporting multi-touch facility.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core processor, Mali 400 GPU for graphics, Android 4.4 KitKat Operating System and 1GB RAM. Accelerometer, light sensor and proximity sensors are available. GPS and FM radio are available.
Camera and Storage:

Gfive xHero 7 is loaded with 8MP rear and 2MP front camera. Other camera features include LED flash, face detection mode, auto flash, panorama, touch focus, geo-tagging and digital zoom. Image resolution of the rear camera is 3264 x 2448 pixels. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2150mAh Li-ion removable battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, GPRS, EDGE and Bluetooth.
Competition:

Gfive xHero 7 faces competition from Micromax Canvas 5 and Gfive President Smart 1. Gfive President Smart 1 has a slower processor, lesser RAM and a smaller screen than Gfive xHero 7 whereas Micromax Canvas 5 has a larger screen, faster processor and more RAM than Gfive xHero 7.

Overview: Xolo is an Indian smartphone maker selling affordable phones and tablets in India. The Xolo Q800 X-Edition is the successor to the Xolo Q800 and sports a better processor.
The key features of the Xolo Q800 X-Edition are as follows:
4.5 Inch display with a resolution of 960x540 pixels(qHD). 245PPI pixel density
1.3 GHz Quad Core MediaTek Processor (MTK 6589) with 1GB of RAM
4GB of Internal Storage
MicroSD card slot, accepts cards upto 32GB
8 Megapixel AutoFocus camera (BSI Sensor) with LED Flash
1 Megapixel front facing camera for video calls
Android 4.1 JellyBean (outdated OS)
Dual SIM (GSM+GSM)
2100mAh battery
Alternatives
ASUS ZenFone 5
Micromax Canvas 2 Colours
The mid-range phone by Honor set to launch in March of 2019.
Design: The Body of the Honor phone is made completely of plastic. The notched display has a significant bezel. The phone is quite slippery.
Display: The phone has a 6.26 inch IPS LCD display with a screen resolution of 1080 x 2280 pixels. The aspect ratio is 19:9 with a pixel density of 432 PPI. The display is bezel-less and supports multi-touch. The screen to body ratio is 79.07%
Camera: The rear camera is 13 megapixels with an aperture of f/1.8 and a depth sensor of 2 megapixels.
The front camera is 8 megapixels and features single LED flash. Features like the ISO, white balance, shutter speed can be altered.
The device is powered by an Octa-core processor coupled with 4GB RAM with 64-bit architecture. The chipset is the Qualcomm Snapdragon 632.

The two variants available are 4GB of RAM with 32 GB of storage and 4GB of RAM with 64 GB of storage.  The 64GB internal memory can be expanded to up to 256 GB. The operating system is the Android 8.1 Oreo.
The graphical processor Mali-T830 MP2 GPU provides an excellent gaming experience.
Its battery power is 4000 mAh and is Li-Polymer.

Introduction:: Zopo Color E is a dual SIM device that was launched in December 2015. Attractive look, good rear camera, 4G connectivity and OTG support, increased energy efficiency by 150% and enhanced performance by 50% are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Zopo Color E comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It is available in 5 colours including White, Black, Red, Blue and Yellow. It has a colorful shell and metallic looking thin mid-frame along with a little curved back cover.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, 1GB RAM, Mali-T720 MP1 graphics and Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System. Light sensor, proximity sensor, accelerometer and compass are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Zopo Color E is loaded with 8MP rear and 0.3MP front camera. There is a 2 MP Dual Rear Camera. Other camera features include HDR, panorama, night mode, sport mode, smile detection, front LED flash, back LED flash Video. It also has rear LED flash and autofocus. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable Li-ion 2100mAh battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Zopo Color E faces competition from Lenovo Vibe P1m and Motorola Moto E3 Power. Lenovo Vibe P1m has more RAM and higher battery capacity than Zopo Color E. Moto E3 Power has better front camera and higher battery capacity than Zopo Color E.

Overview: The Oppo R5 is among the phones aiming for the title of the slimmest smartphone in the world. Oppo has managed to get the R5 lower than 5mm which is commendable.
The features of the Oppo R5 are as follows
5.2 Inch AMOLED display with a resolution of 1920 x1080 pixels, Pixel density of 423 PPI
Octa Core Snapdragon 615 Processor (4 cores at 1.5GHz, 4 cores at 1.0GHz) with 2GB RAM
16GB Internal Storage, non expandable storage
13 Megapixel rear camera with LED Flash, capable of 2160p(4K) Video Recording
Pure Image Software capable of clicking 50 megapixel high resolution photo
5 Megapixel front facing camera
ColorOS 2.0 based on Android 4.4 Kitkat
Incredibly slim at 4.85mm
Supports VOOC fast charging, Phone will charge upto 75% in 30 mins
No 3.5mm headphone jack, comes with a usb to 3.5mm adapter in the box
2000mAh non removable battery
Alternatives
Vivo X5 Max
Samsung Galaxy Alpha
Motorola Moto X Gen 2

Pros: The AMOLED display has excellent colour saturation
The phone comes with quick charging
Both the front and rear camera capture good pictures even in default settings
Cons: Lack of 3.5mm headset jack will be a deal breaker for most
The phone struggles if you have memory intensive applications open and want to switch between them

Overview: The Lava Xolo Q800 is a minor update to their Q700 upper entry-level smartphone. It's got the same 4.5-inch qHD (960 x 540 pixel) display that boasts of IPS technology. There's a MediaTek MT6589 quad-core 1.2 GHz chip powering the phone, just like the Micromax Canvas 2 Plus. There's a reasonable 1GB of RAM and 4GB of internal memory. The main differentiator between the Q800 and Q700 internally is the camera; which is upped from 5MP to an 8MP sensor. Even the front-facing camera is upgraded from VGA to 1MP resolution. Unfortunately, battery capacity is down from 2400 mAh on the Q700 to 2100 mAh on the Q800. It comes with Android 4.1 Jelly Bean out of the box. The Q800 is a 3G ready handset with speeds of up to 21 Mbps.

Samsung's foray in to the troubled waters of the Windows Phone platform hasn't been half as successful as its attempts at Android. With arch rival Nokia hogging all kinds of favors from Microsoft thanks to their alliance, Samsung at times looks least interested in Windows Phone nowadays. But the company ahs on offer some nice handsets on the platform. The Omnia W GT I8350 for example. This phone features a 3.7 inch capacitive 480*800 pixel super AMOLED capacitive display with a Corning Gorilla Glass coating. It has a 1.4 GHz Scorpion processor housed inside a Qualcomm MSM8255 Snapdragon chipset. It gets 8 GB of storage capacity which cannot be expanded further. There is 512 MB of RAM as well. The 5 megapixel camera at the rear can also capture videos in 720p resolution.
Domestic mobile manufacturer Karbonn launched a new affordable smartphone dubbed as the Frames S9. Let’s see what this budget device offers out of the box:

Intex Technologies, incepted in the year 1996 is an Indian Mobile, IT accessories and Consumer Durables Company. The Aqua i5 HD is a dual-SIM phone that has a 5 inch display with the resolution of 1280x720 pixels which takes the pixel density to 293 PPI It comes with 1GB RAM and runs on a 1.3 GHz , MediaTek MT6582 , Quad Core processor. The phone comes with 4GB internal memory which is expandable upto 32GB. It has a rear camera of 13MP and a front camera of 5MP for video calling and now, selfies. The battery is a removable lithium-ion one with 2000mAh power. One looking to buy this phone can also check out the Asus Zenfone 5 or the Micromax Canvas 2 Colours .

Intex, the Indian smartphone manufacturer has been able to sustain in the market by focusing on budget device that offer maximum value for money. The Intex Cloud Crystal 2.5D is yet another example to offer good value for the price it is being sold. Check out of some of features of the device below:

Realme's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed Realme C25s might actually be one of the cheapest devices of all time. This device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone will also pack in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a huge 6000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone will be powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 Octa core SoC.
Design and Display: The Realme C25s will reportedly boast a 6.5 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a high pixel density of 270ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive Waterdrop notch design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 for enhanced viewing experience. The device will come with a screen to body ratio of 88.7% and a refresh rate of 60Hz.
Cameras: The Realme C25s is expected to house a triple rear camera with a 13MP primary sensor, a 2MP macro sensor, and a 2MP sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device will feature a 8MP selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features likeAF Phase Detection, Artificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Time Lapse, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Realme C25s will be baked with the MediaTek Helio G85 Octa core chipset coupled with a Mali-G52 MC2GPU. The device will come assembled with 4GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 64 GB, which can be expanded upto 256GB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 6000mAh Li-ion battery with quick charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Realme C25s will run Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features likedual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth 5.0. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a USB Type-C port, a 3.5mm headphone jack ,and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Vivo's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed Vivo Y12s 2021 might actually be one of the cheapest devices of all time. This device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone will also pack in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a huge 5000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone will be powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 439 SoC.
Design and Display: The Vivo Y12s 2021 will reportedly boast a 6.51 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a high pixel density of 270ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display will supposedly sport an immersive Waterdrop notch design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 for enhanced viewing experience.
Cameras: The Vivo Y12s 2021 is expected to house a dual rear camera with a 13MP primary sensor, and a 2MP depth sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device will feature a 8MP selfie shooter. The camera will arrive with features likeArtificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Time Lapse, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Vivo Y12s 2021 will be baked with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 439 chipset coupled with a Adreno 505GPU. The device will come assembled with 3GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 32 GB, which can be expanded upto 256GB. Fuelling the device will be a huge 5000mAh Li-Polymer battery .
Software and Connectivity: Vivo Y12s 2021 will run Funtouch OS on the top of Android 11 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features likedual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, a/ac/b/g/n/n 5GHz, GPS, Radio ,and Bluetooth 4.2. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a microUSB 2.0 port, a 3.5mm headphone jack ,and a side-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: Established in 2009, Lava is one of the fast growing mobile handset companies in India. They offer phones at very affordable prices. This device was launched in December 2014 and its key features are 
Has a 5 inch display with the resolution of 1280x720 pixels which takes to 294 PPI
Packed with 1GB of RAM and runs on 1.3GHz, Quad Core processor
Dual SIM phone
Comes with 8B of internal storage which is expandable up to 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 10MP and a 2MP camera in the front
Powered by a 4000mAh battery which is non-removable

Targeting the mid-range smartphone market, Samsung played its card against the HTC Wildfire / Wildfire S and released the Ace. The S5830 runs Android on a 3.5" touch screen with an HVGA resolution, just like the first three iPhones. The phone is powered by an 800 MHz single-core processor. The RAM isn't much at 278MB RAM, and the internal storage is also paltry at just 158MB. But for media files, you can put a microSD card of up to 32GB. At the back, you'll find a 5MP auto-focus camera, and given the phone's low processing power, it can take videos at VGA resolution. There's 3G connectivity of up to 7.2 Mbps and WiFi support too. There's a removable 1350 mAh battery powering the Galaxy Ace. The phone runs Android 2.3 Gingerbread with no upgrade path to future versions in place. At the time, the Galaxy Ace did quite well commercially, and led to the Galaxy Ace 2 and the Galaxy Ace Duos follow-up models.

Indian mobile handset company Lava has expanded its affordable smartphones portfolio with a new 4G VoLTE phone — the Lava X50 Plus. In terms of the design, the phone features a metallic body along with a curved back.
