The Samsung Galaxy Music Duos is an entry level handset like the Galaxy Star. The primary difference between the two, and as the name of this phone suggests, is the stereo speakers on the front face. The Galaxy Music Duos, other than that, is more or less the same as the Galaxy Star. It's got the 3.0-inch QVGA display, 512MB of RAM and 4GB of internal memory. While the Star ran on a 1GHz Cortex A5 based chip, the Music Duos runs on a 850 MHz Cortex A9 based one. It comes with Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich out of the box, but has a planned update to 4.1. Another big difference, other than the dual loudspeakers, is 3G support with speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps. The battery is also slightly larger at 1300 mAh, but that might be necessary in order to provide enough juice to power those speakers. The word 'Duos' in its name also suggests that this is a dual-SIM phone. It is available in a single SIM variant too. Lastly, its got the usual WiFi and Bluetooth connectivity too.

In May 2017, Asus launched a new smartphone thereby adding another new member to its affordable Zenfone Go series which was dubbed as the Asus Zenfone Go 5.5 (ZB552KL). The unique attractive feature about this device was its large 5.5-inch display.

The Indian handset maker, Lava has come up with a beautifully designed smartphone, that is reminiscent of the iPhone 4s. It has a sharp and crisp 4.7-inch IPS LCD Display. The HD display has a screen resolution of 1280x720 pixels with a high pixel density of 312PPI. The screen has a Gorilla Glass covering, which makes it scratch-resistant. There is a 1.2GHz Quad-core processor which powers this device and is paired with 1GB RAM. There is 4GB internal memory which can be expanded upto 32GB via a microSD card.

Lava Iris Pro 30 sports a 8 Megapixel rear camera with flash and BSI Sensor, which helps to capture better images in low-light. Moreover, there is a 3 Megapixel front camera for video calling and self-photography. The camera can record Full HD videos at 1080p. It runs on Android v4.2 Jelly Bean. It has some special features like Flip To Mute and Pick To Answer. All basic connectivity options like WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS etc are bundled. It is a Dual-SIM phone with 3G connectivity. The 2000mAh battery should be sufficient to provide backup for a day.

Indian smartphone maker Micromax has come up with the Canvas Doodle to match the ever-increasing demand of bigger screen phones. The Doodle has a 6 inch display with a resolution of 854x480 pixels which drops the pixel density to 163 PPI. The resolution is really low for a display of this size. The device has a 1.3GHz Dual Core processor and 1GB of RAM. The Doodle has 8GB of internal memory out of which 4GB will be available to the user. The device has a microSD card slot that allows storage expansion up to 32GB. It has a 5 megapixel primary camera and is capable of capturing 720p videos. The front facing camera is 0.3 megapixels.

The Doodle 3 is a Dual-SIM device that runs on Android 4.4.2 Kitkat. It comes with a 6 month subscription on the pre-installed BIGFlix app. There is also a magnetic flip cover included in the box. The battery is rated at 2500 mAh and is user replaceable.

Micromax Canvas Doodle 3 is one of the largest devices available under 10K. The only USP of this device is 6-inches screen which bears a screen resolution 854x480 pixels and translates into a low pixel density of 163PPI (Moto E has a pixel density of 256PPI). In a shocking turn of events, the Doodle series which till now bundled a stylus with the package, is not part of the contents of the box in the Doodle 3. We wonder why its branded Doodle in the first place. It is powered by a 1.3GHz Dual-core MediaTek processor and is coupled with 512MB RAM. The smartphone might not be able to multi-task smoothly due to lesser RAM. There is 2GB internal storage, which sounds quite inadequate as you'll get less than 1GB to install your apps on the phone memory. It supports expansion of up to 32GB by using a microSD card.

There is a 5 megapixel rear camera with flash that can capture HD videos at 720p. Moreover, there is a VGA (0.3MP) secondary camera for selfies and video-calling. It runs on Android v4.2 Jelly Bean. It supports Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM) and 3G Connectivity. It also features Bluetooth, WiFi, GPS etc. There is a 2500mAh battery powering this humongous device. The price includes a magnetic flip-cover. Because of the paltry internal memory, we'd rather ask you to look at other options like the Gionee GPAD G3 which has at least 4GB of internal memory.

Given the price range, the Canvas Music A88 has a ton of things going for it. Micromax is always known to dazzle the value-for-money folk, and this one comes with a 4.5-inch 854 x 480 pixel IPS panel and a dual-core 1GHz processor. The only pain point is the low 512MB RAM, which might prove insufficient when running heavy-duty apps and games on this phone. Moving on, theres a 5 megapixel camera that records 720p HD video and even a front-facing VGA camera for Skype calls. Considering the price and the specs, its a cherry on the cake that Micromax is also throwing in a JBL-branded headphone with the package and also have 3 lakh songs free for download via their MLive app.

nubia has introduced the M2 Play, which is a lighter version of the previously launched M2. This phone has slightly toned down specifications and is available at a lower price too. Let's see what the phone has in store for its users.

A comparatively large 2.6-inch touch screen, Full QWERTY keyboard, 3G support and a 1GHz processor  that's the Asha 303. Hailing from the Touch & Type series from Nokia, the Asha 303 may not be a smartphone, yet supports apps like Whatsapp and Angry Birds. Weighing just 99 grams, the phone is fairly light. There may be just about 100MB of internal storage, but thankfully the Asha 303 has a microSD card slot. The camera has a fixed focus and records video in a rather low VGA resolution and at a choppy 15 fps frame-rate. Other than 3G, there's also support for WiFi. The 1300 mAh battery should prove to be sufficient for days of usage, considering the comparatively low specs on the phone.

Introduction:: Micromax Unite 4 is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2016. Fingerprint scanner and attractive look are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Micromax Unite 4 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen IPS capacitive display, Corning Gorilla Glass 2 screen protector, 16M colors, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 293.72PPI pixel density. It is available in 3 colours including Silver, Gray and Champagne.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz MediaTek MT6735P processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Indus OS 2.0 Operating System, Mali-T720 MP2 graphics and 1GB RAM. It has FM radio and GPS. Accelerometer, gyroscope, ambient light sensor and proximity sensor are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Micromax Unite 4 is loaded with an 8MP rear camera with and a 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus and LED flash. Users can record HD videos at 720p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2500mAH Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 20 hours and standby time of up to 280 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Micromax Unite 4 faces competition from Xiaomi Redmi 3S and Yu Yureka S. Xiaomi Redmi 3S has a higher battery capacity, better rear camera and more RAM than Micromax Unite 4. Yu Yureka S has a higher battery capacity, higher pixel density, more RAM, better rear camera and a bigger screen than Micromax Unite 4.

Display and design language: The Meizu M5 boasts a 5.2-inch HD LCD display panel having a resolution of 1280x720 pixels. This display resolution translates to a pixel density of roughly 280 PPI for a better viewing experience. The device also has a solid metal unibody build design and comes in three colour variants which are Blue, Matte Black and Champagne Gold.
Hardware and features: The Meizu M5 is powered by an octa-core MediaTek MT6750 processor which has a clock speed of 1.8GHz and keeps all of the phone’s processes a breeze to use. It is also backed by a Mali -T860 MP2 GPU to enhance gaming performance. The phone runs Android 6.0 out of the box which has an overlay of Meizu’s custom UI called Flyme OS.
Camera and storage: For the camera enthusiasts, the Meizu M5 has a 13MP rear-facing primary camera for clear and vivid images. The phone also sports a 5MP front-facing selfie camera with face detection. As for storage, the phone has 16GB of internal storage which can be expanded up to 128GB through microSD card support.
Battery and Connectivity: The Meizu M5 is powered by a powerful 3070mAh battery pack that can get you through the day of moderate usage with ease. For connectivity, the smartphone supports 2G, 3G, 4G(VoLTE) and Wi-Fi. It also features a fingerprint sensor integrated at the front of the device for better security and quick access.

Overview: Out of the numerous devices from Redmi series, the recently launched Redmi 8A 3GB RAM is one of the very few to support . That makes it one of the cheapest devices despite the fact that it still seems overpriced when comparing the remaining specs to devices such as the Note 9 Pro or the Pro Max. The Redmi 8A 3GB RAM has a large 5000mAh battery and a Qualcomm Snapdragon 439 chipset. The device also scores in the display and cameras department.
Design and Display: The Redmi 8A 3GB RAM features a 6.22 inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 720 x 1520 pixels and a high pixel density of 270ppi. The display sports a Waterdrop notch design with an aspect ratio of 19:9 for enhanced viewing experience. The device will come with added Corning Gorilla Glass v5 protection.
Cameras: The Redmi 8A 3GB RAM ships with a 12MP sensor with LED flash support onboard. On the front, the device features a 8MP selfie shooter. The smartphone arrives with features like AF Phase Detection, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exmor-RS CMOS Sensor, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets .
Battery and Performance: The Redmi 8A 3GB RAM is embedded with the Qualcomm Snapdragon 439 chip and a Adreno 505 GPU. The RAM and internal storage of the device stands at 3GB and 32GB respectively. The device supports memory cards upto a whopping 512GB. Battery life with this device is not an issue with the large 5000mAh Li-Polymer battery with fast charging support onboard.
Software and Connectivity: Redmi 8A 3GB RAM runs Android 9 out of the box. The smartphone arrives with a variety of connectivity options like dual SIM 4G(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n, GPS,Radio, and Bluetooth 4.2. The device ships with an USB Type-C port , a 3.5mm headphone jack .

Pros: Comes with a front flash for better low-light selfies
Has a dedicated microSD card slot
Cons: Battery capacity should have been more

Overview: 5.5 Inch IPS display with a resolution of 960x540 pixels(qHD), low pixel density of 200PPI
1.3 GHz Quad Core Processor with 512MB of RAM
4GB of internal storage MicroSD card support, expandable upto 32GB
8 megapixel autofocus camera with LED Flash(no HD video recording), 2 Megapixel front facing camera
Android 4.2 Jelly Bean (Outdated OS)
Dual SIM (GSM+GSM)
Removable 2100mAh battery
Available in Black and White
Alternatives
Lava Iris X5
Huawei Honor Holly

Lavas Xolo branded devices shot to fame after they managed to bring the first Intel Atom powered mobile phones to the market. That model was the X900 however. The Xolo A800 however has no Intel connection  but sure rides on the popularity wave created by the X900. This device features a Mediatek MT6577 chipset that houses a 1 Ghz Dual Core CPU along with the PowerVR SGX 531 GPU. The RAM is 512 MB and with 4 GB of internal memory, you would end up needing a micro SD card. Luckily, Lava ships a free 8 GB card along with the phone. The A800 features a 4.5 inch, 960*540 pixel qHD display and support dual SIM cards. The phone sports an 8 megapixel rear camera with single LED flash and a VGA front camera. The rear camera can also capture videos in HD. Connectivity options include 3G, Wi-Fi, USB and Bluetooth. The battery on this device at 1600 mAh could be a cause of concern considering the screen size and processing abilities of the phone. The claimed talktime is 5.8 hours on 2G and a mere 2.7 hours on 3G networks.

This Legend, S5i, is similar to its peer  Legend A36. The main difference between the two being that this Legend has 3G connectivity whereas A36 lacks 3G. Legend S5i packs a 5-inch screen with 1GHz Dual core processor and 512MB RAM (the hardware is the same). The rear camera has a 8-megapixel sensor and there is a VGA front facing camera (The rear camera of the Legend S5i is better but the front camera of the Legend A36 is good). It runs on Android Jelly Bean (v4.2). It has an internal storage of 4GB which can be expanded via a microSD card upto 32GB. This phablet is Dual-SIM and also has WiFi, Bluetooth, GPS etc. The humongous device is powered by a 2000mAh battery, which should juice this device for a day (Battery capacity is slightly more than A36).
Released in late 2015, the Titanium Moghul is a all-rounder device from Karbonn. It is a budget smartphone for anyone looking to get started with Android.
Screen & Design:

The Titanium Moghul is priced under Rs 5,000 and for that price it offers a 5” LCD display with a resolution of 960x540. That comes to an average pixel density of 220 PPI. The phone is well designed even with the plastic body it has a back cover with a good pattern and stylish camera panel. The touch buttons on the device are on below the screen and a shiny chrome finish on the edges.
Hardware & Performance:

The Moghul is powered by a 1.2GHz processor and 1GB of RAM. This supports the Android v4.4 Kitkat that the device runs on. The phone offers standard connectivity with 3G and Dual SIM. With a Quad-Core processor the Titanium Moghul manages to score good value for money points in the chipset department. The phone can save decent amounts of data with its 8GB internal storage, however for serious use you will have to occupy the MicroSD card slot that can bump the storage by another 32GB.
Camera & Battery:

Karbonn has loaded the Moghul with a 8 megapixel back camera and 3.2 megapixel front camera. The back camera on this device is capable of shooting HD videos in 720p. The battery on this device is a paltry 2000mAH, you may take a look at the Aqua Power II from Intex for better battery.

The Iris Fuel F1 from Lava is a big battery phone with 4000mAh battery capacity. The phone comes with a 5 inch display with a resolution of 854x480 pixels. The pixel density is just 196PPI which is quite low when compared to competing devices such as Yu Yuphoria or the Redmi 2 Prime in the same category.

The phone is powered by a  MediaTek MTK6580 Quad-core chipset with the four CPU cores clocked at 1.3GHz. The Lava Iris Fuel F1 comes with 2GB RAM, which should provide a good multi-tasking experience. .
On the rear is a  8MP Camera with a single LED flash and capable of recording videos up to 720P. On the front is the 2MP camera for all your selfie needs.

Iris Fuel F1 is a Dual SIM device which supports 4G and has an internal storage of 8GB. You also have a slot for MicroSD card, allowing you to expand the storage upto 32 GB (maximum). The phone runs on Android Lollipop (5.1) fairly close to Stock Android out of the box and is available in two colors viz. White and Black.
Alternatives: For more options check out the Quad Core Phones in India
Also, check out phone with 2GB RAM in India

Overview: ZenFone 4 Selfie is the company's yet another selfie-oriented upcoming smartphone with its latest ZenFone 4 Series. As of now, there's no confirmation about the specs. However, there are many rumours floating around revealing major specs about the device.

Chinese tech firm Lenovo launched the K8 in September. It comes as a successor to K6 launched last year in India. The phone falls in mid-range price segment. Let’s take a look at what the phone has to offer.
FAQs: 1. Will this phone work with Reliance Jio network?
Ans: Yes, the K8 offers VoLTE connectivity which works with Reliance Jio
2. Does the phone have a Hybrid second slot?
Ans: No, the phone has two slots for sim cards & a dedicated slot for microSD card.
3. How is the camera for selfies?
Ans: It has a 8MP front snapper so expect good image quality for selfies.
4. Is the battery removable?
Ans: No, the 4000 mAh battery of the phone is not removable by the user.
5. What type of charging connector do I need?
Ans: For data syncing & charging the phone uses a standard Micro USB port.

Overview: Google came up with the Android One program and partnered with three device manufacturers to provide Pure Google Experience on budget smartphones that would also receive the latest Android updates straight from Google with other Nexus devices. The manufacturers to sign up for the program were Micromax, Lava and Spice and Lava Pixel V1 is a part of the Android One program.
Design and Display: The design of the phone is decent. With plastic as a major build material used, the device does not offer any sort of rich and premium feeling but the curved edges makes it easy to hold the device. About the display, you get a 5.5 inch HD display, having a resolution of 1280x720 pixels the display gets a pixel density of 267PPI. You also get Asahi Dragontail Glass to protect the display.
Hardware and Features: On the inside, the phone has got a MediaTek MT6582 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and paired along is 2GB of RAM. Coming to highlight, Lava Pixel V1 gets a Vanilla Android Experience with Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box. And thanks to the Android One program, the device is said to receive Android 6.0 Marshmallow soon after Google releases it.
Camera and Storage: In terms of pictures, you get a 13MP rear camera that can record videos up to 1080p and on the front is a 8MP camera for those selfie times and video calling needs. The rear camera also get an LED Flash to light up the dark shots and videos. To store all this data you get 32GB of internal storage that can be further expanded more up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: To power the device, we have a 2650mAh battery which might not last you through the day if you are a heavy user. For connectivity, you have a Dual Micro SIM slots but the device lacks 4G LTE connectivity.

Overview: Samsung Galaxy Ace Plus (S7500) comes in after a successful outing of the original Ace S8530. Samsung realizes the potential of low cost and mid-range Android devices, with the pricebaba.com/mobile/samsung-galaxy-y-gt-s5360">Samsung Galaxy and Ace series they are targeting the masses. Compared to its predecessor, the Ace Plus has a slightly larger 3.65-inch screen with HVGA (320x480) resolution. The Ace Plus packs in a GHz processor, 5MP camera and runs a relatively old Android 2.3 (Gingerbread). The phone has 3GB of internal storage, of which 1GB is available for apps. A micro SD expansion slot is also available for additional storage.

Micromax Informatics Limited is one of the leading consumer electronics company in India and claims to be the 10th largest mobile phone player in the world. The Micromax Bolt A69 is a dual-SIM phone that has a 4.5 inches display with the resolution of 854x480 pixels taking the pixel density to 218PPI. Out of the 4GB of internal storage that comes with the phone, only 2.3GB is available to the user. The memory can be expanded up to 32GB by using a microSD card. The phone has a 5 Megapixel rear camera and a VGA front camera. The battery has 1800mAh power and is removable. A person looking to buy this phone can shell out a bit more and purchase the Spice Dream Uno which is a part of the Android One program. The Android One phones promised to get Android version updates for the next two years. Micromax too has an Android One phone called the Canvas A1, which costs as much as the Dream Uno.

Introduction:: Hyve Storm is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2016. Frame made of aluminum alloy, exclusive look, Apps licensed by GMS, MediaTek MiraVision, and sRGB for rich colours, Phase Detection, Auto-Focus technology, Hyve Care for new guarantee and a sharp sensitivity to light are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Hyve Storm comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 142.50 x 71.40 x 8.70 mm. It is available in Mystic Gray and Snow White colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, Mali-T720 for graphics, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and 2GB RAM. It has GPS and FM radio. Light sensor, proximity sensor, accelerometer, compass and gyroscope are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Hyve Storm is loaded with 13MP ISOCELL rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus and LED flash. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.
Competition:

Hyve Storm faces competition from Lenovo Vibe K5, Swipe Elite Plus and Coolpad Mega 2.5D. Lenovo Vibe K5 has a faster processor and higher battery capacity than Hyve Storm. Swipe Elite Plus has faster processor and higher battery capacity than Hyve Storm. Coolpad Mega 2.5D has bigger screen, better front camera and higher battery capacity than Hyve Storm.
Battery and Connectivity:: This dual SIM device is equipped with a non-removable 2000mAh Li-Polymer battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 14 hours and standby time of up to 240 hours on 4G networks. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 nano SIM cards.

This dual SIM device is equipped with a non-removable 2000mAh Li-Polymer battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 14 hours and standby time of up to 240 hours on 4G networks. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 nano SIM cards.

Introduction:: Reliance launched LYF Flame 6 mobile in India in June 2016. It comes with a quad-core processor, fast call connection, slow motion video capture and True 4G support.
Display and Design:: The LYF Flame 6 comes with a 4 inch touchscreen display with resolution of 800 x 480 pixels and a pixel density of 218PPI. The screen comes with Asahi Dragontrail glass protection. The phone weighs around 162 grams and has size dimensions of 126 x 64 x 10.6 mm. It is available in Black color with curvy Golden Bezel. It has easy grip and single hand navigation capability.
Hardware & Features:: The LYF Flame 6 is powered by 1.3GHz quad-core processor and it runs on Android 5.1 version (Lollipop). The phone has some sensors including gyroscope, proximity sensor, ambient light, and accelerometer.
Camera & Storage:: The LYF Flame 6 offers a primary camera of 2MP and front camera of 2MP. It comes with a 512MB RAM and 4GB internal memory which can be expanded up to 32GB by micro SD card. The camera has certain additional features like smile shutter, face detection, anti-banding and slow motion video capture. The phone allows establishing of video conferencing without having the need to download any third party application.
Battery & Connectivity:: The LYF Flame 6 has a 1750mAh Li-ion removable battery. The phone offers dual SIM facility (regular and micro SIM) and offers 2G/3G/4G LTE with one SIM using 4G. Other connectivity options includes Bluetooth 4.0, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, FM and USB support.

Overview: HTC Desire U is a Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM) smartphone running on an outdated Android v4.0 Ice-Cream Sandwich (ICS). There is a HTC Sense 4.0 UI. It sports a 4-inch (800x480 pixels) display with a pixel density of 233PPI. Under the hood, there is a 1GHz Single-core processor and is backed by 512MB RAM. The 4GB internal storage can be expanded upto 32GB by using microSD cards.

Introduction:: Zopo Color C is a dual SIM device that was launched in January 2016. Power saving mode, face recognition technology and attractive design are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Zopo Color C comes with 4.5 inch TPS LCD touch screen capacitive display, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 217PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 133 x 65.7 x 8.5 mm and its weight is 133 grams. It is available in 5 colours including Blue, White, Black, Yellow and Red.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, 1GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and Mali-T720 MP2 for graphics. Accelerometer, light sensor, E-compass and proximity sensor are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Zopo Color C ZP330 is loaded with a 5MP rear camera with 2592 x 1944 Pixels resolution and CMOS image sensor. It has a 2MP front camera. Other camera features include dual LED flash, ISO control, digital zoom, continuous shooting, HDR, face detection, touch to focus and exposure compensation. Users can record HD videos at 1080p through the rear camera. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a 1700mAh Li-Po removable battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. 3G network gives speed of 2.8Mbps whereas 4G gives a speed of 150Mbps.
Competition:

Zopo Color C faces competition from Intex Aqua Raze and Samsung Z2 Tizen. Intex Aqua Raze has a slower processor, higher battery capacity and lesser weight than Zopo Color C. Samsung Z2 Tizen has a smaller screen, lower battery capacity, more expandable memory and more pixel density than Zopo Color C.

Overview: HTC launched the Desire 620G in December 2014. The phone is priced in under Rs. 20,000 which is a very competitive price segment in the markets. Specs of the phone are average and you get phones with better specs for same or cheaper. The phone is available in Milky Way Grey and Santorini Grey. The key specifications of this device are 
Has a 5 inch display with the resolution of 1280x720 pixels which takes the pixel density to 294 PPI
Packed with 1GB of RAM and runs on 1.7GHz, Octa Core processor
Dual SIM phone
Comes with 8GB of internal storage which is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 8MP and a 5MP camera in the front
Powered by a 2100mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Moto G (2nd Gen)
Micromax Canvas Gold

Introduction:: Zopo Color E1 is a dual SIM device that was launched in January 2016. Slim frame, 28nm technology, 178 degree wide angle for viewing, large battery capacity, energy-saving chip, power management IC and long time for constant work and games are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Zopo Color E1 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen IPS capacitive display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 293.72PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 145.9 x 71.4 x 8.5 mm and its weight is 137 grams. It is available in 5 colours including Blue, Red, White, Black and Yellow.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core processor, 1GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and Adreno 510 graphics. Light sensor, proximity sensor, accelerometer and compass are available.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2100mAh Li-Po battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, and Bluetooth.
Competition:

Zopo Color E1 faces competition from Xiaomi Redmi 3S, Swipe Elite Plus and Yu Yureka Plus. Swipe Elite Plus has better rear and front camera and higher battery capacity than Zopo Color E1. Yu Yureka Plus has bigger screen, better rear and front camera and higher battery capacity than Zopo Color E1. Xiaomi Redmi 3S has better rear and front camera and higher battery capacity than Zopo Color E1.
Camera and Storage:: Zopo Color E1 is loaded with 8MP rear and 2MP front camera. Other camera features include HDR, panorama, dual LED flash, night mode, sport mode, auto focus and smile detection. Users can record full HD videos at 720p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.

Zopo Color E1 is loaded with 8MP rear and 2MP front camera. Other camera features include HDR, panorama, dual LED flash, night mode, sport mode, auto focus and smile detection. Users can record full HD videos at 720p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.

Introduction:: Videocon Cube 3 is a dual SIM device that was launched in September 2016. Its back cover is made of enigmatic cubes  and it comes with a 2.5D curved glass display, SOS-be safe app, free Gameloft game and free Eros Now movie subscription for 6 months.
Display and Design:

Videocon Cube 3 has a 5 inch LCD touchscreen IPS display with Asahi Dragontrail Glass screen protector, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 293.72ppi pixel density. It has a dimension of 144.3 X 73.0 X 9.3 mm and it weighs 140 grams.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, 3GB RAM, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System and Mali-T720 graphics. Many apps like Opera Mini, V-Safe, V-Secure, SwiftKey, Dual WhatsApp Support and Office suite, Chillx and Daily Hunt are pre-installed. G-sensor, motion sensor, magnetic sensor and gyroscope are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Videocon Cube 3 is loaded with 13MP rear camera and 5MP front camera with selfie LED flash and dual LED flash. Other camera features include single touch camera operation, HDR, face detection, geo-tagging, panorama, and smile shutter and night vision. HD video recording facility is available. It has an internal storage of 32GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device comes with 3000mAH battery having fast charging facility. Users can enjoy connectivity via 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and VoLTE that works with Jio.
Competition:

Videocon Cube 3 faces competition from Lenovo Vibe K5 and Intex Aqua S7. Lenovo Vibe K5 has faster processor but lower battery capacity than Videocon Cube 3 whereas Intex Aqua S7 has higher battery capacity and higher expandable memory than Videocon Cube 3.

Overview: Offering a good mix of features and budget, the Quattro L50 HD from Karbonn is a smartphone that brings together good hardware & software.
Screen & design:: A chrome finished design with largely plastic body, the Quattro L50 HD gives you a 5” display with a respectable 294PPI. The screen is 720p HD as the name would suggest. The front of the device has a very Samsung like round button and also has touch buttons on the front panel below the display. If you are looking at getting a better display, the Micromax Canvas Fire 4G Plus has better glass protection and PPI.
Hardware:: The Octa-Core processor on this device would mean that the HD screen would indeed play some HD videos for you. The chipset is a MediaTek 1.3GHz MT67539 coupled with 2GB of RAM. The L50 HD also has a Mali GPU to support its operations. These specifications just about enough to handle the Android Lollipop OS this phone runs on. The phone has Dual SIM slots both of which run on GSM and also offers 4G connectivity. All this with a weight of only 134 grams. Karbonn runs this phone on Kandy UI (version 1.0).
Camera & Storage:: The Karbonn Quattro L50 HD does good in the media department with a 13MP shooter which can capture full HD videos for you. The selfie camera is rated at 5MP, again a good one. The 16GB of inbuilt storage is enough and if you plan to shoot a lot of videos, you can easily add a MicroSD card upto 32GB. The battery of 2600mAh may not be the best, but can last a day with average usage.

Overview: Smartron recently launched the srt.phone In India. The interesting part, it is named after the master blaster Sachin Tendulkar who also happens to be Smartron's strategic investor and brand ambassador. Design-wise, the srt.phone boasts of a metal unibody design with curvy edges and slightly contoured back. It measures 8.9mm in thickness and weighs 155 grammes. It also offers a rear-mounted fingerprint scanner.

Micromax A84 also known as Superfone Elite A84 is yet another affordable smartphone plunged into the market by this Indian based company. It sports a 3.98 inches capacitive display that potrays a WVGA resolution of 480 by 800 pixels. This dual-SIM (GSM+GSM) phone is effectively run on Android OS v2.3 Gingerbread. The operating software is backed by a hefty 1 GHz processor which ensures the smooth running of applications. A84 comprises of a memory card slot which can be used to expand internal storage up to 32GB. The device possesses GPRS, EDGE and 3G technology which helps to stay connected to the internet. This device is Wi-Fi enabled. Files and documents can also be transferred from the device using the microUSB port or the Bluetooth functionality of the phone. Micromax A84 offers a 5MP camera on the rear and a 0.3MP camera on the fore. The primary camera entails features like LED flash, geo-tagging and night-mode. The front facing camera facilitates video calls. A84 runs on a standard Li-ion battery of 1630 mAh which gives 4 hours of talk time and up to 150 hours in stand-by mode. The other key highlights of this phone include GPS support, Instant Messaging, FM radio, MP3/MP4 music player, MMS enabled, Predictive text input, Voice Input and Micromaxs pre-installed apps like MStore, Mi Buddy, Yumsters. This handset is available in black colour only.

The Karbonn A15 is an inexpensive Android phone running Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich, which is good news considering a handful handsets in this price range still run the ancient Android 2.3 Gingerbread. Not just that, it also has 3G connectivity with speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps. Not just that, there's WiFi support too. The 4.0 inch screen has an 800 x 480 pixel resolution, and the phone is powered by a single-core 1GHz processor and 512MB RAM. From the 4GB of internal memory, 2.5 gigs is available to the user, not to mention the microSD card slot using which you can expand it even further. There's a 3.15MP camera at the back, but no front-facing video-call camera. But at this price point, we can't expect everything now, can we? At least there's FM Radio, which funnily is not available on many high-end phones these days. A 1420 mAh battery should deliver reasonable up-time, looking at the not too power-intensive spec-sheet.

The LG Optimus L7 P705 happens to be a mid range Android 4.0 laden handset that was released in early 2012. This good looking handset features a 4.3 inch, 480*800 pixel IPS display. Powering the phone is a Cortex A5 processor running at 1 GHz. It features a Qualcomm Snapdragon MSM7227A chipset. The 5 megapixel camera at the back can take decent pictures. Video recording however could have been better with this device supporting only VGA resolution. This could have been at least 720p which has sort of become the de facto standard for mid range phones. The phone gets 4 GB of internal memory with the option to expand it further using microSD cards. The Li-ion 1700 MAH battery is rated for up to six hours of talk time and 550 hours of standby time.

Nubia Z9 Mini is an Amazon exclusive product which competes against the likes of Mi4i and Moto G 2nd Gen. It has exceptional premium looks and has a great set of specifications for the price it being sold at.
4.99 inch IPS display with OGS(One Glass Solution) and a resolution of 1280x720 pixels (5 point multi touch support)
1.2GHz Quad Core Broadcom processor with 1GB of RAM
8GB of Internal memory
MicroSD card slot available with support upto 32GB
8 megapixel autofocus camera at the back with BSI 2 sensor and LED flash, capable of 1080p video recording
2 megapixel front facing camera
Android 4.4.2 Kitkat
Slim body, only 7.9mm thin
Removable 2500mAh battery
Alternative
ASUS ZenFone 5 8GB
Nokia Lumia 630 Dual SIM

Alcatel OneTouch Scribe Easy OT8000D sports a 5 inch Capacitive Touchscreen with a resolution of 480x800 Pixels and pixel density of 186.6 PPI. As the name might suggest, this smartphone comes bundled with a stylus (although it appears to be a simple stylus and not the superior type that you get with the Note series). It is powered by 1.2GHz Dual Core Processor with 512MB of RAM and runs on Android 4.1 Jelly Bean operating System. The device has 4GB internal memory that can be expanded up to 32GB externally via microSD card.

The One Touch Scribe Easy OT8000D has a 5MP rear camera with autofocus and LED Flash and a VGA front camera for video calls. The device offers connectivity options such as 2G, 3G, Wi-Fi, Wi-Fi hotspot, USB, Bluetooth and GPRS/ EDGE. It runs on a 2500mAh Li-Ion battery which provides up to 600 hours of standby time and 10 hours talk time in 2G network and upto 594 hours of standby time and 9 hours talk time in 3G network.

Introduction:: Mtech Jazbaa is a dual SIM device that was launched in October 2015. Good look and good rear camera are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Tech gazebo comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, multi touch facility, 1920 x 1080 pixels screen resolution and 441PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 146.3 x 74.6 x 8.5 mm and its weight is 150 grams. It is available in 2 colours including Silver and Black.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz Quad-core processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and 2GB RAM. Google Talk, Twitter, Facebook chat, YouTube, Gmail, Google Search, WhatsApp, Mtech Zone, Google Play Store are pre-installed. G-sensor and proximity sensor are available. MP3 music player and MP4 video palter are available. Google voice search, E-mail, document readers, handwriting recognition, mms, sound recorder, voice input, screenshot capturing, stopwatch, airplane mode, alarm clock, calculator, calendar, contacts, timer are available.
Camera and Storage:

Mtech Jazbaa is loaded with 13MP rear camera with 4128 x 3096 pixels image resolution and 8MP front camera. Other camera features include HDR, autofocus, and LED flash and digital zoom. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Competition:

Mtech Jazbaa faces competition from Yu Yureka Plus and Intex Aqua Power HD. Yu Yureka Plus has bigger screen, faster processor and higher battery capacity than Mtech Jazbaa. Intex Aqua Power HD has a higher battery capacity, faster processor but lower pixel density than Mtech Jazbaa.
Battery and Connectivity:: This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2000mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 12 hours and a standby time of up to 300 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2000mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 12 hours and a standby time of up to 300 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.

Overview: Asus, the Chinese smartphone manufacturer has launched the Asus ZenFone Go in the price range of around Rs. 6,000, where the other manufactures like Xiaomi, Xolo and Coolpad are already giving cut throat competition. The Asus ZenFone Go 5.0 LTE looks like an average performer when it comes to the specifications of the device.
Display and Design: Asus Zenfone Go 5.0 LTE has a 5 inch LCD Panel display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels giving it a pixel density of 294PPI. Unfortunately, the display lacks Corning Gorilla Glass protection. The phone has a Plastic body but the build looks to be firm and good to hold.
Hardware Specifications and Other Featur: Talking about the performance, the Asus Zenfone GO 5.0 LTE runs on a Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.2GHz and paired along is only 1GB of RAM. In terms of software the phone runs on Android 4.4 KitKat out of the box with Asus's Zen UI running on top of it.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of the device sits a 8MP sensor that can record videos up to 1080p, whereas on the front you get just a 5MP shooter for video calling and selfies. The rear camera also has an LED Flash for taking shots in the dark. And to store all your pictures and other data you get 16GB of internal storage that can be further expanded via a MicroSD card up to 32GB.
Battery and Connectivity: To power all this we have a decent 2500mAh battery that is not removable and should last through a whole working day with average usage and considering the specs. The device supports Dual Micro SIMs supports 4G connectivity.

Overview: Lava has come up with Iris X1 which has specifications making it worth every penny. The metallic edges and the similarly coloured front and back panels give it an iPhone 4s-like appearance. It features a 4.5 inch IPS Display with a pixel resolution of 854x480 pixels which boils down to an average pixel density of 217PPI, but the screen is not bad for its price. The smartphone is powered by a Quad-core processor from Broadcom which clocks at 1.2GHz. Thankfully, it is coupled with 1GB RAM, which should be sufficient to smoothly multi-task on this device. It has an internal storage of 4GB which can be expanded upto 32GB by using microSD memory card.

On the camera front, the smartphone sports a 8 megapixel with flash and BSI Sensor, which should help capturing good low-light images. The 2 megapixel front camera can be used for video calling and selfies. The good thing about the camera is that it can record Full HD videos at 1080p. It runs on Android v4.4 Kitkat, out of the box. The phones size makes it handy to use and the Dual-SIM support along with 3G Connectivity, adds to the functionality of this device. Bluetooth, WiFi and GPS are also included. To juice this device, there is a 1800mAh battery, which should be sufficient to power this device for a day. Similar smartphones in this price segment are Micromax Canvas Unite 2 and the wildly popular Moto E.

Spice Stellar Icon is a dual SIM, touchscreen phone. The phone comes with 512MB RAM and runs on a 1.3GHz, Dual-Core processor. This is poor as 512MB RAM is very less for a phone today. It has a 5 inches display with the resolution of 854x480 pixels which takes the pixel density to the 196 pixels. The phone comes with 4GB internal memory and it can be expanded up to 32GB.

It has an 8MP rear camera which does 720p video recording and a 1.3MP front camera for video calls, etc. This is a decent camera for its price. The battery has 1800mAh power and is removable. One buying this phone should also consider the Spice Dream Uno as it runs on stock Android, and is promised to get Android version updates for two years.

The Galaxy Core is an interesting mid-ranger phone; primarily because it is one of the few reasonably-sized handsets. Where many phones in this price range today have displays that are 5-inches in size, the Core adopts a rather comfortable 4.3-inch screen size with an 800 x 480 pixel resolution. It is powered by an undeclared 1.2GHz dual-core processor, a reasonable 1GB of RAM and 8GB of internal storage. We suppose the chipset may not be very powerful, as the Galaxy Core can only record videos in 480p non-HD resolution. It's got a 5MP camera at the back with an LED flash, and a VGA front-facing camera. Its 1800 mAh battery sounds a little less than what we'd like.

Nokia Asha 302 is a QWERTY social entertainment enabled phone of Asha series which runs on S40 operating system and supports apps like Whatsapp and Facebook. It has 100MB user accessible memory, with memory expandable up to 32GB.
It also comes loaded with a 3.2MP camera, and a music player with MP3 support. It has email, SMS, chat, POP3 and IMAP4 support, and other social applications. It also has support for Java games.

Introduction:: Lava X11 4G is a dual SIM device that was launched in March 2016. Video PIP feature, Smart wake up, Smart Music, Drawing Gestures, battery having Android power saver mode and 12 Indian languages are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Lava X11 4G comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution, impact resistant and scratch proof Corning Gorilla glass screen protection and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 145.5 x 72 x 8.45 mm and its weight is 141 grams. It is available in White Gold and Crystal Blue colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.5GHz quad-core Spreadtrum processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System that can be upgraded to Android 6.0 Marshmallow by a single tap Google access and 2GB RAM. Accelerometer, ambient light sensor and hall sensor are in-built. Google Talk, YouTube, Gmail, Google Search, Google Play are available.
Camera and Storage:

Lava X11 4G is loaded with 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus, digital zoom, voice capture and dual LED flash.  Users can record HD videos at 720p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2500mAh Li-ion battery that provides a talk time of 16 hours 43 minutes on 2G and 10 hours 35 minutes on 3G. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Lava X11 4G faces competition from Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus. Lenovo Vibe K5 has a higher battery capacity, better rear camera, more internal storage capacity and faster processor than Lava X11.

Overview: Galaxy Pocket Duos s5302 by Samsung is the right choice for someone looking for a mobile that is affordable, easy to handle and updated to basic smart-phone functionality. Released in September 2012, this model sports a 2.8 inches TFT capacitive touchscreen. Its compact and slim design gives a bright sight over the 240 by 320 pixels resolution. The TouchWiz UX user interface by Samsung makes its way to the Pocket Duos as well. Powered by an 832 MHz ARM 11 processor the Samsung Pocket Duos runs Android v2.3 Gingerbread. It allows 3GB of internal storage, which can be expanded up to 32GB using a MicroSD card. Connectivity options to the internet are enabled via 2G as well 3G networks. Wi-Fi b/g/n and ability to create WiFi hotspots is also available.

The facility of Bluetooth v3.0 with A2DP allows transmission of files to other devices. Pocket Duos S5302 offers a 2MP camera, 1600 by 1200 image quality and video recording QVGA at 15 fps. Other notable features of this handset include Stereo FM with RDS, GPS-support, organizer, image/video editor, document viewer, voice memo, sensors like accelerometer and compass and predictive text input. Pocket Duos is powered by a standard Li-ion battery (1200 mAh). This gives the users up to 15 hours 20 minutes ( 2G) and up to 6 hours ( 3G) for talk time. In stand-by mode, this phone can sustain up to 410 hours (2G) and 370 hours (3G). Samsung Galaxy Pocket Duos s5302 is available in black and white colours.

Micromax Canvas Magnus A117 is a recent launch from Micromax brand Canvas series and thus replacing Micromax Canvas A116 HD. The smartphone supports 2G and 3G network with specifications like GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 and HSDPA 2100 respectively. It supports dual SIM. The smartphone offers a touch screen of size 720 x 1280 pixels, 5.0 inches with an IPS LCD capacitive touch screen, 16M range of colors. The phone runs on an Android OS, v4.2 (Jelly Bean) with the processor speed of Quad-core 1.5 GHz Cortex-A7 and the chipset used is MTK 6589T. Its got internal memory of 4 GB with 2.6 GB user available with 1 GB RAM. The expandable memory is up to 32 GB (micro SD).

The phone sports a 12 MP camera with 4000 x 3000 pixels, autofocus and an LED flash, wherein the camera is upgraded from 8MP to 12MP as compared to its predecessor  the Canvas HD A116. The additional features that the phone encompasses are Geo-tagging, touch focus, face detection. This phone also offers a secondary front-facing camera of 2MP. The phone has a 2000 mAh standard Li-ion battery which provides up to 7 hours of talk time and 180 hours in stand-by mode. The sensors used in the smartphone are proximity sensor, gravity sensor, motion sensor and light sensor that makes the phone altogether more attractive.

Karbonn A25 is another affordable smartphone infused into the market by Karbonn brand A series. It sports a 5.0 inches display that portrays a WVGA resolution of 480 x 800 pixels. This dual-SIM (GSM+GSM) phone runs on Android OS v4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich). The operating software is backed by a Dual-Core 1 GHz processor. Karbonn A25 has a low internal storage of just 114MB and has microSD card slot which can be used to expand the storage capacity up to 32GB. Karbonn A25 offers a 5MP camera with LED flash on the rear. The front facing camera facilitates video calls. A25 runs on a standard Li-ion battery of 2000 mAh which gives 6 hours of talk time and up to 300 hours in stand-by mode.

This Karbonn smartphone from the Legend series has a Dual core processor and offers a 5-inch screen with an average pixel density of 220PPI. The processor is runs at speed of 1GHz and is paired with 512MB RAM. It has a 5-megapixel rear camera with flash and autofocus. Moreover it has a 2-megapixel front camera for video calling. Although, it lacks 3G connectivity. But it is a Dual-SIM phone and is enabled with WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS. It runs on Android v4.0 Ice-Cream Sandwich (ICS). It has an inbuilt memory of 4GB which can be expanded upto 32GB using a microSD memory card. Other phones in this price range offer 3G but with a smaller screen size.

Introduction:: Lava X17 is a dual SIM device that was launched in July 2016. Support for 12 Indian Languages, time lapse and slow motion video recording, smart gestures are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Lava X17 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, multitouch facility, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 293.72PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 145 x 72 x 8.5 mm. It is available in 3 colours including Black Gold, White Gold, Black Steel and Champagne Gold.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System and 1GB RAM. Various business features like E-Mail, To Do, News and weather, Office Suite, Language translator, Customized Gestures are pre-installed. FM with FM recording and GPS are available. Google Talk, YouTube, Gmail, Google Search, Google Play are available. Accelerometer, photo editor and document viewer are available.
Camera and Storage:

Lava X17 is loaded with an 8MP rear camera having an image resolution of 3264 x 2448 Pixels and 5MP front camera having 84 degree wide angle lens. Other camera features include panorama, digital zoom, GIF, face beauty, autofocus, audio picture, dual LED flash, geotagging. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2350mAh Li-Po removable battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Lava X17 faces competition from Xolo Era 4G. Lava X17 has a lower battery capacity and better rear and front camera than Xolo Era 4G.

Pros: Display is enhanced with a 2.5D curved glass
Has LED flash on both the sides
Comes with a dedicated microSD card slot

Overview: The Lava X41+ is the latest affordable smartphone to make it to the Indian market. It is also the most-recent Lava smartphone in its ‘X series’ lineup. The smartphone flaunts a plastic body, which measures 145 x 71.2 x 8.8 mm and weighs 154 grams. It sports a 5-inch (12.7 cm) IPS display featuring 1280 x 720 pixels HD resolution, Corning Gorilla Glass 2 protection, and 294 ppi pixel density. Considering this, the device should be comfortable to use for most of the users.

The Lava X41+ comes with two SIM card slots, both supporting 4G network. However, only one SIM at a time can be operated on 4G network. Some of the business features include e-mail, to-do, news and weather, office suite, and language translator. Other than that, it embraces calling features such as hands free, conference call, call recorder, and flip to mute. The device comes in two colour options -- Gold and Black.

Furthermore, the Lava X41+ runs standard Android user interface (UI) on top of Android 6.0 Marshmallow operating system. It packs in 1.3GHz quad-core processor, 2GB DDR3 RAM, and 32GB built-in storage (expandable up to 32GB via microSD card). In terms of the warranty, the company offers a 1-year warranty for the device and 6 months warranty for in the box accessories.

The Lava X41+ embraces 2500mAh battery, which is claimed to offer around 55 hours of audio playback at full loudness in earphone mode as well as 20 hours of audio playback at full loudness in speaker mode. In the camera department, it houses 8MP rear camera with LED flash. The camera is capable of recording HD videos. Up front is a 5MP selfie camera front flash. Some of the camera features include face beauty, time lapse, and slow-mo.

On the connectivity front, the Lava X41+ supports voice calling over high-speed LTE network. That aside, it comes with the standard set of connectivity options like Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, FM radio, 3.5mm audio jack, and microUSB 2.0 port. The device also comes with the bunch of sensors like ambient light sensor, accelerometer, and proximity.

The Indian smartphone manufacturer Lava has recently introduced the Fuel series of phones to address the battery issue on smartphones now-a-days. With the massive batteries in the Fuel 50 and the Fuel 60, these phones promise impressive stand-by times.
The features of the Lava iris Fuel 50 are as follows
5 Inch screen with a resolution of 854x480 pixels, 196 PPI pixel density which is decent for the price
1.3GHz Quad Core Processor with 1GB RAM
8GB of Internal storage with 2.9GB available to the user and 2.7GB reserved for apps
MicroSD card slot accepts cards upto 32GB
8 Megapixel rear camera with dual LED flash and a 2 megapixel front facing camera
Android 4.4 Kitkat out of the box
Gesture Control  Double tap to Wake, Camera & Music Quick launch gestures
Display protected by strong Asahi Dragon Tail Glass
Massive 3000mAh removable battery
Alternatives
Intex Aqua Star Power
Intex Aqua Power

Lava iris X1 Grand is a low-end phone. It is stylish phone made for people who want good features in their phones for less. It is available in Black & Gold colour variant and other one in White & Silver.

Micromax A110 Canvas 2 is a much hyped model of Micromax that comes with essentially loaded features as any other smartphone. A110 has a 5 inches display with IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen thus giving a resolution of 480 by 854 pixels. The looks on the MicroMax A110 look inspired by Samsung's Galaxy S III and the 5" screen with Android is a winning formula that Samsung has championed with its Galaxy Note series. The A110 is powered by a MediaTek MT6577 chipset with dual-core 1GHz processor, this phone runs on Android OS v4.0 (Ice-cream Sandwich). For memory, A110 offers a 4GB internal storage, of which 2GB is user-available. This can be expanded to 32GB using Micro SD Cards. Connectivity to internet is enhanced through GPRS, EDGE, 3G networks and Wi-Fi. Bluetooth v3.0 and MicroUSB facilitate easy transmission of files.

Micromax A110 offers an 8MP camera with a high image resolution of 3264 by 2448 pixels. It entails features like auto focus, dual LED flash, geo-tagging, face detection and touch focus. It also has a secondary VGA camera. Apart from these, Micromax A110 sports other varied features including sensors like accelerometer and proximity, GPS-support, FM radio, Organizer, Document viewer, MP3/MP4 player, Voice memo and predictive text input. A110 runs on a standard Li-Ion battery of 2000 mAh. This gives it up to 5 hours of talk-time and up to 180 hours in stand-by mode. Micromaxs A110 is available in colours like black and white.
The Iris series of smartphones are manufactured by the Indian smartphone maker Lava. The Iris X5 is one of its offerings below the ten thousand rupee price range.

The Iris X5 has a 5 inch IPS display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels with a pixel density of 294PPI. The X5 has a 5 megapixel front facing camera with autofocus and flash. Targeted as a selfie focused phone the X5 has an 8 megapixel autofocus rear with Dual LED flash and a BSI sensor. The phone is powered by a 1.2 GHz Quad-core chip made by Broadcom and the phone has 1GB of RAM.

On the software front the device is running on Android 4.4.2 Kitkat. The device somes with 8GB of internal storage with 6GB available to the user for storage. The phone has a MicroSD card slot and the storage is expandable. It accepts cards upto 32GB which is decent. The Iris X5 is a Dual SIM device with a Normal and a Micro SIM slot. It has a 2100mAh Li-Po removable battery. The phone was launched as an Amazon Exclusive and was priced at Rs. 8799.

Introduction:: Celkon Campus Prime is a dual SIM device that was launched in September 2015. Good design, good expandable storage, availability of 3G and affordable price are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Celkon Campus Prime comes with 4.5 inch touch screen TFT capacitive display, multi-touch facility, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 218PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 132 x 67 x 9.3 mm and its weight is 119 grams. It is available in 3 colours including Gold, Brown and White. It provides 16M colors.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz single core Spreadtrum SC7715 processor, Android 4.4 KitKat Operating System, 512MB RAM. It has an accelerometer, document viewer and photo editor. It has an audio playback and a video playback facility. It comes with FM radio, GPS and 3.5mm headphone.
Camera and Storage:

Celkon Campus Prime is loaded with 3.2MP rear camera with digital zoom and 2048 x 1536 pixels resolution. It has 1.3MP front camera. Other camera features include LED flash and autofocus. It has an internal storage of 4GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a Li-ion removable battery of 1600mAh capacity that lets the users enjoy a talk time of nearly 5 hours and standby time of up to 200 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards.
Competition:
Celkon Campus Prime faces competition from iBall Andi 4.5C. iBall Andi 4.5C has a faster processor, higher rear and front camera and higher internal storage than Celkon Campus Prime.

Overview: The Samsung Young Duos is an entry-level handset from the Korean giant. The specs are nothing great  a 3.3-inch HVGA (320 x 480 pixel) display, a single-core 1GHz Cortex A5 based processor and 768MB of RAM. It runs a fairly recent version of Android i.e. 4.1 Jelly Bean. The internal memory is 4GB, so roughly less than half of that should be available to the user. It supports 3G speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps. There's a 3.15MP non-autofocus camera at the back, with no LED flash. There's no front-facing secondary camera too. Powering this phone is a 1300 mAh battery which should prove to be adequate; considering that there aren't any power-hungry components in the phone. The Young Duos is a dual-SIM phone. In this same price range, you have phones like the Lava XOLO Q700, that spec-wise are better than this phone in every way.

Introduction:: Swipe Elite Note is a dual SIM device that was launched in April 2016. InfraRed blaster, 2.5D curved glass display, Vi-Di technology, camera with Sony sensor, elegant sandstone back panel and magnesium alloy body, are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Swipe Elite Note comes with 5.5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive HD IPS display, Asahi Dragontrail glass screen protection, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 267.02PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 154.00 x 77.10 x 8.40 mm and its weight is 194 grams. It is available in Black colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Freedom OS Operating System, and 3GB RAM and Mali T720 graphics. It has GPS and FM radio. G-sensor, light sensor and proximity sensor are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Swipe Elite Note is loaded with 13MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include face detection, autofocus, LED flash, smile shot and continuous shooting. Users can record HD videos at 720p. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card. Users can access 11.65GB.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a non-removable 3000mAh Li-Po battery that gives up to 18 days of standby time. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Swipe Elite Note faces competition from Xiaomi Redmi 3S Prime and Panasonic Eluga Icon. Xiaomi Redmi 3S Prime has a smaller screen and higher capacity battery than Swipe Elite Note. Panasonic Eluga Icon 2 has lesser RAM and less weight than Swipe Elite Note.

Overview: Beating the timing on Apple's multi-coloured iPhone 5c launch and competing with Nokia's bright-shelled Lumia 520, Micromax is playing the colourful card in the entry-level range. The Canvas Fun A74 is an entry level handset that comes in three colour options: Blue, Red and Black. It's got a 4.5-inch 854 x 480 pixel display and is powered by a 1.3GHz dual-core processor. There's 512MB of RAM, and 4GB of internal memory (out of which Micromax claims 1.27GB is available for apps, and 1.25GB for mass storage). You can expand up to 32GB more using a microSD card. There's 3G support with speeds of up to 21Mbps, WiFi 802.11n and a rather old version of Bluetooth i.e. v2.0.

In the camera department, you've got a 5 megapixel fixed-focus lens with an LED flash. The phone has the capability of recording videos in 720p resolution. It comes with Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean out of the box. Powering the unit is a 1500 mAh battery, which given the reasonable specs, should not prove to be too insufficient.

Micromax Ninja A91 is a Dual SIM phone which falls in the budget phone category. It has a 4.5 inches and 854x480 pixel resolution display (for comparison, Celkon AR 45 has a higher 960x854 pixel count). It runs at a speed of 1GHz and has a Dual-core processor. It supports the older Android 4.0 version as opposed to its competitor Celkon AR45 which offers 4.2 version. It has a meagre 256MB RAM and 2GB internal memory space which can be expanded upto 32GB via a microSD card. It has a 5MP rear facing camera and a VGA camera for video calling. The phone supports 3G network connectivity thus enabling fast internet connection.

Meizu, a Chinese smartphone company, first made its presence in the Indian market in 2015 with Meizu m2 Note and after that, the company has launched a range of smartphones to keep the spirit alive. Now, the Meizu M5 is the company’s latest smartphone, which comes with VoLTE support.

Taiwanese smartphone maker Asus has launched the ZenFone 4 in India that will potentially stir up the under Rs. 10,000 smartphone market. The ZenFone 4 is a nice looking device. The phone is a Dual SIM device. It has a 4.5 inch IPS display with 854x480 pixel resolution which takes the pixel density to 218PPI. The device is powered by an Intel Atom Dual core processor clocked at 1.2GHz and comes with 1GB of RAM. The phone has internal storage options of either 4GB or 8GB which can be expanded to 64GB via a MicroSD card. Asus also offers 5GB of online web storage which is free for life.

Asus has a slick-looking interface called the Zen UI and runs on top of Android 4.3 Jelly Bean. The interface is designed in such a way that it compliments the design of the phone. The device has an 8 megapixel primary camera with flash and a 0.3 megapixel front camera. The phone has a non removable 1750mAh battery. The Zenfone 4 will give a tough fight to the Moto E or the recently announced Xiaomi Redmi 1S.

The Micromax A113 Canvas Ego has a 1.2GHz quad core processor and 1GB RAM under the hood which allows user to seamlessly multitask. It has a 4.7-inch LCD capacitive touchscreen with 960x540 pixel resolution display. It has 4GB internal memory out of which 2.7GB is available to user. The memory can be expanded to 32GB using a microSD card. The A113 runs on Android 4.1 Jelly Bean. It features an 8MP rear facing camera with autofocus and LED Flash and the company promotes the same with the night mode feature. It also has a 2MP front facing camera which enables the user to video chat and click self portraits. It provides 3G connectivity speeds of up to 21Mbps.

Panasonic has launched a whole lot of phones in the Indian market in an attempt to compete with the likes of Samsung and Micromax. The Panasonic P55 was one smartphone that managed to impress the masses and the Panasonic P75 is attempting to do the same.
Display and Design: The P75 has a 5 inch IPS display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels which is good for a phone at this price. There is no mention of any glass protection for the screen. The phone is a little thicker but this may be because of the big battery that it houses underneath.
Performance: This Panasonic phone is powered by a MediaTek MT 6580 processor which is a Quad Core processor clocked at 1.3GHz. The phone has 1GB of RAM which is low when compared to its competition.The phone runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop with customizations from Panasonic on top of it. The phone has an ambient light sensor, accelerometer and the proximity sensor.
Camera and Storage: The device has an 8 megapixel autofocus camera at the back with a single LED flash and a 5 megapixel camera on the front. The phone has 8GB of internal storage and a mIcroSD card slot that accepts cards upto 32GB.
No title: The battery is the highlight of this smartphone, it has a 5000mAh battery. The phone should be able to run for 2-3 days with moderate use. The phone has Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity. It is a Dual SIM device.

Overview: The Vivo Y25 runs an outdated Android 5.1 Lollipop-based Funtouch OS 2.1. Vivo states it results in longer running time, smoother operation, and powerful software experience. One can easily customise several software-level functionalities such as lock-screen avatar, visitor mode, and global search.

Pros: Front facing speakers with Dolby ATMOS technology
Cons: Very slipper back panel, cover is recommended
Below average camera output in low-light conditions

Overview: The Panasonic Eluga i2 Activ is a budget offering by smartphone maker Panasonic. It packs in decent specifications and features for a phone of this price range. Let's take a look at what the phone has to offer.

Almost after 15 months, the Japanese smartphone company has launched a successor to Xperia E. The Xperia E1 is essentially a entry-level smartphone with a 4-inch WVGA (800×480 pixels) display with a pixel density of 223 pixels per inch (its predecessor had a smaller 3.5 inch screen). It is powered by Qualcomm's MSM8210 dual-core processor ticking at 1.2GHz and coupled with 512MB RAM and 4GB of internal storage (the older sibling had a single core 1GHz processor). There is a single SIM version of the XPERIA E1 as well. The phones storage can be expanded upto 32GB via a microSD card slot.

Sony is trying to focus on the music abilities of this smartphone. Sony Xperia E1 and E1 Dual come with 100dB loud speakers. It also comes with ClearAudio+ mode and xLOUD feature which enhances overall music experience. The phone has a 3.15 Megapixel rear camera but lacks a front camera. Although the resolution of the camera is the same as the predecessor, many features have been added such as-Geo-Tagging, Face Detection, HDR, Image Stabilization, Panorama. The device lacks LED flash and HD recording, which is disappointing. The phone runs on Android v4.3 Jelly Bean. This model supports Dual SIM and 3G connectivity. It also has Radio which might be a delight to a few customers. To power this gadget there is a 1750mAh battery (which is more than the previous model). This is the Dual SIM version of the phone.
Nubia added the Nubia M2 Lite its M-series lineup in May 2017. The M2 Lite was nubia’s first phone to sport a powerful 16-megapixel front-facing camera aimed at the selfie-enthusiasts.

Introduction:: Lenovo A7700 is a dual SIM device that was launched in September 2016. State of the art performance, Wavemaxx Audio, dual speakers and battery saving intelligence are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Lenovo A7700 comes with 5.5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive IPS display, 16M colors, Lenovo screen, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 267.02PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 152 x 76.2 x 8.5 mm and its weight is 155 grams. It is available in Matte Black and Matte White colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Vibe UI Operating System, Mali T720 graphics and 2GB RAM. It has a proximity sensor, light sensor and gravity sensor. You can switch apps or minimize the screen with just a single tap.
Camera and Storage:

Lenovo A7700 is loaded with an 8MP rear camera having 3264 x 2448 pixels image resolution, face detection, touch focus, autofocus, video sharing, video player, video streaming and HDR. It has 2MP front camera with fixed focus. Other camera features include dual LED flash and HD video recording facility. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a non-removable 2900mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 24 hours and standby time of up to 10 days. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Lenovo A7700 faces competition from Motorola Moto G4 Play. Moto G4 Play has faster processor, higher front camera, higher pixel density and more expandable memory than Lenovo A7700.

Overview: The Karbonn A15+ is an reasonable 4 inch display bearing, Android 4.2 running touch screen phone. Powered by a dual core 1.3GHz processor it comes with 4GB internal memory which is expandable upto 32GB. The 5MP camera which it is equipped with lacks flash, autofocus and video recording, which is acceptable on seeing its price. You could also look at the Moto E which is superior in many ways.

So far this is the best Asha series phone launched in the market. Like the rest two Asha lineup phones namely the Asha 500 and 502, this phone comes with the ice layer of transparent polycarbonate on top of its body cover. The body cover is available in bright red, bright green, yellow, cyan, white and black colors. Nokia has tried to make these recently launched phones cooler by adding the single swipe feature to click photos and with a single tap you can share it on your chosen social networking site. The 503 has a 3 inches screen which is more resistant than rest of the models as its protected by Cornings Gorilla Glass. It has a 5MP camera which is a step above the previous Asha 501, and clicking photos in dim lighting will be better due to the added LED Flash. One can connect faster with the internet as this phone supports the 3G with speeds of up to 7.2Mbps. This phone is available in both single SIM and Dual SIM variant. This phone is the costliest of the Asha lineup at the moment.

The Samsung Galaxy SIII (S3 / SGS3) is one of the most anticipated Android mobiles to launch in 2012. The S3 replaces the Samsung Galaxy S2 as the flagship offering from Seoul. The Galaxy S3 has a large 4.8-inch Super AMOLED screen sporting a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels. The screen resolution reaches a density of 309 PPI on the Galaxy S3, thereby taking it above the 300 PPI "Retina" threshold. It houses a Quad-core 1.4 GHz Exynos processor and 1GB of RAM. Samsung has also integrated a Siri-like feature, dubbed S Voice into the SGS3. An 8 megapixel BSI sensor at the back takes great snaps, videos are shot in high 1080p HD resolution. The front-facing camera measures in at 1.9 megapixels, and does 720p HD video. Samsung has also baked in a lot of functionality over and above Android (4.1 Jelly Bean)  stuff like Eye tracking feature. A large 2100 mAh battery provides ample standby time even with heavy usage.

Introduction:: Micromax Canvas Unite 4 Pro was launched in June in 2016. The device comes with a metallic back panel and support for 12 regional languages.
Display and Design:: Micromax Canvas Unite 4 Pro has an IPS HD touchscreen display of 5 inch and resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels. It provides 16M colours.
Hardware and Features:: Micromax Canvas Unite 4 Pro comes with a 1.3GHz quad-core Spreadtrum SC9832 processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop OS that can be upgraded to Android 6.0 Marshmallow, and a 2GB RAM. The Android software is wrapped with a custom UI and Indus OS 2.0 for the local language users. It has a proximity sensor, accelerometer, ambient light sensor, and gyroscope. There are many mobile apps such as Citrus Cube, Indus Launcher, Amazon Shopping, Scandid, Gaana, Hike, Opera Mini, Quikr, Skype, Snapdeal which are pre-installed in the device. It also has some pre-installed games like Temple Paradise Dash and Monster Truck Saga.
Camera and Storage:: Micromax Canvas Unite 4 Pro is equipped with an 8MP AF rear camera having LED flash, CMOS image sensor and autofocus facility. It has a 5MP FF front camera for selfie shooting and for video calling. It has a video resolution of 720p. This dual SIM device has an internal storage of 16GB which can be expanded up to 32GB using a micro SD card.
Battery and connectivity:: It is loaded with 3900mAh Li-Polymer non-removable battery that provides the users a talk time of 35 hours and standby time of 700 hours. Micromax Unite 4 Pro takes micro SIM. Users can enjoy connectivity through GPS, Wi-Fi, FM, Bluetooth, 3G, and 4G.
Competition:: It faces stiff competition fromIntex Aqua Secure, LYF Wind 4at close prices and specifications but Micromax Canvas Unite 4 Proprovides a better front camera while LYF Wind 4 has higher battery capacity.

Overview: Itel's upcoming mid-ranger dubbed Itel Vision 2 is one of the cheapest devices of all time. This device also has the potential to be crowned as the next mid-range killer. Not just that but the smartphone also packs in a great value for money and some amazing specs for the price such as a beautiful AMOLED display, a huge 4000mAh battery, a great camera setup, and a lot more. The smartphone is powered by the Tru-Octa Core SoC.
Design and Display: The Itel Vision 2boasts a 6.6 inch IPS LCDdisplay with a resolution of 720 x 1600 pixelsand a high pixel density of 266ppi to fabricate rich and crisp visuals. The bezel-less display sports an immersive Punch-hole design along with an aspect ratio of 20:9 and a screen to body ratio of 90% for enhanced viewing experience.
Cameras: The Itel Vision 2 houses a dual rear camera with a 13MP wide-angle primary sensor and a 2MP macro sensor with LED flash support onboard. Coming to the front, the device features a 8MP selfie shooter. The camera arrives with features likeArtificial Intelligence, Auto Flash, Auto Focus, Bokeh Effect, Continuos Shooting, Exposure compensation, Face detection, Geo tagging, High Dynamic Range mode (HDR), ISO control, Touch to focus, White balance presets.
Battery and Performance: The Itel Vision 2 is baked with the Tru-Octa Core chipset coupled with an Adreno 620GPU. The device comes assembled with 2GB RAM paired with an internal storage capacity of 32GB, which can be expanded upto 128GB. Fuelling the device is a huge 4000mAh Li-ion battery with fast charging support on board.
Software and Connectivity: Itel Vision 2 will run Android Go UI on top of Android 10 out of the box. For the connectivity options, the smartphone will support features likedual sim VoLTE(Nano + Nano), Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n, GPS, and Bluetooth. Furthermore, the smartphone will also pack in a microUSB 2.0 port, a 3.5mm headphone jack , USB OTG support and a rear-mounted fingerprint sensor as well.

Overview: This is the dual-SIM version of the Sony Xperia E, and other than this both phones are exactly identical. The Sony Xperia E is an entry-level Android handset available in the under-Rs. 10,000 price range. This phone comes with a 3.5-inch HVGA (320 x 480 pixel) display. It is powered by a dual-core 1GHz ARM Cortex A5 based chipset and 512MB RAM. Out of the 4GB internal memory, 2GB is available to the user, plus there's scope of upgrading it via a microSD card slot. This handset comes with Android 4.1 Jelly Bean from the start. The 3.15MP camera at the back unfortunately is fixed-focus. Worse yet, it isn't complemented by a LED flash, much like the Lumia 520. Connectivity-wise, there's 3G with speeds up to 7.2 Mbps and WiFi support. FM Radio listeners will appreciate the presence of this feature in the Xperia E. The 1530 mAh battery at the back, given the fairly mediocre hardware, should not depreciate that quick.

Xolo A500s IPS is an entry-level 4-inch Android Smartphone bearing a IPS LCD (800x480 pixels) display with a pixel density of 233PPI. The screen is crisp and sharp enough, considering the price and the IPS display renders decent viewing angles as well. It is powered by a 1.3GHz Dual-core MediaTek processor and is paired with 512MB RAM. This chipset is good enough for the price but the phone might not to able to multi-task smoothly because of insufficient RAM. It has an internal memory of 4GB and accepts microSD cards of storage upto 32GB.

Xolo A500s IPS features a 5 Megapixel rear camera with flash, which can record HD videos at 720p. The smartphone runs Android v4.2 Jelly Bean and sports Xolo Secure which is an anti-theft app. It supports Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM), 3G Connectivity, Bluetooth, WiFi, GPS etc. Xolo A500s IPS is very similar to Xolo A500s, the main difference being that the latter bears a non-IPS display (IPS display is better since it gives better viewing angles and color reproduction is also good).

Samsungs Galaxy Ace Duos is what the Korean company brought out by giving the Ace series a touch of Dual-Sim. It has a 3.5 inches TFT Capacitive Touch Screen which gives a resolution of 320 x 480 pixels. Ace Duos comes with an internal 3 GB Memory which is expandable upto 32 GB using Micro SD cards. This phone is powered by a 832 MHz processor, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth v3.0, 3G, Stereo FM radio with RDS and sensors for accelerometer, proximity and compass. Ace Duos runs on Android OS 2.3 Gingerbread.

Android loads its customized Android UI, TouchWiz on the Ace Duos thus comforting long time Samsung users.
