Galaxy Ace has a 5MP Camera with features like auto-focus, geo-tagging and picture quality of 2592x1944 pixels. It provides a video resolution of 30 fps. Powered by a standard Li-ion battery of 1300mAh, it supports for 7 hours in talk-time mode and 420 hours in stand-by mode. Currently available in black and white colours, the Ace Duos would attract users looking for quality Dual SIM options in India.

Nokia's newest entry in to its expanding Asha line up of affordable handsets, the Asha 311 was announced in June 2011. The Asha 311 is also a part of the newly named Asha Touch series of handsets which also include the Asha 305 and the Asha 306. The Asha 311 gets a 3 inch 240 x 400 pixel TFT touch screen display complete with Corning Gorilla glass coating. There is an unnamed processor that runs at 1 GHz under the hood. The phone has 140 MB of internal memory and 128 MB of RAM. This is decent for a product of its class. Taking care of the imaging bit is a 3.15 megapixel fixed focus camera which can also take videos in VGA resolution at a decent 25 fps.

At around Rs. 6,000, the Karbonn A7 is a decent entry level Android phone. It comes with a dual 1GHz Cortex A9 processor and runs on Android 4.0. In built memory is 164MB but is expandable to 32GB. It has a 5MP with flash light but lacks autofocus. The battery is a standard lithium ion one with 1400 mAh capacity, which sounds insufficient.

Introduction:: Hitech Air A9 is a dual SIM device that was launched in May 2016. Support for 21 regional languages and 2.5D curved glass are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Hitech Air A9 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 147.2 x 73.2 x 8.8 mm and its weight is 125 grams. It is available in White and Black colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6753 processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System that can be upgraded to Marshmallow, Mali T720 graphics and 2GB RAM. Call Waiting, call forwarding, call conference, document viewer features are available. It has accelerometer and proximity sensor.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 3500mAh Li-ion battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards.
Competition:

Hitech Air A9 faces competition from Videocon Krypton3 V50JG and Intex Aqua Music. Videocon Krypton3 V50JG has a lower battery capacity and faster processor than Hitech Air A9. Intex Aqua Music has larger screen, faster processor and lower battery capacity than Hitech Air A9.
Camera and Storage:: Hitech Air A9 is loaded with 13MP rear camera having an image resolution of 4128 x 3096 Pixels and 5MP front camera having fixed focus. Other camera features include geotagging, autofocus, and LED flash. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.

Hitech Air A9 is loaded with 13MP rear camera having an image resolution of 4128 x 3096 Pixels and 5MP front camera having fixed focus. Other camera features include geotagging, autofocus, and LED flash. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.

Introduction:: Wind 1 is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2016. Wider viewing angles, notable brightness levels, textured back cover with a stylish, lightweight body and USB OTG support for using pendrive are its major highlights.
Display and Design:: It comes with 5 inch IPS LCD touchscreen display with 5 point multi-touch, an HD resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels and pixel density of 294PPI. It has a dimension of 143.00 x 71.00 x 8.40 mm and its weight is 125 grams. Screen mirroring is available. It is available in 2 colours including White and Black and comes with Asahi Dragontrail glass screen protector.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device comes with 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor, Adreno 306 graphics, 1GB RAM and works on Android 5.1 Lollipop operating System. E-compass, ambient light sensor, G-sensor and proximity sensor are in-built.
Camera and Storage:: This dual SIM device comes with a 8MP rear camera with autofocus, 6X digital zoom and LED flash. It has a 5MP front camera with 88 degree wide viewing angle. HDR, geotagging, panorama, touch focus, night mode, face detection and image enhancer features are available. Users can record HD videos with rear camera at 1080p and with front camera at 720p. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 64GB using a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: Wind 1 is loaded with 2300mAh Li-ion removable battery that provides a talk time of up to 6 hours on 4G networks and standby time of nearly 460 hours. Users can enjoy music for up to 20 hours. Users can have connectivity through 2G, 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth and VoLTE.
Overview: Wind 1 faces direct competition fromSamsung Galaxy Core Prime as both are available in same price range but Wind 1 has a better camera and bigger screen.

This is Lenovos Flagship and has a lot of things going for it, considering the pricing. The 5.5-inch display is packed with 1920 x 1080 pixel Full HD resolution. The phone itself is amazingly thin at 6.9mm and built out of materials that make it feel premium. It is powered by a 2GHz Intel Atom dual-core chip that goes toe-to-toe with the competitive ARM chips in terms of performance. Theres an ample 2GB RAM and 16GB of onboard storage too. A 13MP camera at the back records video at 1080p resolution. It runs the currently recent Android 4.2 Jelly Bean OS with a UI customised by Lenovo. Let's just hope that the 2500 mAh battery can drive all this high-end feature set for an entire day.
Introduction:

Intex Aqua Power Plus was launched on 27 April 2015. It sports some never been features in this range. Major attractions are mighty Battery Backup, Latest Android OS, Powerful Configuration, Camera Quality, etc.
Design and Display:

The Intex aqua Power Plus sports a 5.0-inch IPS LCD Capacitive multi-touch display with HD resolution of 1280*720 pixels which result in a pixel density of 294 pixels per inch. It has a dimension of 147.0*72.0*8.65 mm and weighs 156 grams which result in 64.97% screen to body ratio. It is available in Black + Silver, Champagne, Black + Champagne, White + Champagne colours.
Hardware and Features:

At the heart of it, it is powered by 1.3 GHz quad core cortex A7 processor sitting on MediaTek MT6582M chipset coupled with a 2 GB of RAM. It is operated through Android v5.0 (Lollipop) and Mali-400 MP2 graphics which is undoubted, one of its major attractions.
Camera and Storage:

The Intex Aqua Power Plus is loaded with a 13 MP Primary camera with autofocus snapper and LED Flash at the back with an image resolution of 4128*3096 pixels. It is also armed with 5MP front-facing snapper for capturing selfie and enjoying video calls. Other camera features include CMOS image sensor, Panorama shot, face beauty, Live photo mode, Continuous shots, Voice capture, HDR, smile shot, face detection and video recording 1920*1080 @30 fps. Its internal memory is 16 GB which is expandable further up to 32 GB through MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

The Intex Aqua Power Plus is backed with mighty 4,000 mAh Li-ion battery, which claims to offer to stand by time up to 1176h and talk time up to 8 hours (3G)/ 17 hours (2G). It is a dual SIM Smartphone in which one of them supports 3G at a time. Other connectivity features include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, Mobile Hotspot, FM Radio and Micro USB etc.
Powered by 1.3Ghz Quad Core (MTK6582M) processor and 1GB of RAM
A Standard 4.5-inch (480x854 pixels) FWVGA IPS display with a pixel density of 218 PPI
8GB Internal Storage, expandable upto 64GB via a microSD card
5 MP rear camera that records Full HD videos, and a mediocre VGA front camera
Android 4.4.2 KitKat
Dual SIM support, removable 1700mAh battery
Leather back finish
1 Color option -- Black
Alternatives:
Huawei Honor Holly
Spice Dream UNO Mi-498
Asus Zenfone 4 A450CG

Introduction:: Intex Aqua Ace II is a dual SIM device that was launched in March 2016. MHL cable, good battery backup and upgradability of VoLTE to FOTA are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Intex Aqua Ace II comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 5 point finger touch facility, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 145.30 x 72.00 x 8.65 mm and its weight is 149 grams. It is available in White colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System, and 3GB RAM. It has GPS and FM radio. Gravity sensor and P-L sensor are present. MIDI, MP3, AMR, AAC, WAV, OGG, AWB are audio formats and video formats include 3GP, AVI, MP4. Google Talk, Twitter, Facebook chat, YouTube, Gmail, Google Search, WhatsApp are available.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 3000mAh Li-ion battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 Micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Intex Aqua Ace II faces competition from Micromax Canvas 5. Micromax Canvas 5 has bigger screen, lower battery capacity and better rear camera than Intex Aqua Ace II.
Camera and Storage:: Intex Aqua Ace II is loaded with an 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus, Samsung sensor, Lens 4P/3P, module daling and make daling and LED flash. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. Both front and rear camera can record videos. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.

Intex Aqua Ace II is loaded with an 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus, Samsung sensor, Lens 4P/3P, module daling and make daling and LED flash. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. Both front and rear camera can record videos. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.

Overview: The Alcatel One Touch Idol is a single SIM phone that requires a Micro-SIM. The device comes with a 1GHz Dual-core processor with 512MB of RAM. The phone has a 4.7 inch display with a qHD resolution (540x960) with 234 PPI pixel density.

The phone has an 8 megapixel camera which is capable of 720p video recording and a 2 megapixel front facing camera. The phone runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean and has 4GB of internal memory and 2GB is available to the user. The device has a microSD card slot to expand storage and supports cards up to 32GB.

The Motorola Moto G Second Generation is one of the most popular smartphones in the budget smartphone category. Initially at launch in September 2014, Motorola had decided to launch the phone with only support for 3G. However, with a fierce competition from the likes of Xiaomi RedMi 2 Prime, Lenovo K3 Note and the Yu Yureka Plus in the sub Rs 10,000 category, and in order to keep the phone relevant and up to speeds, a new LTE version of what is arguably the most popular Motorola device was released in 2015. The new Moto G Second Gen from the outside is exactly the same device as the original Moto G Second Gen. If you were to go into nitty gritty details of the phone, then the LTE version weighs 6 grams more than the 3G variant and comes with Android Lollipop out of the box. The only major specification change has been in the battery capacity where, the LTE version comes with a 2390 mAh battery as compared to the 2070 mAh battery on the 3G version.

Introduction:: Zopo Color C1 is a dual SIM device that was launched in January 2016. 28nm technology, 178 degree viewing angle, energy-saving chip, power management IC, providing long time for work and gaming experience are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Zopo Color C1 comes with 4.5 inch LCD touch screen display, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 217PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 133 x 65.7 x 8.5 mm and its weight is 113 grams. It is available in 5 colours including, Rose Red, Classic Black, Snow White, Vibrant Yellow and Sky Blue.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz MediaTek MT6580 quad-core processor, 1GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System. Accelerometer, E-compass, light sensor and proximity sensor are in-built. It has FM radio and GPS. It comes with power saving mode and face recognition technology to offer the users better security.
Camera and Storage:

Zopo Color C1 is loaded with 5MP rear and 2MP front camera. Other camera features include LED flash, touch to focus, face detection, ISO control, exposure compensation, digital zoom and HDR. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a 1700mAh Li-PO removable battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Zopo Color C1 faces competition from Yu Yureka Plus and Karbonn Quattro L50 HD. Yu Yureka Plus and Karbonn Quattro 4G have bigger screen, more RAM, more internal storage capacity and higher rear camera than Zopo Color C1.

Overview: Karbonn started selling mobiles and tablets running on Android from 2009. They claimed to have sold more than 10 million units all over India. Karbonn is one the many other brands who offer value for money products. The key features of this device are 
5 inch display with the resolution of 854x480 pixels
Below average 195 PPI pixel density
Dual SIM
Comes with 512 MB RAM and runs on a 1.3GHz, Dual Core processor
4GB of internal storage is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 8MP, VGA camera in the front
Powered by a 1600mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Spice Dream Uno

Yu Yureka 2 is a successor to the previously launched Yureka by Yu Televentures, a subsidiary of Mircomax. This is a feature packed phone in a good budget, check out all the details you need to know about the phone.

Pros: Handy form factor, good for one handed usage
8MP camera sensors on the back and front of the device are decent
Cons: Sluggish multitasking despite having 2GB of RAM
Battery life is just about average

Overview: The Gionee S11 Lite is a mid-segment smartphone with trending features like bezel-less display & a dual rear camera. Let’s take a look at its overview to find more about this device:

Lava is one of the top 5 Indian smartphone manufacturer that competes with other global brands like Micromax, Xiaomi & LeEco. The company also owns Xolo which has been recently doing well in the market with their budget oriented devices that offers good value for money.
Design and Display: On the front we have a 5 inch HD (1280x720 pixels) display giving the display a pixel density of 294PPI which does sound sharp enough. For protecting the display we do have Asahi Dragontail Glass. In terms of design, the phone looks well built has Glass on the front and back of the device which somewhat resembles the iPhone 4 design.
Hardware and Features: You get a MediaTek MT6735 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and is available in 2GB and 3GB RAM options which should be great for average usage with basic apps and should provide a great multitasking experience. On the software front, Lava Pixel V2 2GB variant comes with Android 5.1 Lollipop whereas the 3GB variant packs the latest Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with Lava's Star OS running on top of it.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of Lava Pixel V2 lies a 13MP camera that can record videos up to 1080p whereas on the front sits a 8MP shooter for those selfie moments. The rear camera also gets a Dual LED Flash for taking videos and pictures in dark plus you also get an LED Flash on the front which is a huge bonus for all selfie lovers. To store all those selfies and other data there is 16GB of onboard storage with expandability option up to 32GB more via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: Powering the device is a 2500mAh non removable battery that should easily last you through the day. On the connectivity front, Lava Pixel V2 supports Dual Micro SIMs and also supports 4G LTE networks with VoLTE in India.

Overview: Lava Iris X8 is yet another budget Android smartphone. It is an upgrade to Lavas Iris X5. It looks strikingly similar to the iPhone 4. For the price it has decent amount of specifications.

Introduction:: Micromax Canvas 5 Lite (Special Edition) Q463 is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. Stylish look, walnut and maple wood finish for the back cover, and decent configuration are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Micromax Canvas 5 Lite (Special Edition) Q463 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 1920 x 1080 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 73.5 x 144 x 8.9 mm and its weight is 151 grams. It is available in Yellow and Tan Brown colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz Quad-core MediaTek MT6735P processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and 3GB RAM. It has FM radio and GPS. Light sensor, proximity sensor, accelerometer and compass are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Micromax Canvas 5 Lite (Special Edition) Q463 is loaded with 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include continuous shooting, auto focus, digital shooting, geo tagging, LED flash, panorama, HDR, touch to focus, face detection, white balance settings, ISO settings, exposure compensation, self-timer, scene mode. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2000mAh Li-ion battery that provides a talk time of up to 5 hours and standby time of nearly 150 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Micromax Canvas 5 Lite (Special Edition) Q463 faces competition from Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus. Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus has faster processor, higher battery capacity and better rear camera than Micromax Canvas 5 Lite (Special Edition) Q463.

Pros: Useful features added to fingerprint sensor
Cons: Build quality could have been better

Overview: The XOLO A500S is an entry-level phone with fairly compelling specifications. The petite sized body houses a 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel display and is powered by a 1.2GHz dual-core processor. There's 512MB of RAM and 4GB of internal storage. The A500S is a 3G capable handset with speeds of up to 21Mbps and has WiFi 802.11n support as well. It runs the Android 4.2 Jelly Bean OS. In the camera department, it has a 5 megapixel autofocus rear camera and a VGA front-facing cam. The rear camera is capable of shooting 720p HD videos, possibly due to the Mali-400 GPU onboard. Powering this unit is a 1400 mAh battery.

Putting some more horse-power behind the popular Galaxy S, Samsung launched the Galaxy S Plus I9001. Compared to the original Galaxy S, the SGS Plus gets a better processor (1.4GHz Qualcomm) and somewhat better battery. The camera reamins at 5MP with 720p recording. The Galaxy S has been a popular Android device since launch, and with Samsung's Touchwiz customization, it does stand out from the rest of the lot.

Aggressively pushing new smartphones around Rs. 10,000 price range this time, Samsung has another, slightly different segment product out here. The Galaxy J Max from Samsung is the latest phone in the J series, however Galaxy J Max can be misunderstood for a tablet, thanks to the huge 7 inch display. With this big screen the phone competes with a couple of devices from Lenovo, the Lenovo Phab and the Lenovo Phab Plus. Also, considering the specs of the Galaxy J max, it is expected that it would priced under 15,000 only with the above to competitors.
Design and Display: In terms of design the phone looks typically Samsung with plastic body and sides that look metal. The rear sports a camera with a speaker grill beside and on the front is the typical Samsung home button. Coming to the huge 7 inch display, it has a resolution of 1280x800 pixels that gives the display a pixel density of 216PPI. The clarity of the display is just average and we would expect at least Full HD resolution on a screen this big. Unfortunately, we do not get an AMOLED display and no Gorilla Glass either.
Hardware and Features: On the inside, Galaxy J Max runs a Spreadtrum SC8830 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.5GHz and along with it is just 1.5GB of RAM. Considering the quite unheard processor and given just 1.5GB of RAM this phone might just not be able to keep up to your multitasking needs. And on the software end, the phone's operating system is based on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box with Samsung's TouchWiz UI running on top of it. You can check the phones running Android Marshmallow out of the box here.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of the device lies a 8MP camera sensor that can record videos up to 720p only, which again is a huge disappointment here. The Galaxy J max also lacks an LED Flash with the rear camera. On the front also you get a very basic 2MP sensor for video calling and not that great selfies. To store all the data you get 16GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 200GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: Now this where the bigger form factor of the device is useful, thanks to it we have a massive 4000mAh battery packed on the back of the device which sounds impressive and should hold up quite well. And in terms of connectivity, Samsung Galaxy J Max is a Dual SIM device that supports 4G LTE in India and also allows VoLTE.

Overview: Launched in September 2014, Karbonn Titanium S10 is an Android smartphone for shoppers looking for options under Rs. 5,000. Karbonn is one of the biggest smartphone and tablet manufacturer in India.
Screen & Design:: Titanium S10 has a 5 inch touchscreen with a 720x1280 px resolution and pixel density of 293.7 PPI. It is large enough to comfortably watch videos and read. The black colour design gives a rich look when held in the hand.
Hardware & Performance:: Karbonn has equipped this phone with a 1.3GHz Quad-Core processor and supported it with 1 GB RAM. While this is good enough for basic functions, you may want to check out Lenovo A1000 that offers a better chipset in the same budget.
Camera & Battery:: The phone has a very good 8 MP rear camera with LED Flash. On the front it has a 2MP camera for your selfies. If you are more of a selfie taker, you can go for the iBall Andi 4.5M Enigma by spending a few extra bucks. Karbonn Titanium S10 comes with a 1850 mAh removable Li-ion battery that would just last a day.
This dual SIM phone supports all basic connectivity options i.e. 3G, Bluetooth and Wi-Fi but lacks 4G.

Overview: The Karbonn S5 Titanium is an sub-Rs. 13k Android smartphone with a heavy-sounding feature list. It all starts with a Quad-core 1.2 GHz processor and 1GB RAM, a 5-inch IPS display bearing a 960 x 540 pixel resolution (which, may not be as high as, say the Micromax Canvas HD, but is marginally higher than the Galaxy Grand). The next "high-end" spec is the 8 megapixel camera and even a 2MP front-facing camera. There's 4GB of internal memory and a microSD card slot that takes up to 32GB. Other than 3G, the phone has WiFi for high-speed internet access. A 2000 mAh battery sounds quite promising to keep this phone with seemingly high specs running for a reasonable time. Oh, and we forgot to mention that like all Indian phone makers do, this phone supports dual SIMs too.

The HTC Incredible S was released in February 2011. Powered by Android 2.2 (Froyo) operating system, the phone has a 1.1GB internal memory with a microSD slot that enables expansion upto 32GB. It runs on a 1GHz Scorpion processor and uses HTC Sense UI. The model has a 4 inch capacitive touch screen. It is also loaded with a rear 8MP camera and a 1.3MP secondary camera, and is enabled to shoot HD videos. It has Bluetooth, 3G and A-GPS support (with access to Google Maps).

Micromax Canvas Viva A72 is again an entry level range dual SIM smartphone. This affordable smartphone offers display size of 480 x 800 pixels, 5.0 inches with TFT touchscreen. 3G support is missing but in 2G the phone works with GSM 900 / 1800 - SIM 1 & SIM 2. The internal memory of this smartphone is 512MB out of which 110MB is usable. You can expand further upto 32GB using a microSD card. It offers Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Wi-Fi hotspot and a Bluetooth of version 3.0. Its primary camera boosts up to 3.15 MP, 2048x1536 pixels and has no secondary camera. This smartphone offers a rather older Android OS v2.3 (Gingerbread). The phone is powered by a 1GHz dual-core CPU. Its seemingly high-capacity 2000 mAh battery should give a good up-time.

After much speculation of an Android-powered Nokia smartphone, the Nokia X+ was officially announced in February 2014 along with the Nokia X and Nokia XL. The Nokia X+ comes in the same colourful shells like the rest of the Lumia series, but runs something very different than Windows Phone inside. Its Android; but not traditional Android like you know it. It is Android thats void of all Google services; like Maps, Gmail, YouTube etc, that are replaced with Microsofts services. Its UI is also a cross between the Windows Phones Tile-based interface coupled with the Fastlane multi-tasking system found on the Asha 500 series. So whats the benefit? Because of the Android base, Nokia says existing Android apps can be easily ported to the Nokia X software platform. Theres also the possibility of sideloading APK files directly. Nokia has their own app store to discover new apps for the Nokia X+.

On the inside, the Nokia X+ is very similar to the Nokia X, which in turn is similar to the Lumia 520. Its got a 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel IPS display and a 1GHz dual-core Snapdragon S4 chip. While the Nokia X had 512MB RAM, the X+ comes with 768MB, thus allowing more apps to run at the same time. Theres 4GB of internal storage (Lumia 520 has 8GB), along with a microSD card slot to expand it further (a 4GB card comes bundled). Theres a lacklustre-sounding 3 megapixel fixed-focus camera at the back with no flash, and no front-facing camera for video calls. The Nokia X+ is a Dual SIM phone with 3G support. The Nokia X+ also comes with Nokias HERE maps with offline navigation, Nokia MixRadio streaming music service and one month of unlimited Skype-Out calls. A 1500mAh battery provides juice to this phone.
Micromax A89 Ninja has a 4-inch WVGA TFT Capacitive touchscreen display that bears a display resolution of 480x800 pixels. This device runs on Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) Operating System.

Micromax has powered the A89 Ninja smartphone with a 1GHZ MediaTek MT6577 Dual-Core Processor accompanied by 512MB of RAM. It has a storage capacity of 4GB which can be further expanded externally up to 32GB via Micro SD Card. The Dual-SIM smartphone features a 3-megapixel Rear Camera but lacks a front camera. The phone is fuelled by a 1,450 mAh Battery providing upto 170 hours of standby time and 4 hours talk time.

On the Connectivity front Micromax A89 Ninja smartphone includes 3G, Bluetooth, A-GPS, Wi-Fi, USB and orientation sensor as its features. The phone comes pre-loaded with applications like Hookup, M! live, M! store, M! Zone+, Fruit devil and Darkman.

FAQs: 1. Does Panasonic T50 work with Reliance Jio Network?
Ans: No, it doesn’t. It is 3G supported smartphone.
2. Does the phone have a Hybrid SIM slot?
Ans: No, it have a dedicated slot for MicroSD card.
3. What type or charging connector do I need?
Ans: You’ll need a micro-USB charging connector for this phone which will come out-of-the-box.
4. Will this get further software updates of Android?
Ans: It comes with Android 5.1 Lollipop with Sail UI on top. So far, the company hasn’t released any update for the device.
5. How is the camera performance for this phone?
Ans: The phone features a 5MP rear camera which is just an average camera. The front facing is a 2MP camera which is below average even considering the price of the device.
6. Does it support OTG?
Ans: No, it doesn’t comes with OTG support.
7. Is the battery removable?
Ans: No, the Panasonic T50 comes with non-removable battery.

Overview: The Canvas Lite A92 is a slightly expensive sibling to the popular Canvas Fun A74, with a fairly similar feature set. Canvas Lite A92 is an entry level handset which has a Dual SIM card provision. By using microSD cards, the memory can be expanded up to 32GB. It runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean version. It comes with a 2000mAh battery.

Spice Smart Flo Mi 359 is a low-end smartphone offering. Specifications that it offers is really one off and it will be a far better buy than other low-end phones. The images make it look very close to HTC One M8 but one should know that its a sub Rs. 4000 phone and the hardware will have a plastic feel from top to bottom.
Here are some of its features:

It has a small 3.5 inches HVGA display with a resolution of 480 x 320 pixels. The size or the resolution is absolutely not an issue till you realize that it only has 256k colors and not a 16 million colors. It has a pixel density of 165 PPI, which means the display wont be as crisp.
The rear camera is a 2MP unit whereas the front camera is a 1.3MP which will give you average quality selfies.
It runs Android 4.4 KitKat as its operating system and is one of cheapest device to do so.

Powered by a 1.3GHz dual-core processor, it will be able to run basic Android applications. It simply wont be able multitask as fluently because of a low 256MB of RAM. But we think it is not made for any heavy usage, but to provide Android at a really affordable pricing.

Underneath the back cover you will find a dual-SIM array and a microSD card slot that will support cards upto 32GB. You will be forced to use a microSD card as the phone comes with mere 512MB of internal memory.
The unit gets its juice from a 1400mAh battery that should be able to fetch you some decent 5 hours of usage.

Intro:: The company has came up with Meizu M2 Note in June 2015.
Display and Design: The smartphone flaunts 5.5-inch screen (1080x1920 pixels) along with a pixel density of 403PPI. The device adorned with a polycarbonate rear panel beautified with matte finish has got dimensions as 150.9x75.2x8.7 mm and at a weight of 149g. Safe from drops and scratches owing to the screen panel built with tempered glass, this one is offered in magnificent shades of blue, pink, gray and white.
Hardware and Features: The device has been embedded with Octa-core MediaTek MT6753 processor that runs at 1.3GHz processing speed. Mali T720-MP3 GPU present in the device makes it easy for the users to have amazing gaming experience with rich graphics. The USP of the device is its Flyme 4.5 UI running on top of Lollipop 5.1. Usual array of sensors include Gyroscope, Proximity Sensor, Accelerometer and Ambient light sensors.
Camera and Storage: It lets the user to capture the lifetime moments and memories with the rear shooter of 13MP with the features as dual-tone LED flash, 4K video recording support and low-light photography through image signal processor. Selfie-centric front camera with a special beauty mode allows capture with the 5MP front snapper. This piece from Meizu comes with 2GB RAM  and has got internal storage of 16 or 32GB and an expandable memory up to 128GB.
Battery and Connectivity: 3100mAh non-removable battery enables the device to run for longer time periods. The device supports dual SIM with the one 4G supportive slot. Other connectivity options include 3G, dual-band Wi-Fi, Wi-Fi Direct, Wi-Fi Hotspot, Bluetooth 4.0, and GPS.
Competition: Meizu M2 Note is a budget Smartphone that is complete value for money and scores high on design. The primary competitors include Lenovo K3 Note, Phicomm Passion 660 and Xiaomi Redmi Note 2.

Camera and Storage:: This dual SIM device comes with 8MP AF rear camera having HDR and LED flash and 2MP front camera. Camera features include ISO control, continuous shooting, exposure compensation, digital zoom and touch to focus. It comes with an internal memory of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with the help of a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: Itel It1553 is loaded with a non-removable 5050mAh Li-Polymer battery that provides the users with a talk time of nearly 36 hours on 2G networks and up to 25 hours on 3G networks. Users will get up to 561 hours of standby time. It has connectivity options like 3G, 2G, 802.11b/g/n Wi-Fi, OTG and BT 4.0 Bluetooth, GPRS and EDGE.

The Samsung S Duos 3 VE is an updated version of the Samsung Galaxy S Duos 3. There are a few design changes and the device comes with a few upgrades. The features offered by the phone are as follows
4 Inch TFT display with a resolution of 800x480 pixels offering a pixel density of 233 PPI
1.2GHz Dual Core A7 processor is clocked higher when compared to 1GHz processor in the older device
512MB of RAM on the phone, the RAM is low and alternatives come with 1GB of RAM
4GB of internal storage, storage is again low and only around 2GB will be available for the user and will cause issues with heavy apps

Dual SIM device (GSM+GSM)

HTC Desire VC was announced in July 2012 and is slowly making its debut in various markets across the globe. This Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich laden handset runs HTC Sense UI and comes with a 4 inch 480*800 pixels, capacitive touch screen display. The most important aspect of this handset is the fact that it is a dual SIM capable CDMA + GSM handset. This is the second dual SIM handset from HTC after the HTC V which is a GSM-GSM dual SIM handset. The Desire VC features a 4 inch 480*800 pixel display and runs Android 4.0 IceCream Sandwich. It gets a 5 megapixel camera at the back and doesn't have a front camera. Under the hood, the phone houses a Cortex A5 processor running at 1 GHz.

Taiwanese smartphone maker Asus has launched the ZenFone 4 in India at an unbelievable price. The previous phone by the company was the Asus Zenfone 5. The ZenFone 4 is a cool looking device. The phone is a Dual SIM device. As the name suggests the device has a 4 inch IPS display with 800x480 pixel resolution which takes the pixel density to 233PPI. The device is powered by an Intel Atom Dual core processor clocked at 1.2GHz and comes with 1GB of RAM. The phone has internal storage options of 8GB which can be expanded to 64GB via a MicroSD card. Asus also offers 5GB of online web storage which is free for life.

Asus has a slick-looking interface called the Zen UI and runs on top of Android 4.3 Jelly Bean. The interface is designed in such a way that it compliments the design of the phone. The device has an 8 megapixel primary camera with flash and a 0.3 megapixel front camera. The phone has a non-removable 1600mAh battery. The Zenfone 4 will give a tough fight to the Moto E or the recently announced Xiaomi Redmi 1S.

Display and design language: The Samsung Galaxy J3 features a 5-inch HD AMOLED display having a resolution of 1280 x 720p. The display translates to a pixel density of about 290 PPI for a clear viewing experience.
Hardware and features: The J3 is powered by a quad-core Spreadtrum SC9830 processor which has a clock speed of 1.5GHz. It is also supplemented by a Mali-400 GPU for better gaming experience.The phone runs Android Marshmallow out of the box. It runs Samsung’s custom user interface built over stock Android called TouchWiz.
Camera and storage: For the camera enthusiasts, the J3 incorporates a rear facing 8MP main camera. It also sports a 5MP front facing camera for selfies. To store valuable data, the smartphone has 8GB of internal storage which can be further expanded to 128GB through microSD support.
Battery and Connectivity: The smartphone is supported by a 2600 mAh battery that can get you through the day with moderate usage. For connectivity, the device supports 2G, 3G and is 4G VoLTE ready in India.

Overview: The Sony Xperia E is an entry-level Android handset available in the under-Rs. 10,000 price range. This phone comes with a 3.5-inch HVGA (320 x 480 pixel) display. It is powered by a dual-core 1GHz ARM Cortex A5 based chipset and 512MB RAM. Out of the 4GB internal memory, 2GB is available to the user, plus there's scope of upgrading it via a microSD card slot. This handset comes with Android 4.1 Jelly Bean from the start. The 3.15MP camera at the back unfortunately is fixed-focus. Worse yet, it isn't complemented by a LED flash, much like the Lumia 520. Connectivity-wise, there's 3G with speeds up to 7.2 Mbps and WiFi support. FM Radio listeners will appreciate the presence of this feature in the Xperia E. The 1530 mAh battery at the back, given the fairly mediocre hardware, should not depreciate that quick. The Xperia E is also available in a Dual SIM variant, if you prefer using two numbers in the same phone.

Chinese handset maker Zopo has added a new phone to its Color lineup – the Zopo Color F2. Zopo had an event scheduled in Mumbai this year where it unveiled its new phone in India. Previously, Zopo launched two phones in its portfolio of “Color” devices in the country such as Color F1, Color C3, and Color F5. Zopo is apparently looking compete with already-established Chinese brands such as Xiaomi, Vivo, and the likes on Indian soil.

Samsung Galaxy Y was a really successful device, an Android phone that was available to the masses at an affordable price. The Galaxy Y Plus aims to take it ahead where the Galaxy Y left off. The device shows lots of similarities with its predecessor and has some changes in key areas. The Galaxy Y Plus comes with a slightly faster processor clocked at 850 MHz faster than the 830MHz on the Galaxy Y. More importantly though, the processor also uses a newer ARM Cortex A9 architecture over the ARMv6 type of chip on the older device.

Internal storage gets a huge boost and the device now has 4GB of internal storage as compared to the measly 180MB on the Galaxy Y. The device runs Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) and is a Dual SIM (Dual standby) phone. The phone is now discontinued and there are other phones like the Micromax Canvas Engage and the Lenovo A390.
