The features of the HTC Desire 526+ are as follows
4.7 inch screen with a resolution of 960 x 540 (qHD), pixel density of 234PPI
1.7GHz Octa Core Processor with 1GB of RAM
8GB internal storage with MicroSD card slot that accepts cards upto 32GB
8 Megapixel primary camera with flash capable of 1080p video recording
2 Megapixel front facing camera capable of 720p recording
Sense UI on top of Android 4.4 Kitkat
HTC Blinkfeed brings all online content on one screen
2000mAh battery
Alternatives
Moto G
Micromax Canvas Nitro A311
Nokias Lumia 530 is a successor to the highly popular Lumia 520. Right now, its the most affordable Windows Phone available in India.

Despite the affordable price, Nokias offering a 1.2Ghz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 200 processor, thus offering a speedy performance. Its coupled with 512MB RAM. The display is 4-inch in size that offers a 854 x 480 pixel resolution and 249.9PPI. The camera is a 5 megapixel fixed focus one (unlike the Lumia 520s autofocus sensor), and misses out on LED flash and also a front camera is missing. Alongside 4GB of internal storage (which is half of the Lumia 520s 8GB internal storage), Nokia is offering 128GB microSD card support to expand your storage. The device comes with a removable 1430 mAh battery. It runs on Windows Phone 8.1 with Lumia Cyan Update.

Lumia 530 comes pre-loaded with apps like Line, Viber, Skype, Yahoo! Messenger, Twitter, Shazam, Microsoft Office, Vine, Facebook and Instagram Beta. Just like other Lumia handsets, this one too comes with 15GB of free OneDrive cloud storage. Its available in Bright Orange, Bright Green, Dark Grey, and White colour variants.

Chinese handset maker Zopo has been consistent at launching smartphones that fall under an entry-level or affordable segment. In spite of launching numerous devices in the Indian market over last few months, the company is playing on the back foot and has not been able to stand out so far. This time, however, it may not be the case since Zopo is aiming for something bigger, something it has not done for almost a year.

The Celkon AR40 is a Dual SIM Android smartphone from Celkon. The phone has a 4 inch display powered by a 1.2GHz Dual Core Processor backed by 512MB of RAM that runs the Android 4.2.2 (Jelly Bean) Operating System. The phone houses a 3 megapixel camera at the back and a secondary camera of unknown resolution (we assume its a VGA camera). The primary camera lacks flash which would mean photography in low light might be a problem.

The AR40 is launched by Celkon under their RahmanIshq series so as a bonus this phone comes preloaded with chartbusters by A R Rahman and a special tune composed by the composer specially for this device. The phone also features a Shake & Transfer service that lets user transfer data by shaking it.

Asus Zenfone C looks like a replacement of the Asus Zenfone 4 (450CG). These devices have a lot in common and were launched to capture the entry level segment for Asus. The features of the Zenfone C are as follows.
It has a 4.5 inch LCD display with a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels with a pixel density of 218PPI.
It uses the same Intel Atom Dual Core processor with 1GB of RAM. The processor is good for light use but may stutter when multitasking or gaming.
The phone runs on Android 4.4 Kitkat with the Zen UI on top of it. The UI is minimalistic but it does come with Asus apps pre installed which can be removed to make space.

The 5 megapixel autofocus camera at the back clicks decent images. The flash is quite useful when clicking photos, a plus over its competitor the Moto E. The VGA front facing camera isnt the best one out there and we would recommend people to use the primary camera for clicking selfies.
It comes with 8GB of internal memory for apps and user data and a microSD card slot that accepts cards up to 64GB.
The Zenfone C is a dual SIM device and uses 2 Micro SIM cards. Thanks to its petite size, it can be held comfortably for long calls, we faced no issues when calling from the device.
Alternatives
Lenovo A6000
Xiaomi Redmi 2
Huawei Honor Holly

The Galaxy J1 4G is an entry-level Android phone from Samsung. It is the 4G variant of the Samsung Galaxy J1. Looking at the specs it looks like it tries to replace the much popular Samsung Galaxy S Duos but you will find out that it exact same device with different bezel and slightly better battery.
Here are the key features of the Galaxy J1 4G:
It is a dual-SIM device where one slot will support 4G networks. It is Samsungs cheapest 4G enabled device.

On the front you will get a 4.3 inches TFT display which has a resolution of 800 x 480 pixels and a pixel density of 217 PPI which was seen on the original Samsung Galaxy S Duos, S Duos 2 and S Duos 3.

A 1.2 GHz quad-core processor is at the heart of the Galaxy J1 4G. It is let down by a low 768MB of RAM. This set of specifications is inadequate for multi-tasking but it will do just fine with basic gaming.
It runs on Android 4.4 KitKat but there is no news of an update to Android 5.0 Lollipop. Samsung is known to overlook its entry-level phone in their update roadmap.

It has a modest 1850mAh battery that will be sufficient for half day usage. It will be running Samsungs TouchWiz UI which is loaded with bloatware which will drain the battery. But you have an option to uninstall/disable some of those applications.
It has a low, 4GB of internal storage but you can expand to up to 128GB with a microSD card.
Alternatives:
Redmi 2
Lenovo A7000
Moto E 2nd Gen

Intex India has launched several devices in the sub 5000 segment. While many of the previous phones didn’t even support 4G LTE, these new phones do have 4G LTE support and are also VoLTE enabled which is now a must, thanks to Reliance Jio.
Design and Display: Intex Aqua Raze is a decent looking device with handy form factor, however considering the price segment do not expect anything fancy but a plasticky build. And thanks to the 4.5 inch display, the phone feels quite handy and can be used easily with single hand. The 4.5 inch display has got a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 218PPI and we do not have any sort of protection over the display.
Hardware and Features: Coming to what sits underneath the Intex Aqua Raze, is a MediaTek MT6735M Quad Core chipset clocked at 1GHz and paired with is 1GB of RAM. And on the software end, the device runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box and no future software update is expected. Besides, the phone does not have any exceptional feature worth mentioning.
Camera and Storage: On the back of the device we have a 5MP camera along with an LED Flash whereas on the front we have a very basic 2MP camera. On the storage front, Intex Aqua Raze comes with 8GB of onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 128GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: To power the device, there is a 1800mAh battery which might not last you through the day. Besides, the phone accepts Dual Micro SIMs and supports 4G LTE Indian bands with VoLTE out of the box. You also get the standard Bluetooth and WiFi with Intex Aqua Raze.

Introduction:: TCL Fit is a dual SIM device that was launched in May 2016. Decent camera and impressive look are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

TCL Fit comes with 5.5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive IPS display, multi-touch facility, 16M colors, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 267PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 151 x 73 x 9 mm and its weight is 172 grams. It is available in Black and White colours.
Hardware and Features:
This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System, Mali T720 graphics and 2GB RAM.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2800mAh Li-ion battery that provides a talk time of up to 28 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards. 4G provides downloading speed of 150 mbps and uploading speed of 50 mbps.
Competition:

TCL Fit faces competition from Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus, Micromax Canvas Mega 4G and Coolpad Note 5. Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus has a better rear camera and smaller screen than TCL Fit. Micromax Canvas Mega 4G has a lower rear camera and more RAM than TCL Fit. Coolpad Note 5 has more RAM and more internal storage than TCL Fit.
Camera and Storage:: TCL Fit is loaded with 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus, LED flash, geotagging. Users can record HD videos at 1080p at 30 frames per second. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.

TCL Fit is loaded with 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus, LED flash, geotagging. Users can record HD videos at 1080p at 30 frames per second. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.

Overview: Karbonn A11 is a recent launch from Karbonn brand A series and thus replacing Karbonn A10. The smartphone supports 2G and 3G network. It supports dual SIM. The smartphone offers a touch screen of size 4.0 inches with TFT capacitive touchscreen, 256K colors. The phone sports a 5 MP camera, autofocus and an LED flash. Camera features include geo-tagging, and face detection. This phone also offers a secondary front-facing camera of 1.3 MP wherein the camera is upgraded as compared to its predecessor  Karbonn A10. The phone runs on an Android OS v4.0.4 (Ice Cream Sandwich) with the processor speed of 1 GHz. Internal memory of the phone is 4 GB with 512MB RAM. The memory can be expanded up to 32 GB using microSD card. The phone has a non-removable 1500mAh standard Li-ion battery which provides up to 5 hours of talk time and 200 hours in standby mode. The sensors used in the smartphone are proximity sensor and accelerometer sensor.

Introduction:: iBall Andi 5Q Gold 4G is a dual SIM device that was launched in July 2016. Premium look, support to 9 Indian Regional system language and reading, iBall OTA for Online Software Update and writing support for 21 Indian regional languages are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

iBall Andi 5Q Gold 4G comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of mm and its weight is grams. It is available in Gold colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735M processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System, Mali T720 graphics and 1GB RAM. It has FM Radio with FM recording, HPS with A-GPS, auto call recording and HD video recording facility along with video playback. It has a light sensor, proximity sensor, gravity sensor and accelerometer.
Camera and Storage:

iBall Andi 5Q Gold 4G is loaded with an 8MP rear camera having 3264 x 2448 pixels image resolution and CMOS sensor and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus and dual LED flash. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a non-removable 3000mAh Li-ion battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards. It provides downloading speed of 150Mbps and uploading speed of 50 mbps on 4G networks.
Competition:
iBall Andi 5Q Gold 4G faces competition from Karbonn Quattro L50 HD. Karbonn Quattro L50 HD has better rear camera but lower battery capacity than iBall Andi 5Q Gold 4G.

Overview: Lava Iris 405 is an Android smartphone with a 4-inch (800x480 pixels) screen. It is powered by a 1GHz Dual-core processor and is coupled with 512MB RAM. The hardware is just bearable considering the price it demands. It comes with a 5 Megapixel camera with flash. Interestingly, there is a secondary camera as well for video calling and self-photography. The device is capable of recording HD videos at 720p. The 4GB internal storage can be expanded upto 32GB. 3G Connectivity and Dual-SIM are offered along with Bluetooth and WiFi. Other similar models are Lava Iris 405+ and Xolo A500s.
Karbonn has launched a new device in the sub 5000 segment. The Karbonn K9 Viraat is a very basic device to serve just about basic purposes with some interesting features.
Design and Display: The design is good in terms of looks but the build is plasticky as expected, it does not feel anything more. On the front of the phone sits a 5.5 inch display that has a resolution of 1280x720 (HD) pixels giving it a pixel density of 267PPI and does not sound that sharp to look at. And unfortunately, there is't any sort of protection over the display.
Performance and Features: Karbonn K9 Viraat gets a MediaTek MT6580 Quad Core processor and is clocked at 1.3GHz. You also get 1GB of RAM combined along. The only plus about this phone can be that it runs on the latest Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box, however you should not expect any updates from Karbonn for the device. Apart from this there isn't any other special feature worth mentioning.
Camera and Storage: On the back of the device you get a 5MP sensor that can record videos up to 720p and for low light conditions you get an LED Flash. On the front there is 2MP camera for video calling or not that great selfies but you do get an LED Flash on the front as well. To store all the data, Karbonn K9 Viraat comes with 8GB of internal storage and you also get expansion option up to 64GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: To power the Karbonn K9 Viraat, there is surprisingly big 2800mAh removable battery and in terms of connectivity you get Dual SIM device but unfortunately lacks 4G LTE and VoLTE connectivity. Apart from that you get standard Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity.

Overview: To add to its budget smartphone portfolio, Karbonn launched a new smartphone in May 2017 dubbed as the Aura Power 4G. The phone ships in two colour variants viz Champagne and Grey.
Lava in an effort to expand its affordable A-series lineup launched, another smartphone in May 2017 called as the Karbonn A77. The phone ships in three colour variants viz.  Blue, Gold, and Grey.

Micromax A87 Ninja is a classy smartphone which sports a 4 inches TFT display that offers a WVGA resolution of 800 by 480 pixels. It is dual-SIM phone powered by a 1GHz Qualcomm Scorpion processor that adds to the efficiency of its swift controls. It runs on Android OS v2.3 Gingerbread. A87 Ninja has a 256MB RAM and an internal memory that can be expanded to 32GB using Micro SD cards. For connectivity, Ninja gives faster access to internet through EDGE, GPRS and 3G networks. Wi-fi and GPS-support along with Bluetooth v2.1 enhances data storage and transmission.

Micromax A87 Ninja offers a 2MP camera with features like fixed focus, night mode and mutli-shot mode, all with 4x digital zoom. It gives an image resolution of 1600 by 1200 pixels. Ninja runs on a standard Li-ion battery of 1400 mAh that gives up to 5 hours of talk time and up to 175 hours in stand-by mode. Apart from these, this handset provides other additional features like FM radio, Music player that supports MP3 format, Gravity sensor, document viewer, Organizer, voice memo and interesting applications like Weather update, Mi Zone, Mi Store, Hookup etc. This model is available in black colour.
Gionee has launched a new device priced around Rs.6000, the Gionee P5W is launched and available in 5 colors viz; Black, Blue, Red, White and Yellow.
Design and Display: As expected from any device in this budget, the Gionee P5W gets a Plastic body which looks like the iPhone 5C with all the color options available. On the front sits a 5 inch HD (1280x720pixels) display which sounds sharp enough for a 5 inch display and gives the display a total pixel density of 294PPI.
Specifications and Software: On the inside is a MediaTek MT6735 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and combined with it is just 1GB of RAM. The processor sounds decent for performing very basic tasks but the 1GB RAM is a major draw back since at least 2GB of RAM is needed to have a good multitasking experience. On the software front Gionee P5W's operating system is based on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box with no details on future updates whatsoever.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of the device you get a 5MP sensor that can record videos up to 720p, whereas on the front is just 2MP camera. The rear camera also gets an LED Flash to take shots and record videos at night. Coming to storage, you get 16GB of internal storage which can be further expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: Powering the device is a 2000mAh user replaceable battery which sounds quite low which makes us doubt if it will last through a whole working day. The Phone accepts Dual Micro SIMs but lacks 4G LTE connectivity.

Overview: The Lava XOLO A500 is an inexpensive Android phone selling under the Rs. 7000 mark. It bears interesting specs for a phone in this price range  first and foremost a dual-core processor clocked at 1GHz. There's 512MB RAM and 4GB of internal storage (out of which we suppose at least half must be available to the user). The second interesting spec is the 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel display. The phone also supports 3G (HSDPA) with speeds up to 7.2 Mbps. Other than 3G, there's WiFi connectivity too. Then, there's a 5 megapixel autofocus camera and a front-facing VGA camera too with an LED flash. Running atop this hardware is Android 4.0 ICS (Ice Cream Sandwich). Powering this phone is a 1500 mAh battery. Finally, like every other Android phone made by Indian manufacturers these days, the Lava XOLO A500 is a dual SIM phone.

The name Superfone Punk itself suggests how it could be of optimum use to the youth as well as the professionals. Micromax that has its roots based in India released Punk A45 in August 2012 which sports a 3.5 inches TFT capacitive touchscreen with a standard HVGA screen resolution of 480 by 320 pixels. This Dual-SIM phone is powered by 650 MHz processor running on Android OS v2.3 Gingerbread. Under the hood, this handset provides a 512MB ROM, but the internal memory can be expanded to 32GB using MicroSD cards. Punk A45 supports connectivity to internet only via 2G network over GSM 900/1800 frequencies. Being Wi-Fi enabled, users can use internet with the help of nearby routers.

Bluetooth v2.0 enables the phone to transfer files to other devices. Superfone Punk A45 offers a 2MP camera with an image resolution of 1600 by 1200 pixels. This camera also allows decent video recording. This phone runs on a standard Li-ion battery 1300mAh. This gives the users up to 4 hours of talk time and up to 167 hours in stand-by mode. Other key characteristics of this phone include FM radio, sensors like accelerometer, instant messaging, email, photo viewer, organizer and predictive text input. This phone is only available in white colour.

Introduction:: Celkon Millennia Xplore Q58 is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2015. Slim body, very good camera and decent configuration are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Celkon Millennia Xplore Q58 comes with 5 inch HD IPS LCD touch screen capacitive display, multi touch facility, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 145.7 x 73.8 x 7.8 mm and its weight is 160 grams. It is available in White colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz Quad-core processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and 1GB RAM. It comes with GPS and FM radio. Accelerometer, light sensor and proximity sensor are in-built. MP3 music player and MP4 video player are available.
Camera and Storage:

Celkon Millennia Xplore Q58 is loaded with 13MP rear camera having 4128 x 3096 pixels image resolution. It has 8MP front camera. Other camera features include LED flash, voice capture, motion track, continuous capture 40 shots and auto focus. It provides the users the facility of video recording at 1280x720 @ 30 fps. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2000mAh Li-ion removable battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards.
Competition:

Celkon Millennia Xplore Q58 faces competition from Celkon Diamond 4G Plus and LG Max. Celkon Diamond 4G Plus has a faster processor, higher battery capacity but lower rear and front camera than Celkon Millennia Xplore Q58. LG Max has higher battery capacity but lower rear and front camera than Celkon Millennia Xplore Q58.

Overview: The Micromax A58 Bolt is a part of the Bolt series; which is the Indian companys branding for entry level phones. It has a 3.5 inch (480x320 pixels) touch-screen display. The screen has a low resolution and a low pixel density, which means that the display is not sharp and crisp enough to please the eye. But, it is acceptable for a phone of this price range. The smartphone is powered by a 1GHz Dual-core processor alongside 512MB RAM. The hardware is satisfactory. There is an internal memory of 512MB of which 90MB is available to the user. Although thats not going to be enough to run more than a couple of apps, at least there is a microSD card slot for memory expansion up to 32GB.

There is 2 Megapixel rear camera. Unfortunately, there is no flash or a secondary camera but we cant expect to have one from a phone of this price range. The USP of this device is that it offers 3G Connectivity along with Dual-SIM support. Bluetooth and WiFi are also available. It runs on Android v4.2 Jelly Bean and comes in black and red colours. The Lava 3G 356 is a similar smartphone.

The Iball Andi5-M8 is an inexpensive entry-level Android smartphone with bang-for-the-buck specifications. The smartphone has a 5-inch 854 x 480 pixel display with a pixel density of 196PPI (the display of this phone is decent). The Android phone is powered by a Dual-core 1.3GHz processor, 512MB of RAM and 4GB internal memory, out of which a little over 2GB is available to the user. There's a microSD card slot to append more memory (the RAM is meagre and the phone might not perform well in case of heavy multi-tasking).

In the camera department, the Andi5-M8 is a leg-up from the Andi5-E7, that has a 5MP cam and no front-facing one, as the Andi5-M8 has a higher 8 megapixel sensor with an LED flash at the back, and a VGA camera up-front for video-calling. The phone lacks HD video recording. This device is powered by 1850mAh battery. Speaking of the connectivity features, other than 3G, you've got the typical WiFi and Bluetooth as well.

The Nokia Asha 501 is the evolution of the Series 40 based touchscreen phones made by the Finnish phone maker. The interface is completely re-designed; keeping touchscreens in mind and optimised for a smaller screen size. The phone has a 3-inch QVGA capacitive display and comes in bright coloured shells that are interchangeable. It has a lockscreen that permanently stays on, showing the time and notifications. The Asha 501 has a petite form factor. It is a dual-SIM phone and both the SIMs are hot-swappable. There is 128MB of internal memory and a microSD card slot for expansion (Nokia is bundling a 4GB card along with the package).

Being an inexpensive handset, Nokia has chosen not to include 3G, just 2G and WiFi support for Internet. But server-side compression while web-browsing makes the experience better. There's a 3.2MP camera at the back but does not have an LED flash. Basics like FM Radio and Bluetooth are covered. The Asha Software Platform 1.0 that powers this phone has an interesting User Interface element called 'FastLane'. This shows you the last 50 actions that you have performed with the phone. Sensors like an accelerometer and a proximity sensor, that are usually found in smartphones, are put in the Asha 501. The phone comes built-in with many popular apps like Facebook, Twitter, Foursquare, an email client etc. and also 40 games. More can be downloaded from the Nokia Store. The battery life is also deemed to be good  it has a whopping 40+ day standby life.

The Galaxy S Advance i9070 was a mid-range handset by Samsung, but received a price cut after the introduction of the Galaxy Grand, bringing it into the upper entry-level segment. This phone is quite comfortable to hold because of its petite sizing, and sports a 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel Super AMOLED display, much like the first Galaxy S i9000. It is powered by a ARM Cortex A9 based dual-core chip grunting at 1GHz. Couple that with the 768MB of RAM, it is just about powerful to run the updated Android 4.1 Jelly Bean. Internal storage comes in either 8GB or 16GB sizes, with a microSD card slot for further expansion. The 5 megapixel autofocus camera at the back can record 720p HD videos at a smooth 30 fps frame-rate. Plus, there's a 1.3MP front-facing camera as well. Powering the handset is a 1500 mAh battery, which considering the specs shouldn't prove too insufficient.

The Xiaomi 1S is the most basic offering from Xiaomi but the phone isn't that basic when it comes to specifications. The Chinese manufacturer believes in selling their devices at cost and that gives them a huge edge wherever they have launched in the world.

The Xiaomi 1S has a 4.7 inch display which has a 1280x720 pixel HD resolution which takes the pixel density to 312PPI, which is probably the sharpest at the price point. If that wasn't enough, it is also an IPS panel; which should deliver better viewing angles. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 2 and should provide good protection from scratches. The processor is a Snapdragon 400 Quad-core chip clocked at 1.6GHz. It has 1GB of RAM onboard and must be adequate for apps nowadays. The device comes with 8GB of storage which can be expanded to 64GB via a microSD card slot. The device has an 8 megapixel snapper with flash and a 1.3 megapixel front facing camera. The device runs the MIUI interface on top of Android 4.3 Jelly Bean out of the box. It has a changeable 2000mAh Li-Po battery. Last but not the least, its a Dual SIM phone, unlike Xiaomis high-end Mi3 model. Bottom line  the phone offers better specs than the Moto G at the price of the Moto E.

The Nokia E5 has been around for quite some time now. Launched back in 2010, the phone made for a decently priced Symbian powered smartphone - complete with a QWERTY keypad and a decent QVGA screen. Fast forward to 2012, the E5 still manages to attract a fair number of consumers. The E5 is available in a variety of colors and comes with just 250 MB of internal memory. You can however add microSD cards and expand the capacity. The 5 megapixel camera at the rear can prove to be a handy camera for urgent photography. It can also act as a camcorder - if you do not mind the OKish video quality.

The Moto C is the first smartphone by Motorola in the C-series. The phone lies in the low-budget price range and comes with decent features and specifications. Let's take a look at what the phone has to offer its users.

Pros: Features a dedicated SD card slot
It is a compact device and is easy to handle
The MediaTek processor that powers this phone isn't capable for heavy gaming
Cons: It has a heavy user interface and 1GB of RAM isn't sufficient for smooth multitasking
Android Lollipop that this phone ships with is outdated
Inbuilt storage of just 8GB is lower than devices in this price range

Overview: Rex 90 is on the higher end of the spectrum when it comes to the Rex series launched by Samsung. Like all the other phones in the series, it also has the Smart Dual SIM with True Hot Swap feature. It also has a slightly bigger screen  3.5 inches with 240 x 320 pixels resolution. The feature phone has a 3.2 Megapixels camera unit capable of 3GP & MPEG-4 video recording. The connectivity options include Bluetooth, GPRS, Wi-Fi and microUSB 2.0. The internal memory of 10 MB can be expanded up to 32 GB allowing you to store all your music, pictures and videos.
The 1000 mAh battery gives a talk time promises a talk time of up to 15 hours. Rex 90 is available in White and Gold Brown color.

Introduction:: Intex Cloud 4G Smart is a dual SIM device that was launched in January 2016. Back panel with painting finish and decent configuration are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Intex Cloud 4G Smart comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive FWFGA display, 2 finger touch facility, 16.7M colors, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 196PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 144.4 x 73.2 x 9.75 mm and its weight is 156 grams. It is available in White and Black colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.5GHz octa-core Spreadtrum SC9830 processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System, Mali 400 graphics and 1GB RAM. Pre-installed apps are FOTA, Intex Service, Opera Mini, OLX, Istore, Clean Master, Newshunt, Chaatz, Magic Store, Freecharge, Saavn. Many games like Asphalt Nitro, Bubble Bash 3, Danger Dash, and Spiderman are pre-loaded.
Camera and Storage:

Intex Cloud 4G Smart is loaded with 5MP rear camera and 2MP front camera. Other camera features include LED flash and auto focus, slow motion video for 3 seconds, HDR, gridlines, color effects, capture image with volume up and down key. Users can record HD videos at 720p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2000mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 6 hours on 2G and up to 4 hours on 3G and a standby time of nearly 150 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 1 normal SIM card and 1 micro SIM card.
Competition:
Intex Cloud 4G Smart faces competition from Lenovo Vibe K5 Note. Lenovo Vibe K5 Note has a higher battery capacity and better rear camera than Intex Cloud 4G Smart.

Overview: Karbonn started selling mobiles and tablets running on Android from 2009. They claimed to have sold more than 10 million units all over India. Karbonn is one the many other brands who offer value for money products. The key features of this device are 
Has a 4 inch display with the resolution of 800x480 pixels with a decent 233 PPI pixel density
Comes with 512MB RAM and runs on a 1.3GHz, Quad-Core processor
Dual SIM phone
Comes with 4GB of internal storage which is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 5MP, VGA camera in the front
Powered by a 1400mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Spice Dream Uno
Micromax Canvas A1

Introduction:: Aqua Strong 5.1 is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. Elegant look, emergency rescue, turbo download features and VoLTE support are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Aqua Strong 5.1 comes with 5 inch LCD TN touchscreen FWVGA display with Corning Gorilla Glass 2 screen protector, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 196PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 141.2 x 72.3 x 9.47 mm and its weight is 150 grams. It is available in Champagne, White and Blue colours.
Camera and Storage:

This dual SIM device comes with 5MP rear camera having 2592 x 1944 pixels resolution and 2MP front camera with autofocus and dual LED flash. Other camera features include voice capture, smile detection, face beauty and panorama. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

Aqua Strong 5.1 is loaded with a 2800mAh non-removable Li-ion battery that provides a talk time from 16 hours to 22 hours and standby time of up to 466 hours. Connectivity options include 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio).
Competition:

Aqua Strong 5.1 faces competition from Xolo Era 4G and Karbonn Aura Power 4G. Xolo Era 4G has faster processor, higher pixel density but lower battery capacity than Aqua Strong 5.1. Karbonn Aura Power 4G has higher battery capacity and better rear and front camera than Aqua Strong 5.1.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, 1GB RAM, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System and ARM Mali-T720 MP1 graphics. Various apps like Matrabhasha, Online Software Update, Clean Master, Opera Mini, Opera Max and Saavn are pre-installed. It has GPS and FM radio.

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, 1GB RAM, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System and ARM Mali-T720 MP1 graphics. Various apps like Matrabhasha, Online Software Update, Clean Master, Opera Mini, Opera Max and Saavn are pre-installed. It has GPS and FM radio.

Overview: Karbonn Titanium Visa 4G is the company's one of the latest 4G LTE-enabled smartphone, so that users can leverage super-fast 4G LTE network and speed. On the front, it comes with a 5-inch (12.7 cm) Full HD display featuring 1920 x 1080 pixels resolution and 441 PPI pixel density.

Karbonn started selling mobiles and tablets running on Android from 2009. They claimed to have sold more than 10 million units all over India. Karbonn is one the many other brands who offer value for money products. The key features of this device are 
Has a 3.5 inch display with the resolution of 480x320 pixels with below average 165 PPI pixel density
Comes with 256MB RAM and runs on a 1Ghz processor
Dual SIM phone
Comes with 512MB of internal storage which is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 3MP, no front facing camera
Powered by a 1420mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Spice Smart Flo Mettle 3.5X

Introduction:: Whitecherry MI Bolt is a dual SIM device that was launched in October 2016. Faster multitasking and rapid processing are its major highlights.
Display and Design:
Whitecherry MI Bolt comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 960 x 540 pixels screen resolution and 260PPI pixel density.
Hardware and Features:
This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System and 1GB RAM. Light sensor, compass, accelerometer and proximity sensor are available.
Camera and Storage:

Whitecherry MI Bolt is loaded with a 5MP rear camera. There is no front camera. Other camera features include LED flash, digital zoom, touch to focus. It has an internal storage of 8GB. There is no card slot for expanding the internal storage.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2850mAh Li-ion battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards.
Competition:: Whitecherry MI Bolt faces competition from Samsung Z2 Tizen, LYF Flame 8 and Xolo Era 4G. Samsung Z2 Tizen has a smaller screen, lower battery capacity and lower pixel density than Whitecherry MI Bolt. LYF Flame 8 has lower battery capacity, smaller screen and better rear and front camera than Whitecherry MI Bolt. Xolo Era 4G has lower battery capacity, better front camera, lower pixel density than Whitecherry MI Bolt. Xolo Era 4G comes with a Dragontrail glass screen protection which is not present in Whitecherry MI Bolt.

Whitecherry MI Bolt faces competition from Samsung Z2 Tizen, LYF Flame 8 and Xolo Era 4G. Samsung Z2 Tizen has a smaller screen, lower battery capacity and lower pixel density than Whitecherry MI Bolt. LYF Flame 8 has lower battery capacity, smaller screen and better rear and front camera than Whitecherry MI Bolt. Xolo Era 4G has lower battery capacity, better front camera, lower pixel density than Whitecherry MI Bolt. Xolo Era 4G comes with a Dragontrail glass screen protection which is not present in Whitecherry MI Bolt.

Overview: The biggest smartphone manufacturer in India, Micromax has again launched a budget friendly device under Rs. 10,000 category. The Canvas Nitro 3 E352 has a 5 inch display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels and has pixel density of 294PPI. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass 3.

The phone runs on a MediaTek MT6592M Octa Core chipset which is clocked at 1.4GHz and having 2GB of RAM is a plus for smoother multitasking. On the back the device sports a 13MP camera sensor with a LED flash. The sensor is capable of recording videos up at 1080p. On the front there is a 5MP shooter for selfies.

The phone is powered by a 2500mAh battery and is Dual SIM device. Nitro 3 has 16GB internal storage & expandable storage up to 32GB via a MicroSD card. It runs on Android Lollipop (5.1) out of the box & is available in Black color only.
Alternatives: For more options check out the best phones under Rs. 10,000

Intro:: A2020 was launched by Lenovo in India in May 2016 as an upgrade of A2010. It is considered as the most affordable mobile phone in India, with a distinguishable high level of internal storage capacity for the range and some additional features like 5-inch FWVGA display and a Mali T720 GPU paired quad-core 64-bit processor.
Display and Design:: The phone has a 5-inch touchscreen display with resolution at 480 x 854 pixels having a pixel density of 294PPI. The screen is IPS capacitive touchscreen, 16M colors. Phone is available in Gold and Rose Gold only. Size dimensions are 143.5 x 71.8 x 9 mm and it weighs around 166 grams.
Hardware & Features:: The phone is powered by quad-core 1.1GHz processor and comes with 1GB RAM. The phone runs on Android 5.1 version (Lollipop) and has an expandable internal storage of 8GB. The phone has certain noticeable features like proximity sensor, ambient light sensor, accelerometer, gyroscope, geo-tagging, touch focus and face detection.
Camera & Storage:: The phone offers a rear camera of 5MP with LED flash and front camera of 2MP. It has a 1GB RAM and a storage of 16GB and can be expanded up to 32GB through microSD card.
Battery & Connectivity:: The phone has a removable Li-Ion 2300 mAh battery. It is a single SIM (GSM) smartphone that accepts a micro-SIM. Internet connectivity is possible with Wi-Fi 02.11 b/g/n, GPS /A-GPS, Bluetooth 4.0, and 4G LTE.
Overview: The phone faces significant competition from cellphones likeCoolpad Note 3 Lite andMeizu m2. These bring high-end features like fingerprint scanner and more storage expandability of up to 128GB via microSD as compared to Lenovo A2020 respectively.
FAQs: 1. Does this phone support Reliance Jio network?
Ans: This phone does support 4G LTE but lacks VoLTE to make calls from Jio network. However, you may use the Jio 4G Voice app to make calls.
2. What type of charging connector do I need?

Overview: Lava is one of the top 5 Indian smartphone manufacturer that competes with other brands like Micromax, Intex & Karbonn. The company also owns Xolo which has been recently doing well in the market with their budget oriented devices that offers good value for money. Lava X81 is a phone that has an extremely well build body with Metal Unibody construction.
Design and Display: On the front sits a 5 inch HD (1280x720) display giving the display a pixel density of 294PPI which does sound sharp enough. Unfortunately, there is no Gorilla Glass protection on the display. In terms of design, the phone looks well built and has an unibody construction. The looks of the device somewhat resembles the iPhone 6 without the antenna bands but definitely a good looking device.
Hardware and Features: You get a MediaTek MT6735 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz and there is 3GB of RAM which should be great for average usage with basic apps and should provide a great multitasking experience. On the software front, Lava X81 comes with the latest Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box.
Camera and Storage: On the rear of Lava X81 lies a 13MP camera that can record videos up to 1080p whereas on the front sits a 5MP shooter for those selfie moments. The rear camera also gets a Dual LED Flash for taking videos and pictures in dark plus you also get an LED Flash on the front which is a huge bonus for all selfie lovers. To store all those selfies and other data there is 16GB of onboard storage with expandability option up to 32GB more via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: Powering the device is a 2700mAh non removable battery that should easily last you through the day. On the connectivity front, Lava X81 supports Dual SIMs and also supports 4G LTE networks in India.

Introduction:: Karbonn Titanium Mach Six is a dual SIM device that was launched in April 2016. Compactive touch, vibrator mode and voice assisted navigation, VR glass facility are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Karbonn Titanium Mach Six comes with 6 inch LCD touch screen fully laminated HD IPS capacitive display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 245PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 160.6 x 87.7 x 8.6 mm and its weight is 163 grams. It is available in Gray and Champagne colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System, and 2GB RAM. It has GPS and FM radio. It has a light sensor, proximity sensor, and gyroscope and gravity sensor.
Camera and Storage:

Karbonn Titanium Mach Six is loaded with 8MP rear camera and 3.2MP front camera. Other camera features include LED flash and autofocus. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a 3300mAh removable Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 6 hours and standby time of up to 180 hours. It takes 4 hours to be charged completely. Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, 2G, WiFi, and Bluetooth. It takes in 2 normal SIM cards.
Competition:

Karbonn Titanium Mach Six faces competition from Meizu M3S and Xiaomi Redmi 3S. Meizu M3S 2GB has a lower battery capacity, smaller screen and better rear camera than Karbonn Titanium Mach Six. Xiaomi Redmi 3S has a smaller screen, higher battery capacity and higher rear camera than Karbonn Titanium Mach Six.

Overview: 3.97 inch screen with a resolution of 800 x 480 pixels, decent 233PPI pixel density
1GHz Dual Core MediaTek processor with 512MB of RAM
4GB of Internal Storage out of which 1GB is for Apps and 1.3GB is for user data
MicroSD card slot with support upto 32GB
2 megapixel fixed focus rear camera with flash, front 0.3 megapixel camera
480p video recording
Removable 1700mAh battery
Android 4.4.2 Kitkat
Front facing Stereo Speakers
Physical Music control buttons below the screen
5 Color option-- Electric Grey,Raging Red,Pristine White,Sunshine Yellow & Cyan Blue

Hardware Specifications and Features:: Panasonic Eluga Note sports the same MediaTek MT6753 Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz combined with 3GB of RAM. The processor might struggle with heavy tasks but the ample 3GB of RAM should be sufficient enough to handle multitasking well. The device has no major feature, not even a fingerprint sensor.
Software and Design:: The operating system of the device is based on Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with Panasonic's FitHome UI running on top of it and there as been no info if ever it will receive Android Nougat update. Panasonic Eluga Note has plastic build material but the quality looks quite solid.
Camera and Storage:: On the rear lies a 16MP sensor that can record videos up to 1080p, whereas on the front is a 5MP camera for video calling and selfies. There is also a Triple LED Flash on the rear of the device that provides ample light while taking low light shots. To store all the data you get 32GB of internal storage which can be expanded up 32GB more via a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: Powering the device is a decent 3000mAh non-removable battery that should easily last through the day. The phone accepts Dual SIMs and supports 4G LTE connectivity with VoLTE.
Overview: Ans: No, the Panasonic Eluga Note does not have a hybrid SIM slot.

Introduction:: Intex Aqua Strong 5.2 is a dual SIM device that was launched in October 2016. Emergency Rescue, Miracast and Miravision are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Intex Aqua Strong 5.2 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 2 finger touch facility, Corning Gorilla glass 2 screen protector, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 196PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 141.20 x 72.30 x 9.47 mm and its weight is 150 grams. It is available in White, Champagne and Blue colours. It has 67.47% of body to screen ratio.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System, Mali-T720 MP1 graphics and 2GB RAM. It has accelerometer. GPS and FM radio are available. Sony Liv, Matrabhasha apps are pre-installed.
Camera and Storage:

Intex Aqua Strong 5.2 is loaded with 5MP rear camera and 2MP front camera. Other camera features include dual LED flash, voice capture, smile detection, face beauty, panorama and auto focus. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of GB that can be expanded up to GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a non-removable 2800mAh Li-ion battery that provides a talk time of up to 22 hours on 2G and up to 16 hours on 3G and 4G networks and standby time of up to 466 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Intex Aqua Strong 5.2 faces competition from Swipe Konnect Plus. Swipe Konnect Plus has a higher rear camera, faster processor and higher battery capacity than Intex Aqua Strong 5.2.

Overview: Adding to the range of smart phones, Sony has come out with its new Xperia Tipo. It has a 3.2 inches TFT Capacitive screen displaying 256K colours and runs on Android OS 4.0 Ice-Cream Sandwich. The display has a scratch-resistant glass. This phone is powered by Cortex A5 processor with 800 MHz Qualcomm Snapdragon chipset. Xperia Tipo has 2.9 GB internal storage (2.5GB available for usage) which is expandable upto 32GB using Micro SD cards. The other features include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth v2.1, 3G (HSDPA network), stereo Radio with RDS, xLoud the audio filter technology and sensors like accelerometer, proximity etc.

Sony Xperia Tipo provides users with a 3.15 MP camera which gives an output of 2048*1536 pixels. The camera features Geo-tagging. Tipo works on a standard Li-ion battery 1500 mAh which sports upto 6 hours in talk-time, upto 360 hours in stand-by mode and music listening time upto 36 hours. Xperia Tipo is available in Serene Black and Classic Silver.

Established in 2009, Lava is one of the fast growing mobile handset companies in India. The phone is packed with a lot of features for its price. How well those features function; we are yet to try out. The phone runs on Android 4.2 JellyBean. It runs on a 1.2GHz dual-core processor. The screen size is of 4 inches. 512MB internal memory is expandable to 32GB. The primary 3MP has Panorama, Geo-tagging, Smile Detection and Fixed Focus while the secondary camera is VGA. The phone is 3G compatible and has a 1500mAh removable lithium-ion battery. At 5K, its definitely value-for-money. Another phone to look at in this price range might be the Samsung Galaxy Star.

The Karbonn A2 is an inexpensive Android phone priced under Rs. 5,000. It runs on a single-core 1GHz processor and 256MB RAM. The screen is a 4-inch capacitive one with an 800 x 480 pixel resolution. Internal memory sounds very low at just 200MB, but for storage of media there's at least a microSD card slot, that can take it all the way up to 32GB. Although there's no 3G on this phone, you can get high-speed internet access over WiFi. There's a 3 megapixel camera at the back and apparently even a front-facing one. The 1750mAh battery providing juice to this kind of configuration should hopefully make the phone last longer than other cheap Android phones. There's FM Radio on the A2 as well.

Nokia Asha 308 is not a smartphone. It is a small handy device featuring a display of 3 inches bearing a screen resolution of 400x240 pixels, which boils down to a low pixel density of 156PPI. There is a microSD card slot which supports memory cards of storage upto 32GB. There is an ordinary 2 megapixel rear camera without flash. Although it is a Dual-SIM phone, it lacks 3G Connectivity. It is equipped with Bluetooth and WiFi. Consider Asha 502, which is a phone running on the newer Asha Software platform.

Introduction:: Lava A76 Plus is a dual SIM device that was launched in November 2016. Video PIP, Smart gestures, Smart music, front flash and decent configuration are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Lava A76 Plus comes with 4.5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive FWVGA TFT display, 16M colors, 800 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 207.32ppi pixel density. It has a dimension of 134 x 66 x 9.3 mm and its weight is 135 grams. It is available in White and Black colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.5GHz Quad-core processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System, and 1GB RAM. It has accelerometer. MP3, 3GP, WAV, MIDI, AMR-NB music player formats are available. Photo editor and document viewer are available.
Camera and Storage:

Lava A76 Plus is loaded with a 5MP rear camera having 2592 x 1944 pixels image resolution and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus, digital zoom, dual LED flash, panorama, HDR, photo timer, grid, and geotagging. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is equipped with an 1850mAh Li-ion battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Lava A76 Plus faces competition from InFocus Bingo 21 and Xolo Era 1X. InFocus Bingo 21 has a higher battery capacity, higher pixel density, poor front camera and a bigger screen than Lava A76 Plus. Xolo Era 1X has a higher battery capacity, more RAM, higher pixel density, better rear camera and a bigger screen than Lava A76 Plus

Overview: Accompanying the HTC 8X, the 8S joins the Windows Phone war. The notable aspect of the HTC 8S is the fact that it runs on the latest Microsoft Windows Phone 8 OS. Its 4 inches display is coated with a Corning Gorilla Glass for protection. The S-LCD capacitive touch screen gives a resolution of 480*800 pixels. It is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon S4 chipset and has a dual-core processor of 1GHz. 8S has an internal storage of 4GB which can be expanded to 32GB using Micro SD cards. 8S enhances connectivity with features like 2G/3G, Bluetooth v3.1, Wi-Fi and internal GPS antenna with GLONASS. Windows Phone 8S offers a 5MP camera with auto focus and LED Flash. This entails features like geo-tagging, touch focus, face detection and video-recording of 720p at 30 fps. 8S uses a standard embedded Li-Ion polymer battery of 1700 mAh. It also provides 7GB free SkyDrive storage and has sensors like accelerometer, proximity, ambient light etc. Music listening experience gets even better with HTCs in built Beats Audio. 8S will be available in colours like Domino, Fiesta Red, Atlantic Blue and High-rise Grey.

Introduction:: Phicomm E670 Energy 2 is a dual SIM device that was launched in February 2016. Keypad having baby skin touch feeling, anti-dazzle and high transparency by full lamination are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Phicomm E670 Energy 2 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, 16.7 mm colors, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 144 x 70 x 8 mm. It is available in White and Black colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.1GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 210 processor, Adreno 304 graphics, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and 2GB RAM. Gravity sensor, light sensor and proximity sensor are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Phicomm E670 Energy 2 is loaded with an 8MP rear camera having Backside Illumination Sensor, four-element lens, exposure control, silent mode, color effect, face detection mode, zoom 6X and geo tagging photos. It has a 2MP front camera. Other camera features include autofocus and LED flash. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a non-removable 2300mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 7 hours and standby time of up to 250 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Phicomm E670 Energy 2 faces competition from Swipe Konnect Plus and Karbonn Quattro L50 HD. Swipe Konnect Plus has higher battery capacity, higher pixel density and lesser expandable memory than Phicomm E670 Energy 2. Karbonn Quattro L50 HD has higher battery capacity and lesser expandable memory than Phicomm E670 Energy 2.

Overview: The Indian manufacturer Lava has launched the Lava A97 priced around Rs. 6,000 with some very average specs. The phone from Lava focuses majorly on VoLTE connectivity & have a portfolio to cover the most important spec in the country right now.
Design & Display: The Lava A97 comes with a plastic body with standard design & nothing exceptional to look up to. In terms of display, there is a 5-inch display with a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 196PPI.
Hardware & Features: This device comes with a Spreadtrum 1.3GHz Quad Core  processor combined with 1GB of RAM. In terms of software, it has got Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with no scope of any future updates. And besides these basic, there is nothing much to expect from a budget device.
Camera & Storage: On the rear & front of the Lava A97 comes a 5MP sensor for pictures, video calling & video recording. The rear 5MP comes with an LED Flash & can shoot videos up to 720p. You get 8GB of onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery & Connectivity: To power the phone, Lava A97 comes with a 2350mAh battery that might just last you through a day with average usage. And in terms of connectivity, this phone has got all the major network bands supported with 4G LTE with VoLTE in India.

Overview: The LG Optimus L9 P769 is a mid-range handset with a reasonably big 4.5-inch IPS display, bearing a qHD (960 x 540 pixel) resolution, and protected by Corning's Gorilla Glass 2. The phone runs on a dual-core 1GHz processor, has 1GB of RAM. Internal memory is listed at 4GB and there's a microSD slot to expand further. The 5MP autofocus shooter at the back can record videos in Full HD (1080p) plus there's a VGA (0.3MP) camera upfront for video calls. Connectivity is served via 3G and WiFi and the L9 can also play DivX and XviD format videos out of the box, much like LG's USB slot-enabled LCD TVs. The capacious 2150 mAh battery quotes a standby time of 672 hours, and given the reasonable spec-sheet, should last more than what we've come to expect from an average Android phone (which these days is not satisfactory at all).

The Micromax A51 Bolt is another handset from Micromax brand Bolt series of budget friendly smartphones. This Dual SIM (GSM + GSM) device offers 2G as well as 3G support. The device sports a 320 x 480 pixels, 3.5 inches, TFT touchscreen display. The phone runs on 832 MHz CPU with 512MB of internal memory (usable memory will be much less) and just 256 MB of RAM. The memory is further expandable up to 32GB using microSD cards. This phone also has WiFi with 802.11 b/g/n, Wi-Fi hotspot and Bluetooth version 3.0. The primary camera is a measly 2 MP sensor. There is a secondary VGA video calling camera as well. The phone runs Android v2.3.7 (Gingerbread) and it is unlikely to get an update to newer versions of Android. Other connectivity options include EDGE, GPRS, and micro USB. The Li-ion battery of 1500 mAh is used and offers up to 4 and a half hours of talk time and 140 hours of standby time.

Micromax A240 Canvas Doodle 2 is a smartphone that has a bunch of exciting features that makes the smartphone seem like a sweet deal. The smartphone as expected is DUAL SIM phone that offers 2G and 3G support. Its little heavy of 220gms due to its enormous screen size and its partially aluminium-built body. The speciality of this phone is the stylus that comes as part of the package along with some pre-installed apps that are meant to be used with a stylus. The smartphone offers 16GB (13GB user available) internal memory with 1GB RAM. It offers 3G speeds of up to a whopping 42 Mbps. Bluetooth 4.0 support is there as well.

In the camera department, the primary camera boosts 12 MP, autofocus, dual-LED flash with features like Geo-tagging, touch focus, image stabilization, face and smile detection and HDR and has a 5MP front facing camera. Videos can be recorded in HD quality with 1080p@30fps. It offers a display screen of 720 x 1280 pixels, 5.7 inches with IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen, 16M colors type. The phone works on Android OS, v4.2.1 (Jelly Bean), CPU Quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A7 with MTK 6589 chipset. Sensors like Accelerometer, proximity etc. are available. Li-Ion 2600 mAh battery claims great battery life up to 220 hours of stand by mode and up to 8 hours in talk time mode.

The Desire 300 spec-wise, is an upper entry-level handset from HTC. With the new model naming system, Desire 300 sits below theDesire 601 and Desire 500. Its modest specs start with a 4.3-inch 800 x 480 pixel TFT display and the Qualcomm S4 Play; that are entry-level chips designed for inexpensive Android phones. This handset has a dual-core 1GHz processor. There's 512MB RAM and 4GB of internal memory, with a microSD card slot for expansion. There's a 5 megapixel camera at the back, but disappointingly is not accompanied by an LED flash. Because of the entry-level chip, videos can be recorded in a non-HD WVGA (800 x 480 pixel) resolution, which is incidentally the same as the screen. Fortunately, a VGA front-facing camera sits up front for video-calling. The 1650 mAh battery given the low-end specs of the phone should be able to deliver a decent uptime.

In May 2017, Intex launched the Aqua Zenith, another addition to the company's budget-friendly smartphone portfolio. The smartphone made its appearance alongside another offering from the OEM dubbed as the Aqua A4.

The LG K10 (2017) was first unveiled at CES 2017 earlier this year and finally made its way through India. It is the successor of the LG K10(2016) launched last year. The device is ‘Made In India’ and it was launched by the Ravi Shankar Prasad (Telecom and IT minister).

It gets an all-metal unibody design with a thickness of just 7.4mm. The phone also sports a fingerprint scanner on the back panel located right beneath the primary camera. Talking about camera, the LG K10 (2017) features a 13-megapixel rear camera with LED flash. On the front, it flaunts a 5-megapixel selfie camera with a 120-degree wide-angle lens.

Talking about the specifications, the LG K10 (2017) sports a 5.3-inch HD IPS display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels and 2.5D curved glass on top. Under the hood, it is powered by an octa-core MediaTek MT6750 64-bit processor clocked at 1.5GHz. The phone gets 2GB RAM and 16GB of internal storage which is further expandable up to 2TB with a MicroSD card.

It is a dual SIM phone and gets 4G VoLTE support. The device packs in a 2800mAh and runs on Android 7.0 Nougat right out-of-the-box. It features all the standard connectivity options such as Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth 4.1, GPS, micro-USB with OTG, and a 3.5mm audio jack. The phone also gets India-specific SOS emergency calling feature which can be evoked by pressing the power button for three consecutive times.

The LG K10 (2017) comes in three colors – Black, Titanium and Gold and is priced at Rs. 13,990. The phone also comes with free smart cover and unlimited audio and video downloads with Hungama app for 45 days.

Pros: Dedicated Dual SIM & MicroSD card slots

Overview: With Nokia making a push in the low end of the market to recapture lost ground, the Asha series came in handy with several devices under Rs 5000. The Asha 200 is a Dual-SIM phone with full QWERTY keyboard, featuring a 2.4" QVGA (320 x 240 pixel resolution) display and a 2 megapixel camera (that takes crappy QCIF videos at 10fps, but at the price point, we can't really complain). It is clear that Nokia is targeting the local Indian manufacturers like Micromax, Maxx and Lava. There's a 1430 mAh battery powering this phone, and considering that the Asha 200 isn't a smartphone (it runs on Nokia's Series 40 interface), this should result into better battery life than most smartphones. There's a microSD card slot to upgrade its memory capacity up to a capacious 32GB.

Chinese phone maker Zopo Mobiles has expanded its Color lineup with a new phone, the Zopo Color F5. Earlier, Zopo launched the Color F1 in India which comes at Rs 8,999. In terms of the specifications, the Zopo Color F5 comes with a 5-inch HD IPS display with 2.5D curved glass and 293 PPI pixel density. The phone is powered by a 64-Bit Quad-Core MediaTek MT6737 clocked at 1.3GHz and 1GB RAM.zopo-color-f5

Introduction:: LYF Wind 3 is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. The phone comes with a matte finish and curved edges giving it a stylish look. It provides a good internal memory and most of the sensor features.
Display and Design:: This dual SIM device comes with 5.5 inch IPS LCD touchscreen display, 1280 x 720 pixels resolution and 233PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 152.6 x 76.6 x 9.4 mm and it weighs 159.2 grams. It provides 16M colors and 5 point multi-touch support. It is available in Black and White colors.
Hardware and Features:: LYF Wind 3 is loaded with 1.2GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 processor, Adreno 306 graphics, 2GB RAM and Android 5.0 Lollipop Operating System. Gravity sensor, e-compass, proximity sensor, ambient light sensor, accelerometer are in-built. FM radio, GPS are available.
Camera and Storage:: This dual SIM device comes with an 8MP rear camera and 2MP front camera. Touch Focus, Auto Focus, LED Flash, Face Detection, Manual HDR, Panorama features are available. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p and 30FPS. QR code scanning and creation facility are present to provide rapid access to websites, emails and messages.
It has an internal memory of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with the help of a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: LYF Wind 3 is equipped with 2920mAh removable Li-ion battery that provides the users with up to 13 hours of talk time on 4G networks, up to 19 hours of music time, up to 5 hours of video playback and nearly 370 hours of standby time. Connectivity options include 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPRS, EDGE and VoLTE.
Overview: LYF Wind 3 can face direct competition fromMicromax Canvas Xpress 4Gas it is available in same price range with a few specification differences like bigger screen size, more processor speed and micro SIM slots with 3G support in LYF Wind 3.

Perhaps it is ironic that the Samsung Galaxy SIII "mini" is a phone with a 4-inch screen size (co-incidentally the same as the first Galaxy S). But when you have the Galaxy SIII measuring in at 4.8 inches, plus a few other Samsung handsets that go beyond the 5-inch barrier, maybe it is apt to call it "mini". So, that 4-inch Super AMOLED display has a reasonable 800 x 480 pixel resolution. The SIII mini i8190 is not just mini in size, it is stripped off the premium features of its big brother. Like the processor is a dual-core 1GHz, or the camera is just 5 megapixel with a 0.3MP front-facing camera. At least the RAM is kept intact at 1GB, also internal storage is fairly ample at 8GB or 16GB capacities. It runs Android 4.1 Jelly Bean with Samsung's latest TouchWIZ overlay. Since the SIII mini doesn't have power-hungry components like a quad-core processor or an HD screen like its elder sibling, the battery capacity is lowered to 1500 mAh, which should be fair given this handset's spec. Unfortunately, the SIII mini never saw the light of day in the Indian market.

Samsung Galaxy Pocket Neo is a highly portable smartphone and easily fits into the pocket. The phone bears a 3-inch display with a screen resolution of 320x240 pixels which is not acceptable from any smartphone of todays age. There is a 850MHz processor paired with 512MB RAM. The chipset is not upto the mark, considering the competition. There is an internal storage of 4GB which can expanded upto 32GB by using microSD card.

There is a mediocre 2 megapixel rear camera which can capture average images. Neither theres flash nor a secondary camera, which adds to the disappointment. Luckily, it supports Dual-SIM with 3G Connectivity. Bluetooth and WiFi are included. The 1200mAh battery is sufficient enough to juice this small handy device. There are many better phones available in this price range.

The Micromax Canvas Fun A63 is an entry-level smartphone from the Indian phone maker. Available in three colour options  Blue, Yellow and Black, the Canvas Fun A63 has a 4-inch 800 x 480 pixel display. Powering the phone is a 1.3GHz dual-core processor and 512MB of RAM. There's 4GB of internal memory, out of which Micromax claims 1GB is available for apps, and 1GB for mass storage. The disappointing part of this phone is a measly-sounding 2 megapixel rear camera. Interestingly, owing to the chipset, that puny camera is reportedly able to shoot 720p HD video. Connectivity options include 3G speeds of up to 21Mbps, WiFi 802.11n and Bluetooth 2.0.

Earlier this year, Panasonic entered the Indian smartphone market with T and P Series. The Japanese company has launched a budget smartphone to capture a blossoming entry-level market. The Panasonic T31 flaunts a 4-inch WVGA (800×480 pixels) display, resulting in a pixel density of 223PPI (which is decent enough for a phone of this price range). It is powered by 1.3GHz dual-core processor paired with 512MB of RAM (this chipset is more powerful than the Samsung Galaxy Star Pro and Sony Xperia Tipo, which have a single core processor).

In terms of photography, the device sports a 3.2 megapixel rear camera without flash. Interestingly, despite the mediocre-sounding rear camera, the phone has a 2 Megapixel front facing camera for video calling (which is great since other smartphones at this price usually lack a secondary camera). It has an internal memory of 4GB and can be expanded using a microSD card.

Connectivity-wise the device features dual-SIM Standby, 3G support, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 and on the software front, it runs on Android 4.2.2 Jelly Bean. Its powered by a 1300mAh battery which is less than the Star Pro and Xperia Tipo.
4 inch display with the resolution of 800x480 pixels
Decent 233 PPI pixel density
Dual SIM phone
1.2Ghz, Quad Core processor with 1GB RAM
4GB internal storage, microSD card slot expandable upto 32GB
Rear camera of 5MP does video recording at 720p
VGA camera in the front
Removable 1700mAh battery
Alternatives
Spice Dream Uno
Micromax Canvas A1
Karbonn Sparkle V

Indian cell phone maker Ziox Mobile introduced a new affordable phone dubbed as Ziox Astra Metal 4G. As the name suggests, it flaunts a metal unibody design with antenna bands at top and bottom. It comes in rose silver, gold, and champagne gold colour options. The device is already available to purchase from leading retail store across the country.

Pros: Good built quality and feels premium
Cons: 1.5GB of RAM sometimes proves insufficient when using heavy apps
Doesn't support fast charging and takes a while to charge
The 5MP selfie camera doesn't capture very clear images

Introduction:

Karbonn is among the biggest smartphone makers in the country. Karbonn was one of the three manufacturers to first bring Google’s Android One initiative to India. Karbonn K9 Smart 4G smartphone was launched in December 2016. The Karbonn K9 smart 4G is a wonderful smartphone for all of the people who face budget restraint. Being a cost effective smartphone, it is no less in the specs department Yhe phone packs in 5-inch display and comes with Tuff glass for scratch resistance. Best buy in India is Rs. 5,349/- at EBay.
Diplay and Design:

The Karbonn K9 Smart 4G flaunts 5-inch LCD TFT multi touch screen capacitive display, 854*480 pixels screen resolution, 196PPI pixel density and covers approx. 64.53% Screen to Body ratio. It has a dimension of 144*74*10 mm and its weight is 105 grams.It is available only in Black colour.
Hardware and Features:

At the heart, the smartphone is loaded with 1.2GHz Quad-core processor, Android 6.0 Marshmallow Operating System, Mali-T720 graphics and 1GB RAM that is capable of powering you through most of the multi-tasking and gaming tasks.
Camera and Storage:

Karbonn K9 Smart 4G packs a 5MP primary camera which can click images of 2,592*1,944 pixels with the help of LED flash, auto focus and digital zoom and 5MP front camera for selfies and video calling. This bidget smartphone comes with an 8GB internal storage that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

The Karbonn K9 Smart 4G is fitted with a removable 2,300mAh Li-ion battery that provides a talk time of 6 hours and standby time of 250 hours, which claims to render a long period of battery backup. On the connectivity side, the smartphone features dual SIM slot (only one can support 3G/4G), voice over LTE, Wi-Fi 802.11, b/g/n, Bluetooth, GPS, mobile hotspot and MicroUSB 2.0 slot.

Powerful performance packed into a compact stylish design is what Samsungs Galaxy Y represents. Galaxy Y sports a 3 inches display which is a TFT capacitive touchscreen that gives a screen resolution of 240 by 320 pixels. The TouchWiz user interface that Samsung uses, boosts the phones performance. Galaxy Y is powered by ARMv6 processor of 832MHz and it runs on Android OS v2.3 Gingerbread. It provides the users with an internal memory of 180MB which can be expanded to 32GB using Micro SD cards. Connectivity to internet is easily facilitated via GPRS, EDGE, 3G networks and Wi-Fi functionality. Bluetooth v3.0 with A2DP allows transmission of files to other devices.

Galaxy Y offers a 2MP camera with geo-tagging and an image quality of 1600 by 1200 pixels. It also facilitates video recording of QVGA at 15 fps. This handset runs on a standard Li-ion battery of 1200 mAh. This gives the handset 6 hours 20 minutes of talk time and up to 540 hours in stand-by mode. Galaxy Ys other notable specifications include stereo FM with RDS, GPS-support, sensors like accelerometer, proximity and compass, image/video editor, Organizer, Quickoffice document viewer, voice memo and predictive text input (swipe). Samsung Galaxy Y is available in Metallic black and white colours. However, the users do get changeable back covers that come in colours like pearly white, dark black, fruity orange, bubblegum pink and silver pattern.

Lava is one of the top 5 Indian smartphone manufacturer that competes with other brands like Micromax, Intex and Karbonn. The company also owns Xolo which has been recently doing well in the market with their budget oriented devices that offers good value for money.

Celkon A118 falls in the mid-range price bucket. It runs at 1.2GHz speed and is powered by a quad-core processor which has 1GB RAM that allows the user to multi-task easily. It has 4GB internal storage which can be expanded up to 32GB by a microSD card and supports Android 4.2 JellyBean. It sports an 8MP rear-facing camera with autofocus and LED Flash in it (To compare  Celkon A119Q sports 12MP camera). The Celkon A118 has a 5 inches IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen with 1280 x 720 pixel resolution. The front facing camera allows its user to click decent selfies and relatively high quality video calls due to its 3MP sensor. Along with WiFi, Bluetooth, GPRS connectivity; Celkon A118 provides the user 3G connectivity as well. It has Dual SIM provision. The phone is backed up by 2000mAh battery.

The ML5 (Monalisa) is a device from the Indian manufacturer Celkon. A Dual SIM cell phone with a twist; though it has 2 SIM slots, one is a Mini SIM slot while the other is a Micro SIM slot. The Monalisa is a pretty phone to look at, with a 4.5 inch qHD display (540x960) with 245PPI pixel density. The phone has 4GB of internal memory with a MicroSD slot to expand the storage to 32GB. The device sports an 8 megapixel main camera with a secondary camera, the resolution of which is unknown to us. Strangely the device does not support HD video recording which is disappointing, considering the specs.

The device is driven by a 1.2 GHz Quad Core processor bundled with 1GB of RAM and runs Android 4.1 (Jelly Bean). There is no information available about updates from Celkon and we think the chances of this device being updated to newer versions of Android is rare.
Xolo launched itself in India in early 2012 and has been doing good business in the market since then. They provide phones with high end specs at decent prices. The key features of this device are 
Has a 5 inch IPS display with the resolution of 1280x720 pixels with decent 293 PPI pixel density
Dual SIM phone
It runs on a 1.3GHz Quad Core processor and is packed with 1GB of RAM
Comes with 4GB of internal storage which is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card

The Nokia C2-03 is a slightly more sophisticated version of the Nokia C2-02. This phone also comes with touch-and-type feature, with a 2.6 inch touch screen and a slider alphanumeric keypad. It comes with 10MB internal memory which is expandable upto 32GB thanks to a microSD slot, which also supports hot swap feature. Apart from email, chat and SMS support, the phone also has Nokia Maps for navigation which depends on local information. The phone has a 2MP camera with 4x digital zoom, music player and stereo FM radio.

The Samsung Galaxy Y is amongst the most affordable Android powered handsets that is available in the market now. Announced by Samsung a few months ago, the device has been a huge hit with the youngsters who have lapped it up in huge numbers. The phone runs Android 2.3 Gingerbread underneath Samsung own TouchWiz UI and features an 830 MHz processor that is mated to 290 MB of RAM. Internal memory is 180 MB which you can expand with memory cards of up to 32 GB in capacity. The 3.0 inch display on the phone gets a resolution of 240*320. For your imaging needs, there is a 2 megapixel camera at the rear which can also capture videos. The phone supports 3G networks and supports W-Fi as well as Bluetooth.

Every since Microsoft came out with Windows Phone 7, questions were raised on low cost smartphones carrying the new OS from Redmond. Nokia launched the lower priced Lumia 710 alongside the Lumia 800. Featuring the same 1.4GHz processor of its elder brother, the Lumia 710 scaled down the display quality (a mediocre TFT panel in comparison to the AMOLED one on the Lumia 800), camera (5MP vs. 8MP) and design to deliver a cheaper Windows Phone. There's just 8GB of internal storage with no facility to expand using a microSD card slot. There's 3G connectivity with speeds up to 14.4 Mbps and WiFi 802.11n support. The battery is also just 1300 mAh (as opposed to the 1450 mAh one in the Lumia 800), but this is a removable one. Competing with Samsung Omnia W, the Lumia 710 much like any other Windows Phone 7.x handset out there will not receive an update to the Windows Phone 8 OS. Numerically, the Lumia 720 can be called as the successor to the Lumia 710, but pricing-wise, the Lumia 620 would be its apt successor. Both these phones fix most of the above-mentioned issues that plagued the first generation of Windows Phone 7 handsets.

Lava Iris X1 are low-end devices, where Lava launched two more devices- The Lava Iris X1 Mini and X1 Grand. Lava Iris X1 Mini is stripped down version of the X1 Grand. It houses nearly same specifications in a much tiny screen size. The X1 mini targets people who are looking for a really affordable Android smartphone.
Has a 5 inch IPS display with the resolution of 1280x720 pixels with decent 293 PPI pixel density

Dual SIM phone
