In April 2017, Honor launched a new variant in its budget segment smartphone series which went by the name of Honor Bee 2. The smartphone is the successor of the Honor Bee smartphone launched in mid-2015.

Introduction:: Panasonic Corporation, one of the world’s largest electronics manufacturers, was founded as Matsushita Electric Industrial Co. Ltd. In 1918. The company was renamed to Panasonic Corporation in 2008. Panasonic Eluga Z Smartphone was launched in July 2015.
Display and Design:: Panasonic Eluga Z measures 141.30*70.60*6.85 mm and weighs 120.00 Gms and screen to body approximates 69.1%. It comes with a 5.00-inch multi-touch screen display with a resolution of 720*1280 pixels and pixel density 294 pixels per inch.
Hardware and Features:: In terms of performance, it is powered by 1.4 GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6592M processor, 2 GB RAM, and 16 GB ROM. It runs Android v4.2.2 (KitKat) which is upgradable to v5.0 (Lollipop). Internal storage is 16 GB which is expandable up to 32 GB through microSD card.
Camera Details:: As far as the cameras are concerned, the Panasonic Eluga Z packs a 13 MP primary camera and 5 MP front shooter for selfie.
Battery and Connectivity:: It is powered by a 2050 mAh removable battery by which you can experience talk time up to 15 h and 18 min and standby time 375 hours on 3G network. It is accepted as dual Sims (GSM and GSM) Smartphone. Connectivity options include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and 3G. Sensors on the phone include Compass Magnetometer, Proximity sensor, and Accelerometer and Ambient light sensor.

Overview: The P61 comes from the P series of smartphones made by Panasonic. The P61 is a phablet and goes against phones like Asus Zenfone 6, Karbonn S9 Titanium, Panasonic P81. The key features of the Panasonic P61 are as follows
6 Inch display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels and a pixel density of 245PPI
1.3GHz Quad Core Processor with 1GB of RAM
16GB Internal Memory MicroSD card slot, expandable upto 32GB
8 Megapixel autofocus camera with LED flash, capable of 1080p Full HD recording
2 Megapixel front facing camera
Android 4.4.2 Kitkat
Glide Play multiple operation interface, helps multitasking
Free Screen Guard and Flip cover in the box
Alternatives
ASUS ZenFone 6
Karbonn S9 Titanium
Panasonic P81

Introduction:: LYF is Reliance Retail’s brand of Smartphones that was launched in India in 2016 and now these phones are available with free Reliance Jio SIM. LYF Water 6 was launched in India on July 15, 2016. It's decent performance, Good storage space, and Average battery backup is its major attractions.
Design and Display:: The LYF Water 6 sports a 5.0-inch IPS LCD capacitive touch screen display with an HD resolution of 1280*720 pixels which results in a pixel density of 294 PPI having Asahi Dragontrail glass screen protector. It has a dimension of 142*70.5*8 mm and its weight is 136 grams. It is available in White Gold color.
Hardware and Features:: At the heart of it, it is powered by a 1.2 GHz Quad core, Cortex A53 Qualcomm Snapdragon 410 MSM8916 processor coupled with 2GB RAM. It is operated through Android v5.1.1 (Lollipop) and Adreno 306 Graphics. Light sensor, Proximity sensor, Accelerometer, compass are available.
Camera and Storage:: LYF Water 6 is loaded with a 13MP primary camera with LED Flash on its back and image resolution of 4128*3096 pixels. It is also armed with 5MP selfie camera. Other camera features include Continuous shooting, HDR, Auto Flash, Face detection and users can record video at 1920*1080 @ 30 fps. Its internal memory is 32GB which is not expandable as it does not come with any MicroSD slot.
Battery and Connectivity:: LYF Water 6 is backed with a non-removable 2920mAh Li-Po battery which claims to offer talk time up to 15 hours (4G). It is a Dual SIM Smartphone both can support 4G network. Other connectivity features include Wi-Fi, Mobile Hotspot, Bluetooth, GPS/AGPS, etc.

Overview: The Galaxy Fame is just one of the many handsets Samsung has currently flooded in the upper entry-level segment. It is in fact, not all that different from the Galaxy Young S6312. It's got a slightly larger 3.5-inch display bearing the same HVGA (320 x 480 pixel) resolution, which actually results in the lowering of the pixel density. Both are powered by a 1GHz single-core processor, and funnily the Galaxy Fame comes with just 512MB of RAM, where the Young Duos had 768MB of RAM. Funny, because the Young is priced a little lower than the Fame. Moving on, there's 4GB of internal memory and a microSD card slot to expand for storing media. Camera is one department where the Galaxy Fame shines when compared to its cousin  there's a 5 megapixel sensor with an LED flash and even a front-facing VGA resolution camera. There's a 1300 mAh battery powering the handset, which we guess should do fine looking at the low-end specs of the phone.

Introduction:: Wind 2 is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. Bigger viewing angles, screen magnification, HotKnot technology for easy media transfer, sturdy build, OTG support and pendrive compatibility, BesLoudness for boosting audio facility, BesAudEnh to improve acoustic output when using earphones, BesSurround for optimizing audio for movies and music are its major highlights.
Display and Design:: Wind 2 comes with a 6 inch LCD HD IPS capacitive touchscreen display with 1280 x 720 pixels resolution and 294PPI pixel density. It has a metal frame and a finish of curved glass. The phone has a high body to screen ratio with 5 point multi-touch. It has a dimension of 157.5 x 81 x 8.5 mm and it weighs 223 grams.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device is loaded with 1GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735M processor, 2GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and Mali-T720 MP1 graphics. Other features.
Camera and Storage:: This dual SIM device comes with an 8MP rear and 2MP front camera with autofocus and LED flash. Users can record HD videos at 720p. Other features include face detection, continuous shot, multi angle view mode to create GIFs, and smile shot ASD, time lapse video, video snapshot and gesture capture. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with the help of a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: Wind 2 comes with 2850mAh Li-ion battery that provides up to 9 hours of talk time on 4G networks and standby time of nearly 190 hours. Users will get nearly 6 hours of HD video playback time and up to 35 hours of music time. Connectivity options include 3G, 4G LTE (India Compatible), 2G, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/ g/ n, Bluetooth and VoLTE.
Overview: Wind 2 can face direct competition fromLenovo K3 Note andMotorola Moto G4 Play but Wind 2 has lower battery capacity, lower processor speed and lesser resolution camera. However, the phone comes at a significantly lower price than others and has an array of impressive features.
India-based brand Kult has launched a budget smartphone dubbed as Kult Impulse with good features. Let’s check the technical specifications of this phone in detail:

Introduction:: Lava X50 is a dual SIM device that was launched in July 2016. Smooth metal body with a stylish curved back panel having NCVM coating, Screen shrink feature for managing everything by 1 hand, ability to swipe with 3 figures for taking picture and battery with power saver mode are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Lava X50 comes with 5.5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, ONCELL display with 5 point touch, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 267.02PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 155.00 x 71.80 x 8.80 mm. It is available in Blue colour.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735A processor, Mali-T720 MP2 graphics, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System that can be upgraded to Android 6.0 Marshmallow, and 2GB RAM. Accelerometer, ambient light sensor and proximity sensor are in-built. It has 12 Indian languages and smart gestures, auto call recording facility.
Camera and Storage:

Lava X50 is loaded with 8MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include continuous shooting, geotagging, LED flash, panorama, HDR and face detection, white balance setting, auto focus, ISO setting, exposure compensation, self timer, and scene mode. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2800mAh Li-Po battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Lava X50 faces competition from Lenovo Vibe K5 Plus. The latter has a faster processor, higher rear camera, more internal storage and more pixel density than Lava X50.

LYF Water 9 is a dual SIM device that was launched in October 2016. Touch free experience, fingerprint sensor, App encryption, sleek look and thin bezel, gesture capture mode and power saver app are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

LYF Water 9 comes with 5.5 inch LCD touch screen display, 2.5D Asahi Dragontrail glass screen protector, 1920 x 1080 pixels resolution and 400.53PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 144 x 70.7 x 7.7 mm and its weight is 135 grams.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is equipped with 1.5GHz octa-core MediaTek MT6753 processor, 1GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop operating system and Mali-T720 graphics. Hover your palm upon the screen and capture pictures, view photo gallery and unlock your device. Gravity sensor, light sensor, hall sensor, proximity sensor, e-compass are in-built. Air gestures, float gestures, three point screenshot, standby screen gestures, three point camera launcher, double tap to lock or unlock and two point volume adjustment are available.
Camera and Storage:

LYF Water 9 is built with 8MP rear camera having autofocus and LED flash and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include HDR, panorama, geotagging, face detection and multi angle viewing mode. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is loaded with a 2800mAh Li-Po non-removable battery that provides a talk time of up to 10 hours and standby time of nearly 115 hours, up to 3 hours of video playback time and music time of nearly 9 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio).
Competition:
LYF Water 9 faces competition from Oppo Neo 7 which has lower battery capacity and smaller screen than LYF Water 9.

Overview: The S series from Lenovo are Android powered devices that focus on style, they promise to deliver a good audio-video experience. There are two main highlights of the series - Long battery life and a high res display. The key features of the Lenovo S920 are as follows
5.3 Inch IPS Display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels and a pixel density of 277PPI
1.2GHz Quad Core MediaTek Processor with 1GB of RAM

The Nokia Asha 210 is an inexpensive feature phone running Nokia's non-smart Series 40 OS. This QWERTY handset comes in a variety of peppy colours. It's got a 2.4-inch QVGA (320 x 240 pixels) display, a microSD card slot supporting up to 32GB cards. The striking physical characteristic of the Asha 210 is the dedicated WhatsApp button on the phone. Yes, HTC had a Facebook button on the ChaCha, Nokia has put the hugely popular multi-platform instant messenger that almost everybody we know uses. This is a big plus as compared to feature phones like the REX series from Samsung, which don't support WhatsApp at the moment. If that wasn't enough, Nokia's also announced that WhatsApp won't be charging their yearly fee of Rs. 50 for these handsets. Being an inexpensive phone, there's no 3G support, but other than 2G, you also have WiFi. Following the trend of dual SIM phones set by Indian phone makers like Micromax, the Asha 210 also comes with two SIM slots, one of which is hot-swappable. There's a 2MP camera at the back off which we wouldn't expect great quality. But there are some unique tricks, like built-in voice guidance that makes taking self-portraits easy without a front-facing camera.

Introduction:: Intex Aqua Ring is a dual SIM device was launched in July 2016. The phone has a back panel with sandstone finish, latest Android OS and provides a good battery capacity.
Display and Designs:: Intex Aqua Ring is equipped with a metal ring design, a 5 inch HD IPS display with 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution, 16.7M colours and 294PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 143.5 x 72 x 9.25 and it weighs 159 grams. It has touch 5-Finger facility and 66.66% body to screen ratio. It is available in Black colour.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device comes with a 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6580 processor, 1GB RAM, Mali-400 MP2 graphics and Android 6.0 Marshmallow OS. G-sensor, proximity sensor, light sensor are in-built. Some apps like Online Software Update, Matrabhasha, Saavn and Clean Master are pre-installed.
Camera and Storage:: Intex Aqua Ring comes with a 5MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Autofocus, face beauty, dual LED flash, panorama mode, gesture feature, and smile shot features are available. Users can record videos with both front and rear camera. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with the help of a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: This dual SIM device is loaded with a Li-ion 2450mAh battery that provides the users with a talk time of 6 hours and standby time of 240 hours. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards. Connectivity options include WLAN 802.11b/g/n 4.0, GPS, ADPS, Bluetooth and Wi-Fi Hotspot.
Overview: Intex Aqua Ring can face direct competition from Karbonn Aura Power,Micromax Canvas Spark 2 Plus andGionee Pioneer P5 Mini as they have somewhat similar specifications. However, Karbonn phone has a significantly higher battery capacity and better rear side camera but lower speed processor.

Pros: Premium design with thin-bezels and sandstone finish
Cons: LED notifications supports only white colour

Overview: With over 6 months delay to launch the Jio 4G services in India, Reliance's smartphone brand LYF has been aggressively launching new smartphones. LYF Water 8 is the 19th addition to the brand, which sounds astonishing considering its just been 7 months since the brand launched it's first smartphone in January 2016.
Design and Display: LYF Water 8 is a really good looking device with glass on the back and metal on the sides. The phone is also sleek at just 7mm and handy with a 5 inch display. The phone so far is known to be available in two colors viz., Black and White. Up on the front of the phone sits a 5 inch display that has a resolution of 1280x720 pixels giving it a pixel density of 294PPI and should sharp enough. The display being an AMOLED panel, it should give good viewing experience, however the display lacks Gorilla Glass protection.
Hardware and Performance: Powering the LYF Water 8 on the inside is a Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.5GHz and combined with it is 3GB of RAM. Now, 3GB of RAM should be good enough to handle heavy multitasking and also the processor should hold well in terms of performance but the processor is known for heating issues so you might want to check on that before buying. Coming to the software of the phone, it is based on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box, which is slightly a disappointment as we expect devices to now ship with the latest Marshmallow out of the box.
Camera and Storage: For photography we have a 13MP rear shooter that can record videos up to 1080p @30fps and on the front we have a 5MP sensor for those selfies and video calling needs. Both front and the rear camera sport an LED Flash for those low light shots and selfies. And to store all the media and other date you get 16GB of onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 128GB more via a MicroSD card.
Connectivity and Battery: Like all LYF phones this phone is 4G enabled with VoLTE support. LYF Water 8 is a Dual SIM device and accepts Micro+Nano SIMs. Other than the that you get the standard WiFi, Bluetooth. When it comes to power, the phone might disappoint some as it packs just a 2600mAh battery unit which is sealed in the device. Unfortunately, we do not have wireless or fast charging support here.
Competition: Expected to retail around Rs. 10,000 you get quite a good phones in the similar price range that offer much more in terms of hardware and features. Here are a few of them:

Overview: Motorola upgraded the original Defy with better specs to make the Defy+ (Defy Plus) one of the ultimate Android phones in its segment. Powered by Android OS, Defy+ features a larger display than its predecessor and a faster processor. The Defy+ is available in Black & White colors, however, the White color isn't launched in India.

Introduction:: Lava A89 is a dual SIM device that was launched in May 2016. Video PIP feature for working and watching videos simultaneously, torch, voice gestures, speedy processor and sound recorder are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Lava A89 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive display, multi touch facility, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 196PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 145.5 x 72 x 9.1 mm and its weight is 157 grams. It is available in White and Black colours. It comes in an attractive candy bar design.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.5GHz quad-core Spreadtrum SC9830A processor, Mali-400 MP2 graphics, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and 1GB RAM. Vibration on call connection, auto call recording and flip to mute are available. It has accelerometer, light sensor, proximity sensor and unlimited phonebook memory.
Camera and Storage:

Lava A89 is loaded with a 5MP rear camera with and a 2MP front camera. Other camera features include dual LED flash, digital zoom, HDR, grid, photo timer and autofocus. Users can record HD videos at 720p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Competition:
Lava A89 faces competition from Xolo Era 4G. Xolo Era 4G has higher battery capacity and higher pixel density than Lava A89.
Battery and Connectivity:: This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2000mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of 14 hours 15 minutes on 2G networks and standby time of up to 7 hours on 3G networks. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.

This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2000mAh Li-ion battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of 14 hours 15 minutes on 2G networks and standby time of up to 7 hours on 3G networks. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.

Overview: Panasonic, in May 2017 launched a 4G VoLTE-enabled smartphone for its budget-friendly smartphone segment, dubbed as Panasonic P85. The company also launched the Panasonic Eluga Ray alongside the P85. The device sports a sleek build measuring at 9.35mm and weighing 146.7 grams.

Earth being the premium series of smartphones by the brand LYF, Earth 2 has got some real neat features to justify the price. It is so far the most expensive phone by the brand and in terms of performance it should not disappoint users that use the device for basic purposes and apps but not game a lot, especially graphic intensive games. Even though it might not be the best piece of hardware, the device does support 4G and VoLTE support as well, something that every LYF device boasts of.
Display and Design: LYF Earth 2 has a handy 5 inch display size that is difficult to find these days, the display has a 1920x1080 pixels resolution that gives the display a pixel density of 441PPI. At this pixel density the display is surely very sharp and crisp. Unfortunately, there is no Gorilla Glass protection. Coming to the design, the device boasts premium build materials like Glass on front and back of the device with Metal sides around the device.
Performance and Software: On the inside we have Qualcomm's Snapdragon 615 chipset running, it is Octa Core chipset clocked at 1.5GHz and paired with it is 3GB of RAM. This combination should provide decent user experience but do not expect the best of gaming experience, however the 3GB of RAM should let multitasking between apps buttery smooth. Talking about the software, LYF Earth 2 disappoints here a bit as it does not ship with the latest Android Marshmallow out of the box but is still based on Android 5.1 Lollipop with no information on future software updates.
Camera and Storage: On either sides of the device we have got a 13MP shooter which might cheer those selfie lovers and comes with a couple of enhancement features from the software end. Both the cameras can record videos up to 1080p @ 25fps and sport an LED Flash for low light shots, whereas the rear camera also features Laser Autofocus. To store all your high quality pictures and other data you get 32GB of onboard storage which can be further expanded via a MicroSD card up to 64GB.
Battery and Connectivity: To power all this there is a 2500mAh battery that which ideally won't last you a day if you are a sort of heavy user. The battery is sealed on the back of the device and unfortunately, the device does not support wireless or fast charging. In terms of connectivity, the phone accepts Dual SIMs of which the second slot is Hybrid which will take a MicroSD card or a Nano SIM. LYF Earth 2 is 4G enabled device with VoLTE support.

Overview: Karbonn Titanium S5 plus is a minor update to the Karbonn Titanium S5, which is now discontinued. This is a budget smartphone featuring a 1.3GHz Quad-core processor and is backed by 1GB RAM. It sports a 5-inch display with a screen resolution of 960x540 pixels, same as the older one. It has an internal memory of 4GB (of which around 2GB is available to the user) which can be expanded upto 32GB by using a memory card.

It has the same 8 Megapixel camera with flash but this phone can record HD videos as well at 720p resolution. Also, there is a secondary VGA (0.3MP) camera for video calling and self photography. It runs on Android v4.2 Jelly Bean. It is a Dual-SIM phone with 3G connectivity. The phablet is powered by a 1800mAh battery which might be insufficient to run the four cores for a full day.
The Panasonic P95 is a budget smartphone aimed at first time buyers launched in May 2018. Let’s check the device overview below:

Celkon AR 50 is a recent launch from Celkon brand with appealing specification in affordable range. The display size of 5 inches with Capacitive Touchscreen suits with the trend of big-size smartphones. The internal memory of this smartphone is 4GB which can be expanded up to 32GB using microSD card and the RAM size is of 512MB. The smartphone runs on Android OS, v4.2 with CPU speed of Dual-core 1.2 GHz. Also the well-sized 2000mAh battery should give reasonable uptime. In the camera department, the primary camera is a 5MP with no flash light and no auto focus. Theres a secondary camera for video-calling. With the rear camera videos cannot be recorded in HD quality. The smartphone supports 3G network. Other features that Celkon AR 50 supports are Bluetooth, GPRS, WiFi and microUSB version 2.0.

The A90 is a smartphone from the Indian handset maker, Karbonn, which comes with a high resolution camera for the price. The Karbonn A90 features a 5 Megapixel rear camera with flash and has a secondary camera as well for video calling. It sports a 4 inch IPS Display (800x480 pixels) with a pixel density of 233PPI (which is great for a phone of this price range). For storage purpose, a microSD card slot has been included.

The phone runs on a 1GHz Single-core processor and is paired with 512MB RAM. The hardware is not upto the mark, considering the cut-throat competition prevailing in the market. Although the phone supports Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM), it does not offer 3G Connectivity. Bluetooth and WiFi are available. It runs on Android v4.0 Ice-Cream Sandwich (ICS), which is now outdated. There is a 1400mAh battery included, which should be sufficient to juice this device for a considerable period of time. It hovers around the range of Nokia's touch-enabled Asha series, with the Asha 502 being the nearest competitor.

Smartphone maker Zopo has launched its Color C3 device in India. This launch comes in a month after the launch of the Zopo Color F1. The Color C3 was announced globally at the MWC in Barcelona earlier this year alongside the Zopo F2 and the Zopo F5.

The Optimus Black P970 was introduced back in early 2011. Initially loaded with Android 2.2 Froyo, the device has been through many update circles and is compatible with Android 4.0  a commendable job indeed. The device features a Cortex A8 processor running at 1 GHz. Graphics is handled by a PowerVR SGX530 GPU. The internal memory is just 2 GB which can be expanded further using micro SD cards. The device features a 4 inch, 480*800 pixel display. It features a 5 megapixel main camera which can also capture videos in 720p. There is a secondary front camera as well that can click at 2 megapixels. The battery rated at 1500 mAh is good for six hours of talk time and over 375 hours of standby time. The device supports 3G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, USB and FM Radio.

The Micromax A35 Bolt is another handset from the Indian manufacturers Bolt series of affordable smartphones. This Dual SIM (GSM + GSM) device is positioned above the same brands A27. The device sports a 4-inch, WVGA (800*480 pixels) display. Under the hood, we have an ARM Cortex A5 SoC which houses a 1 GHz processor. There is 512 MB of ROM and just 256 MB of RAM. The internal memory is 160 MB which you can increase further using micro SD cards. The graphics bit is handled by a Mali 300 GPU. Like the A27, this one too lacks 3G support  but has WiFi. The imaging bit is taken care of by the 2 MP Primary Camera. There is a secondary VGA video calling camera as well. The phone runs Android v2.3.5 (Gingerbread) and it is unlikely to get an update to newer versions of Android. Other connectivity options include EDGE, GPRS, Bluetooth ad micro USB. The Li-ion battery is rated at 1500 mAh and offers up to 4 hours of talk time and 175 hours of standby time.

The Asha 202 is yet another Dual-SIM Asha series phone. However, this one comes with a twist, a touch screen in a simple bar phone. Nokia packs in a package of 40 EA games in the 202. Along with a 2 megapixel camera, the 202 also features Bluetooth, MicroSD card slot, FM & a 3.5mm audio port. After losing considerable ground to local Indian manufacturers like Karbonn, Micromaxx, Maxx and others, Nokia is fighting back with its Asha series. The Asha 202 is expected to woo the bottom of the pyramid and go mass market.

The Nokia C2-02 was released in August 2011. The phone incorporated touch-and-type, which means it has a touch screen and an attached alphanumeric slider keypad. It has upto 10MB internal memory which is expandable upto 32GB through a microSD slot which is built in.

The phone supports apps based on Java and Flash. It has support for email, SMS, Bluetooth and USB 2.0. It also has a 2MP camera with 4x digital zoom. Also included are a music player and a stereo FM radio.

Intro:: The Lava EG932 is an entry level Android Smartphone aimed largely at value conscious buyers. It is not meant for heavy multitasking or media consumption but provides most of the necessary features of a smartphone. A noticeable feature is its Dual Rear Camera.
Display and Design:: The Lava EG932 has an all plastic build with angular corners. It has a 5 inch LCD screen with 960 x 540 pixels resolutions. This gives it a pixel density of 221PPI. It is available in Black and White colors. There is no protective cover on screen and the same can be obtained from market.
Hardware and features: This Android handset is powered by a 1.2GHz Snapdragon quad-core CPU. This dual SIM handset is compatible with Mini SIMs and supports 3G. The Lava EG932 uses Android v4.3 (KitKat) OS. It supports VOiP and Push mail. Like other Android based devices, it supports Google apps too. The phone allows both GSM and CDMA networks. For entertainment, MP3 and MP4 file support is provided along with FM radio facility. The device supports Indian languages.
Camera and storage: The device is among the few Indian models to sport a Dual Rear Camera setup including 5MP and 0.3MP resolutions respectively. A flash is located at the back of the device. The phone also has a VGA front facing camera that can record HD and full HD videos. There is an onboard 1GB RAM and an internal expandable memory of 4GB.
Battery and connectivity: The phone has a 2000mAh dual battery which is removable. It has Bluetooth, Wi-Fi and USB tethering connectivity.
Overview: The Lava EG932 faces stiff competition from similarly priced entry level Aandroid contenders. Its main rivals areMicromax Unite 3 andXolo Era X both sporting higher specifications like 8GB RAM and 8MP camera.

The Nokia C3-00 comes with a QWERTY keypad. The phone comes with 55MB internal memory, with upto 8GB expandable memory. The phone has a conversational SMS feature, MMS, Nokia Mail, Bluetooth 2.1 and USB 2.0. Also included is a 2MP camera with 4x digital zoom, also capable of shooting videos. A Nokia Music Player, stereo FM radio and a 3.5mm jack are also included.

Micromax Canvas Juice A77 sports a 5-inch screen which makes it fall under the Phablet category. This phone houses a huge 3000mAh battery which is the unique selling point of this phone and so the inclusion of the word juice in its name. It claims to deliver 10 hours of talktime and 282 hours standby. Though, it is unclear whether this phone supports USB Host function, using which phones like the Lenovo P780 can charge other USB devices. The screen resolution is 854 x 480 pixels. The Juice A77 is powered by Dual-Core processor clocked at 1.3GHz speed (Cortex A7) and has 1GB RAM and a Mali 400MP GPU. Internal storage is 4GB out of which 1.27GB is reserved for apps. The memory can be expanded to 32GB by microSD card. It has a 5MP rear-facing camera with LED flash and a 0.3MP VGA front-facing camera for video calling. Like many of the MicroMax models even this phone has a dual SIM. It has 3G connectivity as well.

Introduction:: Hyundai HI 50 Young is a dual SIM device that was launched in September 2016. Lightweight body and impressive design are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Hyundai HI 50 Young comes with a 5 inch LCD touch screen FWVGA capacitive display, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution, 16.7M colors and 195.93PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 143.4 x 71 x 9.5 mm and its weight is 133 grams. It is available in Black and White colours.
Hardware and Features:
This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735M processor, 2GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System. It has an accelerometer in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Hyundai HI 50 Young is loaded with an 8MP rear camera with 3264 x 2448 pixels image resolution and a 5MP front camera. Other camera features include panorama, LED flash, smile shot, auto focus, motion track, digital zoom, face beauty, multi angle view mode, photo live mode. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2000mAh Li-ion battery that provides nearly 8 hours of talk time and nearly 220 hours of standby time. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth. It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:

Hyundai HI 50 Young faces competition from Yu Yunique Plus, Intex Aqua Fish and InFocus Bingo 21. Yu Yunique Plus has a smaller screen, faster processor and higher pixel density than Hyundai HI 50 Young. InFocus Bingo 21 has a smaller screen, higher battery capacity, higher pixel density and more expandable RAM than Hyundai HI 50 Young. Intex Aqua Fish has faster processor, higher battery capacity but lower front camera than Hyundai HI 50 Young.

LYF Water 7 is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2016. Super fast fingerprint sensor, body made of aluminum alloy, protection by Asahi Dragontrail glass and camera with 8 smart modes are its major highlights.
Display and Designs:: LYF Water 7 comes with a 5.5 inch IPS LCD display with a resolution of 1920 x 1080 pixels and pixel density of 401PPI. It has a design of unibody and it is lightweight in nature. It has a dimension of 155.3 x 77.2 x 8.55 mm and its weight is 160 grams. It is available in 2 colors including Silver and Gold.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device comes with 1.5GHz octa-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 processors, 2GB RAM and Adreno 405 graphics and Android 5.1 OS. In-built sensors include proximity sensor, ambient light sensor, accelerometer and gyroscope.
Camera and Storage:: It has a rear camera of 13MP with autofocus and LED flash and front camera of 5MP with 88 degree viewing angle. HDR, panorama, electronic aperture, ISO controls, white balance presets and exposure compensation facilities are available. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p. This dual SIM device is equipped with 16GB internal memory that can be expanded up to 128GB.
Battery and Connectivity:: LYF Water 7 is loaded with a non-removable Li-ion battery of 3000mAh that provides the users with a talk time of 14 hours on 4G networks and 150 hours of standby time. Users can enjoy HD videos for 7 hours and listen to music for 20 hours. Connectivity options include 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, Wi-Fi, 2G, Bluetooth and VoLTE.
Overview: LYF Water 7 can face direct competition fromXiaomi Redmi Note 3,Samsung Galaxy J7 (2016) as these are available with similar specifications with a few differences such as higher battery capacity of Xiaomi phone and higher processor speed of Samsung Galaxy.

The Nokia Asha 306 is amongst the three Nokia Asha Touch series of handsets that were recently announced by the Finnish phone maker. Other phones in this range include the Asha 305 and the Asha 311. The Asha 305 gets a 3 inch 240*400 pixel resistive touch screen display and runs the proprietary S40 OS from Nokia. The phone gets 10 MB of internal memory which can be easily upgraded to 32 GB using micro SD cards. The phone gets a basic 2 megapixel fixed focus camera and basic video capturing abilities. The best part about this handset is probably its seamless connectivity options that its sibling, the Asha 305 https://pricebaba.com/mobile/nokia-asha-305 lacks. This entry level handset boasts of WLAN capabilities and also supports Bluetooth, USB and GPRS/EDGE connectivity options.

Bolt series by Micromax encapsulates the phones focused on multimedia for people on a budget. The Bolt AD3520 has dual front firing speakers and media keys at the bottom that signifies that it is built for multimedia usage. It is succeeded by Micromax Bolt A065.
Here are some of its features:
A 3.5 HVGA display at the front of this device has a resolution of 320x480 pixels. The display is tiny and mediocre mainly due to a low resolution.
On the front of the device there are dual firing speakers at the top and the bottom that will aid to good sound quality on the loudspeaker.
It comes with Android 4.4.2 Kitkat out of the box. No upgrades planned.
1.3GHz Dual-core processor will be sufficient for daily tasks such as surfing the web and watching videos.
At the back there is a 2MP camera. The front camera is rated at 0.3MP which sounds horrible.
This phone comes in 3 colors: Electric Grey, Raging Red and Pristine White
Alternatives:
Micromax Bolt A065
Panasonic T9

Samsung Galaxy Star Pro is the entry-level smartphone from Samsung. It has a 4 inch WVGA (800x480 pixels) screen with a pixel density of 233PPI. The screen is crisp and sharp and has decent viewing angles as well. The smartphone is powered by a 1GHz Cortex A5 processor and 512MB RAM. The chipset is very basic and may lag under heavy usage. It supports Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM) but lacks 3G connectivity. Internet can be accessed using 2G cellular data and WiFi.

There is 2 Megapixel rear camera without flash. The camera is just basic so dont expect it to capture good images. There is no secondary front facing camera. It runs on Android 4.1 Jelly Bean. The 1500mAh battery should give a decent uptime. To look at other options, check out other phones between the Rs. 5,000 to Rs. 10,000 range.

The Lava 3G 402+ is an entry-level 3G smartphone. It has a simple design and bears a 4-inches display (800x480 pixels) with a pixel density of 233PPI, which is decent from a phone of this range. The smartphone is powered by a 1.3GHz Dual-core processor and is coupled with 512MB RAM, which is acceptable for such a phone, considering its price (it might not be able to efficiently multi-task due to insufficient RAM). The phone has an internal storage of 4GB, which can be expanded upto 32GB by using microSD memory cards.

There is 3 Megapixel snapper at the back that is accompanied with LED flash and supports HD video recording at 720p. The VGA (0.3MP) front camera can be used for video calling and Skype. The phone runs on Android v4.2 Jelly Bean and Supports Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM). Bluetooth and WiFi are added for additional functionality. There is a 1500mAh battery included to juice this device, which should be sufficient to power this device for a day, considering the modest hardware. The Lava 3G 356 and Lava 3G 402 are the other variants.

Micromax Canvas HD A116 is the successor to the immensely popular A110. Micromax did well with the Canvas 2 and it sold on a premium in local markets owing to stock shortages. The A116 brings the same screen size of 5" with Android, but Micromax seems to have worked on the display quality this time. Micromax has a 1.2GHz Quad Core processor powering the A116 and a 1GB RAM to back it up. Stock Android version 4.2 (Jelly Bean) helps the case for them.

The 8MP camera produces 720p videos, which we would hope is better than its predecessor. The 5" LCD sports a resolution of 1280x720, which keeps the Canvas series in competition with Samsung Galaxy Note 2.
In May 2017, Intex launched a new variant in its budget-friendly smartphone portfolio dubbed as the Aqua A4. The device ships in a black colour variant.
Introduction:
3.9 Inch display with a resolution of 800x480 pixels, pixel density of 239PPI
1.3GHz Dual Core Processor with 256MB of RAM
768MB Internal Storage with 256 for storage and 512MB for user data
MicroSD card slot, expandable upto 32GB
3.2 Megapixel Fixed focus camera, no flash. VGA Front facing camera
Android 4.2 Jelly Bean (Outdated OS)
Dual SIM (GSM+GSM) but no 3G
Removable 1500mAh battery
Alternatives
Panasonic T9
Celkon Campus 35K
With the launch of Jio network, the home grown brand LYF has been aggressively launching phones in the sub Rs. 10,000 segment. The Water 7s is the latest addition from the brand in the segment.
Design & Display: LYF Water 7s has an all plastic body, however the device gets a textured back that makes it look & feel good. In general it is a very basic design. The display is 5.5-inch in size and has a resolution of 1920x1080 pixels (Full HD) giving it a pixel density of 401PPI. And we do not get Gorilla Glass protection.
Hardware & Features: You get a MediaTek MT6753 octa core chipset clocked at 1.3GHz & combined along is ample 3GB of RAM & Mali-T720 MP1 GPU. Coming to the software, LYF Water 7s ships with Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box & has near-stock Android UI. Besides, the phone also gets a fingerprint sensor on the back of the device.
Camera & Storage: There is a 13MP camera on the rear of the device with an LED Flash & can record videos up to 1080p. Whereas, on the front you get a 5MP sensor for selfies & video calling. To store data & pictures you get 16GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 64GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery & Connectivity: To power the device there is a 2800mAh battery that can be user replaced in case of any issues. The battery capacity sounds average & might just last you through the day if you are a very basic user. In terms of connectivity, this phone gets the standard Bluetooth & WiFi connection & also supports 4G LTE with VoLTE calling over the Reliance Jio network.

Overview: Indian smartphone manufacturer Intex added the Aqua Lions T1 in its lineup. The later is comparatively low priced as compared to the former one. Let’s take a look at the phone's overview:
FAQs: 1. Will this phone work with Reliance Jio network?
Ans: Yes, this phone supports VoLTE out of the box and should work well with Jio network.
2.Does both SIM card support 4G?
Ans: Yes, both the sim cards support 4G.
3. How is the camera for selfies?
Ans: There is a 5MP front camera with LED flash that help you click good low light selfies.
4. Is the battery removable?
Ans: Yes, the 2700mAh battery can be removed by the user.
5.What comes in the box?
Ans: In the box you will get the device, charger, earphone & a user manual.

Overview: Karbonns Machone Titanium S310 is a budget smartphone which is available exclusively on Snapdeal. It is priced close to Karbonns Android One device, the Sparkle V.
Key Features:
It sports a 4.7 inches display with 720p resolution. It has a great PPI of 313 which would make reading a joy on the Titanium S310.
A 8MP camera at the back is a rare sight for a budget phone, and the pictures will be sharp if not great due to the high megapixels count.
It houses the same 1.3GHz Quad-core processor and 1GB RAM which was seen on the Karbonn Sparkle V and the Titanium S25.
8GB internal storage with 32GB expandable memory via a microSD card slot.
There is an 1800mAh battery which is removable and should give half a day battery life with rough usage considering it is also running a heavy Karbonn skin on top of Android 4.4 KitKat.
Alternatives:
Karbonn Sparkle V
Micromax Canvas A1
Motorola Moto E 2nd Gen 3G

The Karbonn Smart A12 Star is a budget smartphone from Karbonn. It is a dual SIM device and the design looks like a mash up from other devices. The front design and home button looks like its borrowed from Apple devices and the back is inspired from the Galaxy Note 3.

The Smart A12 Star has a 4 inch display with a resolution of 480x800 pixels with a pixel density of 233PPI. The phone is powered by a 1.2 GHz Dual-Core processor and has 512MB of RAM. The phone has a 5 megapixel camera with an LED flash and a front facing VGA camera. The device runs Android 4.4 Kitkat which is the most recent version of the OS. The device comes with 4GB of internal memory and is expandable via a MicroSD card slot. The battery is rated at 1400mAh which isnt adequate for a device with such specifications
The Aqua Style III is a budget offering by Intex which packs in decent specifications and features at this price range. Let's see what the phone has to offer its users.
Intex lately launched the Aqua trend lite in its portfolio that caters to the sub Rs. 5,000 market. The phone comes with the most basic set of specs with no fancy features.
Design & Display: Intex Aqua Trend Lite comes with a plastic body & feels thick at 11.5mm. On the front you will see a 5-inch display with a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 196PPI. The small display makes it easy to use single handed but the thickness might be a concern for some.
Hardware & Features: There is a MediaTek MT6737 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.25GHz with Mali-T720 MP2 GPU. Only 1GB of RAM is a bummer as it would result in the best multi-tasking experience. In terms of software, the phone runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box.
Camera & Storage: On the front of the device you will find a basic 2MP camera, whereas on the rear there is a 5MP sensor that can shoot videos up to 720P. And you get 8GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 128GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery & Connectivity: To power the device you get 2600mAh battery which is user replaceable. Intex Aqua Trend Lite is a Dual SIM device that supports 4G LTE network in India & also supports Jio network via the VoLTE feature.

Introduction:: Intex Cloud Cube is a dual SIM device that was launched in December 2015. Cast screen special function, slow motion video capture, and good storage capacity are its highlights.
Display and Design:

Intex Cloud Cube comes with a 4.5 inch LCD touchscreen display, FWVGA TN display, 854 x 480 pixels screen resolution and pixel density of 218PPI. It has a dimension of 135 x 66 x 9.5 mm. Its weight is 105 grams. It is available in 2 colours, White and Grey.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device comes with 1.2GHz quad-core Spreadtrum 7731 processor, 512MB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System. Assistant sensor and gravity sensor are in-built. Other features include Google Play Store, calculator, backup and restore, Gmail, calendar, clock, FM radio, note, voice search. Applications like Matrabhasha, FOTA, Intex Play, Opera Mini, Intex Service, Follo, Newshunt, Clean Master, Quikr VAS Applications are pre-installed.
Camera and Storage:

Intex Cloud Cube is loaded with a 2MP rear and 0.3MP VGA front camera. Camera features include HDR, capture image during recording, volume up/down key for capturing image and slow motion video recording. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB using a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a removable Li-ion battery of 2000mAh capacity that lets the users a standby time of up to 150 hours and a talk time of nearly 5 hours. Connectivity options include tethering, portable hotspot, 5 pin ports, Bluetooth, HSDPA/Edge/GPRS/WAP, AGPS and 802.11b/g/n Wi-Fi.
Competition:

Intex Cloud Cube can face direct competition from Lava A48, Panasonic T30 and Micromax Bolt Supreme 2 as these 3 are available in same price range with somewhat similar features. All these 3 have smaller screen, lower battery capacity but high pixel density than Intex Cloud Cube.

Overview: The Alcatel Idol Mini is only available as the Dual SIM variant in India. The device comes with 8GB of internal memory with 5.6GB available to the user. The single SIM variant has a MicroSD expansion slot which is missing from the Dual SIM variant. The phone has a 4.3 inch display with 480 x 854 pixels of resolution taking the pixel density to 228PPI.

The processor on the phone is a 1.3GHz Dual-core processor with 512MB RAM. It has a 5 megapixel camera capable of 720p video recording. The phone runs Android 4.2 JellyBean out of the box and comes with a 1700mAh battery.
Karbonn Titanium S320 is an Android smart phone priced under Rs 5,000. This one would go down as an affordable smartphone with Whatsapp & web capabilities.
Zen Mobiles launched the Admire Unity in November 2017. This device offers multiple regional languages & is aimed at first time smartphone users. Let’s look at what the phone offers:
FAQs: 1. Will this phone work with Reliance Jio network?
Ans: Yes, the Zen Admire Unity comes with VoLTE connection so using Reliance Jio shouldn’t be an issue
2. Does the phone have a Hybrid second slot?
Ans: No, the device offers two slots for sim card & one slot for microSD card.
3. How is the camera for selfies?
Ans: It has a 2MP front camera so expect decent image quality for selfies.
4. Is the battery removable?
Ans: Yes, the user can remove the phone’s battery.
5. What type of charging connector do I need?
Ans: You need a standard Micro USB port for charging.

Overview: HTC Desire 510 is the Taiwanese companys addition to the Desire line up. This series by HTC has phones that can be categorized under the budget and mid-range segment. The Desire 510 is the cheapest 4G enabled HTC phone in the market.
Key Features:
The 4.7 inch display is capable of a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels which is disappointing as the phones under this price range now comes with higher resolution displays.

HTC Desire 510 is not a unibody design, and you can remove the back cover and the battery. It has rounded edges which is similar to the Desire 610 or even the Desire 820. But it is much sleeker than these two and thus it would fit comfortably in hands. Thumbs can easily reach the top of the screen which seems impossible today with bigger phones.
The phone comes with Android 4.4 KitKat which is skinned by HTCs Sense UI. The UI is arguably one of the nicest Android skins which does not come with much of a bloatware.

It comes with Snapdragon 410 Quad core processor which is clocked at 1.2GHz. Navigating the OS in general should be pretty fast and things will take the right turn as soon as this device gets a Lollipop update, as the 410 processor has a 64 bit architecture.
The rear camera is a 5 megapixel unit which sounds really low for the price.

There is a microSD card slot underneath the removable back cover and the user has to use it because there is only 8GB built-in out of which 4.25GB is user available. On the flip-side, the expansion storage will accept a whopping 256GB memory card.
It is available in Terra White and Meridian Grey.
Alternatives:
Yu Yureka
Lenovo A7000

Karbonn A5 is a smartphone from Karbonn brand A series. The smartphone supports both 2G and 3G network. It is a dual SIM smartphone. The display size is 320 x 480 pixels, 3.2 inches with display type TFT capacitive touchscreen, 256K colors. The smartphone has a very little internal memory space of 512MB but provides an external memory slot that is expandable up to 32GB (microSD card) and a measly 256MB RAM. The phone sports a primary camera 3.15 MP, 2048x1536 pixels, and a VGA quality secondary camera. The inbuilt OS offered by Karbonn A5 is the ageing Android OS v2.3 (Gingerbread) with CPU speed of 1GHz. The phone also provides with Accelerometer sensor. Li-Ion 1200 mAh battery is used in this smartphone which should be sufficient, given the low-end hardware.

Celkon A63 is a Dual SIM budget phone which got launched in August 2013. It is powered by 1.2GHz Dual-core processor, 256MB RAM and 512MB internal memory which can be maximised up to 32GB with the help of microSD card. It features Android 4.2 Jelly Bean. It sports a 4-inches 800x480 pixel resolution screen. Celkon A63 has a 3.2MP rear-facing camera (for comparison  Celkon A62 has 8MP auto-focus camera) with a 0.3MP VGA front camera which allows user to video call. 3G connectivity is absent here but Bluetooth, GPRS and WiFi connections are enabled. It has a 1500mAh battery.

Intex Technologies, incepted in the year 1996 is an Indian Mobile, IT accessories and Consumer Durables Company. The Intex i4 Plus was launched three months after the Intex i4 and both have very similar specs. But, the i4 Plus is priced lesser. The key features of the device are 
5 inch display with the resolution of 854x480 pixels
Below average 195 PPI pixel density
Dual SIM
Comes with 512 MB RAM and runs on a 1.2GHz, Dual Core processor
4GB of internal storage is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 8MP, 1.3MP front facing camera
Powered by a 2000mAh battery which is removable
Alternatives
Spice Dream Uno
Micromax Canvas A1

Xolo Q500 is an entry-level Quad-core Android smartphone. It has a 4-inches Display (800x480 pixels) with a pixel density of 233PPI, which is decent enough for such a phone. OGS (One Glass Solution) technology has been used for in this device. There is a 1.2GHz Quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 200 processor. For multi-tasking, there is 1GB RAM on-board (which should be sufficient to run multiple apps simultaneously). The Quad-core processor is supported by a decent Adreno 203 graphic chipset. Overall, the hardware is more than sufficient for everyday use. The 4GB internal memory can be expanded upto 32GB by using a microSD card.

It has a 5 megapixel rear camera with LED flash. It can record 720p HD videos. There is a VGA front facing camera for video calling. It runs on an older Android v4.1 Jelly Bean. There are no UI overlays. It is a Dual-SIM smartphone and supports 3G Connectivity, Bluetooth and GPS. There is a 1450mAh battery, which might not be able to juice this device for a day. This phone should give the popular Moto E a run for its money in some aspects.

Introduction:: IT1507 is an entry level smartphone which was  launched with dual SIM, good memory, good camera and some vivid control features like geo-tagging, face detection, panorama and touch focus. It is one of the most slimmest devices by ITEL.
Display and Design:: The phone has a 5 inch touchscreen display with resolution at 480 x 854 pixels having a pixel density of 196PPI. The screen is IPS capacitive touchscreen with multitouch. Phone is available in Black and Silver. It has size dimensions of  144 x 72.5 x 8.5 mm. The phone runs on Android 5.1 version (Lollipop).
Hardware & Features:: The IT1507 is powered by 1.2GHz quad core processor and comes with 512MB of RAM. Other features include fast battery charging, active noise cancellation, video editing and document viewer.
Camera & Storage:: The IT1507 offers a primary camera of 5MP and front camera of 2MP for selfie shooters. It has an internal storage of 8GB and can be expanded up to 32GB with micro SD card.
Battery & Connectivity:: The IT1507 has a 2400mAh Li-ion battery with 250 hours standby and 8 hours of regular talktime. The phone offers dual SIM facility. Typical sensors include proximity, ambient light, and accelerometer which are present in the phone. Apart from that these essentials, the phone also offers connectivity through bluetooth 4.0, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, 3G HSPA+, FM and USB support.
Overview: There are other options likeInfocus Bingo 10 andLYF Flame 8 that are providing higher RAM. Bingo phone also has good memory expandability than other phones. However, when comparing prices, IT1507 provides the best features at the desired price point.

Introduction:: The Gionee P5 Mini was launched in April 2016 with Amigo 3.1 User Interface, dual-SIM feature, and storage expansion of up to 32GB as a budget device.
Display and Design:: The device has an IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen with 16M colors. The resolution is 854 x 480 pixels and 4.5 inch display screen. The handset is available in black, blue and white color variants. The phone weighs 153 grams.
Hardware and Features:: Gionee P5 Mini has a Mediatek MT6580M chipset, 1 GB RAM and a quad-core 1.3GHz CPU using the Mali-400 MP2 GPU. Some built-in features are ambient light sensor, gyroscope, proximity sensor, and accelerometer. The device is pre-loaded with apps like Facebook, WhatsApp, WPS Office, Clean Master, 360 Security Lite and Touch Pal.
Camera and Storage:: The phone has a 5MP primary camera with autofocus, LED flash and 2MP secondary camera. The device has 8GB internal memory that can be expanded up to 32GB with SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: The device consists of a removable Li-Ion 1800 mAh battery and has a long standby time of up to 237 hours. It is 3G enabled and provides connectivity through Bluetooth and WI-Fi options. It has dual SIM facility and both slots allow 2G and 3G SIMs.
Competition:: Other competing Smartphones includeAsus Zenfone Go 4.5 andSony Xperia tipo. These phones have similar features but Gionee P5 Mini stands out among competition as the most affordable phone with the desired specifications.

Overview: The LG Optimus L5 II Dual E455 is an upper-entry-level handset from the Korean manufacturer. It has a 4.0-inch 800 x 480 pixel IPS display. This Android 4.1 Jelly Bean smartphone is powered by a single-core 1GHz Mediatek 6575 chip coupled with 512MB of RAM and 4GB internal memory (out of which, a little less than half is available to the user). It supports 3G speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps and has WiFi/Bluetooth connectivity as well. There's a 5 megapixel auto-focus camera at the back which records video in relatively-low VGA resolution, but at a smooth 30 frames per second. There is FM Radio, Dual SIM support and a comparatively big 1700 mAh battery providing juice to this phone.

The Earth 1 is the elder brother to LYF Water 1 with a bigger display and battery from LYF. The brand much known for pioneering a series of phones with VoLTE support in India to compliment their Jio Network.
Here are the specifications of LYF Earth 1:
The device has a good 5.5 inch Full HD (1920x1080 pixels) resolution with a pixel density of 401PPI.
On the inside is the  Qualcomm Snapdragon 615 Octa Core chip clocked at 1.5GHz and has 2GB of RAM.
Behind sits a 13MP camera with an LED Flash and on the front is a 5MP shooter for those selfies.
The device supports Dual SIMs (Micro+Nano), both of which are 4G capable.
LYF devices have been made well to work with Reliance Jio network.
In terms of storage the device has 32GB internal storage that can be expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
The LYF Earth 1 runs on Android Lollipop (5.1) out of the box.
The device has a massive 3500mAh removable battery life.

Intex India has launched several devices in the sub 5000 segment. While many of the previous phones didn’t even support 4G LTE, these new phones do have 4G LTE support and are also VoLTE enabled which is now a must, thanks to Reliance Jio.
Design and Display: Intex Aqua Craze is a decent looking device with handy form factor, however considering the price segment do not expect anything fancy but a plasticky build. And thanks to the 5 inch display, the phone feels quite handy and can be used easily with single hand. The 5 inch display has got a resolution of 1280x720 (HD) pixels giving it a pixel density of 294PPI and we do not have any sort of protection over the display.
Hardware and Features: Coming to what sits underneath the Intex Aqua Craze, is a MediaTek MT6735P Quad Core chipset clocked at 1GHz and paired with is 1GB of RAM. And on the software end, the device runs on Android 5.1 Lollipop out of the box and no future software update is expected. Besides, the phone does not have any exceptional feature worth mentioning.
Camera and Storage: On the back of the device we have a 8MP camera along with an LED Flash whereas on the front we have a very basic 2MP camera. On the storage front, Intex Aqua Craze comes with 8GB of onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: To power the device, there is a 2500mAh battery which might just last you through the day. Besides, the phone accepts Dual Micro SIMs and supports 4G LTE Indian bands with VoLTE out of the box. You also get the standard Bluetooth and WiFi with Intex Aqua Craze.

Overview: Following the previously launched Asha 501, Nokia has launched Asha 500, in a bid to expand the Asha series. The fresh look that Nokia has added to the phone is the ice layer of transparent polycarbonate. Beneath it we can see the colourful bright colored covers available in yellow, red, green, black, white and cyan. It has a few cool features like taking a photo with a single swipe and sharing it on social network with a single tap. The Fastlane multi-tasking feature of Nokia phone can now be customized to protect privacy. This phone is cheaper than Asha 501 and so some of the features are lacking in it. It has a 2.8 inch screen which is .2 smaller than Asha 501. It has 2MP camera which is lesser than Asha 501s 3.15MP camera. It supports 2G and WiFi for internet access. It is available in Dual SIM along with Single SIM variant.
Introduction:

LYF mobiles a brand under Reliance Retail has launched a range of smartphones that support the 4G as well as VoLTE on the Reliance Jio Network. The Wind 4 is one of LYF’s cheaper offerings and comes good specifications.
Design & Design: The LYF Wind 4 has a 5 inch display with a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels. The phone has a pixel density of 294 PPI and is an LCD panel. The phone supports 5 finger multi touch
Hardware & Features: The phone is powered by a Snapdragon 210 processor which is a Quad Core processor clocked at 1.1GHz. The phone has 1GB of RAM onboard and the phone runs on Android 5.1.1 with some customizations by LYF on top.
Camera & Storage: The LYF Wind 4 has an 8 megapixel autofocus camera at the back and 2 megapixel fixed camera on the front for selfies. The rear camera is aided by an LED flash and can record videos in 720p. The storage on the phone is around 8GB which may be less if you store a lot of music and games on the device. Thankfully the device gets a MicroSD card slot that accepts cards up to 128GB.
Battery & Connectivity: Battery is one of the strengths of this phone as it packs in a massive 4000mAh battery. The phone can easily last 2 days with the battery as the processor isn’t a power hog. In terms of connectivity the phone comes with Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity.

Overview: Karbonn Titanium series continues to bring good specifications along with affordable price to its Android line-up. The S205 is a phone that competes with likes of Micromax & Lava.

The Ace 3 is much needed update to the Ace 2. The Ace 3 has a slight increase in screen size (4.0 inches from 3.8 inches) than its predecessor. The resolution remains the same at 480x800 (WVGA) pixels. It comes with a dual core 1.0GHz processor. While the camera (5MP) and battery (1500 mAh) life remain unchanged, the phone will run on Android 4.2. It also comes with 4GB internal memory and 1GB RAM. This phone didn't launch in India. You can check out Samsungs Galaxy S Duos 2 or Galaxy Core its place.

HSL Y303 is a budget Android smartphone, primarily aimed at those who are looking to convert from feature phone to smartphone for the first time. Launched just under the Rs 3,000 mark, the phone is the perfect entry point for someone who has never used an Android before and wants an experience but at a budget. A diminutive display, old Android version and limited RAM means, the phone is not going to be a great exhibition of true capabilities of Android.
The latest addition to the Wind series of smartphones by the brand LYF is the Wind 7s. This phone offers quite basic specs for people looking to use it for Reliance Jio network.
Design & Display: LYF Wind 7s features a plastic body & has an handy design with a small 5-inch display with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels. The phone feels quite thick at 8.7mm & comes in two colours black & blue. The display does not have Gorilla Glass protection.
Hardware & Features: This phone runs on Qualcomm's Snapdragon 210 quad core processor that is clocked at 1.3GHz combined with it is Adreno 304 GPU. You also get 2GB RAM which sounds fair for the price. It runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with near-stock UI. Sadly, you do not get fingerprint sensor.
Camera & Storage: Rear of the device you get an 8MP sensor with an LED Flash & can record videos up to 720p only. For selfies & video calling you have a 5MP sensor. You also get internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded up to 128GB more via a MicroSD card.
Battery & Connectivity: To power this device you get 2250mAh battery that is user replaceable & might not last you through the day. See phones with better battery in this price range here. And in terms of connectivity, the phones accepts Dual SIMs & is 4G supported with VoLTE enabled for Reliance Jio network.

Overview: Powered by 1.3Ghz Quad Core Cortex A7 processor and 1GB of RAM
5 inch IPS display based on one glass solution (OGS) technology, 720p HD resolution and a good 294 PPI
4GB Internal Storage (only approx. 500MB user available), expandable upto 32GB via a microSD card
12 MP auto-focus rear camera that records Full HD videos, and a decent 2MP front camera
Android Jelly Bean 4.2.2 (Upgradable to Kitkat)
Features like auto call recording, flip to mute, dial from SMS and contact directly, shake to answer, Voice capture in camera, smart answer
Dual SIM support
Removable 1750mAh battery
Box bundled with 3 Changeable Battery Covers of red, blue and color
Alternative
Asus Zenfone 5 8GB A500CG
Xolo Q1011
Karbonn Titanium S192

Introduction:: LYF Wind 4S is a dual SIM device that was launched in October 2016. Superb design, easy and comfortable grip, gesture motion control, DTSTM powered speakers and USB OTG support are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

LYF Wind 4s comes with 5.5 inch LCD touch screen display, 1280 x 720 pixels resolution and 293.72PPI pixel density. It is available in 3 colours including, Blue, Brown and Black. It has a dimension of 144.7 x 73 x 9 mm and its weight is 148 grams.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is equipped with 1.1GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 210 processor, 2GB RAM and Android. By assigning any of the six letters of M, C, E, O, W to the apps of your choice, you can access them with ease. Gravity sensor, light sensor, E-compass and proximity sensor are in-built. Various gestures like double click to wake, slide up to unlock, slide down to launch camera, slide left to choose app, slide right to open messages and standby screen are available.
Camera and Storage:

LYF Wind 4S is built with 8MP rear camera with autofocus and LED flash and 5MP front camera. It has an internal storage of 16GB that can be expanded to 128GB by using a micro SD card. However, one can use only 11.56GB of this internal space for storage.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 4000mAh battery that provides a talk time of up to 343 hours on 4G network and a standby time of up to 634 hours. Users get nearly 11 hours of video playback time and up to 42 hours of audio playback time. Users can enjoy connectivity via 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio).
Competition:
LYF Wind 4S faces competition from Panasonic Eluga Icon. It has a lower battery capacity than LYF Wind 4S.

Overview: Intex, the Indian manufacturer has launched a new device in the under Rs. 5,000 category. Intex Aqua Q8 is a good device for the price but lacks some must have support & features.
Design & Specs: Intex Aqua Q8 has an all plastic body that feels the same but is acceptable considering the price. Looks nothing special but has an very ordinary & standard design. The 4.5-inch display on the top has a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 218PPI. And there is not layer of Gorilla Glass protection on the display.
Hardware & Features: The phone has a Spreadtrum SC7731C Quad Core chipset that is paired with Mail-400 GPU. And there is just 1GB of RAM which is acceptable for the price but might not be the best option for multitasking. On the software front, it runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box. Besides these basics, there are no other options.
Camera & Storage: The 5MP sensor on the back sounds very basic but has an LED Flash to be used when low lighting. On the front of the phone, you get an even worse 0.3MP camera. In terms of storage, you have 8GB of onboard storage of which just 5.9GB is available for the user to install apps & store data. Storage can also be expanded up to 32GB more via a MicroSD card.
Connectivity & Battery: Intex Aqua Q8 is a Dual SIM device but does not support 4G LTE network. Due to which you won't be able to use Reliance Jio network. And to juice up the device, there is a 1650mAh battery that is user removable.

Introduction:: Intex Aqua 3G Pro is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2015. The phone has a lightweight compact design with brushed metal finish and has lots of useful pre-installed apps.
Display and Designs:: It comes with a 4 inch TFT touchscreen display with 800 x 480 pixels resolution, 16.7M colours and pixel density of 233.2PPI. This dual SIM device comes with a dimension of 125.2 x 63.3 x 10 mm and it weighs 107.6 grams. It is available in Champagne, Silver and Brushed Black colours.
Hardware and Features:: Intex Aqua 3G Pro is loaded with 1GHz Spreadtrum SC7715 processor, Android KitKat 4.4.2 operating system and 512MB RAM. Some apps like Opera Mini, Ask Me, Newshunt, Intex Zone, Intex Play, QuickOffice, Intex Service are pre-installed. Other features include FM Radio, Intex Zone, Auto Call Record, Google Play Store and FM recording LED flash. Pre-loaded instant messaging option is available. Proximity sensor, ambient light sensor, accelerometer, and gyroscope are also available.
Camera and Storage:: This dual SIM device has a 2MP rear camera with flash and 0.3MP VGA front camera. Intex Aqua 3G Pro comes with an internal storage of 4GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: It has a Li-ion battery of 1400mAh that provides the users with a talk time of 3.5 hours on 3G networks and standby time of 180 hours. Automatic power management facility is available.
Users can enjoy connectivity through 3G, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, micro USB, A-GPS and Wi-Fi Hotspot. This dual SIM device takes in 2 regular SIM.
Competition:: Intex Aqua 3G Pro can face direct competition fromMicromax Canvas Spark 2 Plus,Karbonn A6 Turbo as these are available with somewhat similar features in the same price range. The specifications are most similar to Karbonn mobile but have higher processor and latest operating system. Micromax Canvas has slightly higher speed processor, more RAM, more storage and better camera but these features come at an increased price.

Overview: The Indian technology firm iBall, has added another device to its Andi series. The new member added to this family is Andi5-E7, which is an entry level phablet for those consumers who are looking for a huge screen on the cheap. The Andi5 E7 sports a 5-inch TFT ( 854 X 480 pixels) display, with a mediocre pixel density of 196PPI. The dual-SIM smartphone is powered by a 1.3GHz dual-core Cortex A7 processor coupled with 512MB RAM (the RAM in this device is just bearable and might result in lags along when used heavily).

The device has a 5 megapixel camera with flashlight. Unfortunately it lacks a secondary camera and HD recording. The phone comes with features such as Bluetooth, WiFi and GPS. But it lacks 3G connectivity which other companies offer at this price segment. The device runs on Android v4.2 and has 4GB internal memory which can be expanded to 32GB using a memory card. The smartphone is fuelled by a 1850mAh battery. This phone is competing with a ton of inexpensive phablets from Indian phone makers like Micromax, Karbonn etc.

The Indian smartphone manufacturer competes with the likes of the brands Micromax, Karbonn, Xiaomi, Lava, etc. and has been coming up with phones that offer good value for money. The Intex Aqua 4.5E looks like a decent attempt for those while to switch from a feature phone to a smartphone considering the price at which it is being offered. Check below some of the features of the device:

Another of Karbonns mid range offerings, the A9 features a 4 inch, WVGA (800*480 pixels), IPS, multi touch display. Powered by a 1.2 GHz ARM Cortex-A5, Dual Core processor the device runs Android v4 (Ice Cream Sandwich) and could be upgradeable to Jelly Bean in the not too distant future. This GSM+GSM Dual SIM handset supports 3G and gets dual cameras as well. The rear 5 megapixel autofocus camera can also record videos in HD while the front camera can be used for video and skype calling in 1.3 megapixel resolutions. The Karbonn A9 features 3GB of internal memory as well as a slot for adding micro SD cards of up to 32 Gb capacity. The A9 is powered by a larg-ish 1420 mAh battery that on paper offers the end user a talk time of 11 hrs (2G) and 6 hrs (3G). The standby time is rated at 300 hrs on 2G and 260 hrs on 3G.

Pune-based cellphone company Swipe, which is known for launching budget Android smartphones, has launched an affordable smartphone — the Swipe Elite 2 Plus. With this launch, Swipe has further extended its Elite series in India.

The Asha series has seemed to appeal to those people who are looking for a basic touch-phone which can run Whatsapp. Yes, even this phone supports Whatsapp even though technically it can be called a non-smartphone. Going by specs, the phone features a 2.8 inches screen with a resolution of 320x240 pixels, which boils down to a low pixel density of 143PPI but is acceptable for a phone of this price. It runs a touch-optimised version of the classic Series 40 interface, so you need not frown at the hardware specifications like the unmentioned processor name and the paltry-sounding 64MB RAM. For storage, there is hardly any internal memory but there is a microSD card slot which supports upto 32GB memory cards.

This handy device has a 1.3 Megapixel camera but lacks a flash. Apart from Whatsapp, the phone even offers Facebook, Twitter, LINE and WeChat. It has Radio and a music player. The drawbacks of this device are that it is a Single-SIM phone, lacks WiFi and 3G connectivity. So only 2G data connection can be used to connect your phone to the internet. Moreover, it supports a Micro-SIM. It is available in six colours- Black, White, Red, Green, Cyan and Yellow. If you seek features like WiFi, then check out the Asha 501 which costs a little more.

The Nokia Asha 201 is a low end, Series 40 powered handset that is quite similar to its sibling, the Asha 200. Both the handsets are visually similar and the only difference between the two is that the Asha 200 is a dual SIM capable device while the 201 doesn't get that capability. The Asha 201 gets a 320*240 pixel, 2.4 inch display and comes with an internal memory of 10 MB. As this being grossly inadequate, the phone supports microSD cards of up to 32 GB in size. The phone also gets a basic 2 megapixel camera which can also capture videos at basic QCIF resolution at a measly 10 fps. But the main highlight of the Asha 201 is  this is one of the cheapest phones to support WhatsApp. Yup, WhatsApp is selectively available for certain Series 40 handsets from Nokia.

The Nokia 500 was released in August 2011. The phone is powered by a 1GHz processor for fast browsing and runs on Symbian OS. The phone has a 3.2 inch, high resolution capacitive touch screen. It comes with 2GB of internal memory expandable up to 32GB through a microSD slot which is provided.

It is loaded with a 5MP full focus camera with 4x digital zoom. A music player and stereo FM radio are also built in, with video recording. It also has Bluetooth, USB, 3G and WiFi support. It comes with A-GPS with Nokia Maps application.

Introduction:: Lava A72 is a dual SIM device that was launched in April 2016. Video PIP, audio picture, auto call recording, smart music, smart gestures and support for 12 Indian languages are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Lava A72 comes with 5 inch LCD touch screen capacitive IPS display, Corning Gorilla glass screen protector, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 293.72PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 145.5 x 72 x 8.45 mm and its weight is 141 grams. It is available in Blue Silver and White Gold colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.3GHz quad-core processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System that can be upgraded to Android 6.0 Marshmallow and 1GB RAM. Ambient light sensor, Hall Effect sensor and accelerometer are in-built. Conference Call, Call Recorder, and Flip to Mute are available.
Camera and Storage:

Lava A72 is loaded with 5MP rear camera and 5MP front camera. Other camera features include dual LED flash, geo tagging and panorama. Users can record HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a 2500mAh Li-Po removable battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 13 hours on 2G networks and up to 11 hours on 2G networks. Users can play music for nearly 26 hours 14 minutes in earphone mode in full volume. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 2 micro SIM cards.
Competition:
Lava A72 faces competition from Xolo Era 1X. Xolo Era 1X has a higher rear camera and slower processor than Lava A72.

Overview: The Nokia C2-00 boasts of a dual GSM SIM and a 1.8 inch TFT display with 128xÃÂ160 pixels screen resolution. Also packed in the phone is an MP3 player, Stereo FM radio, VGA camera, memory expandable upto 32GB and USB. It comes with simple looks and a sleek candy bar design at an attractive price. It is available in three colors.

Asha 502 is a slightly better version of Asha 500 and Asha 501. The Fastlane feature is now customizable to only show apps that you want. Also, you can see the Facebook updates and access Twitter easily. The phone will be available in six bright colors namely yellow, red, green, cyan, black and white. The body is covered with a transparent polycarbonate covering. It has added few cool features like taking a photo with a single swipe and sharing it on social network with a single tap. Asha 502 is bigger than the Asha 500 as its screen size is 3 inches. In the camera department, Nokia sure has improved its standards in this Asha range. The Asha 502 has a 5MP camera along with LED Flash to aid low-light photography, which was missing in Asha 500 and 501. The switching of SIM cards is quite easy and what makes this phone more better is that it remembers the last five SIM configurations. It doesnt come in single SIM variant. It supports 2G and WiFi for internet. This phone is a tad costlier than Asha 500.

Introduction:: V40HD smartphone was launched by Videocon as an entry phone for new mobile users that comes with 3G connectivity and Android v4.4 (KitKat) operating system.
Display and Design:: The phone has a 4 inch touchscreen display with resolution at 480 x 800 pixels having a pixel density of 220PPI. The device weighs 124 grams. The screen is TFT capacitive touchscreen and the phone’s dimensions are 62 x 118.2 x 10.6 mm.
Hardware & Features:: V40HD is powered by 1GHz single core processor and it comes with 256MB of RAM. The phone runs on Android v4.4 (KitKat). The dedicated GPU can enhance your video watching and gaming performance.
V40HD offers 3.2MP rear and 0.3MP front facing camera. The camera features are autofocus, LED flash, panorama, video calling. It has storage of 512MB and can be expanded up to 32GB with microSD Card.
Battery & Connectivity:: V40 HD has a 1400mAh Li-ion Battery. The phone offers dual SIM features. Available mobile network bands in this phone are GSM 850 / 900 / 1800 / 1900 MHz for 2G, HSDPA 850 / 900 / 1900 / 2100 MHz for 3G network. For connectivity and sharing, the phone has Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, dual-band and micro USB port. It also has A-GPS receiver for location positioning. Sensors on the phone include proximity sensor, ambient light sensor, accelerometer and gyroscope.
Competition:: In this price range, it has competitors like Micromax Bolt S301 and Intex Aqua Ring. Intex phone has a higher RAM, more storage, better processor, greater battery capacity, better camera and latest Android OS but it comes with a significant differential pricing.

Overview: Intex Aqua Y2 Pro is a reasonably priced smartphone from Intex. It is a dual-SIM device that is running on Android 4.4.2 KitKat. It surprisingly sports good specifications for the price its being offered.
Here is a quick feature tour:
The Aqua Y2 Pro has a 4.5inch FWVGA screen with 480p resolution. Because of the display size, the phone fits easily in one hand.
It sports a 5 megapixels camera with flash and a secondary 0.3MP camera.
