Dual SIM with 3G capability with WiFi and FM radio makes it a complete package for a youth oriented device.
4GB of built-in storage is present and the storage can be expanded with a microSD card slot with up to 32GB of memory.
It is powered by 1GHz Dual-core processor and 1GB of RAM. These are good only if you plan not to multitask a lot.
Battery is rated at 1600mAh and seems adequate for a day worth usage.
Alternatives:
Karbonn Sparkle A1
Micromax Unite A092
Asus Zenfone 4

The Nokia 3310 is a classic phone by the Finnish brand. After many years, Nokia decided to revisit the past and introduce the highly popular feature phone. Let's see the specifications and features of the Nokia 3310.
Samsungs Metro series encapsulates low-end devices from the company. Samsung Metro 360 SM is the best offering in the metro series with a fast processor and a good display.
Lets take a look at this device:
It has a 2.4inches 240 x 320 (QVGA) resolution TFT display that has a PPI of 167. There is a photo gallery and camera that could make use of the good display.
There is a microSD card slot that can be used to add 16GB of storage. Internal storage is rather less at 128MB and would be used for contacts and messages storage.
Built-in camera has is rated at 3.1mp and will click average images. There is no flashlight that could be used as a torch light, like other feature phones commonly offer.
It also has bluetooth v3.0 for file transfers and paring to a bluetooth headset.
It is a dual SIM device and houses a 1000 mAh battery that would last more than 12 hours with average usage.
Alternatives:
Nokia Asha 500
Nokia 220
The Cloud X12 is a phone from the Indian smartphone maker Intex Technologies. The phone is targeted at the entry level mobile segment. The Intex Cloud X12 has the following features

This is a good looking candy bar phone which boasts a 2.8 inch screen. It is a Dual-SIM phone (GSM+GSM). It features a 2 megapixel rear camera without flash. The phone lacks 3G connectivity and WiFi but internet can be accessed using cellular data. Unfortunately, the device does not support Whatsapp but Facebook and Twitter are available. There is a microSD card slot which supports memory cards upto 32GB. Songs can be played via the music player and radio. Images and songs can be shared using Bluetooth. It is available in many colours  white, black, red and yellow.

The LG Optimus L4 II Dual is LGs offering in the budget segment. As the name suggests its a Dual SIM phone ( Dual standby). The SIM 1 slot supports the 3G bands while the 2nd slot is strictly 2G. The phone has a 3.8 inch Display with a resolution of 320x480 which translates to a 152 PPI pixel density screen. The screen is a letdown in terms of resolution, even cheaper phones like the Karbonn A35 have a qHD display. The phone comes with a 3.15 megapixel camera and has LED flash, secondary camera has been excluded. ?

The device houses a 1GHz Cortex A9 processor with 512MB RAM to support its operation. The phone has 4 GB of inbuilt memory with a microSD slot that supports cards up to 32GB. The phone comes pre-installed with Android Jelly Bean (4.1.2). The OS is outdated and with only 512MB RAM, the possibilities of the phone receiving the further updates is low. The Moto E is the best all rounder in this segment.

The Nokia X2-02 was released in December 2011. The phone has a candy bar design. It has memory expandable upto 32GB with hot swap feature. Also, it has a music player and stereo FM radio. It has Easy Swap feature, which enables swapping of SIM cards while the phone is switched on. The phone also has support for social networking apps.

Intro:: Lenovo A1000 model was released in September 2015. This stylish Lenovo smartphone offers exhaustive features including certain useful pre-loaded apps with high speed connecting at a low price point.
Display and Design:: The phone has a 4 inch screen display. It weighs 132 grams and provides a sturdy hold. This is a pocket friendly mobile phone that has a curved back cover providing a good hand grip. It has multi-touch capacitive touchscreen with 800 x 480 pixels resolution. The phone is available in two colors including Pearl White and Onyx Black.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM phone uses an Android v5 Lollipop operating system powered by a 1.35 GHz quad-core  Spreadtrum SC7731 processor with Cortex-A7 with Mali-400MP2 GPU. This smartphone has a pre-installed HTML browser and various sensors like accelerometer sensors. The phone has some useful pre-loaded applications like SHAREit, CLONEit and SYNCit used for sharing files, restoring contacts, backing up messages and managing call logs.
Camera and Storage:: The phone has an integrated rear camera of 5MP and 0.3MP front camera. In addition, the LED flash captures vibrant, sharp photos and videos. It also allows video chatting through front camera. The phone is packed with 8GB internal storage which is expandable up to 32GB by inserting a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: The phone is powered by a removable Li-Po 2000 MAH battery. This 3G enabled Lenovo A1000 has HSPA+ connectivity and provides a high download speed of 21Mbps  allowing one to speedily download videos, music and movies. It can be connected through Wi-Fi, GPS, and Bluetooth.
Competition:: Introducing its A1000 model, Lenovo has given a tough competition to Motorola Moto E (2nd Gen). In the less price compared to Moto E 2nd Gen, Lenovo has provided almost all the features in A1000.

Overview: Intel surprised all with it chose Lava to launch its Intel Atom based Android smartphone in 2012. After the X900, Intel is following up with the Lava Xolo X500 that runs its Atom Lexington Z2420 chip that is targeted at low cost smarpthones. The X500 sports a basic 3.5" full touchscreen with a resolution of 480x320, a 5MP camera, 512MB of RAM and 4GB of internal memory. The X500 also allows MicroSD expansion. Lava also packs in a PowerVR SGX540 GPU in the X500.

The phone is a Dual SIM and runs on Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich. It also benefits from Intel's Hyper-Threading technology. The X500 would compete with low end Android phones like the Sony Tipo Dual.

The Nokia 101 was released as an entry level dual SIM phone. Apart from dual SIM facilities, it also has a music player and expandable memory upto 16GB. Its additional facilities include a flashlight, stereo FM radio and a speaking alarm clock. It has long battery life with a standby time of 32 days. There's a 1.8 inch colour screen and it runs on Nokia's Series 40 interface. Thanks to the 3.5mm headphone jack, you can attach a better pair of earphones if you wish. The phone has no form of wireless connectivity, not even Bluetooth, which is somewhat disappointing.

Alcatel is an international multinational company which designs, develops, and markets globally a growing range of mobile and Internet devices. The Alcatel One Touch IDOL X 6040D is a dual SIM phone, running on Android 4.2 Jelly Bean and has a 1.5 GHz MediaTek MT6589 Plus Quad-Core processor. It has a 5 inch Full HD screen. The internal 16GB storage can be expanded upto 32GB. It has a 13.1MP back camera and a 2MP front facing camera. The battery life is of 2000mAh. Another device in the similar price bracket is Alcatel Hero 8020A, that costs a little more. If price is a constraint then one can go for this phone rather than the prior.

The Karbonn A30 is the homegrown manufacturers first attempt at a full-fledged Phablet and this is among the largest screened one currently available in India. With a huge 5.9 inch display at its disposal, the A30 is even larger than the already huge Samsung Galaxy Note and hovers around the tablet category. The 5.9 inch display however has a resolution of only 800*480 pixels, resulting in a measly low 159 PPI, which will make the display look not crisp. The A30 is powered by the same SoC as the ne found on the Micromax Canvas A 110 (Dual core MT6577) clocked at 1GHz. It is supported by the PowerVR SGX 531 GPU. Adoring the rear of this handset is the 8 MP HD Primary Camera which can also capture full HD videos. There also is a 1.3 MP Secondary Camera. The handset currently runs Android v4.0.4 (Ice Cream Sandwich)  and as expected, is Dual SIM capable with one SIM supporting 3G network. The battery on this phablet is rated at 2500 mAH which again is quite a lot  but the large display may not warrant a long battery life.

The Nokia 208 is a very basic entry level handset from the Finnish phone maker. It has a typical candy-bar form factor with a num-pad for input and runs the 'non-smart' Series 40 interface. Its got a 2.4-inch QVGA (320 x 240 pixel) display and other barebones specifications. For example, the camera is just 1.3 megapixels, so can't expect great quality snaps from it. The only interesting thing about the Nokia 208 is the 3G support  it can serve internet speeds of up to 7.2 Mbps. But it is questionable how much high-speed internet will you be able to enjoy on that tiny screen in the first place; maybe tethering to a computer using the data cable would be a use-case.

The iBall Andi 4.5 K6 is a budget phone which provides Dual SIM functionality and has 3G service enabled. This smartphone sports a 4.5 inch 960x540 pixel density IPS display. iBall 4.5 K6 is powered by a dual-core 1.3GHz Cortex A7 processor that's coupled with 1GB of RAM, which should give the average user reasonable speed in the user interface. Its got 4GB of internal memory out of which only 2GB is available. To expand the memory space further, theres a microSD card provided which supports 32GB storage.

In the camera department, its got a 8MP rear facing camera which has features such as autofocus and LED flash. Theres also a front camera, enabling user to do video calls and click selfies. It runs Android 4.2 Jelly Bean. Its got a 1600mAh battery which might be a little disappointment for users with heavy usage. Like other recent iBall Andi smartphones, this phone also supports the flip to mute feature.

Introduction:: LYF Flame 7s is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. Sturdy build, textured back panel, 10 Indian languages, easy to operate interface, video pop-up feature and screen mirroring for images are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

LYF Flame 7s comes with 4 inch LCD touchscreen display, Asahi Dragontrail glass for screen protection, 800 x 480 pixels resolution and 233PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 125.6 x 63.8 x 11.5 mm and its weight is 127 grams. It is available in Black and Red colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is run by 1.5GHz quad-core Spreadtrum SC9830A processor, Android 5.1 Lollipop operating system, Mali-400 MP2 graphics and 1GB RAM. Ambient light sensor, accelerometer and proximity sensor are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

LYF Flame 7s is built with 5MP rear and 0.3MP front camera with fixed focus, 4x digital zoom and LED flash. Users can record HD videos at 720p. Anti-banding, smile shutter, white balance, panorama, face detection, metering, burst mode and HDR features and slow motion video facilities are available. It has an internal storage 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with a micro SD card. Users can use approximately 6GB of storage.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with 1800mAh Li-ion removable battery that provides a talk time of up to 6 hours on 4G network, standby time of up to 400 hours, audio playback time of nearly 7 hours and up to 4 hours of video playback time. Users can enjoy connectivity via 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth and VoLTE (Works with Jio). It takes in 1 normal SIM and 1 micro SIM card.
Competition:
LYF Flame 7s faces competition from Samsung Z2 Tizen. It has a lower battery capacity and more expandable memory than LYF Flame 7s.
Overview: 7. What comes in the box? Ans: Inside the box you get a LYF Flame 7s handset, a wall charger, a Micro USB cable and a pair of earphones.
Ans:: Yes, like all LYF phones, the Flame 7s also supports VoLTE to work with the Reliance Jio network.
Flame 7s has the standard Micro USB  port for charging and data syncing.

Overview: The Nokia 112 is yet another similar looking and similarly specÃ¢â¬â¢d sibling to the Nokia 111 and the 110. This one, announced along with the other two handsets back in May 2012, boasts of a 1.8 inch, 128*160 pixel display and support for Bluetooth 2.1 with EDR as well as memory expansion. Like the other phones in its range from Nokia, the 112 can also take in memory cards of up to 32 GB in capacity. The camera at the rear can capture images at VGA resolution and can take videos at 176*144. The phone also gets an FM radio with RDS capabilities. You can also record stuff from FM stations and listen to it later. The 1400 MAH BL 6C battery on this device offers 840 hours of standby time as well as 14 hours of talktime.

Xolo has been constantly increasing its product range to capture the market share. Xolo Q1010 is essentially a budget phablet with a quad-core processors. It sports a 5-inch HD IPS display with One Glass Solution (OGS) technology, this technology will deliver a reasonably sharp screen clarity at a pixel density of 294PPI (same display is used in Q1100). The phone is powered by 1.3GHz Quad-core processor, coupled with 1GB RAM. It has an internal storage of 4GB which can be expanded using a microSD memory card (Q1100 has an internal memory of 8GB).

The smartphone has a 8-megapixel rear camera with BSI sensor which helps in capturing better images under low-light conditions. It has a secondary camera of 2-megapixels for video calling and Skype. It can capture Full HD videos at 1080p resolution. Xolo Q1010 runs on a slightly older Android v4.2 Jelly Bean but it has been appended with smart features for quick accessibility  for example, definite patterns can be set to quickly open the applications from the lock screen itself. Apart from this, it has an OTG cable for connecting a USB pendrive on-the-go. The giant is powered by a 2250mAh battery.

The Nokia X2 was launched in September 2011. It has a candy bar design. It runs on Nokia S40 operating system. The model comes with 70MB user accessible memory and a microSD slot with external memory expandable upto 16MB. It has a music player and stereo FM radio, with MP3 support. It also has a 5MP camera with 4x digital zoom and LED flash, and is enabled for QVGA video recording. It has Bluetooth and GPRS support, with email, chat, SMS and native email client.
Reliance Jio network powered smartphone brand from the same parent company, LYF has a set of phones VoLTE phones covering budget segment. LYF Wind 7i is the latest addition to the list.
Design & Display: LYF Wind 7i features a plastic body & has nothing extraordinary to be noticed which is fair for the price. The has good in hand feel & comfortable to use with 5-inch display & around 8.7mm thickness. The 5-inch display comes with a resolution of 1280x720 pixels giving it a pixel density of 294PPI.
Hardware & Features: Inside the phone you get a Qualcomm's Snapdragon 210 Quad Core processor that is combined with Adreno 304 GPU & 1GB RAM that delivers just about average performance. On the software front, it comes with Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box with no details on update schedule.
Camera & Storage: Rear of the device gets a 8MP camera whereas the front has a 5MP sensor. The rear camera also gets an LED flash & can record videos up to 720p. And in terms of storage there is 8GB of onboard storage that can further be expanded up to 32GB more via a MicroSD card.
Battery & Connectivity: LYF Wind 7i comes with a 2250mAh battery that can be user replaced & might not you through the day. Check here for phones with good battery life. In terms of connectivity, it supports all the major network with VoLTE & works perfectly fine with Reliance Jio network.

Overview: With the recent launch of F series by LYF, the LYF F8 is the latest addition to it. Like all LYF phones, the F8 also supports Jio network. This phone is priced under Rs. 5,000 and targeted to first time smartphone users to experience Jio network.
Design and Display: LYF F8 gets a plastic body considering the pricing. And thanks to the smaller 4.5-inch display, this phone has got a smaller footprint making it easy to use with one hand. The display has a resolution of 854x480 pixels giving it a pixel density of 217PPI. Unfortunately, there is not Gorilla Glass protection over the display.
Hardware & Features: Running inside is 1.3GHz Qualcomm Snapdragon 210 Quad Core chipset and along with it is 1GB of RAM. The specs do sound outdated but the motive here is for first time smartphone users to experience Jio network. On the software front, you get LYF's almost near stock Android 6.0 Marshmallow out of the box. It being a budget friendly phone, not may other features are expected.
Camera & Storage: On the rear of the device is a 8MP sensor that can record videos up to 720p and the rear camera also comes with an LED flash. Whereas on the front you get 5MP camera for selfies and video calling needs. To store all the data you get 8GB of internal storage that can be further expanded up to 128GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery & Connectivity: Powering the LYF F8 is a 2000mAh unit that is user removable. In terms of connectivity, you get the standard WiFi & Bluetooth plus the phone does support VoLTE for Jio network.

Overview: The Samsung Metro Duos is a dual SIM phone with dual standby. The sleek bar phone features a classic metallic design and showcases some powerful multimedia features. The phone has a 2.2 inch QVGA screen for all the interaction with the phone - be it instant messaging, SMS, browsing your photos or reading the e-mails. The e-mails are synced with the PC using Active Sync. The phone has a pre-installed application  mFluent IM allowing the user to connect to multiple instant messengers such as GTalk, MSN Messenger or Yahoo Messenger. The mobile also gives a direct link for the two social network giants  Facebook and Twitter. The phone also has a AccuWeather widget, giving real-time weather forecasts and temperature in different parts of the world.

The phone is equipped with a 2 Megapixels camera. The internal storage of 46MB can be expanded up to 16 gigabytes using a microSD card, allowing you to store all your pictures, videos and songs. Connectivity options in the phone include GPRS, WAP and Bluetooth. The phone is backed up by a 1000mAh battery giving a talk time of about 10 hours and standby time of up to 500 hours.

Videocon V1570 is an affordable phone with barebone specifications. It supports dual SIM (GSM + GSM) functionality. It is powered by a Lithium-Ion battery of 1200 mAh size, that results in a battery life up to 300 hours in standby time and 7 hours in talktime mode. The phone has got a screen size of 3 inches with TFT Capacitive Touchscreen 65K Colors. V1570 lacks internal inbuilt memory but has an external memory card slot which can be used to extend memory up to 8 GB. The phone weighs 85 grams. Its got a camera sporting 1.3 MP sensor with no flash light and no auto focus. The phone also lacks a secondary camera. V1570 has Bluetooth, GPRS support but lacks WiFi. Its got a non-smart proprietary OS, parts of which look like theyve been inspired from the older versions of Apple iOS.

YF Flame 2 is a new addition to the Flame Series of phone by LYF. It is a budget friendly device and packs just about average hardware. Even though it might not be the best piece of hardware, the device does support 4G and VoLTE support as well, something that every LYF device boasts of.
Display: LYF Flame 2 has a 4 inch display that is rare to find these days, the display has a 800x480 pixels resolution that gives the display a pixel density of 233PPI. The display is average in terms of sharpness. Unfortunately, there is no Gorilla Glass protection.
Performance: In terms of performance, the phone gets a MediaTek MT6735M Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.1GHz and combined along is just 1GB of RAM, which sounds like a disappointment as we expect at least 2GB of RAM for optimum performance.
Camera and Storage: On te rear you get a bare minimum 5MP camera sensor, whereas on the front lies a 2MP camera. The rear camera can record videos up to 720p and also has an LED Flash. TO store all the data you get 8GB on onboard storage that can be further expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity: To power all this there is a 1500mAh battery that should easily last through the day considering the specs of the device. In terms of connectivity, the phone accepts Dual SIMs and is 4G enabled with VoLTE support.

Overview: Delhi based smartphone manufacturer i-smart Mobiles has been in the industry for over a year now but has not been able to even capture a considerable market share to talk about. The i-smart IS 56 Mercury V2 is another attempt by the brand to sustain the in the smartphone industry. Let’s see what this new device has to offer:

A low cost dual SIM offering from Nokia, the 206 has no intention to conquer the mind of the high-end buyer. The candy bar handset was released back in November 2012 and boasts of a 2.4 inch 240*320 pixel display. The phone gets a 1.3 megapixel camera which can also record videos in the ultra-low QCIF resolution at 10 fps. The 206 gets 64 MB of Internal memory which you can expand further using micro SD cards. The handset gets its power from a Li-Ion 1100 mAh battery (BL-4U) which endows it with a stand-by time of 680 hours. The talk time is rated at 20 hours. In music playback mode, the device will last you an impressive 41 hours. Connectivity options are somewhat limited with the device lacking support for either Wi-Fi or 3G. Bluetooth, micro USB and EDGE do find their way in, though. The phone is available in five color options - Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, Black and White.

One of the few low cost phones with a touchscreen and full QWERTY keyboard, the Motorola Ex119 is widely appreciated for its easy to use UI and large buttons. The EX119 also features Dual SIM support, FM radio and a 3.5mm audio jack. Giving a stiff competition to most other low cost devices by the likes of Micromax, the Motorola EX119 features WiFi and a brand of international repute.
Karbonn Titanium S25 Klick is budget dual-SIM phone from Karbonn. It features entry-level specifications and it is an alternative to the online-only Karbonn Titanium Machone S310.
Here are the key features:
The Titanium S25 sports a 5 HD display. There are off screen capacitive buttons beneath the display.
It comes with 8GB of internal storage which is further expandable via microSD slot to upto 32GB.

A 13-megapixels rear camera with led flash sets it aside from mid-range devices. What makes it even better is the 5 megapixel front facing camera. There is also a dedicated camera button which makes it easy to operate the camera.
It is powered by a 1.3GHz quad-core processor and 1GB of RAM. Occasional frame drops while gaming and lagging while multitasking would be expected with these numbers.
It runs on Android 4.4 KitKat with Karbonns own skin on top. It will house a heavy amount of bloatware but you can uninstall it at your will.
It packs a modest 2000 mAh battery that should last for one day.
Alternatives:
Karbonn Titanium S5
Moto E 2nd Gen
Asus Zenfone 5

Introduction:: Ringing Bells Smart 101 is a dual SIM device that was launched in February 2016. It is the cheapest smartphone with given specifications and 4G compatibility in the market.
Display and Design:: Ringing Bells Smart 101 comes with a 5 inch IPS QHD touchscreen LCD display with 960 x 480 pixels screen resolution and 214.66PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 142 x 71.4 x 8 mm and its weight is 125 grams. It is available in dual color, like Black with Gray and White with Gold.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device has 1.3GHz quad-core processor, 1GB RAM and Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating system. Proximity sensor, ambient light sensor and gyroscope are in-built. FM radio, 3.5 mm headphone jack and GPS are available. Built-in applications include Google Talk, Google+, Twitter, YouTube, Facebook chat, Gmail, Google Search and WhatsApp.
Camera and Storage:: This dual SIM device is loaded with an 8MP rear camera with LED flash and autofocus and 3.2MP front camera. Users can record videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 32GB with the help of 1 micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:: This dual SIM device comes with a 2800mAh Li-ion removable battery that provides the users with a talk time of up to 10 hours on 3G network and a standby time of up to 300 hours. Users will get a talk time of 8 hours when using 4G network. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), EDGE, 3G, GPRS, 2G, Wi-Fi 802 b/g/n, Bluetooth. It accepts 1 micro SIM and 1 regular SIM.
Overview: Ringing Bells Smart 101 can face direct competition fromLyf Flame 6,Lenovo A1000,Micromax Bolt Q326,Panasonic T44 as these are available with somewhat similar features and price range. However it is the lowest priced smartphone to provide 4G connection, better rear camera and big screen.
Panasonic T40 is a stripped down version of Panasonic T41. It is a low-end device which is targeted at budget conscious users. It has pretty average specifications and newer phones are more powerful.
Heres a quick look at the features:
It has a small 4.5 inches display with a resolution of 854 x 480 pixel with a pixel density of 217 PPI.
Primary camera is a 5 megapixel unit which is a norm for low-end devices. No secondary camera present on this device which is a downer.
It is powered by a 1.3GHz Quad Core processor and comes with a rather low 512MB of RAM. You may face some issues with running apps and games on this device.
An internal storage of 4GB is present out of which 2.8GB will be user available.
Alternatives:
Moto E 2nd Gen
Micromax Canvas A1
Spice Dream Uno

The T41 is Panasonics first smartphone to have Android 4.4.2 KitKat and also the second most affordable smartphone being sold by the company. The device is a successor to Panasonic T31 and the T41 gets a much-needed overall upgrade. The device is competitively priced in the range of Zenfone 4, Moto E and Xiaomi Redmi 1S.

The T41 is powered by a 1.3Ghz quad-core processor coupled with 512MB RAM. It has a 4.5 inch screen touting a 480 x 854 pixels screen resolution (217.7PPI). It has a 5-megapixel auto-focus rear camera with LED Flash and a VGA camera on the front. The internal storage is 4GB, expandable with a microSD slot up to 32GB. The battery is removable unit with 1650mAh capacity.

The Panasonic T41 is a dual-SIM device requiring Micro-SIM sized cards for both slots. The smartphone will come in red, black and white colours. All connectivity options like GPRS/ EDGE, 3G, Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/n, Bluetooth, GPS and Micro-USB are included on the device.
Reliance Jio with its much anticipated 4G launch in pipeline, has already launched few 4G enabled Android smartphones under the brand name LYF. The cheapest from the brand so far is the Flame 1.
Here are the specifications of LYF Flame 1:
The phone has a 4.5 inch display with a resolution of 854x480 pixels, giving it a total of 217.7 PPI.
The device has a  Qualcomm Snapdragon 210 Quad Core chipset clocked at 1.1GHz paired with 1GB RAM.
LYF Flame 1 has 5MP camera sensor on the front and back. The one of the back has an LED Flash.
It is a Dual SIM device that accepts 2 micro SIMs of which one is 4G LTE capable and supports VoLTE as well.
In terms of storage, it has got 8GB internal storage that can be expanded up to 32GB via a MicroSD card.
The phone runs on Android Lollipop (5.1) out of the box.

Karbonn A8 is an Android smartphone from the popular Indian manufacturer Karbonn. It offers 4 inch capacitive screen on the phone, bearing a 800 X 480 pixels resolution with a display type TFT Capacitive Touchscreen 16M Colors. The A8 is powered by a 1GHz dual core processor and 512 MB of RAM. The internal memory is 4GB, and by using microSD card it can be upgraded up to 32GB. This dual-SIM phone is 3G and WiFi enabled too. A 5 megapixel camera at the back with autofocus and flash light delivers a good image quality and it records video as well. A secondary camera is used for video calling purposes. A Standard-Battery Lithium-Ion 1500 mAh battery should deliver decent battery life given the modest specifications.

Nokia 114 is an entry-level handset with a small 1.8 inch, 128 x 160 pixel resolution screen. It's a dual-SIM handset, but being an inexpensive handset, does not support 3G, nor WiFi, just 2G. But a 3.5mm jack and a microSD card support of up to 32GB should double its usage as an MP3 player. You've got Bluetooth for file transfers, and USB for data transfers. There's a camera at the back, but the pitiful VGA (0.3 megapixel) resolution results in less than mediocre quality of photos and videos. The BL-5C Li-ion battery is rated at 1020 mAh. Externally, the phone has reasonably-sized buttons and a textured back that gives it a distinct look. It is available in three colours Black, Magenta and Cyan. It is quoted a standby time of close to a month, can play music continuously for 17 hours and talk straight for 10.5 hours.
Introduction:

The Nokia C2 01 was launched in November 2010. This candy bar model is a 3G supported phone with fast browsing and instant messaging services, with facilities such as a microSD slot which supports hot swap and supports expansion upto 16GB. It has a 3.2MP camera with 4x digital zoom, which can also shoot videos. It also has support for Bluetooth and USB 2.0.

Introduction:: Zopo Color S5.5 is a dual SIM device that was launched in February 2016. Huge storage, camera having PureCel Sensor, attractive design and color variation and good battery backup are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Zopo Color S5.5 comes with 5.5 inch touchscreen display, 1280 x 720 pixels screen resolution and 267PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 153.8 x 77.1 x 9.0 mm and its weight is 167 grams. It is available in White, Gray, Blue, Green and Red colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1.32GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6735 processor, 1GB RAM, Android 5.1 Lollipop Operating System and ARM Mali-T720 for graphics. Its performance is enhanced by 50% and energy efficiency enhanced by 150% by using ARM Mali-T720. Accelerometer, E-compass and gravity sensors are in-built.
Camera and Storage:

Zopo Color S5.5 is loaded with 8MP rear and 2MP front camera. Other camera features include continuous shooting, HDR, autofocus, digital zoom, auto flash, LED flash, face detection, touch to focus. Users can record full HD videos at 1080p. It has an internal storage of 8GB that can be expanded up to 64GB by using a micro-SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a 3000mAh Li-Po non-removable battery that increases the power saving ability by 35%. Users can enjoy connectivity through 4G LTE (India Compatible), 3G, 2G, WiFi, Bluetooth and mobile hotspot.
Competition:

Zopo Color S5.5 faces competition from Zopo Hero 1 and Xiaomi Redmi Note 3. Zopo Color S5.5 has a larger screen and better batrery capacity but poor rear and front camera than Zopo Hero 1. Xiaomi Redmi Note 3 more battery capacity and more RAM than Zopo Color S5.5.

Overview: Introduction:
Panasonic GD25c is a dual SIM device that was launched in September, 2016. Supporting both Hindi and English languages and its CE certification at a low price are its main highlights.
Display and Design:

Panasonic GD25c comes with a non-touch 2.4 inches LCD TFT display, 320 x 240 pixels resolution and 166.7PPI. It has a dimension of 118.50 x 51.6 x 12.8 mm. It is available in Gray and Black colours. It has an alphanumeric keypad.
Hardware and Features:

It comes with a proprietary operating system. This dual SIM device is loaded with WAP browser. Phonebook can contain only 500 entries. Some features like LED torch light, multi languages and mobile tracker are in-built. Other facilities like calculator, stopwatch, FM radio, calendar, alarm, world clock are available. It supports the video formats of MPEG4 and MP3 for music formats. It has both audio and video player.
Camera and Storage:

It comes with a rear camera of 1.3MP. It has an image resolution of 1280 x 1024 pixels and digital zoom. Video recording feature is available. Panasonic GD25c has an internal storage that can be expanded up to 16GB.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is equipped with 1250mAh Li-ion removable battery. The users can enjoy connectivity via Bluetooth with A2DP and 2G. It uses mini SIM. GSM and CDMA networks are available. GPRS is available.
Competition:

This dual SIM device can face direct competition from Nokia 215 and Lava Flair P1i as these are available with somewhat similar features but competing phones have higher battery capacity and better camera except Nokia phone which has only 0.3 MP rear camera. However, CE certification and support to both English and Hindi languages give Panasonic GD25c an edge over others.
Introduction:

The Nokia C5-05 is a full touch screen phone, which was released in April 2010. The model runs on Symbian platform. It has 40MB user accessible memory, and a microSD slot which can expand the memory upto 16GB. It comes with hot swap feature for memory card, and support for Bluetooth, USB 2.0 and A-GPS with Nokia Maps. It also has a 2MP camera, with 3x digital zoom and LED flash. Also packed in the model are a music player and stereo FM radio.

Nokia Asha 305 is yet another low cost Dual SIM phone to launch in India. Nokia is sweetening the deal in the sub Rs. 5000 market with a full touchscreen device. The 3-inch screen is unfortunately resistive type, and has a resolution of QVGA (240x320 pixels) and the battery is rated at 1110 mAh. Powered by the good old Series 40 that is adapted for touchscreen operation (with design cues taken from Nokia's failed Meego OS), Nokia hopes to give competition to the likes of Micromax and Maxx Mobile. Even though this handset isn't a smartphone, there's a Nokia Store that allows installing Java based apps. There's a Nokia Maps app as well. Asha 305 misses out on 3G and WiFi connectivity but gets full marks for its looks and design. There's a microSD card slot to expand memory and even a 2GB card complimentary in the box.

Introduction:: Itel, the world’s largest feature phone maker, entered India in 2016 with a couple of low-end feature and smartphones. This included the Itel IT1512 which is among the entry level smartphone targeted to budget conscious users or those users switching from feature phone to smartphone for the first time. It is not feature rich or suited for heavy media usage. This dual SIM phone works on GSM networks and supports micro SIM.
Display and Design:: The Itel IT1512 has a screen size of 5 inch with a resolution of 854 x 480 pixels and a pixel density of 196PPI. It has size dimensions of 143 x 72 x 8.65 mm. The plastic body of the phone is slim with black front color and Champagne Gold finish at the back.

Hardware & Features: The Smartphone has a MediaTek MT6735M CPU inside. The quad-core CPU runs at a speed of 1 GHz. Itel IT1512 runs on Android 6.0 Marshmallow. It is an LTE capable device that supports features like GPS and inbuilt FM radio.

Overview: Phablet is the newest trend and India has always loved phones & TVs with larger screens. Given the success of the Samsung Galaxy Note series, many Indian manufacturers are busy churning out Android phones with large screens. The Micromax Canvas 2 A110 is one fine example and the A101 is yet another from the same manufacturer. The A101 runs Android 4.0 (Ice Cream Sandwich) and would retail for a bit lesser than the A110.

2GB of internal storage, 512MB RAM, 1GHz Dual-core processor and a 5-inch WVGA display makes the A101 a lucarative bet in the low end market. For the ones who cannot afford a Galaxy, the Micromax phones are a good alternative. The A101 features a 5MP rear camera and a VGA front camera. It supports the standard communications like 3G, WiFi, Bluetooth and GPS. A 2,100 mAh battery helps the device support the large screen and the Dual-core processor. Just like its predecessors, the A101 supports Dual SIM cards, that goes well for its target market. You shall miss HD video recording on this device (720p or 1080p) but video playback on the large screen should be delightful. So getting a cheap Galaxy Note?

The humble Nokia C1-01 is an entry-level phone. Launched in December 2010, the phone breaks free from the dual sim capabilities which was seen in earlier models of the kind. The model contains a MicroSD slot, with 64MB internal memory expandable upto 32GB. Basic features of the model contain Bluetooth connectivity, FM radio, MP3 support and a VGA camera.

This Legend is not a smartphone. It has a 3.5-inch touch screen and is a Dual-SIM phone. Legend K77 has a 1.3-megapixel camera without flash. Videos can be recorded and saved on a memory card which can be expanded up to 8GB. It has a 1000mAh battery which may not give a powerful battery backup. The phone has Bluetooth for sharing files but lacks WiFi, which is not a major disappointment, which is nowadays found in the most inexpensive of touch phones.
Introduction:
Intex Aqua Glory was officially released In India on Jan 10, 2013. It is one of the cheapest Android Smartphone and it is packed with all the necessary features along with great looks.
Design and Display:

Intex aqua glory sports a 4.0 inches LCD touch screen display with a resolution of 480*320 pixels which result in the density of 144.2 pixels per inch. Its building material is plastic. It has a dimension of 121 x 67.3 x 11.8 mm and weighs 114 gm, which results in 58.51% screen to body ratio. It is available in only Black colour.
Hardware and Features:
The Intex aqua glory is powered by a 1 GHz Single core MediaTek MT6515, ARM Cortex A9 Processor coupled with 256MB RAM. It is operated through Android v2.3.6. (Gingerbread) and PowerVR SGX 531 GPU.
Camera and Storage:

Intex aqua glory is loaded with 3 MP Primary camera with a clear image resolution of 2048*1536 pixels. It is also armed with 1.3 MP Front Camera for shooting Selfie. Camera features include Autofocus, LED Flash, and Digital Zoom. Its Internal Memory is 512 MB which is further expandable up to 32 GB through a MicroSD slot.
Battery and Connectivity:

Intex aqua glory is equipped with a 1400 mAh battery, which claims to offer to stand by time up to 250 hours and talk time up to 5 hours. It is a Dual SIM Smartphone, both SIMs support 2G network. Other connectivity features include Bluetooth, WI-Fi, Mobile Hotspot, USB etc.

Indian manufacturer Micromax is doing extremely great in Indian market. It has got a wide range of products catering to all the segments. Although Micromax is more popularly known for their Canvas range of smartphones, the MicroMax X101 is an entry level featured phone. The phone is available in two colors. Its got an internal memory of 32 MB that can be expanded up to 4 GB using a microSD card. X101 has 16 MB RAM. This phone also supports GPRS and FM Radio as well. At this price range, the X101 also offers a rear camera and Bluetooth. The phone has Lithium-Ion 1000 mAh battery that should give decent results.

A Chinese phone maker Zopo Mobile added a new device in its Color lineup, the Color F1. The company launched it in India at INR 8,999, available in black, white, and gold colours. The phone comes with multi-accounts support for social networking apps such as WhatsApp, Skype, Facebook, etc. Meaning, the Zopo Color F1 can clone the apps so that users can have multiple accounts running simultaneously. It also comes with built-in Barcode/QR code scanner, App Lock, and floating video integration.

Borrowing the naming scheme from Apple, Micromax's much awaited A90S is an upgraded version of its predecessor the A90. This dual-SIM phone has a 4.3 inches super AMOLED capacitive touchscreen that gives a display resolution of 480 by 800 pixels. The phone is powered by MediaTek MT6577 processor clocked at a dual-core 1GHz. A90S gives an internal storage of 4GB of which 2GB is user-available and a 512MB RAM. This can be expanded to 32GB using MicroSD cards. Users can connect to internet through networks like EDGE, GPRS, 3G and Wi-Fi. Bluetooth v4.0 with A2DP enables efficient transmission of files to other devices. A90S offers an 8MP camera with 4x digital zoom and LED Flash. This camera entails features such as geo-tagging, auto focus, multi shot and panoramic image capture. It gives an image quality of 3264 by 2448 pixels. The phone also has a secondary VGA camera. Micromax A90S runs on a standard Li-ion battery of 1600 mAh. Thus it gives the users up to 4 hours of talk-time and up to 180 hours in stand-by mode. Apart from this, its other features include GPS-sopport, Hyper fast Games, Melody composer, sensors like G-sensor / proximity / light, FM radio, document viewer, Voice Memo and predictive text input (SWYPE). A90S is available in only black colour.

LYF mobiles is the newest smartphone maker to launch its smartphones in India. The LYF brand is owned and managed by Reliance Retail. These smartphones are all VoLTE enabled in order to support the company’s Jio Network.

Indian cell phone company Swipe has announced a new affordable smartphone dubbed Swipe Konnect 4G. The device is currently listed exclusively on Shopclues, so those who are interested in buying this phone can register on the e-commerce portal. However, the actual sale will commence next week, starting December 27th.

Celkon is an Indian manufacturer of mobiles who offer feature phones and smartphones for the budget oriented segment. Indian Government has allowed the company to shift its base for manufacturing from China to India. The phone is priced extremely competitively at Rs. 2399.
Display and Design:: The phone offers a 3.5 inch capacitive touchscreen display with a resolution of 320×420 pixels with a pixel density of 165 pixels per inch. Weight of the phone is about 95.5 grams making it comparatively lighter in comparison to many other phones. Loudspeaker of the phone is on the back side of phone. Phone has a removable battery of 1200mAh. Colors available in this phone are black, light blue, dark blue, brown, silver and red+black. Dimensions of the phone are 114.5×62.3×10.4 mm.
Hardware & Features:: The Celkon Campus A359 is powered by 1GHz Spreadtrum SC7715 and offers 512MB of RAM. The phone runs on Android OS v4.4.2.
Camera & Storage:: The phone sports a 2 megapixel primary camera with LED flash. There is no front camera present on the phone. The phone has internal memory of 256MB and can be further expanded more via memory card.
Battery & Connectivity:: Battery capacity is low at 1200mAh but a good phone for the people on a budget. The phone is Dual SIM (GSM/HSPA)
Competition:: The phone is focused at an extremely budget oriented segment and other competitors in this group include iBall Andi Genius 2, Karbonn A108 and Videocon Infinium Z30 Aire.

Overview: The Nokia C1-02 is the younger sibling of the Nokia C1-01. It was launched in December 2010. It offers pretty much the same features as the C1- 01, like a MicroSD slot expandable upto 32 GB, Bluetooth services, VGA camera, a music player with MP3 support, applications for Chat and Ovi Mail, and GPRS connectivity.

The Maxx MSD7 Smarty is an entry level smartphone from the upcoming Indian brand Maxx. The phone features a 4 inch TFT Display (800 X 480 pixels). The device runs on an outdated Android v2.3 (Gingerbread). It has a 5 MP rear camera with flashlight and a 0.3 MP Secondary Camera. The dual SIM phone is powered by a single core 1GHz processor with 256MB of RAM. It has an internal memory of 512 MB which is expandable. Apart from this, the phone has WiFi and bluetooth but lacks 3G connectivity. 3G connectivity is available in other devices of this price range.

The Nokia 109 is a feature phone from Nokia. The device has a 1.8 inch screen with a resolution of 160x128 pixels with a pixel density of 114PPI. The phone runs on a proprietary JAVA OS and has 16MB of RAM. The phone has a 3.5mm headphone jack and can work with any headphones. The single SIM device has a MicroSD card slot that accepts cards upto 32GB. The battery is removable and uses the standard Nokia 2.0 charging connector for charging.

Nokia 108 is a Dual-SIM (GSM+GSM) feature phone which has a candy-bar design and is available in many beautiful colours such as black, white, blue, red and yellow. It boasts a 1.8 inch (160x128 pixels) display. There not much to boast about its 0.3 megapixel (VGA) camera at the back which lacks an LED flash but is capable of capturing recording videos. The phone also has a slot for microSD card which helps in expanding storage upto 32GB. Thus the phone can double up as an MP3 player. Although it lacks NFC, this phone can instantly pair with other compatible Bluetooth devices by just tapping them together (like how NFC works)  Nokia calls this feature SLAM. Internet can be accessed from this phone by using 2G cellular data. There is 950mAh battery in this phone which is sufficient enough to power this device for 2-3 days. If you want a slightly better keypad phone, then check out the Nokia 225 Dual SIM as well.

Announced back in May 2012, the Nokia 110 is an affordable, low end handset designed for the masses. The phone comes with a 128*160 pixel TFT color display that measures 1.8 inches across and has 10MB of internal memory. This can be expanded to a colossal 32GB should the user wants to. The phone also supports Bluetooth file transfer Ã¢â¬â a feature that users in this price band would appreciate. At the rear of the handset is a basic camera that can capture images at VGA resolution. The same camera can also capture videos in 176*144 resolution at 15 fps. Apart from these, the handset also gets support for FM Radio with RDS and with support for FM recording as well. The phone offers up to 10 hours 30 minutes of talk time and 636 hours of standby time.

Maxx mobile Maxx Powerhouse phone is a feature phone and targets people at the lower end of the market. The main feature of this phone is that it has a 5200mAh battery which can also be used as a powerbank to charge other phones. The device has a 2.4 TFT screen. The phone has a VGA camera on the back but lacks a front facing camera. The storage can be expanded upto 8GB by using a microSD card. Due to the huge battery, the phone is heavy and it also doesn't look very appealing. The phone supports GPRS so you could use the internet on this device. At this price range, the phone will compete with the Nokia 108 Dual Sim.

Intro:: Lenovo Sisley S90 is an ace Smartphone launched by the company back in November 2014.
Display and Design:: The superbly designed smartphone comes with 5 inch Super AMOLED HD display (1280x720 pixels) along with a pixel density of 294PPI. The device feels supremely light in hand and in the pocket owing to its slim build. The dimensions are 146x71.7x6.9 mm and it weighs 129g. The brilliant display supports 16M colors and is offered in shades of silver, pink, gray and gold.
Hardware and Features:: The device is powered by a  Qualcomm MSM8916 Snapdragon 410 chipset that is clocked at 1.2GHz. Adreno 306 GPU present in the smartphones makes it easy for the users to experience rich graphics. It is pre-installed with the Android Operating System (v 4.4.4 KitKat). Proximity Sensor, Accelerometer and Ambient Light Sensor installed in the device separate it from the others in this league of devices.
Camera and Storage:: The device enables the user to capture the beautiful lifetime memories with its efficient primary camera of 13MP with the features as f/2.0 aperture, LED flash, 1/3.2" sensor size, 1.4µm pixel size, geo-tagging, touch focus, face detection and HDR. It also allows capturing of the selfies with extreme clarity and utmost resolution through its 8MP front camera enhanced with LED flash and autofocus. This device from Lenovo comes with a RAM of 1GB and has got internal storage of 16GB.
Battery and Connectivity:: It comes with a non-removable Li-Po battery with the capacity as 2300mAh. The device supports dual SIM with the first slot for 4G connectivity. Other connectivity options include Wi-Fi, NFC, 3G, GPS/AGPS, Bluetooth v4.0 and USB port.
Competition:: Lenovo S90 Sisley is a budget Smartphone that is power packed and scores high on design. The primary competitors include Moto G4 and Samsung Galaxy J7.

Overview: Karbonn has recently launched two candy bar designed phones with numeric keypad under the brand name Kochadaiiyaan. This Legend has a large 2.8-inch (non-touch) screen with a 1.3-megapixel camera and flash, capable of recording videos as well. It also has a memory card slot which can be used to expand memory up to 8GB. Apart from this it has Bluetooth and FM-Radio. It is a Dual-SIM phone with 1800mAh battery. This model is similar to the Legend 2.4, only difference being the screen and battery size. It is a feature phone and not a smartphone.

Karbonn mobile has now launched the 'Kochadaiyaan' branded mobile phones. Kochadaiyaan is a futuristic fantasy film, starring Rajinikanth, which is set to be released in April 2014. This entry-level phone in the legendary series has a 2.4-inch (non-touch screen) with a 1.3-megapixel camera and flash, capable of recording videos as well. It also has a memory card slot which can be used to expand memory up to 8GB. Apart from this it has Bluetooth and FM-Radio. It is a Dual-SIM phone with 1200mAh battery (compared to 1800mAh battery of Legend 2.8).
Introduction:

Karbonn Smart A51+ was officially released in India on 28 May 2014. It is an entry-level Smartphone with average specifications and targets to suffice only basic Smartphone requirements. If you look for a low budget smartphone, this could be a good option.
Design and Display:

Karbonn Smart A51+ sports a 3.5 inch LCD Capacitive Touch screen display with a screen resolution of 320*480 pixels which results in a density of 165 pixels per inch. It has a Dimension of 132.0*67.5*9.25 mm, which results in 40.94% screen to body ratio. It is available in Black and White colour.
Hardware and Features:

The Karbonn Smart A51+ is powered by a 1.3 GHz Dual core processor which is coupled with a 256 RAM. It is operated through Android v4.2 (Jelly Bean) which is outdated still acceptable for its affordable price tag.
Camera and Storage:

Karbonn Smart A51+ is loaded with 3.2 MP Primary Camera with a clear image resolution of 2048*1536 pixels. It is also armed with 0.3 MP Front Camera which is decent enough for making video calls. Camera features include LED Flash and Digital Zoom. Its Internal Memory is 512 MB which is further expandable up to 32 GB through MicroSD card.
Battery and Connectivity:

Karbonn Smart A51+ is equipped with 1100 mAh Li-ion battery. It is a Dual SIM Smartphone which supports 2G network only. Other connectivity features include Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Mobile Hotspot and USB etc.
HMD global, the parent company of Nokia launched the Nokia 130 in July 2017.

Specs-wise, the Nokia 130 sports a 1.8-inch QVGA display bearing a resolution of 1280 x 720 pixels. The device comes with a plastic body and ships in Black, Gray, and Red color options. There’s a 0.3MP VGA camera on the front. The Nokia 130 supports memory cards up to 32GB.
The Nokia 130 packs a 1020 mAh removable battery. Connectivity-wise, it features a 3.5mm headphone jack, Bluetooth and 2G networks.

The Nokia 107 is a feature phone from Nokia. The device has a 1.8 inch screen with a resolution of 160x128 pixels with a pixel density of 114PPI. The phone runs on a proprietary JAVA OS and the device has 4MB of RAM. The phone has a 3.5mm headphone jack and can work with any headphones. The device has dual-SIM capability and a MicroSD card slot that accepts cards upto 16GB. The battery is removable and uses a microUSB port for charging.
Has a 3.5 inch display with the resolution of 480x320 pixels with below average 165 PPI pixel density
Comes with 256MB RAM and runs on a 1GHz processor
Dual SIM phone
Comes with 512MB of internal storage which is expandable upto 32GB by using a microSD card
Rear camera of 2MP, no front facing camera
Powered by a 1400mAh battery which is removable

Nokias entry level phone goes colour. The Nokia 106 comes with a 1.8 inch colour display sporting a resolution of 160x128 pixels. This feature phone runs Nokia OS Series 30 and has some essential apps preloaded. This device comes with a 800 mAh battery and due to its basic nature has a stand-by time of upto 35 days. This device is a 2G device and is restricted to basic telephony.

With a capability to support 5 phonebooks and up to 500 contacts, this phone means business. The phone should work as a good calling device and is primarily targeted at the rural market. The phone has a flashlight that can be used in emergencies. In the same price range the closest competitor is the Karbonn K20+ which has a 1.3 MP camera and a much bigger 1800mAh battery.
Nokia 215 is the latest budget phone by Nokia but is sold by Microsoft in India. It is a feature phone, comes with Facebook but sadly no WhatsApp and has the following things to offer.
2.4 inch color LCD display with a resolution of 320x240 pixels and has a low power mode
Proprietary Series 30+ OS
MicroSD card slot accepts cards upto 32GB
8MB RAM for apps is adequate since the apps are very light
0.3 megapixel fixed focus camera, does video recording as well (320x240)
Come Preloaded with Opera Mini, Facebook, Twitter and Messenger but there is no WhatsApp support
Bluetooth support for media transfer (Bluetooth 3.0)
Dual SIM device (Mini SIM)
MicroUSB port for charging
1100mAh removable battery offers up to 21 days of standby

Introduction:: Itel it5020 is a dual SIM device that was launched in August 2016. Low price and moderately good configuration are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Itel it5020 comes with 2.4 inch LCD non- touch screen TFT display, 320 x 240 pixels resolution and 167PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 124.5 x 54 x 11.4 mm and its weight is 136 grams. It is available in Blue and Black colours. It has a screen to body ratio of 29.18 %.
Camera and Storage:

Itel it5020 is built with 2MP rear camera with 1600 x 1200 Pixels resolution and digital zoom. It has a 0.3MP front camera with features including geotagging and autofocus. It has an internal storage of 64MB that can be expanded up to 32GB with a micro SD card.
Battery and Connectivity:
This dual SIM device is loaded with 1000mAh Li-ion battery. Users can enjoy connectivity through 2G and Bluetooth.
Competition:

Itel it5020 faces competition from Samsung Guru Plus, Karbonn K4000 Baahubali, Sansui A11 and Micromax X606. Itel it5020 has a bigger screen than Micromax X606. Sansui A11 has a bigger screen and higher battery capacity than Itel it5020. Samsung Guru Plus has a smaller screen and lower battery capacity than Itel it5020. Karbonn K4000 Baahubali has much a higher battery capacity but lower rear camera than Itel it5020.
Hardware and Features:: This dual SIM device is equipped with Spreadtrum processor and proprietary operating system. It has wireless FM and Facebook. Calculator, alarm, stopwatch and calendar are some of the in-built applications. Call waiting and call forwarding features are also available in the phone.

This dual SIM device is equipped with Spreadtrum processor and proprietary operating system. It has wireless FM and Facebook. Calculator, alarm, stopwatch and calendar are some of the in-built applications. Call waiting and call forwarding features are also available in the phone.

Overview: Samsung Guru FM E1220 is an entry-level handset by Samsung. The Guru FM E1220 is a single SIM feature-phone. The phone has a color display with 1.8 inches of screen size. Its got GPRS (2G) connectivity. The phone also supports FM Radio. The company claims to have a decent battery life with an average use of the phone.

Putting an end to its break, smartphone maker Itel has finally launched a new device targeting the entry-level segment - the Itel it5026. This device seems to be below average but might provide a decent run for the money if you are on an extremely low budget. The device comes assembled with a good enough display, a decently sized 1200mAh battery, and an average camera setup for the price.
Design and Display: The Itel it5026 sports a 2.4 inch display having a resolution of 240 x 320 pixelsand a pixel density of 167ppi.
Cameras: The Itel it5026 features a single 0.3MP camera on the back.
Battery and Performance: The internal storage capacity can be expanded up to 64GB. Fuelling the device is a 1200mAh Li-ion battery.
Software and Connectivity: Speaking of connectivity, the Itel it5026 supports dual sim and Bluetooth. Besides, the smartphone also packs in a 3.5mm headphone jack.

Overview: Introduction:
Intel it5611 is a single SIM device that was launched in India in May 2016.
Design and Display:

Itel it5611 sports a 2.4 inch LCD display (non-touch screen) with a resolution of 320*240 pixels. The resolution is normal according to the phone. The pixel density on the Itel it5611 is 166.67 PPI. The display does not have a layer of protection on the top and users will need to be careful with their phones and put a glass protector on as its building material is plastic. It has a dimension of 127*54.5*14.9 mm and available only in Black colour.
Hardware and Features:
The Itel it5611 is powered by a 1 GHz Single-core processor and has 512MB of RAM. It runs Proprietary Operating System. It isn’t the powerful phone in the segment as phones like today (Smartphones).
Camera and Storage:
Itel it5611 is loaded with 0.3MP Rear camera Resolution having Flash only. There is a MicroSD card slot that can be used to further expand storage to 32GB.
Battery and Connectivity:

This Dual SIM device is equipped with a removable 2500mAh Lithium-ion (Li-ion) battery. The phone supports 2G only. For connectivity, it has the MicroUSB port along with Bluetooth and Wi-Fi. Other features include FM radio. The Itel it5611 is a Dual Mini Normal SIM (GSM) phone but no Hybrid Slot is available.

Cons: Its battery capacity may prove insufficient to get you through a day

Overview: Zen mobiles has added another entry level smartphone to its product range. The company is following the trend of large screen sizes; that are here to stay. The Dual-SIM smartphone features a 5-inch IPS LCD display with 480x800 pixels resolution (the display is not crisp but acceptable for a phone of this price). The Zen Ultrafone 504 is powered by a 1.3GHz dual-core processor (unspecified chipset) alongside 512MB of RAM. The hardware is decent for its price, but there are many other mobile phones available in the market with Quad-core processors like the Lava Iris 458q and Karbonn Titanium S2 at similar prices.

Zen Ultra 504 sports a 5-megapixel autofocus rear camera accompanied by an LED flash and also includes a 1.3-megapixel front-facing camera for video calling and selfies. The camera resolution is less than what competition offers. The device comes with 4GB of inbuilt storage, which can be expanded up to 32GB with the help of a microSD card. The device gets its juice from a 2000mAh battery and offers include Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, GPRS, EDGE, GPS and 3G connectivity options.
The Samsung E1200 is a feature phone launched in September 2012. Read the technical specifications below:

The Samsung E1200 bears a 1.5-inch display with screen resolution of 128 x 128 pixels. The display is good enough for basic usage. There is a micro USB port for charging and a 3.5 mm headphone jack. The device ships in Black, and White color variants.
The E1200 is powered by a 800 mAh battery which is removable. The device offers single SIM slot for networking with support for 2G connectivity. A mini SIM card is compatible with the device.

Karbonn K9 is a feature phone with smart features. The phone supports dual SIM (GSM + GSM). The phone weighs 112 grams. The phones got a keypad. The phone has TFT screen with 2.4 inches of screen size. The phone lacks internal memory but has an external memory card slot that can be used to expand memory up to 16 GB. Karbonn K9 supports GPRS and Bluetooth connectivity. It's camera sports a 1.3 MP sensor with no Flashlight and no auto focus. The phones got a huge battery size of 1800 mAh, which will give good results. Looking at the features, it is clear that the phone is positioning itself and is competing with the entry level phones like the Nokia 100and is targeting customers who are looking for low budget phones with keypad.

Pros: Durable build and can withstand unintentional drops
Cons: Image quality of captured images isn't good

Overview: The Nokia 100 was released as the most affordable entry level phone. A classic color phone, the model was released with basic facilities like calling, SMS and stereo FM radio. It has a talk time up to 7.2 hours. It also comes with 20 color themes.

The Karbonn K101 is a budget-friendly phone with some attractive features. The phone supports dual SIM (GSM+GSM). The phones got 1.8 inches screen size with TFT 65K Colors. The phone lacks an inbuilt internal memory but has got a memory card slot that can be expanded up to 2 GB. The phone has FM Radio with One Touch FM Key. Other features like, Torch Light, Mobile Tracker, Voice Recording, Anti Theft Feature, Call Conference is supported by the phone. Li-ion battery of 900mAh is embedded that keeps the phone alive Up to 400 hours in standby mode and Up to 2.5 hours in talktime mode.

Micromax Joy series are the manufacturers ultra low-end devices that cost less than Rs. 1000. What really is surprising about these low end devices from Micromax is that they still have a Dual SIM functionality and huge battery life. The Joy X1850 is a minor upgrade to the Joy X1800.
Lets take a look on features it has to offer:
Micromax Joy X1850 comes in a plastic packet. It looks like a packet of candy at the first glance but it really has a phone worth Rs. 800 in it.
This phone has a candy bar avtaar with rubberized keypad which is not backlit.

It is in the same league of Nokia 105 or the 108, but it has a camera built in which sets it apart. A 0.8MP VGA camera would take photos that you would only want to view on the phone itself. A good feature to have at this price point.
While you would not expect any sort of memory on device of this caliber, this phone has an SD card slot which supports upto 4GB that allows you to store MP3, photos and even 3GP videos.
You would also be able to send and receive files over bluetooth and pair a bluetooth headset that would surely cost more than this phone itself.
Apart from playing videos and music, you can also play FM radio through its speakers.
A talk time of 8 hours and standby time of 642 hours is achieved by its huge 1800mAh battery.
Alternatives:
Nokia 105
Lava Arc 11i

Introduction:: Itel it2180 is a dual SIM device that was launched in June 2016. Big torch having dedicated key and super battery mode are its major highlights.
Display and Design:

Itel it2180 comes with 1.77 inch LCD non-touch screen QQVGA display, 160 x 128 pixels resolution and 116PPI pixel density. It has a dimension of 114.5 x 49.3 x 14.2 mm. It has a colour TFT screen. It is available in White along with Dark Gray and Dark Blue colours.
Hardware and Features:

This dual SIM device is equipped with a proprietary operating system. It has a calculator, stopwatch, calendar, alarm. It supports 3GP, MP4 video formats and ARM, AAC, MP3, WAV music formats. It has an FM radio and auto call recorder.
Camera and Storage:
Itel it2180 is built with 0.8MP rear digital camera and 0.8MP digital front camera. Camera has digital zoom. It has an internal storage of up to 8GB expandable upto 32GB.
Battery and Connectivity:

This dual SIM device is loaded with 1000mAh Li-ion removable battery that lets the users enjoy a talk time of up to 9.64 hours and standby time of up to 177.78 hours. Users can enjoy connectivity through 2G and Bluetooth BT 3.0.
Competition:

Itel it2180 faces competition from Micromax X590, Intex Eco Plus, Sansui X70 and Philips E130. Itel it2180 has a lower battery capacity and a smaller screen than Philips E130 and Sansui X70. Micromax X590 has a higher battery capacity than itel it2180. Sansui X70 has a higher pixel density than Itel it2180. Intex Eco Plus has more expandable storage than Itel it2180.
